title: Radio City (Indian radio station)
text: Radio City is India's first private FM radio station and was started on 3 July 2001.

title: Radio City (Indian radio station)
text: It broadcasts on 91.1 (earlier 91.0 in most cities) megahertz from Mumbai (where it was started in 2004), Bengaluru (started first in 2001), Lucknow and New Delhi (since 2003).

title: Radio City (Indian radio station)
text: It plays Hindi, English and regional songs.

title: Radio City (Indian radio station)
text: It was launched in Hyderabad in March 2006, in Chennai on 7 July 2006 and in Visakhapatnam October 2007.

title: Radio City (Indian radio station)
text: Radio City recently forayed into New Media in May 2008 with the launch of a music portal - PlanetRadiocity.com that offers music related news, videos, songs, and other music-related features.

title: Radio City (Indian radio station)
text: The Radio station currently plays a mix of Hindi and Regional music.

title: Radio City (Indian radio station)
text: Abraham Thomas is the CEO of the company.

title: History of Albanian football
text: Football in Albania existed before the Albanian Football Federation (FSHF) was created.

title: History of Albanian football
text: This was evidenced by the team's registration at the Balkan Cup tournament during 1929-1931, which started in 1929 (although Albania eventually had pressure from the teams because of competition, competition started first and was strong enough in the duels) .

title: History of Albanian football
text: Albanian National Team was founded on June 6, 1930, but Albania had to wait 16 years to play its first international match and then defeated Yugoslavia in 1946.

title: History of Albanian football
text: In 1932, Albania joined FIFA (during the 12–16 June convention ) And in 1954 she was one of the founding members of UEFA.

title: Echosmith
text: Echosmith is an American, Corporate indie pop band formed in February 2009 in Chino, California.

text: Originally formed as a quartet of siblings, the band currently consists of Sydney, Noah and Graham Sierota, following the departure of eldest sibling Jamie in late 2016.

title: Echosmith
text: until they signed to Warner Bros.

title: Echosmith
text: Records in May 2012.

title: Echosmith

title: Echosmith
text: The song was Warner Bros.

title: Echosmith
text: Records' fifth-biggest-selling-digital song of 2014, with 1.3 million downloads sold.

title: Echosmith

title: Women's colleges in the Southern United States
text: Women's colleges in the Southern United States refers to undergraduate, bachelor's degree–granting institutions, often liberal arts colleges, whose student populations consist exclusively or almost exclusively of women, located in the Southern United States.

title: Women's colleges in the Southern United States
text: Many started first as girls' seminaries or academies.

title: Women's colleges in the Southern United States
text: Salem College is the oldest female educational institution in the South and Wesleyan College is the first that was established specifically as a college for women.

title: Women's colleges in the Southern United States
text: Some schools, such as Mary Baldwin University and Salem College, offer coeducational courses at the graduate level.

title: First Arthur County Courthouse and Jail
text: The First Arthur County Courthouse and Jail, was perhaps the smallest court house in the United States, and serves now as a museum.

title: Arthur's Magazine
text: Arthur's Magazine (1844–1846) was an American literary periodical published in Philadelphia in the 19th century.

title: Arthur's Magazine
text: Edited by T.S. Arthur, it featured work by Edgar A. Poe, J.H. Ingraham, Sarah Josepha Hale, Thomas G. Spear, and others.

title: Arthur's Magazine
text: In May 1846 it was merged into "Godey's Lady's Book".

title: 2014–15 Ukrainian Hockey Championship
text: The 2014–15 Ukrainian Hockey Championship was the 23rd season of the Ukrainian Hockey Championship.

text: Only four teams participated in the league this season, because of the instability in Ukraine and that most of the clubs had economical issues.

text: Generals Kiev was the only team that participated in the league the previous season, and the season started first after the year-end of 2014.

title: 2014–15 Ukrainian Hockey Championship

title: 2014–15 Ukrainian Hockey Championship
text: In the final, ATEK Kiev defeated the regular season winner HK Kremenchuk.

title: First for Women

title: First for Women
text: It is based in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey.

title: First for Women

title: Freeway Complex Fire
text: The Freeway Complex Fire was a 2008 wildfire in the Santa Ana Canyon area of Orange County, California.

title: Freeway Complex Fire
text: The fire started as two separate fires on November 15, 2008.

title: Freeway Complex Fire
text: The "Freeway Fire" started first shortly after 9am with the "Landfill Fire" igniting approximately 2 hours later.

title: Freeway Complex Fire
text: These two separate fires merged a day later and ultimately destroyed 314 residences in Anaheim Hills and Yorba Linda.

title: William Rast
text: William Rast is an American clothing line founded by Justin Timberlake and Trace Ayala.

text: It is most known for their premium jeans.

text: The label also produces other clothing items such as jackets and tops.

title: William Rast
text: The company started first as a denim line, later evolving into a men’s and women’s clothing line.

title: Ritz-Carlton Jakarta
text: It is operated by The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company.

title: Ritz-Carlton Jakarta
text: The complex has two towers that comprises a hotel and the Airlangga Apartment respectively.

title: Ritz-Carlton Jakarta

title: Oberoi family
text: The Oberoi family is an Indian family that is famous for its involvement in hotels, namely through The Oberoi Group.

title: Ishqbaaaz
text: Ishqbaaaz (English: "Lovers") is an Indian drama television series which is broadcast on Star Plus.

title: Ishqbaaaz
text: It premiered on 27 June 2016 and airs Mon-Fri 10-11pm IST.

title: Ishqbaaaz
text: Nakuul Mehta, Kunal Jaisingh and Leenesh Mattoo respectively portray Shivaay, Omkara and Rudra, the three heirs of the Oberoi family.

title: Ishqbaaaz
text: The show initially focused on the tale of three brothers, later become centered on the love story of Shivaay and Annika (Surbhi Chandna); with the story of Omkara and Rudra being shifted to the spinoff series "Dil Boley Oberoi".

title: Ishqbaaaz
text: In July 2017 "Dil Boley Oberoi" ended and the storylines were merged back into "Ishqbaaaz" which doubled its runtime.

title: Hotel Tallcorn
text: The Hotel Tallcorn is located in Marshalltown, Iowa.

title: Hotel Tallcorn
text: Today it is called the Tallcorn Towers Apartments.

title: Hotel Tallcorn
text: Built in 1928 by the Eppley Hotel Company, local citizens contributed $120,000 to ensure the successful completion of this seven-story hotel.

title: Hotel Tallcorn
text: It was completed in connection to the seventy-fifth anniversary of Marshalltown.

title: Hotel Tallcorn
text: The hotel's sale in 1956 from the Eppley chain to the Sheraton Corporation was part of the second largest hotel sale in United States history.

title: Hotel Tallcorn
text: The Tallcorn was listed as a contributing property in the Marshalltown Downtown Historic District on the National Register of Historic Places in 2002.

title: Mohan Singh Oberoi
text: Rai Bahadur Mohan Singh Oberoi (15 August 1898 – 3 May 2002) was an Indian hotelier, the founder and chairman of Oberoi Hotels & Resorts, India's second-largest hotel company, with 35 hotels in India, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Egypt, Australia and Hungary.

title: Hotel Bond
text: Hotel Bond is a historic hotel, built in two stages in 1913 and 1921, in downtown Hartford, Connecticut by hotelier Harry S. Bond.

title: Hotel Bond
text: It is located near Bushnell Park, and was considered the grandest hotel in Hartford during its heyday.

title: Hotel Bond
text: The second section is a 12 story building attached to the 6 story first section.

title: Hotel Bond
text: A Statler Hotel opened in the area in 1954, creating competition, and the Bond Hotel company declared bankruptcy shortly after that.

title: Hotel Bond
text: It was bought by the California-based Masaglia Hotel chain, which began an incremental renovation program.

title: Hotel Bond
text: In 1964 it was sold to a Cincinnati, Ohio investment group which announced extensive renovation plans.

title: Hotel Bond
text: However, the financing plans fell through and the hotel was again in bankruptcy.

title: Hotel Bond
text: The building was sold at auction to the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Hartford in 1965, and it became the home of the Saint Francis Hospital School of Nursing.

title: Hotel Bond
text: The Bond Ballroom reopened in 2001, with the rest of the building becoming a Homewood Suites by Hilton in 2006.

title: The Oberoi Group
text: The Oberoi Group is a hotel company with its head office in Delhi.

title: The Oberoi Group
text: Founded in 1934, the company owns and/or operates 30+ luxury hotels and two river cruise ships in six countries, primarily under its Oberoi Hotels & Resorts and Trident Hotels brands.

title: Future Fibre Technologies
text: Future Fibre Technologies (FFT) is a fiber optic sensing technologies company based in Melbourne, Australia, with its US head office in Mountain View, California, Middle East head office in Dubai, Indian head office in New Delhi and European head office in London.

title: Future Fibre Technologies
text: Founded in 1994, Future Fibre Technologies product line provides optical fiber intrusion detection systems for perimeters, buried oil and gas pipelines and data communication networks.

title: 289th Military Police Company
text: The 289th Military Police Company was activated on 1 November 1994 and attached to Hotel Company, 3rd Infantry (The Old Guard), Fort Myer, Virginia.

title: 289th Military Police Company

title: Glennwanis Hotel
text: The Glennwanis Hotel is a historic hotel in Glennville, Georgia, Tattnall County, Georgia, built on the site of the Hughes Hotel.

title: Glennwanis Hotel
text: The hotel is located at 209-215 East Barnard Street.

title: Glennwanis Hotel
text: The old Hughes Hotel was built out of Georgia pine circa 1905 and burned in 1920.

title: Glennwanis Hotel
text: The Glennwanis was built in brick in 1926.

title: Glennwanis Hotel
text: The local Kiwanis club led the effort to get the replacement hotel built, and organized a Glennville Hotel Company with directors being local business leaders.

title: Glennwanis Hotel
text: The wife of a local doctor won a naming contest with the name "Glennwanis Hotel", a suggestion combining "Glennville" and "Kiwanis".

title: Lisa Simpson
text: Lisa Marie Simpson is a fictional character in the animated television series "The Simpsons".

title: Lisa Simpson
text: She is the middle child and most intelligent of the Simpson family.

title: Lisa Simpson
text: Voiced by Yeardley Smith, Lisa first appeared on television in "The Tracey Ullman Show" short "Good Night" on April 19, 1987.

title: Lisa Simpson
text: Cartoonist Matt Groening created and designed her while waiting to meet James L. Brooks.

title: Lisa Simpson
text: Groening had been invited to pitch a series of shorts based on his comic "Life in Hell", but instead decided to create a new set of characters.

title: Lisa Simpson
text: He named the elder Simpson daughter after his younger sister Lisa Groening.

title: Lisa Simpson
text: After appearing on "The Tracey Ullman Show" for three years, the Simpson family were moved to their own series on Fox, which debuted on December 17, 1989.

title: Marge Simpson
text: Marjorie Jacqueline "Marge" Simpson (née Bouvier) is a fictional character in the American animated sitcom "The Simpsons" and part of the eponymous family.

title: Marge Simpson
text: She is voiced by Julie Kavner and first appeared on television in "The Tracey Ullman Show" short "Good Night" on April 19, 1987.

title: Marge Simpson
text: Marge was created and designed by cartoonist Matt Groening while he was waiting in the lobby of James L. Brooks' office.

title: Marge Simpson
text: Groening had been called to pitch a series of shorts based on "Life in Hell" but instead decided to create a new set of characters.

title: Marge Simpson
text: He named the character after his mother Margaret Groening.

title: Marge Simpson
text: After appearing on "The Tracey Ullman Show" for three seasons, the Simpson family received their own series on Fox, which debuted December 17, 1989.

title: Bart Simpson
text: Bartholomew JoJo "Bart" Simpson is a fictional character in the American animated television series "The Simpsons" and part of the Simpson family.

title: Bart Simpson
text: He is voiced by Nancy Cartwright and first appeared on television in "The Tracey Ullman Show" short "Good Night" on April 19, 1987.

title: Bart Simpson
text: Cartoonist Matt Groening created and designed Bart while waiting in the lobby of James L. Brooks' office.

title: Bart Simpson
text: Groening had been called to pitch a series of shorts based on his comic strip, "Life in Hell", but instead decided to create a new set of characters.

title: Bart Simpson
text: While the rest of the characters were named after Groening's family members, Bart's name is an anagram of the word "brat".

title: Bart Simpson
text: After appearing on "The Tracey Ullman Show" for three years, the Simpson family received its own series on Fox, which debuted December 17, 1989.

title: Allie Goertz
text: Allison Beth "Allie" Goertz (born March 2, 1991) is an American musician.

title: Allie Goertz
text: Goertz is known for her satirical songs based on various pop culture topics.

title: Allie Goertz
text: Her videos are posted on YouTube under the name of Cossbysweater.

title: Allie Goertz
text: Subjects of her songs have included the film "The Room", the character Milhouse from the television show "The Simpsons", and the game Dungeons & Dragons.

title: Allie Goertz
text: Her style has been compared to that of Bo Burnham.

title: Allie Goertz
text: In December 2015, Goertz released a concept album based on the Adult Swim series "Rick and Morty", "Sad Dance Songs", with the album's cover emulating the animation and logo of the series.

title: Allie Goertz
text: The album was made possible through Kickstarter.

title: Allie Goertz
text: She is co-host of Everything's Coming Up Podcast, a Simpsons-focused podcast along with Julia Prescott.

title: Milhouse Van Houten
text: Milhouse Mussolini van Houten is a fictional character featured in the animated television series "The Simpsons", voiced by Pamela Hayden, and created by Matt Groening who named the character after President Richard Nixon's middle name.

title: Milhouse Van Houten
text: Later in the series, it is revealed that Milhouse's middle name is "Mussolini."

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: Los Angeles Reader was a weekly paper established in 1978 and distributed in Los Angeles, United States.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: It followed the format of the (still active) Chicago Reader.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: The paper was known for having lengthy, thoughtful reviews of movies, plays and concerts in the LA area.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: James Vowell was its founding editor.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: Among its writers were Keith Fitzgerald, Nigey Lennon, Lionel Rolfe, Lawrence Wechsler, Mick Farren, Richard Meltzer, Heidi Dvorak, Chris Morris, Jerry Stahl, Steven Kane, Andy Klein, Allen Levy, Jim Goad, Kirk Silsbee, Henry Sheehan, Samantha Dunn, Natalie Nichols, Steve Appleford, Eric Mankin (also editor), Paul Birchall, Eddie Rivera (who wrote the paper's first cover story), Amy Steinberg, Harry Sheehan, Dan Sallit, Myron Meisel, David Ehrenstein.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: Tom Davis, Bruce Bebb, Stuart Goldman, Ernest Hardy, Kevin Uhrich, Erik Himmelsbach and David L. Ulin.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: It is famous for being the first newspaper to publish Matt Groening's cartoon strip, Life in Hell on April 25, 1980.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: James Vowell hired Matt Groening as his assistant editor in 1979.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: Groening was also originally a Reader music critic.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: It also ran a cartoon strip by David Lynch (director of Blue Velvet) called The Angriest Dog in the World, a strip notable for having exactly the same drawing panels for its entire run.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: James Vowell and his wife Codette Wallace bought the Reader from the Chicago Reader in February 1989.

title: Los Angeles Reader
text: They sold "The Reader" to New Times Media in 1996, which merged it with the "Los Angeles View" to form "New Times LA".

title: Homer Simpson
text: Homer Jay Simpson is a fictional character and the main protagonist of the American animated television series "The Simpsons" as the patriarch of the eponymous family.

title: Homer Simpson
text: He is voiced by Dan Castellaneta and first appeared on television, along with the rest of his family, in "The Tracey Ullman Show" short "Good Night" on April 19, 1987.

title: Homer Simpson
text: Homer was created and designed by cartoonist Matt Groening while he was waiting in the lobby of James L. Brooks' office.

title: Homer Simpson
text: Groening had been called to pitch a series of shorts based on his comic strip "Life in Hell" but instead decided to create a new set of characters.

title: Homer Simpson
text: He named the character after his father, Homer Groening.

title: Homer Simpson
text: After appearing for three seasons on "The Tracey Ullman Show", the Simpson family got their own series on Fox that debuted December 17, 1989.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: "The Simpsons" is an American animated television sitcom created by Matt Groening for the Fox Broadcasting Company.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: The series is a satirical parody of a middle class American lifestyle epitomized by its eponymous family, which consists of Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa and Maggie.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: It is set in the fictional town of Springfield, and lampoons American culture, society and television, and many aspects of the human condition.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: The family was conceived by Groening shortly before a pitch for a series of animated shorts with producer James L. Brooks.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: Groening created a dysfunctional family and named the characters after members of his own family, substituting Bart for his own name.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: The shorts became a part of "The Tracey Ullman Show" on April 19, 1987 and after a three-season run, the sketch was developed into a half-hour prime time show and became a hit series for Fox.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: The growing popularity of the series motivated video game developers to create video games based on the series.

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: Two pinball machines have also been produced; one self-titled, that was only made available for a limited time after the first season finale (1990) and "The Simpsons Pinball Party" (2003).

title: List of The Simpsons video games
text: Additionally, several handheld device games have been released, such as "Bartman: Avenger of Evil" (1990) and "Bart Simpson's Cupcake Crisis" (1991).

title: The Simpsons: An Uncensored, Unauthorized History
text: The Simpsons: An Uncensored, Unauthorized History is a non-fiction book about the American animated television series "The Simpsons".

title: The Simpsons: An Uncensored, Unauthorized History
text: It was written by John Ortved, and first published in October 2009 by Faber and Faber.

title: The Simpsons: An Uncensored, Unauthorized History
text: In the United Kingdom, the book is called Simpsons Confidential: The uncensored, totally unauthorised history of the world's greatest TV show by the people that made it.

title: The Simpsons: An Uncensored, Unauthorized History
text: The book is an oral history of the show, and concentrates particularly on the writers and producers of the show.

title: The Simpsons: An Uncensored, Unauthorized History
text: The book includes entire chapters devoted to key figures such as creator Matt Groening and James L. Brooks and Sam Simon, who helped develop the series.

title: The Simpsons: An Uncensored, Unauthorized History
text: According to National Public Radio reviewer Linda Holmes, "Ortved's thesis, essentially, is that lots of people are responsible for the success of "The Simpsons", and their creator, Matt Groening, has too often been viewed as the sole source to the detriment of others who also deserve to be praised."

title: List of The Simpsons guest stars
text: In addition to the show's regular cast of voice actors, celebrity guest stars have been a staple of "The Simpsons", an American animated television sitcom created by Matt Groening for the Fox Broadcasting Company, since its first season.

title: List of The Simpsons guest stars
text: "The Simpsons" focuses on the eponymous family, which consists of Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa and Maggie.

title: List of The Simpsons guest stars
text: The family was initially conceived by Groening for a series of animated shorts, which originally aired as a part of "The Tracey Ullman Show" between 1987 and 1989.

title: List of The Simpsons guest stars
text: The shorts were developed into a half-hour prime time series which began in December 1989.

title: List of The Simpsons guest stars
text: The series' 27th season began in September 2015 and episodes of "The Simpsons" have aired.

title: List of The Simpsons guest stars
text: A feature film adaptation of the series called "The Simpsons Movie", was released in 2007.

title: Moloch: or, This Gentile World
text: Moloch: or, This Gentile World is a semi-autobiographical novel written by Henry Miller in 1927-28, initially under the guise of a novel written by his wife, June.

title: Moloch: or, This Gentile World
text: The book went unpublished until 1992, 65 years after it was written and 12 years after Miller’s death.

title: Moloch: or, This Gentile World
text: It is widely considered to be of interest more as a study of Miller’s artistic growth than as a worthy piece of fiction.

title: Launceston by-election, 1874
text: The Launceston by-election of 1874 was fought on 3 July 1874.

title: Launceston by-election, 1874
text: The byelection was fought due to the void Election of the incumbent Conservative MP, James Henry Deakin (senior).

title: Launceston by-election, 1874
text: It was won by the Conservative candidate James Henry Deakin (junior).

title: Incest: From a Journal of Love
text: Incest: From a Journal of Love: The Unexpurgated Diary of Anaïs Nin (1932–1934) is a 1992 non-fiction book by Anaïs Nin.

title: Incest: From a Journal of Love
text: It is a continuation of the diary entries first published in "Henry and June: From the Unexpurgated Diary of Anaïs Nin".

title: Incest: From a Journal of Love
text: It features Nin's relationships with writer Henry Miller, his wife June Miller, the psychoanalyst Otto Rank, her father Joaquín Nin, and her husband Hugh Parker Guiler.

title: Incest: From a Journal of Love
text: She also copied some of her correspondence with these people into her diary.

title: Incest: From a Journal of Love
text: Much of this book was written in English, although those of her letters which were originally written in French and Spanish were translated.

title: Incest: From a Journal of Love
text: Most of this diary takes place in France, particularly Clichy, Paris and Louveciennes.

title: James Henry Deakin (junior)
text: James Henry Deakin (1851 – 8 November 1881) was a British Conservative politician, the son of Col. James Henry Deakin, a Manchester merchant.

title: Ewan MacColl
text: James Henry Miller (25 January 1915 – 22 October 1989), better known by his stage name Ewan MacColl, was an English folk singer, songwriter, communist, labour activist, actor, poet, playwright and record producer.

text: She is also well known in Britain, where she has lived for more than 30 years, and was married to the singer and songwriter Ewan MacColl until his death in 1989.

title: Henry Miller Memorial Library
text: The Henry Miller Memorial Library is a nonprofit arts center, bookstore, and performance venue, championing the late writer, artist, and Big Sur resident Henry Miller, as well as many other, both living and dead, creative individuals living in or near Big Sur, California.

title: Henry Miller Memorial Library
text: Henry Miller’s friend Emil White built the house that is now the Library in the mid-1960s.

title: Henry Miller Memorial Library
text: After Miller died, in 1980, Emil decided to maintain his property as a memorial to his friend and as a gallery where local artists could show their work.

title: Henry Miller Memorial Library
text: In 1981 Emil White, with the help of the Big Sur Land Trust, created "The Henry Miller Memorial Library, Founded by Emil White."

title: June Miller
text: June Miller (January 7 or 28, 1902 – February 1, 1979) was the much-written-about second wife of Henry Miller.

title: Jim Miller (Australian footballer, born 1919)
text: James Henry Miller (born 30 May 1919) is a former Australian rules footballer in the Victorian Football League (VFL).

title: Cadmium chloride
text: Cadmium chloride is a white crystalline compound of cadmium and chlorine, with the formula CdCl.

title: Cadmium chloride
text: It is a hygroscopic solid that is highly soluble in water and slightly soluble in alcohol.

title: Cadmium chloride
text: Although it is considered to be ionic, it has considerable covalent character to its bonding.

title: Cadmium chloride
text: The crystal structure of cadmium chloride (described below), composed of two-dimensional layers of ions, is a reference for describing other crystal structures.

title: Cadmium chloride
text: Also known are CdCl•HO and CdCl•5HO.

title: Water blue

title: Water blue
text: Water blue stains collagen blue in tissue sections.

title: Water blue
text: It is soluble in water and slightly soluble in ethanol.

title: Diflucortolone valerate
text: Diflucortolone valerate (also "Nerisone" cream/oily cream/ointment, "Neriderm" ointment, Japanese ジフルコルトロン (Jifurucorutoron ) is a corticosteroid rated Class 2 "potent" (100-150 times) in the New Zealand topical steroid system.

title: Diflucortolone valerate
text: It is a white to creamy white crystalline powder.

title: Diflucortolone valerate
text: It is practically insoluble in water, freely soluble in dichloromethane and in dioxan, sparingly soluble in ether and slightly soluble in methyl alcohol.

title: Diflucortolone valerate
text: Chemically, it is a corticosteroid esterified with valeric acid.

title: Diflucortolone valerate
text: It is commonly used topically in dermatology.

title: Diflucortolone valerate
text: The brand name is Nerisone; its creams come in potencies of 0.1% and 0.3%.

title: Heptanoic acid
text: Heptanoic acid, also called enanthic acid, is an organic compound composed of a seven-carbon chain terminating in a carboxylic acid.

title: Heptanoic acid
text: It is an oily liquid with an unpleasant, rancid odor.

title: Heptanoic acid
text: It contributes to the odor of some rancid oils.

title: Heptanoic acid
text: It is slightly soluble in water, but very soluble in ethanol and ether.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: Magnesium chloride is the name for the chemical compound with the formula MgCl and its various hydrates MgCl(HO).

title: Magnesium chloride
text: These salts are typical ionic halides, being highly soluble in water.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: The hydrated magnesium chloride can be extracted from brine or sea water.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: In North America, magnesium chloride is produced primarily from Great Salt Lake brine.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: It is extracted in a similar process from the Dead Sea in the Jordan valley.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: Magnesium chloride, as the natural mineral bischofite, is also extracted (via solution mining) out of ancient seabeds; for example, the Zechstein seabed in northwest Europe.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: Some magnesium chloride is made from solar evaporation of seawater.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: Anhydrous magnesium chloride is the principal precursor to magnesium metal, which is produced on a large scale.

title: Magnesium chloride
text: Hydrated magnesium chloride is the form most readily available.

title: Ethanol
text: Ethanol, also called alcohol, ethyl alcohol, and drinking alcohol, is a compound and simple alcohol with the chemical formula C2H5OH .

title: Ethanol
text: Its formula can be written also as CH3 −CH2 −OH or C2H5 −OH (an ethyl group linked to a hydroxyl group), and is often abbreviated as EtOH.

title: Ethanol
text: Ethanol is a volatile, flammable, colorless liquid with a slight characteristic odor.

title: Ethanol
text: It is used as a drug and is the principal type of alcohol found in alcoholic drinks.

title: Tributyltin oxide
text: Tributyltin oxide (TBTO) is an organotin compound chiefly used as a biocide (fungicide and molluscicide), especially a wood preservative.

title: Tributyltin oxide
text: Its chemical formula is <ce>2O</ce>.

title: Tributyltin oxide
text: It has the form of a colorless to pale yellow liquid that is only slightly soluble in water (20 ppm) but highly soluble in organic solvents.

title: Tributyltin oxide
text: It is a potent skin irritant.

title: Benzamide
text: Benzamide is an off-white solid with the chemical formula of CHCONH.

title: Benzamide
text: It is a derivative of benzoic acid.

title: Benzamide
text: It is slightly soluble in water, and soluble in many organic solvents.

title: Gold(III) chloride
text: Gold(III) chloride, traditionally called auric chloride, is a chemical compound of gold and chlorine.

title: Gold(III) chloride
text: With the molecular formula AuCl, the name gold trichloride is a simplification, referring to the empirical formula, AuCl.

title: Gold(III) chloride
text: The Roman numerals in the name indicate that the gold has an oxidation state of +3, which is common for gold compounds.

title: Gold(III) chloride
text: There is also another related chloride of gold, gold(I) chloride (AuCl).

title: Gold(III) chloride
text: Chloroauric acid, HAuCl, the product formed when gold dissolves in aqua regia, is sometimes referred to as "gold chloride" or "acid gold trichloride".

title: Gold(III) chloride
text: Gold(III) chloride is very hygroscopic and highly soluble in water as well as ethanol.

title: Gold(III) chloride
text: It decomposes above 160 °C or in light.

title: Chloride
text: The chloride ion is the anion (negatively charged ion) Cl.

title: Chloride
text: It is formed when the element chlorine (a halogen) gains an electron or when a compound such as hydrogen chloride is dissolved in water or other polar solvents.

title: Chloride
text: Chloride salts such as sodium chloride are often very soluble in water.

title: Chloride
text: It is an essential electrolyte located in all body fluids responsible for maintaining acid/base balance, transmitting nerve impulses and regulating fluid in and out of cells.

title: Chloride
text: Less frequently, the word "chloride" may also form part of the "common" name of chemical compounds in which one or more chlorine atoms are covalently bonded.

title: Chloride
text: For example, methyl chloride, with the standard name chloromethane (see IUPAC books) is an organic compound with a covalent C−Cl bond in which the chlorine is not an anion.

title: Li Na
text: Li Na (; ; born 26 February 1982) is a retired Chinese professional tennis player, who achieved a career-high WTA-ranking of world No. 2 on 17 February 2014.

title: Li Na
text: Over the course of her career, Li won seven WTA singles titles and two Grand Slam singles titles at the 2011 French Open and 2014 Australian Open.

title: Li Na
text: Li's rise to prominence came after those victories, which made her the first and only Grand Slam singles champion from East Asia and Asia as a whole.

title: Li Na
text: Prior to this, she had already become the first player representing an East Asian and Asian country to appear in a Grand Slam singles final, a milestone she achieved at the 2011 Australian Open.

title: Li Na
text: Li was also the runner-up at the 2013 Australian Open and 2013 WTA Tour Championships, a three-time quarterfinalist at Wimbledon and a semifinalist at the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games and 2013 US Open.

title: Li Na
text: Among her other most notable accolades, she was the first Chinese player to win a WTA tour title at the Guangzhou International Women's Open in 2004, the first to reach a Grand Slam singles quarterfinal at the 2006 Wimbledon Championships, and the first to break into the world's top 10.

title: Li Na
text: Her feats have sparked a major population growth of tennis players in East Asia, earning her the reputation as the region's tennis pioneer and trailblazer.

title: Williams sisters
text: The Williams sisters are two professional American tennis players: Venus Williams (b. 1980), a seven-time Grand Slam title winner (singles), and Serena Williams (b. 1981), twenty-three-time Grand Slam title winner (singles), both of whom were coached from an early age by their parents Richard Williams and Oracene Price.

title: Williams sisters
text: There is a noted professional rivalry between them – between the 2001 US Open and the 2017 Australian Open tournaments, they met in nine Grand Slam singles finals.

title: Williams sisters
text: They became the first two players, female or male, to play in 4 consecutive grand slam singles finals from the 2002 French Open to the 2003 Australian Open; Serena famously won all 4 to complete the first of two "Serena Slams".

title: Williams sisters
text: Between 2000 and 2016, a 17-year span, they collectively won 12 Wimbledon singles titles (Venus won 5 and Serena won 7).

title: Williams sisters
text: By winning the 2001 Australian Open women's doubles title, they became the 5th pair to complete the Career Doubles Grand Slam and the only pair to complete the Career Doubles Golden Slam.

title: Williams sisters
text: At the time, Venus and Serena were only 20 and 19 years old, respectively.

title: Williams sisters
text: Since then they have gone on to add another two Olympic gold medals in the 2008 Beijing Olympics and the 2012 London Olympics.

title: Williams sisters
text: Nearly a decade later, the duo would go on to win 4 consecutive grand slam doubles titles from 2009 Wimbledon through 2010 Roland Garros, which would catapult them to co-No.

title: Williams sisters
text: 1 doubles players on 7 June 2010.

title: Williams sisters
text: Two weeks later, on 21 June 2010, Serena would hold the No. 1 singles ranking and Venus would be right behind her at No. 2 in singles.

title: Williams sisters
text: Their most recent grand slam doubles titles came at the 2012 Wimbledon & 2016 Wimbledon events.

title: Williams sisters
text: They remain very close, often watching each other's matches in support, even after one of them has been knocked out of a tournament.

title: Henri Leconte
text: Henri Leconte (born 4 July 1963) is a former French professional tennis player.

title: Henri Leconte
text: He reached the men's singles final at the French Open in 1988, won the French Open men's doubles title in 1984, and helped France win the Davis Cup in 1991.

title: Henri Leconte
text: Leconte's career-high singles ranking was world No. 5.

title: Steffi Graf
text: Stefanie Maria "Steffi" Graf (] ; born 14 June 1969) is a German former tennis player, who was ranked world No. 1 during her career.

title: Steffi Graf
text: Graf won 22 Grand Slam singles titles.

title: Steffi Graf
text: Her 22 singles titles put her second on the list of Major wins in the female competition since the introduction of the Open Era in 1968 and is third all-time behind Margaret Court (24) and Serena Williams (23).

title: Steffi Graf
text: In 1988, she became the first and only tennis player (male or female) to achieve the Golden Slam by winning all four Grand Slam singles titles and the Olympic gold medal in the same calendar year.

title: Steffi Graf
text: Furthermore, she is the only tennis player to have won each Grand Slam event at least four times.

title: 1986 Grand Prix German Open
text: The 1986 German Open (also known as the 1986 Ebel German Open) was a men's tennis tournament of the 1986 Nabisco Grand Prix and played on outdoor red clay courts.

title: 1986 Grand Prix German Open
text: It was the 77th edition of the event.

title: 1986 Grand Prix German Open
text: It took place at the Am Rothenbaum in Hamburg, West Germany, from 15 September through 21 September 1986.

title: 1986 Grand Prix German Open
text: Henri Leconte won the singles title.

title: 1986 Grand Prix German Open
text: Fourth-seeded Henri Leconte won the singles title.

title: Jonathan Stark (tennis)
text: Jonathan Stark (born April 3, 1971) is a former professional tennis player from the United States.

title: Jonathan Stark (tennis)
text: During his career he won two Grand Slam doubles titles (the 1994 French Open Men's Doubles and the 1995 Wimbledon Championships Mixed Doubles).

title: Jonathan Stark (tennis)
text: Stark reached the World No. 1 doubles ranking in 1994.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Pam Teeguarden (born April 17, 1951) is a former American professional tennis player in the 1970s and 1980s, ranked in the top 20 from 1970–1975, according to "John Dolan's Women's Tennis Ultimate Guide", prior to computer rankings.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: She won two Grand Slam Doubles Titles and was a quarter finalist in singles at the U.S. Open and The French Open.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Her father Jerry, a well known coach, helped Margaret Court win the coveted Grand Slam (all four Grand Slam titles in one year) in 1970 and Virginia Wade to her 1977 Wimbledon triumph.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Teeguarden was voted the "Most Watchable Player" based on play and appearance by a group of Madison Avenue advertising executives or "Mad Men" while playing at the US Open.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Teeguarden played in 19 consecutive US Opens, holding the record until Chris Evert played in 20.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: She wore the first all black outfit in the history of tennis in 1975 at The Bridgestone Doubles Championships in Tokyo, starting a trend that is still popular today.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Teeguarden was the first woman tennis player signed by Nike.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: She played on the victorious Los Angeles Strings Team Tennis team in 1981 and won the Team Tennis Mixed Doubles Division with Tom Gullikson in 1977; they were also runners-up in the league that year.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: Kenneth Robert Rosewall {'1': ", '2': ", '3': 'AM, MBE', '4': "} (born 2 November 1934) is a former world top-ranking amateur and professional tennis player from Australia.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: He won a record 23 tennis Majors including 8 Grand Slam singles titles and before the Open Era a record 15 Pro Slam titles and a record 35 Major finals overall.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: He won the Pro Grand Slam in 1963.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: Rosewall won 9 slams in doubles with a career double grand slam.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: He is considered to be one of the greatest tennis players of all time.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: He had a renowned backhand and enjoyed a long career at the highest levels from the early 1950s to the early 1970s.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: Rosewall was one of the two best male players for about nine years and was the World No. 1 player for a number of years in the early 1960s.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: He was ranked among the top 20 players, amateur or professional, every year from 1952 through 1977.

title: Ken Rosewall
text: Rosewall is the only player to have simultaneously held Pro Grand Slam titles on three different surfaces (1962–1963).

title: Ken Rosewall
text: At the 1971 Australian Open he became the first male player during the open era to win a Grand Slam tournament without dropping a set.

title: 2009 Serena Williams tennis season
text: Serena Williams's 2009 tennis season officially began at the 2009 Medibank International Sydney.

title: 2009 Serena Williams tennis season
text: Williams finished the year ranked world no. 1 for the second time in her career, having played in 16 tournaments, more than any other year.

title: 2009 Serena Williams tennis season
text: She also broke the record previously set by Justine Henin for the most prize money earned by a female tennis player in one year, with Williams earning $6,545,586.

title: 2009 Serena Williams tennis season
text: In doubles, she finished the year ranked world no. 3, despite playing only six tournaments as a pair.

title: 2009 Serena Williams tennis season
text: She won five Grand Slam titles, putting her total Grand Slam titles at 23.

title: Larisa Neiland
text: Larisa Savchenko-Neiland (née Savchenko; born 21 July 1966) is a former professional tennis player who represented the Soviet Union and Latvia.

title: Larisa Neiland
text: A former world number one ranked doubles player, Neiland won two women's doubles Grand Slam titles and four mixed doubles Grand Slam titles.

title: Larisa Neiland
text: She also won two singles titles and sixty-five doubles titles.

title: India
text: India, officially the Republic of India ("Bhārat Gaṇarājya"), is a country in South Asia.

title: India
text: It is the seventh-largest country by area, the second-most populous country (with over 1.2 billion people), and the most populous democracy in the world.

title: India
text: It is bounded by the Indian Ocean on the south, the Arabian Sea on the southwest, and the Bay of Bengal on the southeast.

title: India
text: It shares land borders with Pakistan to the west; China, Nepal, and Bhutan to the northeast; and Myanmar (Burma) and Bangladesh to the east.

title: India
text: In the Indian Ocean, India is in the vicinity of Sri Lanka and the Maldives.

title: India
text: India's Andaman and Nicobar Islands share a maritime border with Thailand and Indonesia.

text: India is a country in South Asia.

title: List of companies of India
text: It is the seventh-largest country by area, the second-most populous country (with over 1.2 billion people), and the most populous democracy in the world.

title: Eutrapela
text: Eutrapela is a genus of moth in the Geometridae family.

title: Eutrapela
text: It contains only one species, Eutrapela clemataria, the curve-toothed geometer moth or purplish-brown looper, which is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Nova Scotia to Florida, west to Texas and north to Saskatchewan.

title: Eutrapela
text: The habitat consists of deciduous and mixed woodlands.

title: Geography of India
text: India lies on the Indian Plate, the northern portion of the Indo-Australian Plate, whose continental crust forms the Indian subcontinent.

title: Geography of India
text: The country is situated north of the equator between 8°4' to 37°6' north latitude and 68°7' to 97°25' east longitude.

title: Geography of India
text: It is the seventh-largest country in the world, with a total area of 3287263 km2 .

title: Geography of India
text: India measures 3214 km from north to south and 2933 km from east to west.

title: Geography of India
text: It has a land frontier of 15200 km and a coastline of 7516.6 km .

title: Yoshiyasua
text: Yoshiyasua is a grass moth genus (family Crambidae) of subfamily Musotiminae.

title: Yoshiyasua
text: Some authors have placed it in the snout moth family (Pyralidae), where all grass moths were once also included, but this seems to be in error.

title: Yoshiyasua
text: The genus contains only one species, Yoshiyasua yasudai, which is found in Japan, where it has been recorded from the Ryukyu Islands.

title: Nepita
text: Nepita is a genus of moth in the family Arctiidae.

title: Nepita
text: The genus consists of only one species, Nepita conferta, which can be found in India and Sri Lanka.

title: Nepita
text: The species commonly called footman moth.

title: Parectropis
text: Parectropis is a genus in the geometer moth family (Geometridae).

title: Parectropis
text: A small Old World genus, it contains only a good dozen species altogether, though new ones are still being discovered.

title: Parectropis
text: Only one species ("P. similaria") is found in Europe; most others live in Asia though some occur in Africa.

title: Indogrammodes
text: Indogrammodes is a genus of moths of the Crambidae family.

title: Indogrammodes
text: It contains only one species, Indogrammodes pectinicornalis, which is found in India.

title: Eumacaria
text: Eumacaria is a genus of moth in the family Geometridae.

title: Eumacaria
text: It contains only one species, Eumacaria madopata, the brown-bordered geometer moth, which is found in North America, where it has been recorded from British Columbia, northern Washington, southern Saskatchewan, from Maine to Florida, South Dakota, North Dakota, Nebraska, Wyoming, Idaho, Colorado and New Mexico.

title: Eumacaria
text: The habitat consists of orchards and shrublands.

title: Nymphuliella
text: Nymphuliella is a genus of moth of the Crambidae family.

title: Nymphuliella
text: It contains only one species, Nymphuliella daeckealis, the China Mark Moth, which is found from New Jersey south to Florida and west to Colorado.

title: Verano de Escándalo (1998)
text: The 1998 Verano de Escándalo (Spanish for "Summer of Scandal") was the second annual "Verano de Escandalo" professional wrestling show promoted by AAA.

title: Verano de Escándalo (1998)
text: The show took place on September 18, 1998, in Madero, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

title: Verano de Escándalo (1998)
text: The main event featured steel cage match between the teams of Heavy Metal and Blue Demon Jr. and Kick Boxer and Abismo Negro.

title: Verano de Escándalo (1998)
text: The stipulation of the main event was that if the team of Heavy Metal and Blue Demon Jr. lost referee Guicho Dominguez would be referee El Tirante's "slave" for a week.

title: Verano de Escándalo (1998)
text: If Kick Boxer and Abismo Negro lost El Tirantes would be Guicho Dominguez's slave for a week.

title: Triplemanía VII
text: Triplemanía VII was the seventh "Triplemanía" wrestling show promoted by AAA.

title: Triplemanía VII
text: The show took place on June 11, 1999, in Madero, Mexico.

title: Triplemanía VII
text: The Main event featured a Six-man "Lucha Libre rules" tag team match between the teams of Perro Aguayo, Octagón and El Cobarde II and El Texano, Perro Aguayo Jr. and Sangre Chicana.

title: Triplemanía VII
text: In the semi-main event Heavy Metal and El Felino defended the hair of their father, referee Pepe "Tropi" Casas while Kick Boxer and Thai Boxer defended the hair of referee El Tirantes.

title: Triplemanía VII
text: As a result, El Tirantes had his hair shaved off after the match.

title: Protection racket
text: A protection racket is a scheme whereby a group provides protection to businesses or other groups through violence outside the sanction of the law.

title: Protection racket
text: Through the credible threat of violence, the racketeers deter people from swindling, robbing, injuring, sabotaging or otherwise harming their clients.

title: Protection racket
text: Protection rackets tend to appear in markets where the police and judiciary cannot be counted on to provide legal protection, either because of incompetence (as in weak or failed states) or illegality (black markets).

title: E. Gordon Gee
text: Elwood Gordon Gee (born February 2, 1944) is an American academic and is currently serving his second term as President of West Virginia University.

title: E. Gordon Gee
text: He has served as the chief executive at several universities in the United States, previously serving at Ohio State University.

title: E. Gordon Gee
text: Gee had been heading an Ohio State-based think tank following his retirement from the Ohio State presidency on July 1, 2013.

title: E. Gordon Gee
text: He retired in response to a series of controversies relating to comments he made, the last of which involved anti-Catholic comments allegedly made in jest about the University of Notre Dame.

title: E. Gordon Gee
text: His resignation thus ended his second term as the president; he had previously served as president of Ohio State from 1990 to 1997.

title: Badr Hari
text: Badr Hari (Arabic: بدر هاري‎ ‎ ; born 8 December 1984) is a Moroccan-Dutch super heavyweight kickboxer from Amsterdam, fighting out of Mike's Gym in Oostzaan.

title: Badr Hari
text: He is a former K-1 Heavyweight champion (2007—2008), It's Showtime Heavyweight world champion (2009-2010) and "K-1 World Grand Prix 2009" finalist.

title: Badr Hari
text: Hari has been a prominent figure in the world of kickboxing and was once considered the best kickboxer in the world, however he has been involved in a number of controversies relating to his "unsportsmanlike conducts" in the sport and crimes of violence outside of the ring.

title: Guerra de Titanes (1998)
text: "Guerra de Titanes" (1998) ("War of the Titans") was the second "Guerra de Titanes" professional wrestling show promoted by AAA.

title: Guerra de Titanes (1998)
text: The show took place on December 13, 1998 in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Mexico.

title: Guerra de Titanes (1998)
text: The Main event featured a Steel Cage Match that highlighted two storyline feuds between Octagón and his "Evil twin" Pentagón and the feud between Heavy Metal and Kick Boxer as Octagón and Heavy Metal teamed together to take on Pentagón and Kick Boxer.

title: Global Fighting Championship
text: Global Fighting Championship (also known as GFC) was a UAE-based kickboxing and mixed martial arts (MMA) event.

title: Global Fighting Championship
text: Fighters from around world on the roster include Badr Hari, Peter Aerts, Peter Graham, Dewey Cooper, Zabit Samedov.

title: Global Fighting Championship
text: It was considered as one of the biggest kickboxing and MMA promotion in Middle East.

title: Outrageous Betrayal
text: Outrageous Betrayal: The Dark Journey of Werner Erhard from est to Exile is a non-fiction book written by freelance journalist Steven Pressman and first published in 1993 by St. Martin's Press.

title: Outrageous Betrayal
text: The book gives an account of Werner H. Erhard's early life as Jack Rosenberg, his exploration of various forms of self-improvement techniques, and his foundation of Erhard Seminars Training "est" and later of Werner Erhard and Associates and of the Est successor course, "The Forum".

title: Outrageous Betrayal
text: Pressman details the rapid financial success Erhard had with these companies, as well as controversies relating to litigation involving former participants in his courses.

title: Outrageous Betrayal
text: The work concludes by going over the impact of a March 3, 1991 "60 Minutes" broadcast on CBS where members of Erhard's family made allegations against him, and Erhard's decision to leave the United States.

title: Betting controversies in cricket
text: Cricket has had a number of controversies relating to players being involved with the betting aspects of the game.

title: Betting controversies in cricket
text: In particular, numerous players have been approached by bookmakers and bribed to throw matches, aspects of matches (e.g. the toss) or provide other information.

title: Prosecution of gender-targeted crimes
text: Prosecution of gender-targeted crimes is the legal proceedings to prosecute crimes such as rape and domestic violence.

title: Prosecution of gender-targeted crimes
text: The earliest documented prosecution of gender-based/targeted crimes is from 1474 when Sir Peter von Hagenbach was convicted for rapes committed by his troops.

title: Prosecution of gender-targeted crimes
text: However, the trial was unsuccessful in indicting Sir von Hagenbach with the charge of rape because the war in which the rapes occurred was "undeclared" and thus the rapes were only considered illegal.

title: Prosecution of gender-targeted crimes
text: Gender-targeted crimes continued to be prosecuted, but it was not until after World War II when an international criminal tribunal- the International Military Tribunal for the Far East (Tokyo Tribunal)- were officers charged for being responsible of the gender-targeted crimes (particularly rape) and other crimes against humanity.

title: Prosecution of gender-targeted crimes
text: Despite the various rape charges, the Charter of the Tokyo Tribunal did not make references to rape, and rape was considered as subordinate to other war crimes.

title: Prosecution of gender-targeted crimes
text: This is also the situation for other tribunals that followed, but with the establishments of the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) and the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda (ICTR), there was more attention to the prosecution of gender-targeted crimes with each of the statutes explicitly referring to rape and other forms of gender-targeted violence.

title: House of Anubis
text: House of Anubis is a mystery television series developed for Nickelodeon based on the Dutch-Belgian television series "Het Huis Anubis".

title: House of Anubis
text: The series was created by Hans Bourlon and Gert Verhulst and premiered on Nickelodeon on 1 January 2011 in the United States and on 25 February 2011 in the United Kingdom.

title: House of Anubis
text: The series is the first series from the network to be filmed outside the United States and the first telenovela-format series for the network.

title: House of Anubis
text: The show aired from 1 January 2011 to 17 June 2013.

title: Batibot

text: "Sesame!"

title: Batibot

title: Batibot

title: Wolfblood
text: Wolfblood is a British–German fantasy teen drama television series targeted at a young adult audience.

title: Wolfblood
text: Created by Debbie Moon, it is a co-production between CBBC and ZDF/ZDFE.

title: Wolfblood
text: The television series revolves around the life of the species known as wolfbloods.

title: Wolfblood
text: They are creatures that have enhanced senses and look like humans but at can turn at will into wolves.

title: Wolfblood
text: Their transformation is uncontrolled during a full moon, and they are at their weakest during "the dark of the moon", at a new moon.

title: Wolfblood
text: The television series focuses on their daily life and the challenges that they face to hide their secret.

title: Wolfblood
text: Each series has new characters and concepts and overall the television series has an interesting storyline.

title: Wolfblood
text: To date, five complete series have aired.

title: Wolfblood
text: Series 1 first aired on 10 September 2012 and concluded on 22 October 2012 and consisted of 13 episodes.

title: Wolfblood
text: Series 2 first aired on 9 September 2013 and concluded on 21 October 2013 and again consisted of 13 episodes.

title: Wolfblood
text: Series 3 first aired on 15 September 2014 and concluded on 27 October 2014 and also consisted of 13 episodes.

title: Wolfblood
text: Series 4 first aired on 8 March 2016 and concluded on 13 April 2016 and this time consisted of 12 episodes.

title: Wolfblood
text: A fifth season was announced on 6 June 2016 and began airing on 27 February 2017 and concluded on 1 May 2017 with 10 episodes.

title: Graduation Day (Buffy the Vampire Slayer)

title: Fish Police (TV series)
text: Fish Police is an animated television series from Hanna-Barbera based on the comic book series created by Steve Moncuse.

title: Fish Police (TV series)
text: It first aired on CBS in 1992, lasting six episodes over one season.

title: Fish Police (TV series)
text: In February of that year, three episodes aired, then the show was axed after falling in the television ratings.

text: The remaining three episodes never aired in the United States, but the entire series ran in European syndication.

title: Fish Police (TV series)

title: Nathalia Ramos
text: Nathalia Norah Ramos Cohen (born July 3, 1992) is a Spanish-Australian actress, who also holds U.S. citizenship.

title: Nathalia Ramos
text: Ramos is known for her portrayals of Yasmin in the 2007 film "", Jill in the 2013 film "The Damned", and lead character Nina Martin in the 2011 Nickelodeon television series "House of Anubis".

title: Het Huis Anubis
text: Het Huis Anubis ("The House of Anubis") is a Belgian-Dutch children's television drama created by Studio 100 and Nickelodeon, airing in the Netherlands and Flanders.

title: Het Huis Anubis
text: It first aired in September 2006 and the last episode was broadcast on December 4, 2009.

title: Het Huis Anubis
text: The show was a huge success in the Benelux, despite the show's low budget for the first two seasons.

text: Das Haus Anubis is a television program produced jointly by Belgian broadcaster Studio 100 and Nickelodeon and the first remake of Het Huis Anubis aired in The Netherlands and Belgium.

title: Das Haus Anubis
text: Another English remake called House of Anubis aired in 2011.

title: Das Haus Anubis
text: With a seven-figure production budget, it is one of Nickelodeon's largest in-house productions, and the first German daily soap opera specifically aimed at older children.

title: Das Haus Anubis
text: From 29 September 2009 to 4 May 2012, the show had been running both on children's channel Nick (daily at 7:40pm, and repeated in the afternoon and at weekends), and season 1 on music channel VIVA.

title: Mount Panorama Circuit
text: Mount Panorama Circuit is a motor racing track located in Bathurst, New South Wales, Australia.

title: Mount Panorama Circuit
text: It is situated on a hill with the dual official names of Mount Panorama and Wahluu and is best known as the home of the Bathurst 1000 motor race held each October, and the Bathurst 12 Hour event held each February.

title: Mount Panorama Circuit
text: The 6.213 km long track is technically a street circuit, and is a public road, with normal speed restrictions, when no racing events are being run, and there are many residences which can only be accessed from the circuit.

title: 2016 Intercontinental GT Challenge
text: The 2016 Intercontinental GT Challenge was the first season of the Intercontinental GT Challenge.

title: 2016 Intercontinental GT Challenge
text: The season featured three rounds — after the cancellation of the 6 Hours of the Americas - starting with Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour on 7 February and the season concluded with the Sepang 12 Hours on 10 December.

title: Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The Bathurst 12 Hour (currently known as the Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour for sponsorship reasons) is an endurance race for GT and production cars held at the Mount Panorama Circuit, in Bathurst, Australia in February each year.

title: Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The race was first held in 1991 for Series Production cars and moved to Sydney's Eastern Creek Raceway in 1995 before being discontinued.

title: Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The race was revived in 2007, again for production cars, before adding a new class for GT3 and other GT cars in 2011.

title: Bathurst 12 Hour
text: This has led to unprecedented domestic and international exposure for the event.

title: Bathurst 12 Hour
text: In all, sixteen races have taken place; fifteen at Mount Panorama and one at Eastern Creek Raceway.

title: 2018 Intercontinental GT Challenge
text: The 2018 Intercontinental GT Challenge will be the third season of the Intercontinental GT Challenge.

title: 2018 Intercontinental GT Challenge
text: The season will feature four rounds, starting with the Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour on 4 February, and concluding with the California 8 Hours on 21 October.

title: 2016 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The 2016 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour was an endurance race for a variety of GT and touring car classes, including: GT3 cars, GT4 cars and Group 3E Series Production Cars.

title: 2016 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The event, which was staged at the Mount Panorama Circuit, near Bathurst, in New South Wales, Australia on 7 February 2016, was the fourteenth running of the Bathurst 12 Hour.

title: 2016 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: It was also the opening round of the 2016 Intercontinental GT Challenge Series.

title: 2017 Intercontinental GT Challenge
text: The 2017 Intercontinental GT Challenge will be the second season of the Intercontinental GT Challenge.

title: 2017 Intercontinental GT Challenge
text: The season features four rounds, starting with the Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour on 5 February, and concluding with the Sepang 12 Hours on 10 December.

title: 2017 Intercontinental GT Challenge
text: Laurens Vanthoor is the defending drivers' champion and Audi is the defending manufacturers' champion.

title: 2013 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The 2013 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour was an endurance race for a variety of GT and touring car classes, including: GT3 cars, GT4 cars, Group 3E Series Production Cars and Dubai 24 Hour cars.

title: 2013 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The event, which was staged at the Mount Panorama Circuit, near Bathurst, in New South Wales, Australia on 10 February 2013, was the eleventh running of the Bathurst 12 Hour.

title: 2013 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The race also incorporated the opening round of the 2013 Australian GT Championship.

title: 2013 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The Australian GT Championship was to compete as the first hour only and cars were permitted to enter for only that hour or to cross-enter for both the first hour and continue for the endurance race.

title: 2015 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The 2015 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour was an endurance race for a variety of GT and touring car classes, including: GT3 cars, GT4 cars and Group 3E Series Production Cars.

title: 2015 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The event, which was staged at the Mount Panorama Circuit, near Bathurst, in New South Wales, Australia on 8 February 2015, was the thirteenth running of the Bathurst 12 Hour.

title: 2017 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The 2017 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour endurance race for GT and touring car classes, GT3 and GT4 cars was staged on the Mount Panorama Circuit, near Bathurst, in New South Wales, Australia 5 February 2017.

title: 2017 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The 15th running of the Bathurst 12 Hour constituted the opening round of the 2017 Intercontinental GT Challenge Series.

title: 2017 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: For the first time, the winners of the race were awarded the Australian Tourist Trophy.

title: 2014 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The 2014 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour was an endurance race for a variety of GT and touring car classes, including: GT3 cars, GT4 cars and Group 3E Series Production Cars.

title: 2014 Liqui Moly Bathurst 12 Hour
text: The event, which was staged at the Mount Panorama Circuit, near Bathurst, in New South Wales, Australia on 9 February 2014, was the twelfth running of the Bathurst 12 Hour.

title: Lights Out Paris
text: Lights Out Paris is the first studio album by American hip hop artist Sims, a member of Minneapolis indie hip hop collective Doomtree.

title: Lights Out Paris
text: It was released July 28, 2005 on Doomtree Records and includes guest appearances from P.O.S, Crescent Moon, and Toki Wright, among others.

title: Lights Out Paris
text: The album was re-released with four remixes and five songs from Sims' "False Hopes Four" on vinyl in June 2015.

title: El-P
text: Jaime Meline (born March 2, 1975), better known by his stage name El-P (shortened from El Producto), is an American hip hop recording artist, record producer, and record executive.

title: El-P
text: Originally a member of Company Flow, El-P has been a major driving force in alternative hip hop for more than two decades, producing for several notable rappers such as Aesop Rock, Mr. Lif, and Cage, among others.

title: Born and Raised (EP)
text: Born and Raised is the debut EP by American hip hop duo Smif-N-Wessun, released on December 3, 2013, under Duck Down Music Inc..

title: Born and Raised (EP)
text: Entirely produced by Beatnick & K-Salaam, the 6-song EP is a blend between reggae and hip hop, and includes guest appearances from Junior Reid, Jr.

title: Born and Raised (EP)
text: Kelly, Jahdan Blakkamoore, and DJ Full Factor.

title: Born and Raised (EP)
text: The EP was preceded by one single — "Solid Ground" featuring dancehall icon Junior Reid.

title: Lord Steppington
text: Lord Steppington is the debut studio album by California-based hip hop duo Step Brothers (rapper/producers The Alchemist and Evidence).

title: Lord Steppington
text: The album was released on January 21, 2014 by Rhymesayers Entertainment.

title: Lord Steppington
text: The record was produced entirely by Alchemist and Evidence, and includes guest appearances from Action Bronson, Roc Marciano, Blu, Fashawn, Rakaa, Oh No, Styles P, Domo Genesis and The Whooliganz – Alchemist's old group which included actor Scott Caan.

title: Control Freek
text: Control Freek is the second solo effort by rapper Tash of the West Coast hip hop crew Tha Alkaholiks.

title: Control Freek
text: This albums comes ten years after Tash's first well-received solo album Rap Life.

title: Control Freek
text: It was released in 2009 on Amalgam Digital.

title: Control Freek
text: It includes guest appearances from Tash's group Tha Alkaholiks in addition to guest spots from Del the Funky Homosapien, King T, B-Real from Cypress Hill, Knoc-turn'al, Khujo from Goodie Mob, among others.

title: Hip hop
text: Hip hop or hip-hop is a subculture and art movement developed in South Bronx in New York City during the late 1970s.

title: Hip hop
text: While people unfamiliar with hip hop culture often use the expression "hip hop" to refer exclusively to hip hop music (also called "rap"), Hip hop is characterized by nine distinct elements or expressive realms, of which hip hop music is only four elements (rapping, djaying, beatboxing and breaking).

title: Hip hop
text: Afrika Bambaataa of the hip hop collective Zulu Nation outlined the pillars of hip hop culture, coining the terms: "rapping" (also called MCing or emceeing), a rhythmic vocal rhyming style (orality); DJing (and turntablism), which is making music with record players and DJ mixers (aural/sound and music creation); b-boying/b-girling/breakdancing (movement/dance); and graffiti art, which he called "aerosol writin'", although many say that the graffiti that hip hop adopted had been around years earlier, and had nothing to do with hip hop culture.

title: Hip hop
text: (visual art).

title: Hip hop
text: Other elements of hip hop subculture and arts movements beyond the main four are: hip hop culture and historical knowledge of the movement (intellectual/philosophical); beatboxing, a percussive vocal style; street entrepreneurship; hip hop language; and hip hop fashion and style, among others.

title: Fast Cars, Danger, Fire and Knives
text: Fast Cars, Danger, Fire and Knives is an EP by American hip hop artist Aesop Rock.

title: Fast Cars, Danger, Fire and Knives
text: Released via the Definitive Jux label on February 22, 2005, the record is produced by Blockhead and Aesop Rock himself, with the former producing three tracks and the latter producing four, with one track produced by Rob Sonic.

title: Fast Cars, Danger, Fire and Knives
text: Vocals are handled by Aesop Rock, with guest appearances from Camu Tao and Metro of S.A. Smash and Definitive Jux label head El-P.

title: Fast Cars, Danger, Fire and Knives
text: All scratches are performed by DJ Big Wiz.

title: Longterm Mentality
text: Longterm Mentality is the debut studio album by American hip hop recording artist Ab-Soul.

title: Longterm Mentality
text: It was released on April 5, 2011, by Top Dawg Entertainment (TDE), exclusively to digital retailers, serving as Ab-Soul's debut retail release.

title: Longterm Mentality
text: The album features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Schoolboy Q, Kendrick Lamar, Punch, Alori Joh, JaVonté, MURS, BJ the Chicago Kid and Pat Brown, with the production from American hip hop record producers such as Tae Beast, Ayiro, Sounwave, AAyhasis, Context, Alexis Carrington and Tommy Black.

title: Longterm Mentality
text: Upon its release, the album received a highly acclaimed by music critics.

title: Experimental hip hop
text: Experimental hip hop, also known as abstract hip hop, is a genre of hip hop that employs structural elements typically considered unconventional in traditional hip hop music.

title: Experimental hip hop
text: Some notable experimental hip hop record labels include Definitive Jux, Anticon, Big Dada and Ninja Tune.

title: Experimental hip hop
text: While most experimental hip hop incorporates turntablism and is produced electronically, some artists have introduced acoustic elements to the music to facilitate it being performed live.

title: Changes (Alyson Avenue album)
text: Changes is the third album by Swedish AOR/rock band Alyson Avenue with new vocalist Arabella Vitanc.

title: Changes (Alyson Avenue album)
text: Alyson Avenue released their third album "Changes" through Avenue of Allies.

title: Changes (Alyson Avenue album)
text: The record was co-produced by band members and Chris Laney (Crazy Lixx, H.E.A.T., Brian Robertson) and includes guest appearances by Anette Olzon (Ex-Nightwish, Ex-Alyson Avenue), Michael Bormann (Ex-Jaded Heart, Charade, BISS), Rob Marcello (Danger Danger, Marcello - Vestry), Fredrik Bergh, (Street Talk, Bloodbound), Tommy Stråhle and Mike Andersson (Cloudscape, Planet Alliance).

title: Louis Stevens (writer)
text: Louis Stevens (December 25, 1896 – September 29, 1963) was an American screenwriter of the silent and sound film eras.

title: Louis Stevens (writer)
text: Born on Christmas Day 1896 in Riga, Latvia, Stevens entered the film industry in 1920 when he co-wrote the silent film "A World of Folly", with Jane Grogan.

title: Louis Stevens (writer)
text: In his over 30-year career he worked on over 40 screenplays, as well as several film shorts and two television series.

title: Louis Stevens (writer)
text: Among his more notable films were: contributing to the script of the 1931 version of "Dracula", starring Bela Lugosi; co-writing the story for What Price Hollywood?

title: Louis Stevens (writer)
text: (1932); the screenplay for the 1940 western, "Colorado", directed by Joseph Kane, and starring Roy Rogers; the story for "Streets of Laredo" (1949), starring William Holden, Macdonald Carey and William Bendix; 1951's "The Cimarron Kid", starring Audie Murphy; and "Horizons West" (1952), starring Robert Ryan, Julie Adams, and Rock Hudson.

title: Louis Stevens (writer)
text: Stevens' final screenplay was for "Flaming Frontier" in 1958, although he did some work on additional dialogue for the 1959 film, "Desert Desperadoes".

title: Louis Stevens (writer)
text: Stevens also wrote several television episodes, one for "Cheyenne", and two for "Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans", all in 1957.

title: The Lone Gunmen
text: The Lone Gunmen are a trio of fictional characters, Richard "Ringo" Langly, Melvin Frohike and John Fitzgerald Byers, who appeared in recurring roles on the American television series "The X-Files", and who starred in the short-lived spin-off, "The Lone Gunmen".

title: The Lone Gunmen
text: Their name was derived from the Warren Commission's conclusion that Lee Harvey Oswald was solely responsible for the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Hermanos de Pistoleros Latinos
text: Hermandad de Pistoleros Latinos (HPL, a.k.a. Pistoleros Latinos or Cuetes) is a Latino prison gang founded by Chino Avitia in Texas during the early 1980s.

title: Hermanos de Pistoleros Latinos
text: The English translation of the gang's name is "Brotherhood of Latin Gunmen".

title: Hermanos de Pistoleros Latinos
text: It operates in all Texas prisons and on the streets in many communities in Texas, particularly in Laredo.

title: Hermanos de Pistoleros Latinos
text: HPL is active throughout Mexico with its largest contingent in Nuevo Laredo.

title: Hermanos de Pistoleros Latinos
text: The gang is structured and is estimated to have 1,000 members.

title: Hermanos de Pistoleros Latinos
text: Members maintain close ties to several Mexican drug trafficking organizations and are involved in the trafficking of large quantities of cocaine and marijuana from Mexico into the United States for distribution.

title: Piranha (1972 film)
text: Piranha, also known as Piranha, Piranha or Caribe, is a 1972 adventure film shot in Venezuela starring William Smith and Peter Brown who had previously starred together in the "Laredo" Western TV series and Ahna Capri.

title: Gunmen from Laredo
text: Gunmen from Laredo is a 1959 American western film produced and directed by Wallace MacDonald, which stars Robert Knapp, Maureen Hingert, and Walter Coy.

title: Seemanto-heera
text: Sheemanto heera (The Frontier Diamond) is a detective novella written in Bengali by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay featuring the sleuth Byomkesh Bakshi and Ajit Bandyopadhyay.

title: Seemanto-heera
text: Written in 1934, it is the third such work of fiction featuring Byomkesh and is written in first-person narrative, as experienced by Byomkesh's friend, associate, and narrator, Ajit Bandyopadhyay.

title: Frontier Texas!
text: Frontier Texas!

title: Frontier Texas!
text: is a 14000 sqft museum of the American West in downtown Abilene, the seat of Taylor County in West Texas.

title: Frontier Texas!
text: The museum serves as a visitors information center for the Texas Forts Trail, one of ten Texas Historical Commission driving regions.

title: Frontier Texas!
text: Opened in 2004 at 625 North First Street on 6.4 acre near the Texas and Pacific Railway tracks, the museum focuses on settlers and lifestyles in the Old West.

title: Frontier Texas!
text: Exhibits display attacks by Indians and wolves, stampeding buffalo, a card game shootout, and a prairie thunderstorm.

title: Frontier Texas!
text: Visitors see depictions of buffalo hunters, Comanche warriors, explorers, and pioneers in the theatre called the "Century of Adventure", 1780-1880.

title: Frontier Texas!
text: The narrator in the theater is actor-artist Buck Taylor from Fort Worth.

title: Walter Coy
text: Walter Darwin Coy (January 31, 1909 – December 11, 1974) was an American stage, radio, film, and, principally, television actor, originally from Great Falls, Montana.

title: Walter Coy
text: He was best known for narrating the NBC western anthology series, "Frontier", which aired early Sunday evenings in the 1955–1956 season.

title: Max McLean
text: Max McLean is the founder and artistic director of Fellowship for Performing Arts, a New York City-based producer of live theater from a Christian worldview.

title: Max McLean
text: McLean conceived, adapted, produced and starred in "The Screwtape Letters", a play based on the book by Oxford and Cambridge scholar, author and fantasy writer C.S. Lewis.

title: Max McLean
text: His stage adaptation of Lewis’ "The Great Divorce" launched its national tour in late 2013.

title: Max McLean
text: McLean adapted, co-directed and starred in "C.S. Lewis Onstage: The Most Reluctant Convert", and co-wrote and produced "Martin Luther on Trial".

title: Max McLean
text: McLean also is the narrator of The Listener's Bible.

title: Bruce Harwood
text: Bruce Harwood (born April 29, 1963) is a Canadian character actor best known for his role of John Fitzgerald Byers, one of The Lone Gunmen on the television series "The X-Files".

title: Bruce Harwood
text: In addition to "The X-Files", Harwood portrayed Byers in the spin-off series "The Lone Gunmen", which aired thirteen episodes in 2001.

title: Bruce Harwood
text: He has also played other roles with a strong similarity to Byers, such as Willis, a technician from the Phoenix Foundation in "MacGyver", and government-scientist-turned-conspiracy-theorist Dr. Avery Strong in "The Outer Limits".

title: Bruce Harwood
text: He was a founding member of the Vancouver summer Shakespeare festival, Bard on the Beach.

title: Bruce Harwood
text: He also starred in the 1988 movie "Earth Star Voyager".

title: Pantun Sunda
text: Pantun Sunda is a type of Sundanese oral narrative performance interspersed with songs and music played on a "kacapi", a kind of zither.

title: Pantun Sunda
text: A pantun is intended to be recited during an evening-length performance during which a single performer relates the story of a hero’s initiation: The protagonist leaves his kingdom in order to seek experiences, beautiful princesses to become his wife, power, other kingdoms to subject, the realization of a dream (Rosidi 1984a:143); after having succeeded in reaching his goal he finally returns to his kingdom.

title: Pantun Sunda
text: Alongside descriptions of historical events, the stories often contain mythical elements.

title: Pantun Sunda
text: Pantun were originally not written down, the bards often being illiterate and in many cases blind.

title: Pantun Sunda
text: Originally the performances had a sacred character, as was clear from the offerings made at the beginning of the recitation and also from the content of the introductory part of the story, called rajah, which was an invocatory song, imploring the help of divine figures to ward off bad influences.

title: Pantun Sunda
text: The linguistic form of the pantun was not strictly fixed, however the dominant form employed in most pantun is the octosyllabic verse.

title: Pantun Sunda
text: For a detailed description of the nature and form of a Sundanese pantun you are referred to Eringa (1949), to Hermansoemantri (1977–79).

title: Bubu music
text: Bubu music is traditional music played by the Temne people in Sierra Leone.

title: Bubu music
text: The music was originally used in witchcraft ceremonies, but later it turned into a popular religious processional style played during Ramadan.

title: Bubu music
text: In its folk form, the music is played by blowing on bamboo cane flutes and on metal pipes -often repurposed auto parts.

title: Peşrev
text: Peşrev (pronounced ] in Turkish), "Pişrev" ( ), "peshrev," or "pishrev;" called "bashraf" بشرف in Arabic; is an instrumental form in Turkish classical music.

title: Peşrev
text: It is the name of the first piece of music played during a group performance called a fasıl (] ).

title: Peşrev
text: It also serves as the penultimate piece of the "Mevlevi ayini", ritual music of the Mevlevi order, under the name "son peşrev" (final peşrev), preceding "son semai".

title: Peşrev
text: It usually uses long rhythm cycles, stretching over many measures as opposed to the simpler usul the other major form of instrumental music uses, "saz semai".

title: Skiffle
text: Skiffle is a music genre with jazz, blues, folk and American folk influences, usually using a combination of manufactured and homemade or improvised instruments.

title: Skiffle
