title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
text: Filming began on September 10, 2012, in Atlanta, Georgia, before moving to Hawaii.

title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
text: The plot of "Catching Fire" takes place a few months after the previous installment; Katniss Everdeen and fellow District 12 tribute Peeta Mellark have returned home safely after winning the 74th Annual Hunger Games.

title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
text: Throughout the story, Katniss senses that a rebellion against the oppressive Capitol is simmering throughout the districts.

title: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?
text: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?

title: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?
text: (天神乱漫 -LUCKY or UNLUCKY!?

title: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?
text: - ) is a Japanese adult visual novel developed by Yuzusoft, and released for the PC on May 29, 2009.

title: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?
text: The game was later ported to the PlayStation Portable console by Russell on March 25, 2010, under the title "Tenshin Ranman - Happy Go Lucky!!"

title: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?
text: The gameplay in "Tenshin Ranman" follows a plot line which offers pre-determined scenarios with courses of interaction, and focuses on the appeal of the four female main characters.

title: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?
text: The story revolves around Haruki Chitose, the very unfortunate protagonist, and older brother of Sana Chitose.

title: Tenshin Ranman: Lucky or Unlucky!?
text: One day, he receives a parcel containing something he would never have thought.

title: Hello, Good-bye
text: Hello, Good-bye (ハローグッドバイ , Harō Guddobai ) is a Japanese adult visual novel developed and published by Lump of Sugar.

title: Hello, Good-bye
text: It was released on December 17, 2010 for Windows as Lump of Sugar's sixth title.

title: Hello, Good-bye
text: A trial edition was released in October 2010 rated for all ages.

title: Hello, Good-bye
text: The primary focus of the game is the appeal of the four female main characters.

title: Hello, Good-bye
text: The story resolves around the protagonist, Kaito Toubu, who is actually a secret agent with the ability to experience time loops.

title: May 16 coup
text: The May 16 coup (Hangul: 5.16 군사정변 ; Hanja: 五一六軍事政變 ; RR: "O-illyuk gunsa-jeongbyeon " ) was a military coup d'état in South Korea in 1961, organized and carried out by Park Chung-hee and his allies who formed the Military Revolutionary Committee, nominally led by Army Chief of Staff Chang Do-yong after the latter's acquiescence on the day of the coup.

title: May 16 coup
text: The coup rendered powerless the democratically elected government of Yun Bo-seon and ended the Second Republic, installing a reformist military Supreme Council for National Reconstruction effectively led by Park, who took over as Chairman after General Chang's arrest in July.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: Han Myeong-sook (born March 24, 1944; Korean: 한명숙 ] ) was the Prime Minister of South Korea from April 2006 to March 2007.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: She is South Korea's first female prime minister (second female prime minister overall if the acting premiership of Chang Sang is included).

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: She was from the United New Democratic Party (UNDP) as a member of the Korean National Assembly (representative) for Ilsan-gab, and is a graduate of Ewha Womans University in Seoul with a degree in French literature.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: She resigned as Prime Minister on March 7, 2007 and declared her presidential candidacy.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: But she did not succeed in the nominations.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: In 2008 she ran for parliament, but was not elected.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: However, in January 2012 she was elected leader of the main oppositional Democratic United Party (DUP) before the April legislative elections and became a member of parliament.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: But the liberals did not manage to defeat the ruling Saenuri Party and Han stepped down as party leader in April 2012.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: In August 2015, Han was convicted of receiving illegal donations at the amount of 900 million KRW, and sentence to two years in prison.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: She is ineligible to run for public office for ten years after her prison term.

title: Han Myeong-sook
text: She became the first former prime minister of the Republic of Korea to serve a prison time.

title: Chang Dae-hwan
text: Chang Dae-hwan (also Chang Dae-whan; born 21 March 1952) is a South Korean businessman.

title: Chang Dae-hwan
text: He is best known as the president of the "Maeil Business Newspaper", South Korea's main business daily.

title: Chang Dae-hwan
text: He also served a brief stint as South Korea's acting prime minister in August 2002 under president Kim Dae-jung, but the National Assembly voted not to confirm him.

title: Chang Won-jun
text: Chang Won-jun (Hangul: 장원준, Hanja: 張元準) (born July 31, 1985 in Seoul) is a South Korean starting pitcher who currently plays for the Doosan Bears.

title: Chang Won-jun
text: Chang played for the Lotte Giants in the Korea Baseball Organization from 2004 to 2011.

title: Chang Won-jun
text: He bats and throws left-handed.

title: Korea under Japanese rule
text: Korea under Japanese rule began with the end of the short-lived Korean Empire in 1910 and ended at the conclusion of World War II in 1945.

title: Korea under Japanese rule
text: Japanese rule of Korea was the outcome of a process that began with the Japan–Korea Treaty of 1876, whereby a complex coalition of the Meiji government, military, and business officials sought to integrate Korea both politically and economically into the Empire of Japan.

title: Korea under Japanese rule
text: A major stepping-stone towards the Japanese occupation of Korea was the Japan–Korea Treaty of 1905, in which the then-Korean Empire was declared a protectorate of Japan.

title: Korea under Japanese rule
text: The annexation of Korea by Japan was set up in the Japan–Korea Treaty of 1910, which was never actually signed by the Korean Regent, Gojong.

title: Tommy Chang (martial artist)
text: Born and raised in Kyong Ki Do, South Korea, Master Tommy Chang is a Korean-Canadian world-renowned 7th degree Taekwondo and 8Th Degree Hapkido instructor and Grandmaster, actor, stunt performer, stunt coordinator and producer.

title: Tommy Chang (martial artist)
text: With over 40 years of training and experience in Taekwondo and Hapkido, Master Chang also trained extensively in ITF/WTF TKD, Moo Duk Kwan, and Judo.

title: Tommy Chang (martial artist)
text: He is also an 8th Degree Black Belt in Hap Ki-Do, specializing in pressure points, take-downs and grappling.

title: Tommy Chang (martial artist)
text: His martial arts expertise also encompasses mastery of several weapons.

title: Tommy Chang (martial artist)
text: In addition, he is a WTF-certified Master Instructor of Taekwondo and a Canadian National Referee (1st Class).

title: United States in the Korean War
text: At the conclusion of World War II the Allied nations began the process of disarmament of Axis controlled regions.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: Japan occupied Korea at this time and had been in control since 1910.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: In 1945, the decision was made to have American Marines forces oversee Japanese surrender and disarmament south of the 38th parallel and the Soviet Union would facilitate the change of power to the north.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: At the time there was no political motivation and seemed to be a logical and convenient plan of action.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: The original agreement and intent was to create a unified and independent Korea out of the post Japanese occupation era.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: Instead each side of the 38th parallel established its own government under the influence of the occupational country; the United States in South Korea and the Soviet Union in North Korea.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: Both new Korean governments discredited the other and claimed to be the only legitimate political system.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: Tensions between the North and South escalated and each side began to petition foreign powers for resources and support.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: South Korea wanted weapons and supplies from Truman and the United States government while North Korea sought help from Stalin and the Soviet Union.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: The United States was still war weary from the disruptive World War II campaign and refused South Korea's request for weapons and troops.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: North Korea convinced the Soviet Union to supply them with the weapons and support they requested.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: This decision coincided with the United States withdrawing the last remaining combat troops from South Korea.

title: United States in the Korean War
text: North Korea saw its opportunity and attacked South Korean forces at the 38th parallel on June 25, 1950 and thus initiating the Korean War.

title: Chang Mi-hee
text: Chang Mi-hee (born December 8, 1958) is a South Korean actress active since 1976.

title: Chang Mi-hee
text: She was born Lee Yun-hui in Seoul, South Korea in 1957.

title: Chang Mi-hee
text: Chang debuted as an actress in 1976 as starring in "Seong Chun-hyang jeon" directed by Park Tae-won and TBC TV drama, "Haenyeo Dang-sil" (Sea Woman Dang-sil).

title: Chang Mi-hee
text: Chang was commonly referred to as "New Troika" or "Second Troika" along with her rival actresses, Jeong Yun-hui and Yu Ji-in of the 1970s and 1980s after the "First Troika", Moon Hee, Nam Jeong-im, and Yoon Jeong-hee of the 1960s.

title: Chang Yong-hak
text: Chang Yong-hak (25 April 1921 – 31 August 1999) was a Korean writer.

title: Chang Yong-hak
text: Chang was born in Hamyeong Buk-do in what is now North Korea.

title: Chang Yong-hak
text: He studied at Waseda University in Japan, before being drafted into the Japanese army.

title: Chang Yong-hak
text: After the end of World War Two, he taught high school in Korea, writing fiction on the side.

title: Chang Ucchin
text: Chang Ucchin (26 November 1917 – 27 December 1990) is one of the representatives of modern Korean fine art.

title: Chang Ucchin
text: Chang was born when Korea was still under Japanese colonial rule.

title: Chang Ucchin
text: He studied western art at Tokyo's Imperial School of Art.

title: Chang Ucchin
text: He became a professor of fine arts at Seoul National University in 1954, but resigned to paint full-time from 1960.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: The Los Angeles County Federation of Labor was started in 1885.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: Originally, the Los Angeles County Federation of Labor was split into five individual unions of bakers, cigar makers, printers, tailors, and carpenters.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: Now they represent over 300 unions, about 800,000 people, throughout Los Angeles County, making it the second largest in the country.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: “A survey published in December 2003 showed that the three largest unions in the Los Angeles County Federation of Labor were SEIU 434B (with seventy-four thousand homecare and nursing home workers), SEIU 399 with forty-five thousand health care and other employees, and the United Teachers of Los Angeles (with thirty thousand teachers from the American Federation and the National Education Association).”

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: They have helped make Los Angeles a union city.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: Their mission is to “ promote a voice for workers through organizing themselves into unions, building strong coalitions of labor, community, faith, and responsible businesses, engaging in both organizing and political campaigns, electing pro-union and pro-worker candidates and advancing public policies that support workers, families and local communities.”

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: They also encourage people to help make change by voting.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: The Los Angeles County Federation of labor is a major focal point for new American labor movement.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: Recently, the impressive progression of Los Angeles becoming a union city has become a stand out model for other non-union cities because of Los Angeles’ anti-union history.

title: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
text: Los Angeles combines the economic development activism and the refined political work of the Los Angeles County Federation of Labor.

title: Good Life Cafe
text: The Good Life Cafe was a health food market and cafe in Los Angeles, California, known for its open mic nights that helped the 1990s Los Angeles alternative hip hop movement flourish.

title: Good Life Cafe
text: In 2008, director Ava DuVernay, who had performed at the cafe with the Figures of Speech hip hop group, released a documentary about the cafe, "This Is The Life".

title: Good Life Cafe
text: The film featured a number of hip hop artists discussing the importance of the Good Life Cafe to themselves and the hip hop scene.

title: Good Life Cafe
text: The Cafe was open from 1989 to 1999.

title: Austin Young
text: Austin Young (born April 12, 1966) is an American photographer, film maker and new media artist currently based in Los Angeles.

title: Austin Young
text: His work has created an encyclopedic documentation of sub and trans culture in New York, Los Angeles and San Francisco.

title: Austin Young
text: Young's photographs have been featured in major publications such as Interview magazine, OK, and Flaunt and have been shown in solo exhibitions and projects at LACMA (Los Angeles, CA), Machine Project (Los Angeles, CA), Hammer Museum (Los Angeles, CA), Berkeley Art Museum (Berkeley, California); and as well as groups shows at Los Angeles Contemporary Exhibitions (Los Angeles, CA) and Stephen Cohen Gallery (Los Angeles, CA).

title: Austin Young
text: In addition to photography and film making, Young is co-founder of Fallen Fruit, an art collective who use fruit as a common denominator for public engagement and collaboration.

title: Old School (film)
text: Old School is a 2003 American comedy film released by DreamWorks Pictures and The Montecito Picture Company and directed by Todd Phillips.

title: Old School (film)
text: The story was written by Court Crandall, and the film was written by Phillips and Scot Armstrong.

title: Old School (film)
text: The film stars Luke Wilson, Vince Vaughn, and Will Ferrell as three depressed thirty-somethings who seek to re-live their college days by starting a fraternity, and the tribulations they encounter in doing so.

title: Old School (film)
text: Since its release it has gained a massive cult following, since a lot of minor characters in the film went on to have huge careers such as Simon Helberg, Elisha Cuthbert, Rob Corddry and Artie Lange.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: Stephen Nicholas (born 23 August 1978) also known as Stephen Charles Nicholas is an actor and presenter from Doncaster, South Yorkshire, England.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: Stephen currently lives in Sheffield, his first role was on Sky One's Dream Team, where he played Scott Ward.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: From there, he filmed the first in the trilogy Goal!

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: (In which he played a Newcastle United Reserves player).

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: Following this, he moved to Los Angeles, where he played Smith in the feature film Futbaal: The Price of Dreams.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: Stephen then returned to the UK to make a Bollywood film called Dhana Dhana Goal with John Abraham.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: Stephen then experienced his first opportunity in reality TV with the show Premier League All Stars for Sky One, as well as playing a footballer, he was on-hand to present celebrity gossip and pitch side reports.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: He then appeared in Celebrity Most Haunted and Date the Enemy.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: From there he then went on to star in Goal 3 where he not only acted in the film he also became the football choreographer and choreographed all the football scenes in the film.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: Nicholas then starred in the film Damned United where he played Welsh international Alan Durban, the film was filmed in Chesterfield and Leeds and was directed by Oscar winner Tom Hooper and also starred Oscar nominated Michael Sheen.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: Stephens next production was the feature film called 'No Way Back Now'about the notorious Manchester district of Moss Side, where Stephen played the lead actor Stuart Gavin,The feature is roughly based on the notorious Gooch gang that terrorised Manchester throughout the years.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: The next move for Stephen was pantomime where he was part of the production Aladdin over the Christmas period of 2015 in Doncaster playing Abanaza the main villain which he did until January 7, 2016!

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: He has recently been cast in the up-and-coming Feature Film 'Whiteblade' where he will play Thurstan the head Warlord Whiteblade is currently in production and Stephen is shooting his scenes in August 2016.

title: Stephen Nicholas (actor)
text: In September 2016 Stephen will be presenting the Sky TV show 'Britz go Bollywood' the show consists of a group of Celebrities being dressed by The best Indian designers, Stephen is the main presenter of the show which will be screened live September 2, 2016.

title: John Miner
text: Composer John Miner may be best known for his rock opera Heavens Cafe, which was staged at the Flamingo Theater in Las Vegas 1996, the Charleston Performing Arts Center in 1997, and later at Insurgo Theater in Los Angeles in 2004.

title: John Miner
text: Miner formed the progressive rock group Art Rock Circus to perform the music with a live band on stage alongside the singers and actors.

title: John Miner
text: Investor Mike Lewis was instrumental in financing and staging Heavens Cafe.

title: John Miner
text: The Tributary Music Label released a live CD of Heavens Cafe to the progressive rock community in 2000.

title: Quality Cafe
text: Quality Cafe is the name of two different former locations in Downtown Los Angeles, California.

title: Quality Cafe (jazz club)
text: Quality Cafe was a historical restaurant and jazz club located at 1143 East 12th Street near the corner of Central Avenue in Downtown Los Angeles.

title: Quality Cafe (jazz club)
text: Quality Four, a jazz quartet founded by saxophonist Paul Howard and featuring young vibraphonist Lionel Hampton, was formed in 1924 to play at Quality Cafe.

title: Quality Cafe (jazz club)
text: The band soon became Quality Quintet and then Quality Serenades, and was disbanded after a tour with Hazel Myers later in the same year.

title: Quality Cafe (jazz club)
text: On June 7, 1924, the venue changed its name to Humming Bird Cafe and became "one of the hottest nightclubs in the area" under this name.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: Filandia is a town and municipality in the northern part of the department of Quindío, Colombia.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: It is located on the west side of Cordillera Central of the Andes mountain range running through central Colombia, 26 km north of the departmental capital Armenia.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: It is the northernmost of twelve municipalities that form Quindío, the second smallest department of Colombia.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: It houses a small community economically supported by agriculture and tourism.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: Although coffee is the major agricultural product, the municipality's diverse ecosystem makes it perfect for the production of numerous fruits and vegetables.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: The population is evenly split between the urban and rural areas, with an urban population in the town of Filandia itself of nearly 7000 inhabitants and a population of around 6500 in the rest of the municipality.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: Most of the population is classified as mestizo (63,2%) and the most common religion is Roman Catholic.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: The town's architecture, landscapes and the sociability of the locals makes Filandia one of the most beautiful and attractive towns in the department of Quindio and the nation.

title: Filandia, Quindío
text: The town's best-known tourist attractions are its "mirador" (viewing tower) with its extensive views over the Cauca River valley to the west and the Parque Nacional Natural los Nevados to the east (it is also possible to see both Armenia and Pereira from the top of the tower), and the cafe in the main square where scenes from the popular Colombian telenovela "Cafe, con aroma de mujer" were filmed.

title: Quality Cafe (diner)
text: The Quality Cafe (also known as Quality Diner) is a now-defunct diner at 1236 West 7th Street in Los Angeles, California.

title: Quality Cafe (diner)
text: The restaurant ceased to function as a diner in late 2006 but has appeared as a location featured in a number of Hollywood films, including "Training Day", "Old School", "Se7en", "Ghost World", "Gone in 60 Seconds", "The Stepfather", "What's Love Got to Do with It", "Sex and Death 101", and "Catch Me If You Can."

title: Quality Cafe (diner)
text: It was also featured in Season 1 of the 2007 television series "Mad Men," in the episode "5G".

title: Guess Who I Saw Today
text: "Guess Who I Saw Today" is a popular jazz song written by Murray Grand with lyrics by Elisse Boyd.

title: Guess Who I Saw Today
text: The song was originally composed for Leonard Sillman's Broadway musical revue "New Faces of 1952" in which it was sung by June Carroll.

title: Paul Nassau
text: Paul David Nassau (January 30, 1930 in New York City – March 9, 2013 in Palm Beach Gardens) was an American composer and lyricist for the stage.

title: Paul Nassau
text: He contributed songs to the musical revue "New Faces of 1956", and wrote both the music and lyric to the Broadway shows "Happy Town" (1959), "A Joyful Noise" (1966), and "The Education of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N" (1968).

title: Paul Nassau
text: He married Chloe Anderson on December 23, 1953.

title: Paul Nassau
text: The couple had two children: Robert and Julie.

title: New Faces of 1952
text: New Faces of 1952 is a musical revue with songs and comedy skits.

title: New Faces of 1952
text: It ran on Broadway for nearly a year in 1952 and was then made into a motion picture in 1954.

title: New Faces of 1952
text: It helped jump start the careers of several young performers including Paul Lynde, Alice Ghostley, Eartha Kitt, Robert Clary, Carol Lawrence, Ronny Graham, performer/writer Mel Brooks (as Melvin Brooks), and lyricist Sheldon Harnick.

title: Carol Lawrence
text: Carol Lawrence (born September 5, 1932) is an American actress, most often associated with musical theatre, but who has also appeared extensively on television.

title: Monotonous (song)
text: "Monotonous" is a popular song written by June Carroll and Arthur Siegel for Leonard Sillman's Broadway revue "New Faces of 1952".

title: Monotonous (song)
text: The song was written based on the experiences of its singer Eartha Kitt.

title: Monotonous (song)
text: It was performed, at the insistence of Kitt, on three chaise longues (Kitt tried originally for six and was given three in compromise), crawling cat-like from one to the other, demonstrating her flexibility and her dance training from the Katherine Dunham Company.

title: Monotonous (song)
text: The song also includes references to many well-known people of the 1950s.

title: Monotonous (song)
text: People referenced in the song include:

title: How to Eat Like a Child
text: How to Eat Like a Child – And Other Lessons in Not Being a Grown-up is an original musical comedy television special that aired on NBC on September 22, 1981.

title: How to Eat Like a Child
text: Based on Delia Ephron's best-selling book of the same name, and adapted for television by Judith Kahan with music and lyrics by John Forster, the one-hour special, through a series of comedy skits and songs, lampoons the adult world through the eyes of children.

title: How to Eat Like a Child
text: The musical variety stars Dick Van Dyke as the resident "grown-up" alongside 15 children (8 boys and 7 girls) ranging in age from 7 to 13.

title: How to Eat Like a Child
text: Several of the special's young performers would subsequently go on to achieve child stardom in their own right, most notably Corey Feldman, Billy Jacoby and Georg Olden.

title: New Faces (film)
text: New Faces is a 1954 American film adaptation of the musical revue "New Faces of 1952" directed by Harry Horner and sketches directed by John Beal.

title: New Faces (film)
text: Filmed in Cinemascope and Eastmancolor it was released by Twentieth Century Fox on March 6, 1954.

title: Mary Begoña
text: Mary Begoña (born 1929 in Bilbao, Spain) was the stage name of María Bragas Begoña who was a Spanish vedette and actress.

title: Mary Begoña
text: She started dancing at age 7 and performed in venues in Madrid while she was studying at the Academies of Quiroga, Ompín and Monreal.

title: Mary Begoña
text: Then she studied with Antonio Bautista and Sacha Goudine in Barcelona.

title: Mary Begoña
text: She debuted in a musical revue at the age of fourteen and during Spanish Civil War (from 1936 to 1939) was part of the CNT Union.

title: Mary Begoña
text: In 1943, Begoña worked in Valencia in Juanita Reina's acting troupe, but returned to Madrid to debut in the Teatro Calderón.

title: Mary Begoña
text: In 1945 she appeared in the revue "Danubio Azul" (Blue Danube) with Manolo Caracol and Lola Flores and the following year was the principal vedette in the revue "De la Tierra a Venus" (From the Earth to Venus).

title: Mary Begoña
text: For the next several years she performed in variety shows with various acting troupes, such as "Tres días para quererte" (1945), "¡Róbame esta noche!"

title: Mary Begoña
text: (1947), "A La Habana me voy" (1948).

title: Mary Begoña
text: In 1951, she did a season in the US and then returned to Spain appearing in "¡A vivir del cuento!"

title: Mary Begoña
text: (1952) and "Los líos de Elías" (1954).

title: Mary Begoña
text: Begoña then formed her own company, which between 1953 and 1960 performed ten different plays.

title: Mary Begoña
text: As her career declined in revue style shows, she began performing in comedy theater, film, and television.

title: Leonard Sillman
text: Leonard Sillman (May 9, 1908 - January 23, 1982) was an American Broadway producer.

title: Leonard Sillman
text: Born in Detroit, Michigan on May 9, 1908, he was the brother of June Carroll, the brother-in-law of Sidney Carroll and the uncle of Steve Reich and Jonathan Carroll.

title: Leonard Sillman
text: He is perhaps best known for his series of musical revues, "Leonard Sillman's New Faces", which introduced many major stars to Broadway audiences, such as Eartha Kitt, Inga Swenson, Paul Lynde and Maggie Smith.

title: Leonard Sillman
text: Versions of "New Faces" were produced in 1934, 1936 (made into the film "New Faces of 1937"), 1943, 1952 (made into the film "New Faces"), 1956, 1962 and 1968.

title: Leonard Sillman
text: The very first "New Faces" in 1934 included actors Henry Fonda, Imogene Coca and Frances Dewey Wormser.

title: Leonard Sillman's New Faces of 1968
text: Leonard Sillman's New Faces of 1968 is a 1968 musical revue produced by Leonard Sillman.

title: Leonard Sillman's New Faces of 1968
text: The original production included Madeline Kahn.

title: Leonid Ramzin
text: Leonid Konstantinovich Ramzin (Russian: Леони́д Константи́нович Рамзи́н ) (1887–1948) was a Soviet thermal engineer, and the inventor of a type of flow-through boiler known as the straight-flow boiler, or Ramzin boiler.

title: Leonid Ramzin
text: He was a laureate of the Stalin Prize First-Class, which he received in 1943.

title: Leftover hash lemma
text: The leftover hash lemma is a lemma in cryptography first stated by Russell Impagliazzo, Leonid Levin, and Michael Luby.

title: Phthinosaurus
text: Phthinosaurus is an extinct genus of therapsid from the Middle Permian of Russia.

title: Phthinosaurus
text: The type species Phthinosaurus borrisiaki was named by Soviet paleontologist Ivan Yefremov in 1940 on the basis of an isolated lower jaw.

title: Phthinosaurus
text: Because this jaw provides few distinguishing characteristics, the evolutionary relationships of "Phthinosaurus" are poorly known.

title: Phthinosaurus
text: Yefremov named the family Phthinosuchidae in 1954 to include "Phthinosaurus" and the newly named "Phthinosuchus", which was described on the basis of a crushed partial skull.

title: Phthinosaurus
text: American paleontologist Everett C. Olson placed both of these therapsids in the larger infraorder Phthinosuchia in 1961.

title: Phthinosaurus
text: In 1974 Leonid Tatarinov named the family Phthinosauridae to include "Phthinosaurus" alone, retaining "Phthinosuchus" within Phthinosuchidae.

title: Kate Dillon Levin
text: Kate Dillon Levin (born March 2, 1974 in Washington D.C.) is an American model, activist and actress.

title: Kate Dillon Levin
text: She is best known for her work as a plus-size model where she appeared in multiple editorials in fashion magazines, appeared in cosmetics, plus-size, and designer campaigns, worked with top photographers on campaigns and in editorials and appeared in many mass media outlets.

title: Kate Dillon Levin
text: She was the first plus-size model to appear in U.S. Vogue and was the first plus-size model to appear in a Gucci campaign.

title: Kate Dillon Levin
text: Dillon has also been involved with many non-profit organizations, and is an advocate for eating disorder awareness and treatment, sustainability, global poverty reduction and social justice.

title: Kate Dillon Levin
text: She received her bachelor's degree in political science and international studies from University of St. Thomas and master's degree in international development from Harvard University's John F. Kennedy School of Government.

title: Kate Dillon Levin
text: Dillon was briefly married to Gabe Levin.

title: Kate Dillon Levin
text: During the marriage they had a son.

title: Tony Levin
text: Anthony Frederick Levin (born June 6, 1946) is an American musician and composer, specializing in electric bass, Chapman Stick and upright bass.

title: Tony Levin
text: He also sings and plays synthesizer.

title: Tony Levin
text: Levin is best known for his work with King Crimson and Peter Gabriel.

title: Tony Levin
text: He was also a member of Liquid Tension Experiment, Bruford Levin Upper Extremities, ProjeKct One, and ProjeKct Four.

title: Tony Levin
text: He has led his own band, Stick Men.

title: Gabriel Levin
text: Gabriel Levin (Born 1948, Paris) is a poet, translator and essayist.

title: Gabriel Levin
text: He lives in Jerusalem with his wife and children.

title: Gabriel Levin
text: Levin is one of the founding editors of Ibis Editions, a small non-profit press devoted to the publication of the literature of the Levant, and serves as its Editor-at-large.

title: Gabriel Levin
text: Levin's work has appeared in numerous literary magazines, including PN Review, The Times Literary Supplement, the Chicago Review, Raritan and Parnassus.

title: Gabriel Levin
text: "To these Dark Steps", a volume written in response to operation "Cast Lead" (2008), was set by British composer Alexander Goehr for tenor, children's choir, and ensemble and premiered September 2012 at the CBSO Centre in Birmingham.

title: Gabriel Levin
text: Levin is the son of the American novelist Meyer Levin (best known for "Compulsion", the first "non-fiction novel") and French novelist Tereska Torres.

title: Leonid Levin
text: Leonid Anatolievich Levin ( ; Russian: Леони́д Анато́льевич Ле́вин ; Ukrainian: Леоні́д Анато́лійович Ле́він ; born November 2, 1948) is a Soviet-American computer scientist.

title: Pavel Urysohn
text: Pavel Samuilovich Urysohn (Па́вел Самуи́лович Урысо́н ) (February 3, 1898 – August 17, 1924) was a Soviet mathematician of Jewish origin who is best known for his contributions in dimension theory, and for developing Urysohn's Metrization Theorem and Urysohn's Lemma, both of which are fundamental results in topology.

title: Pavel Urysohn
text: His name is also commemorated in the terms Urysohn universal space, Fréchet–Urysohn space, Menger–Urysohn dimension and Urysohn integral equation.

title: Pavel Urysohn
text: He and Pavel Alexandrov formulated the modern definition of compactness in 1923.

title: Meyer Levin
text: Meyer Levin (October 7, 1905 – July 9, 1981) was an American novelist.

title: Meyer Levin
text: Perhaps best known for his work on the Leopold and Loeb case, Levin worked as a journalist (for the "Chicago Daily News" and, from 1933–39, as an editor for "Esquire").

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: Leonid Bunimovich is a Soviet and American mathematician, who specializes in dynamical systems.

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: He is known for discovery of a fundamental mechanism of chaos (hyperbolicity) in Dynamical systems, which is called mechanism of defocusing.

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: The most famous class of chaotic dynamical systems of this type Dynamical billiards are focusing chaotic billiards (e.g., the "Bunimovich stadium","Bunimovich flowers", etc.).

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: More recently he introduced so called Bunimovich mushrooms, which are visual examples of billiards with mixed regular and chaotic dynamics.

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: In many labs over the world were built experimental devices in the form of various Bunimovich billiards.

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: He received bachelor's degree in 1967 and PhD in 1973 from the University of Moscow.

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: His thesis adviser was Yakov G. Sinai.

title: Leonid Bunimovich
text: In 1986 he was awarded Doctor of Sciences degree in "Theoretical and Mathematical Physics".

title: Whiteout Conditions
text: Whiteout Conditions is the seventh studio album by Canadian indie rock band The New Pornographers.

title: Whiteout Conditions
text: It was released on April 7, 2017, and is the first album not to feature either longtime drummer Kurt Dahle or singer-songwriter Dan Bejar.

title: A. C. Newman
text: Allan Carl Newman (born April 14, 1968) is a Canadian musician and singer–songwriter.

title: A. C. Newman
text: He was a member of the indie rock bands Superconductor and Zumpano in the 1990s.

title: A. C. Newman
text: Following the breakup of those bands, he reemerged as the leader of the New Pornographers in 2000, a band who have enjoyed commercial and critical success.

title: Kings of Leon
text: Kings of Leon is an American rock band that formed in Nashville, Tennessee, in 1999.

title: Kings of Leon
text: The band is composed of brothers Caleb Followill (b. January 14, 1982, lead vocals, rhythm guitar), Nathan Followill (b. June 26, 1979, drums, percussion, backing vocals) and Jared Followill (b. November 20, 1986, bass guitar, backing vocals), with their cousin Matthew Followill (b. September 10, 1984, lead guitar, backing vocals).

title: Little Scout
text: Little Scout are an independent band from Brisbane, Australia.

title: Little Scout
text: They have released two EPs and one album, and have toured with established Australian bands Yves Klein Blue, The Holidays, Holly Throsby, Clare Bowditch and Cloud Control; and international bands Belle and Sebastian, The New Pornographers, Sharon Van Etten, School of Seven Bells and Camera Obscura.

title: Little Scout
text: Soon after forming in 2008 they were named as one of Triple J's "Next Crop" artists and have been featured on Vimeo, receiving over 69,000 views.

title: Little Scout
text: Their debut album "Take Your Light" was released in 2011, to positive reviews.

title: Neko Case
text: Neko Richelle Case ( ; born September 8, 1970) is an American singer-songwriter, best known for her solo career and her contributions as a member of the Canadian indie rock group The New Pornographers.

title: Good People Rock
text: GOOD PEOPLE ROCK: A Yellow Bird Project Covers Compilation is an exclusive album of Yellow Bird Project bands covering other Yellow Bird Project bands.

title: Good People Rock
text: It was released in vinyl and digital formats via Madic Records, which is a label imprint of Arts & Crafts Productions, owned and operated by Dan Mangan.

title: Good People Rock
text: The album was crowd-funded on PledgeMusic and took several years to produce The album's first single, Andrew Bird's cover of "The Fake Headlines" (originally by The New Pornographers), was released on April 7, 2015 with a music video that was premiered on Pitchfork Media.

title: Kathryn Calder
text: Kathryn Jane Calder (born June 17, 1982) is a Canadian indie rock musician, who performs as a solo artist, and is a member of the band The New Pornographers.

title: Kathryn Calder
text: She is a former member of Immaculate Machine.

title: Kathryn Calder
text: Calder started with The New Pornographers by filling in for Neko Case for live performances and was made a permanent member in 2006.

title: Kurt Dahle
text: Kurt Colin Dahle is a Canadian musician best known for his work as a drummer and vocalist with the rock bands Age of Electric, Limblifter, and The New Pornographers.

title: Phantom Buffalo
text: Phantom Buffalo is an indie-rock band from Portland, Maine.

title: Phantom Buffalo
text: The band was known as The Ponys until 2004, when both Portland's Ponys and Chicago-based band The Ponys were invited to perform at South by Southwest.

title: Phantom Buffalo
text: Being the lower-profile of the two bands, the Portland group decided on a name change shortly thereafter.

title: Phantom Buffalo
text: The current lineup consists of Jonathan Balzano-Brookes (vocals, guitar), Tim Burns (guitar, vocals), Joe Domrad (drums), Jacob Chamberlain (drums), Sean Newton (bass), and Philip Willey (guitar, accordion, keyboards).

title: Phantom Buffalo
text: The band has released music domestically on the Time-Lag Records label and in the UK on Rough Trade Records.

title: Phantom Buffalo
text: The band's jangly, psychedelic pop music has been compared to The Byrds and New Zealand's The Chills, as well as North American indie-pop acts like The Shins and The New Pornographers.

title: The New Pornographers
text: The New Pornographers is a Canadian indie rock band formed in 1997 in Vancouver, British Columbia.

title: The New Pornographers
text: Presented as a musical collective of singer-songwriters and musicians from multiple projects, the band has released seven studio albums to critical acclaim for their use of multiple vocalists and elements of power pop incorporated into their music.

title: 655 Park Avenue
text: 655 Park Avenue is a Georgian-style co-op residential building on Manhattan's Upper East Side, located on Park Avenue between 67th Street and 68th Street, adjacent to the Park Avenue Armory.

title: 655 Park Avenue
text: It was developed in 1924 by Dwight P. Robinson & Company.

title: 655 Park Avenue
text: The building at 655 Park Avenue was designed by architects James Edwin Ruthven Carpenter, Jr., often referred to by the initials "J.E.R. Carpenter", and Mott B. Schmidt.

title: 655 Park Avenue
text: Carpenter is considered the leading architect for luxury residential high-rise buildings in New York City in the early 1900s, while Schmidt is known for his buildings in the American Georgian Classical style, including Sutton Place and houses for New York City's society figures and business elite.

title: 101 Park Avenue
text: 101 Park Avenue is a 629 ft tall skyscraper in New York City, New York.

title: 101 Park Avenue
text: It was completed in 1979 to 1982 and has 49 floors.

title: 101 Park Avenue
text: Eli Attia Architects designed the building, which is the 64th tallest in New York.

title: South Phoenix
text: South Phoenix is a region of Phoenix, Arizona, with the boundaries of the Gila River Indian Community to the south and west, 48th Street or Interstate-10 (Phoenix/Tempe and Phoenix/Chandler borders) to the east, and the Salt River to the north.

title: South Phoenix
text: This area includes Phoenix's following Urban Villages: South Mountain Village (aka South Mountain District) along with Laveen Village and Ahwatukee Village.

title: South Phoenix
text: The area is sometimes simply referred to as "the Southside" by its residents.

title: South Phoenix
text: Major arterial east-west streets include Broadway Road, Southern Avenue, Baseline Road, Dobbins Road, Elliott Road, Warner Road, Chandler Boulevard, and Pecos Road, most of which connect South Phoenix with the suburbs of Tempe and Chandler.

title: South Phoenix
text: Major arterial south-north streets include 24th Street, 16th Street, 7th Street, Central Avenue, 7th Avenue, and 19th Avenue connecting South Mountain Village to Central and North Phoenix; 27th Avenue, 35th Avenue, 43rd Avenue, 51st Avenue, 59th Avenue, 67th Avenue, and 75th Avenue connecting Laveen to west Phoenix; and 32nd Street, 40th Street, and 48th Street connecting South Mountain Village to east Phoenix and Tempe.

title: 750 7th Avenue
text: 750 Seventh Avenue is a 615 ft (187m) tall Class-A office skyscraper in New York City.

title: 750 7th Avenue
text: It was completed in 1989 in the postmodern style and has 36 floors.

title: 750 7th Avenue
text: Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo & Associates designed the building, and it is owned by Hines, a Texas based real estate investment company.

title: 750 7th Avenue
text: The building's continuous helix design, culminating in a chimney-like extension, was caused by the New York City Building Code, which requires setbacks.

title: 750 7th Avenue
text: The 84 exterior column transfers exist because of the owner's requirement for a column-free space.

title: 750 7th Avenue
text: It is tied with the New York Life Building for the 74th tallest building in New York City.

title: 750 7th Avenue
text: It is also LEED certified.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: Berkeley is a city-center neighborhood in Denver, Colorado, located in the area traditionally called Northwest Denver, on the west side of Interstate 25 and just south of Interstate 70.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: The neighborhood is bounded by Federal Boulevard on the east, I-70 on the north, Sheridan Boulevard on the West and 38th avenue on the south.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: It is bordered by the West Highland neighborhood on the south and is often erroneously grouped together with the Highlands.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: The neighborhood contains two lakes surrounded by parks, one eponymous (stretching from 46th Avenue to I-70 and Sheridan Boulevard to Tennyson Street) and Rocky Mountain Lake Park (stretching from Lowell Boulevard to Grove Street and 46th Avenue to I-70).

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: Berkeley Park also contains the William Scheitler Recreation Center, run by the City and County of Denver and including both indoor and outdoor public pools.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: Berkeley has experienced rapid growth and rise in property values in the last 20 years and particularly since the closing of Elitch Gardens Amusement Park in October 1994.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: Particularly, Tennyson Street has become a commercial and cultural center for Northwest Denver, beginning in the current decade to rival Highland Square in nearby Highland.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: City Congressman Rick Garcia pushed for the further development of Tennyson Street in the November 2011 election season and succeeded in obtaining the voters' approval for $2.5 million in public works funding.

title: Berkeley, Denver
text: Business owners on Tennyson from 48th Avenue to 38th Avenue currently collaborate in an Art Walk held on the first Friday of every month.

title: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)
text: The Church of St. Ignatius of Loyola is a Roman Catholic parish church located on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, New York City, administered by the Society of Jesus (Jesuits).

title: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)
text: The parish is under the authority of the Archdiocese of New York, and was established in 1851 as St. Lawrence O'Toole's Church.

title: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)
text: In 1898, permission to change the patron saint of the parish from St. Lawrence O’Toole to St. Ignatius of Loyola was granted by Rome.

title: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)
text: The address is 980 Park Avenue, New York City, New York 10028.

title: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)
text: The church on the southwest corner of Park Avenue and 84th Street is part of a Jesuit complex on the block that includes Wallace Hall, the parish hall, beneath the church, the rectory at the midblock location on Park Avenue, the grade school of St. Ignatius's School on the north midblock location of 84th Street behind the church and the high school of Loyola School (also 980 Park Avenue) at the northwest corner of Park Avenue and 83rd Street.

title: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)
text: In addition, another Jesuit high school, Regis High School (55 E 84th Street), occupies the midblock location on the north side of 84th Street.

title: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)
text: The church was added to the National Register of Historic Places on July 24, 1980.

title: Squire Park, Seattle
text: Squire Park is a district in the city of Seattle, in the U.S. state of Washington.

title: Squire Park, Seattle
text: According to the Squire Park Community Council, it is bounded on the south by S. Jackson Street, on the west by 12th Avenue and 12th Avenue S., on the north by E. Union Street, and on the east by 23rd Avenue and 23rd Avenue S., placing it within what are commonly thought of as First Hill and the Central District.

title: Squire Park, Seattle
text: Its main thoroughfares are E. Jefferson and Cherry Streets and E. Yesler Way (east- and west-bound) and 14th Avenue (north- and south-bound).

title: Squire Park, Seattle
text: Swedish Medical Center's Cherry Hill campus is located here, Seattle University, a Jesuit University has part of its campus in Squire Park, as the Admissions, some dormitories and Athletics departments are east of 12th Avenue.

title: Hounsfield Heights/Briar Hill, Calgary
text: Hounsfield Heights/Briar Hill is an inner suburban neighbourhood in northwest Calgary, Alberta, Canada.

title: Hounsfield Heights/Briar Hill, Calgary
text: Located north of the Hillhurst and West Hillhurst communities, the boundaries of the district are 16th Avenue N (Trans-Canada Highway)to the north; 14th Street W to the east; Lane north of 7th Avenue N to 19th Street W and 8th Avenue N to the south; and Crowchild Trail, 12th Avenue N, Juniper Road, and 22nd Street W to the west.

title: Hounsfield Heights/Briar Hill, Calgary
text: Lions Park C-Train station is located within the community.

title: Hounsfield Heights/Briar Hill, Calgary
text: The community is built on an escarpment and is popular for its views of downtown to the south and the Rocky Mountains to the west.

title: Greenwich Avenue
text: Greenwich Avenue, formerly Greenwich Lane, is a southeast-northwest avenue located in the Greenwich Village neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City.

title: Greenwich Avenue
text: It extends from the intersection of 6th Avenue and 8th Street at its southeast end to its northwestern end at 8th Avenue between 14th Street and 13th Street.

title: Greenwich Avenue
text: It is sometimes confused with Greenwich Street.

title: Greenwich Avenue
text: Construction of West Village Park, bounded by Greenwich Avenue, 7th Avenue, and 12th Street, began in 2016.

title: Tinley Park station
text: Tinley Park Station (also known as Tinley Park-Oak Park Avenue Station) is an elaborate commuter railroad station along Metra's Rock Island District line in Tinley Park, Illinois.

title: Tinley Park station
text: The station is officially located at 6700 South Street between Oak Park Avenue and 66th Court, however parking is also available on the opposite side of the station along North Street between Oak Park Avenue and 67th Avenue, as well as the center of the block of Oak Park Avenue, 173rd Street, 67th Court and 172nd Street.

title: Tinley Park station
text: Another parking area exists along South Street opposite the main parking lot at the station.

title: Tinley Park station
text: The station itself is lies 23.5 mi away from LaSalle Street, the northern terminus of the line.

title: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger
text: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger (恐竜戦隊ジュウレンジャー , Kyōryū Sentai Jūrenjā ) is a Japanese tokusatsu television series and the sixteenth installment in the long-running "Super Sentai" franchise of superhero programs.

title: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger
text: Produced by Toei and Bandai, it aired on TV Asahi from February 21, 1992 to February 12, 1993, with a total of 50 episodes.

title: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger
text: It was the first Sentai series to have a regular Sixth Ranger.

title: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger
text: It was also the first Sentai series to be adapted into an installment of the American "Power Rangers" series.

title: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger
text: Footage from all 50 episodes was extensively used for the first season of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers".

title: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger
text: The title Toei gives this series for international distribution is "Galaxy Rangers".

title: GoGo Sentai Boukenger
text: GoGo Sentai Boukenger (轟轟戦隊ボウケンジャー , Gōgō Sentai Bōkenjā ) is the 30th series in Toei's Super Sentai series, a franchise of Japanese tokusatsu television series.

title: GoGo Sentai Boukenger
text: It is the first installment to be broadcast in HDTV.

title: GoGo Sentai Boukenger
text: It premiered on February 19, 2006 at 7:30 a.m. on TV Asahi.

title: GoGo Sentai Boukenger
text: Its footage was used in the American series, "Power Rangers Operation Overdrive", while the original footage was dubbed into Korean for the South Korean series, "Power Rangers Treasure Force".

title: Gosei Sentai Dairanger
text: Gosei Sentai Dairanger (五星戦隊ダイレンジャー , Gosei Sentai Dairenjā ) is a Japanese tokusatsu television series.

title: Gosei Sentai Dairanger
text: It was the seventeenth production in the long-running Super Sentai franchise of television tokusatsu dramas produced by Toei Company, following "Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger".

title: Gosei Sentai Dairanger
text: It was originally broadcast from February 19, 1993 to February 11, 1994.

title: Gosei Sentai Dairanger
text: Toei gave this series the name "Star Rangers" for international distribution.

title: Engine Sentai Go-onger
text: Engine Sentai Go-onger (炎神戦隊ゴーオンジャー , Enjin Sentai Gōonjā ) is the title of Toei Company's thirty-second Super Sentai series of Japanese tokusatsu television series.

title: Engine Sentai Go-onger
text: It premiered on February 17, 2008, a week following the finale of "Juken Sentai Gekiranger", and ended on February 8, 2009.

title: Engine Sentai Go-onger
text: It aired as part of TV Asahi's 2008 Super Hero Time block alongside "Kamen Rider Kiva".

title: Engine Sentai Go-onger
text: Its footage was used for the American series, "Power Rangers RPM" and was dubbed into Korean as "Power Rangers Engine Force".

title: Engine Sentai Go-onger
text: The catchphrase for the series is "Rushing by at full-throttle mach speed, our slogan is 'go on!'"

title: Engine Sentai Go-onger
text: (マッハ全開で突っ走る俺たちの合言葉は"ゴーオン!" , Mahha zenkai de tsuppashiru oretachi no aikotoba wa "Gō On!" )

title: Power Rangers
text: Power Rangers is an American entertainment and merchandising franchise built around a live action superhero television series.

title: Power Rangers
text: Produced first by Saban Entertainment, later by BVS Entertainment, and today by SCG Power Rangers, the television series takes much of its footage from the Japanese tokusatsu "Super Sentai", produced by Toei Company.

title: Power Rangers
text: The first "Power Rangers" entry, "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers", debuted on August 28, 1993, and helped launch the Fox Kids programming block of the 1990s, during which it catapulted into popular culture along with a line of action figures and other toys by Bandai.

title: Power Rangers
text: s of 2001 , the media franchise has generated over $6 billion in retail sales worldwide.

title: Super Sentai
text: The Super Sentai Series (スーパー戦隊シリーズ , Sūpā Sentai Shirīzu ) is a long-running Japanese superhero team franchise of TV series produced by Toei Co., Ltd., Toei Agency and Bandai, and aired by TV Asahi ("Sentai" is the Japanese word for "task force" or "fighting squadron").

title: Super Sentai
text: The shows are of the "tokusatsu" genre, featuring live action characters and colorful special effects, and are aimed at children.

title: Super Sentai
text: "Super Sentai" is one of the most prominent "tokusatsu" franchises in Japan, alongside the Ultra Series and the Kamen Rider Series, which it currently airs alongside in the "Super Hero Time" programming block on Sundays.

title: Super Sentai
text: Outside Japan, the Super Sentai Series is best known as the source material for the "Power Rangers" franchise.

title: Unofficial Sentai Akibaranger
text: Unofficial Sentai Akibaranger (非公認戦隊アキバレンジャー , Hikōnin Sentai Akibarenjā ) is a Japanese tokusatsu comedy series based on the Super Sentai Series.

title: Unofficial Sentai Akibaranger
text: It is not part of the official line up in Toei Company's Super Sentai franchise, but is instead a parody geared towards adults who were fans of the franchise as children.

title: Unofficial Sentai Akibaranger
text: The show aired on BS Asahi (TV Asahi's broadcast satellite channel) starting April 6, 2012, and Tokyo MX starting April 9, 2012.

title: Doubutsu Sentai Zyuohger
text: Doubutsu Sentai Zyuohger (動物戦隊ジュウオウジャー , Dōbutsu Sentai Jūōjā ) is a Japanese Tokusatsu television series and the 40th entry of Toei's long-running Super Sentai series, following "Shuriken Sentai Ninninger".

title: Doubutsu Sentai Zyuohger
text: "Zyuohger" premiered February 14, 2016, joining "Kamen Rider Ghost", and later, "Kamen Rider Ex-Aid" in the "Super Hero Time" line-up on TV Asahi affiliate stations, until its conclusion on February 5, 2017.

title: Doubutsu Sentai Zyuohger
text: Released as part of Super Sentai's 40th anniversary and Toei's "Super Hero Year", "Zyuohger" is the fourth series in the franchise whose central theme is animals, 28 years after "Choujuu Sentai Liveman", 15 years after "Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger" and 10 years after "Juken Sentai Gekiranger".

title: Doubutsu Sentai Zyuohger
text: The series also has a Minecraft-inspired cube/square motif.

title: Doubutsu Sentai Zyuohger
text: The lead screenwriter for the series is Junko Kōmura.

title: Chouriki Sentai Ohranger
text: Chōriki Sentai Ohranger (超力戦隊オーレンジャー , Chōriki Sentai Ōrenjā ) is a Japanese tokusatsu television series and the 19th installment in the long-running Super Sentai franchise of superhero programs.

title: Chouriki Sentai Ohranger
text: Its footage was used in the American series, "Power Rangers Zeo" (the closing credits of "Zeo" referred to it as "O Rangers").

title: Kimberly Hart
text: Kimberly Ann Hart is a fictitious character in the "Power Rangers" universe.

title: Kimberly Hart
text: Played by actress Amy Jo Johnson during the first three seasons of the show, plus on the two feature films of the franchise, Kimberly has the longest tenure of any female ranger in the series' history, and fourth overall.

title: Kimberly Hart
text: She is possibly the best remembered as the first Pink Ranger and first Pink Ninja Ranger from the first entry of the franchise "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers".

title: Kimberly Hart
text: Kimberly was the Pink Ranger for nearly three years before she was written off the show as having given up her powers for good to Zordon's new alumna Katherine Hillard.

title: Lion's Den (2008 film)
text: Lion's Den (Spanish: "Leonera" ) is a 2008 Argentine drama film directed, co-written, co-produced and co-edited by Pablo Trapero.

title: Lion's Den (2008 film)
text: Addressing motherhood within the prison system, it stars Martina Gusmán, Elli Medeiros and Rodrigo Santoro.

title: Lion's Den (2008 film)
text: The film competed in the Competition at the 2008 Cannes Film Festival.

title: White Elephant (2012 film)
text: White Elephant (Spanish: Elefante blanco ) is a 2012 Argentine drama film directed by Pablo Trapero.

title: White Elephant (2012 film)
text: The film competed in the "Un Certain Regard" section at the 2012 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Pablo Trapero
text: Pablo Trapero (Born 4 October 1971) is an Argentine film producer, editor and director.

title: El Bonaerense
text: El bonaerense is a 2000 Argentine, Chilean, French, and Dutch drama film.

title: El Bonaerense
text: It was directed and produced by Pablo Trapero.

title: El Bonaerense
text: The screenplay was a joint effort of Nicolas Gueilburt, Ricardo Ragendorfer, Dodi Shoeuer, Pablo Trapero, and actor Daniel Valenzuela, and partly funded by INCAA.

title: El Bonaerense
text: It features Jorge Román, Mimí Ardú, among others.

title: Crane World
text: Crane World (Spanish: Mundo grúa ) is an 1999 Argentine film, written and directed by Pablo Trapero.

title: Crane World
text: The film was produced by Lita Stantic and Pablo Trapero.

title: Crane World
text: It features Luis Margani, Adriana Aizemberg, Daniel Valenzuela, among others.

title: Carancho
text: Carancho is a 2010 Argentine crime film directed by Pablo Trapero and starring Ricardo Darín and Martina Gusmán.

title: Carancho
text: It was entered into the Un Certain Regard section of the 2010 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Carancho
text: The film was selected as the Argentine entry for the Best Foreign Language Film at the 83rd Academy Awards, but it did not make the final shortlist.

title: Familia rodante
text: Familia rodante (English: "Rolling Family") is a 2004 comedy drama film, written and directed by Pablo Trapero, and produced by various countries, including Argentina.

title: Familia rodante
text: The film's executive producers were Hugo Castro Fau and Martina Gusman, and it was produced by Pablo Trapero, Robert Bevan, and Donald Ranvaud.

title: The Clan (film)
text: The Clan (Spanish: El Clan ) is a 2015 Argentine biographical crime film directed by Pablo Trapero.

title: The Clan (film)
text: It was selected to be screened in the main competition section of the 72nd Venice International Film Festival, where director Pablo Trapero won the Silver Lion.

title: The Clan (film)
text: The film was selected as the Argentine entry for the Best Foreign Language Film at the 88th Academy Awards but was not nominated.

title: Aleksander Ford
text: Aleksander Ford (born Mosze Lifszyc; 24 November 1908 in Kiev, Russian Empire – 4 April 1980 in Naples, Florida, United States) was a Polish Jewish film director; and head of the Polish People's Army Film Crew in the Soviet Union during World War II.

title: Aleksander Ford
text: Ford became director of the nationalized Film Polski company following the Red Army occupation of Poland.

title: 7 Days in Havana
text: 7 Days in Havana (Spanish: 7 días en La Habana ) is a 2012 Spanish-language anthology film.

title: 7 Days in Havana
text: Set during a week in the Cuban capital Havana, the film features one segment for each day, each segment directed by a different filmmaker.

title: 7 Days in Havana
text: The directors are Julio Medem, Laurent Cantet, Juan Carlos Tabío, Benicio del Toro, Gaspar Noé, Pablo Trapero and Elia Suleiman.

title: 7 Days in Havana
text: The screenplay was written by the Cuban novelist Leonardo Padura Fuentes.

title: 7 Days in Havana
text: The film is a co-production between companies in Spain, France and Cuba.

title: 7 Days in Havana
text: It was shot on location in Havana.

title: List of magazines in Malaysia
text: The first women's magazine was published in Malaysia in 1932.

title: List of magazines in Malaysia
text: In the 2000s there were nearly fifty local titles addressing women in the country.

title: List of magazines in Malaysia
text: These magazines also include those having an Islamic perspective.

title: List of magazines in Malaysia
text: Some international women's magazines are also published in Malaysia.

title: List of magazines in Malaysia
text: One of them is "Elle Malaysia", which was first published in March 2014.

title: List of magazines in Malaysia
text: Another one, "Women’s Health", was started in April 2015.

title: List of magazines in Malaysia
text: Comic magazines and film magazines are also common in Malaysia.

title: First for Women
text: First for Women is a woman's magazine published by Bauer Media Group in the USA.

title: First for Women
text: The magazine was started in 1989.

title: First for Women
text: It is based in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey.

title: First for Women
text: In 2011 the circulation of the magazine was 1,310,696 copies.

title: Jane (magazine)
text: Jane was an American magazine created to appeal to the women who grew up reading "Sassy Magazine"; Jane Pratt was the founding editor of each.

title: Jane (magazine)
text: Its original target audience (pitched to advertisers) was aged 18–34, and was designed to appeal to women who did not like the typical women's magazine format.

title: Jane (magazine)
text: Pratt originally intended the magazine to be named "Betty", but she was voted down by everyone else involved in the making of the magazine.

title: Rabotnitsa
text: Rabotnitsa (Russian: Работница ; English: The Woman Worker ) is a women's journal, published in the Soviet Union and Russia and one of the oldest Russian magazines for women and families.

title: Rabotnitsa
text: Founded in 1914, and first published on Women's Day, it is the first socialist women's journal, and the most politically left of the women's periodicals.

title: Rabotnitsa
text: While the journal's beginnings are attributed to Lenin and several women who were close to him, he did not contribute to the first seven issues.

title: Jane Addams
text: Jane Addams (September 6, 1860May 21, 1935), known as the "mother" of social work, was a pioneer American settlement activist/reformer, social worker, public philosopher, sociologist, author, and leader in women's suffrage and world peace.

title: Jane Addams
text: She co-founded, with Ellen Gates Starr, an early settlement house in the United States, Chicago's Hull House that would later become known as one of the most famous settlement houses in America.

title: Jane Addams
text: In an era when presidents such as Theodore Roosevelt and Woodrow Wilson identified themselves as reformers and social activists, Addams was one of the most prominent reformers of the Progressive Era.

title: Jane Addams
text: She helped America address and focus on issues that were of concern to mothers, such as the needs of children, local public health, and world peace.

title: Jane Addams
text: In her essay “Utilization of Women in City Government,” Jane Addams noted the connection between the workings of government and the household, stating that many departments of government, such as sanitation and the schooling of children, could be traced back to traditional women’s roles in the private sphere.

title: Jane Addams
text: Thus, these were matters of which women would have more knowledge than men, so women needed the vote to best voice their opinions.

title: Jane Addams
text: She said that if women were to be responsible for cleaning up their communities and making them better places to live, they needed to be able to vote to do so effectively.

title: Jane Addams
text: Addams became a role model for middle-class women who volunteered to uplift their communities.

title: Jane Addams
text: She is increasingly being recognized as a member of the American pragmatist school of philosophy, and is known by many as the first woman "public philosopher in the history of the United States.

title: Jane Addams
text: In 1889 she co-founded Hull House, and in 1920 she was a co-founder for the ACLU.

title: Jane Addams
text: In 1931 she became the first American woman to be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, and is recognized as the founder of the social work profession in the United States.

title: Marianne Schnall
text: Marianne Schnall is an American writer, interviewer, and feminist.

title: Marianne Schnall
text: Her interviews with Madeleine Albright, Dr. Jane Goodall, Gloria Steinem, Jane Fonda, Eve Ensler and others have been published by several magazines and websites.

title: Marianne Schnall
text: In 1995 she founded the not-for-profit website Feminist.com.

title: Marianne Schnall
text: She is the author of "Daring to Be Ourselves" based on her interviews with a variety of well-known women.

title: Marianne Schnall
text: She and Amy Richards contributed the piece "Cyberfeminism: Networking the Net" to the 2003 anthology "", edited by Robin Morgan.

title: Marianne Schnall
text: Marianne’s latest book is "," featuring interviews with politicians, public officials, thought leaders, writers, artists, and activists in an attempt to discover the obstacles that have held women back and what needs to change in order to elect a woman into the White House.

title: Marianne Schnall
text: With insights and personal anecdotes from Sheryl Sandberg, Maya Angelou, Gloria Steinem, Nancy Pelosi, Nicholas Kristof, Melissa Etheridge, Olympia Snowe, and many more, "What Will It Take to Make A Woman President?

title: Marianne Schnall
text: " addresses timely, provocative issues involving women, politics, and power.

title: Jane Cunningham Croly
text: Jane Cunningham Croly (December 19, 1829 – December 23, 1901) was an American author and journalist, better known by her pseudonym, Jennie June.

title: Jane Cunningham Croly
text: She was a pioneer author and editor of women's columns in leading newspapers and magazines in New York.

title: Jane Cunningham Croly
text: She founded the Sorosis club for women in New York in 1868 and in 1889 expanded it nationwide to the General Federation of Women's Clubs.

title: Jane Cunningham Croly
text: She also founded the Woman's Press Club of New York City.

title: My Secret Garden
text: My Secret Garden: Women’s Sexual Fantasies is a 1973 book compiled by Nancy Friday, who collected women's fantasies through letters and taped and personal interviews.

title: My Secret Garden
text: After including a female sexual fantasy in a novel she submitted for publishing, her editor objected, and Friday shelved the novel.

title: My Secret Garden
text: Later, after other women began writing and talking about sex publicly, Friday began thinking about writing a book about female sexual fantasies, first collecting fantasies from her friends, and then advertising in newspapers and magazines for more.

title: My Secret Garden
text: She organized these narratives into "rooms", and each is identified by the woman's first name, except for the last chapter, "odd notes", which is presented as the "fleeting thoughts" of many anonymous women.

title: My Secret Garden
text: The book revealed that women fantasize, just as men do, and that the content of the fantasies can be as transgressive, or not, as men's.

title: My Secret Garden
text: The book, the first published compilation of women's sexual fantasies, refuted many previously accepted notions of female sexuality.

title: Be Love
text: Be Love is a Japanese manga magazine targeting women published by Kodansha.

title: Be Love
text: It debuted in September 1980.

title: Be Love
text: It is one of the leading manga magazines for adult women, the first of its kind, and was instrumental in the rising popularity of josei manga in the 1980s, which led to the creation of other magazines targeted at women such as "You" and "Big Comic for Lady".

title: Be Love
text: As of 2003, "Be Love", like "You" and "Jour", published stories focussing on "the reality of everyday life" experienced by its readers.

title: List of magazines in China
text: In 1898 the first women's magazine was published in China.

title: List of magazines in China
text: The number of women's magazines has increased in the country since the late 1980s.

title: List of magazines in China
text: In addition to national titles international magazines are also published in the country. "

title: List of magazines in China
text: Madame Figaro", and "Elle" are among such titles both of which entered into the Chinese market in 1988.

title: List of magazines in China
text: In 1998 "Cosmopolitan" began to be published in the country. "

title: List of magazines in China
text: Esquire" is the first international men's magazine which entered into the magazine market in China in 1999.

title: List of magazines in China
text: Starting in the 2000s several Japanese magazines began to be circulated in Chinese language in the country, including "CanCam".

title: Baby Doll
text: Baby Doll is a 1956 American black comedy drama film directed by Elia Kazan, and starring Carroll Baker, Karl Malden and Eli Wallach.

title: Baby Doll
text: The film also features Mildred Dunnock and Rip Torn.

title: Baby Doll
text: It was produced by Kazan and Tennessee Williams, and adapted by Williams from his own one-act play "27 Wagons Full of Cotton".

title: Baby Doll
text: The plot focuses on a feud between two rival cotton gin owners in rural Mississippi; after one of the men commits arson against the other's gin, the owner retaliates by attempting to seduce the arsonist's nineteen-year-old virgin bride with the hopes of receiving an admission by her of her husband's guilt.

title: Nicholas Ray
text: Nicholas Ray (born Raymond Nicholas Kienzle Jr., August 7, 1911 – June 16, 1979) was an American film director best known for the movie "Rebel Without a Cause."

title: Elia Kazan
text: Elia Kazan (born Elias Kazantzoglou September 7, 1909 – September 28, 2003) was a Greek-American director, producer, writer and actor, described by "The New York Times" as "one of the most honored and influential directors in Broadway and Hollywood history".

title: Art & Gadg
text: Art & Gadg is an original radio play by Gregory Evans about the relationship between Arthur Miller (Art) and Elia Kazan (Gadg short for gadget, a nickname of Kazan).

title: Art & Gadg
text: The 45-minute play was first transmitted on BBC Radio 4 15 January 2013.

title: Art & Gadg
text: It was directed by Marc Beeby.

title: A Letter to Elia
text: A Letter to Elia is a 2010 documentary film directed by Kent Jones and Martin Scorsese that follows the life and career of film director Elia Kazan and how he influenced Scorsese.

title: A Letter to Elia
text: Made from clips from films, stills, readings from Kazan's autobiography, a speech he wrote on directing read by Elias Koteas, a videotaped interview done late in Kazan's life, and Scorsese's commentary on and off screen.

title: The Visitors (1972 film)
text: The Visitors is a 1972 American drama film directed by Elia Kazan.

title: The Visitors (1972 film)
text: It was entered into the 1972 Cannes Film Festival.

title: The Visitors (1972 film)
text: Kazan used Daniel Lang's "Casualties of War" story as a jumping-off point for this film.

title: Truckline Cafe
text: Truckline Cafe was the title of a 1946 Broadway play written by Maxwell Anderson, directed by Harold Clurman, produced by Elia Kazan, and starring Marlon Brando and Karl Malden.

title: Truckline Cafe
text: The short-lived play ran only 13 performances and is best remembered today for the fact that each night Brando would run up and down a flight of stairs prior to an entrance to induce an effectively frenzied demeanor for one of the scenes.

title: Truckline Cafe
text: The cast also included David Manners, to whom Brando has attributed much of his subsequent success, and Kevin McCarthy.

title: Truckline Cafe
text: The play is noted for Brando's first major appearance on Broadway, during which he garnered attention for an unusually intense performance which presaged his later work on "A Streetcar Named Desire".

title: Truckline Cafe
text: "Truckline Cafe" is also notable for being the first collaboration between Brando and Kazan, who later made "A Streetcar Named Desire", "Viva Zapata", and "On the Waterfront" together.

title: Truckline Cafe
text: The play also remains notable for being the first time Brando and Malden worked together, prior to co-starring in "A Streetcar Named Desire", "On the Waterfront", and "One Eyed Jacks".

title: All My Sons
text: All My Sons is a 1947 play by Arthur Miller.

title: All My Sons
text: It opened on Broadway at the Coronet Theatre in New York City on January 29, 1947, closed on November 8, 1949 and ran for 328 performances.

title: All My Sons
text: It was directed by Elia Kazan (to whom it is dedicated), produced by Elia Kazan and Harold Clurman, and won the New York Drama Critics' Circle Award.

title: All My Sons
text: It starred Ed Begley, Beth Miller, Arthur Kennedy, and Karl Malden and won both the Tony Award for Best Author and the Tony Award for Best Direction of a Play.

title: All My Sons
text: The play was adapted for films in 1949 and 1987.

title: Maya Kazan
text: Maya Kazan (born November 24, 1986) is an American stage, TV and film actress and director.

title: Maya Kazan
text: She is known for playing Caroline in "Frances Ha", Eleanor Gallinger on "The Knick" and Mabel Thompson on "Boardwalk Empire".

title: Maya Kazan
text: She is the daughter of screenwriters Nicholas Kazan and Robin Swicord.

title: Maya Kazan
text: She is the granddaughter of film director Elia Kazan and playwright Molly Kazan.

title: Maya Kazan
text: Maya is the younger sister of actress Zoe Kazan.

title: Macao (film)
text: Macao is a 1952 black-and-white film noir adventure directed by Josef von Sternberg and Nicholas Ray.

title: Macao (film)
text: Producer Howard Hughes fired director von Sternberg during filming and hired Nicholas Ray to finish it.

title: Macao (film)
text: The drama features Robert Mitchum, Jane Russell, William Bendix, and Gloria Grahame.

title: WizKids
text: WizKids/NECA, LLC is an American company based in New Jersey that first made its mark in the game industry producing collectible miniatures wargames.

title: WizKids
text: WizKids was purchased by and is a subsidiary of National Entertainment Collectibles Association.

title: WizKids
text: The company was founded in 2000 by Jordan Weisman, a veteran of the game company FASA.

title: WizKids
text: It was purchased by sports-card manufacturer Topps, Inc. in 2003.

title: WizKids
text: (Topps was, in turn, acquired by Michael Eisner's Tornante Company and Madison Dearborn Partners in 2007.)

title: Aixam
text: Aixam-Mega is a French automobile manufacturer based in Aix-les-Bains, Savoie.

title: Aixam
text: It was founded in 1983 to make microcars following the acquisition of Arola.

title: Aixam
text: On April 11, 2013, US based Polaris Industries announced that it had acquired Aixam-Mega.

title: Arola (microcar)
text: Arola SARL was a small manufacturing company based in Lyon-Corbas, France, which manufactured a range of microcars, designed to be driven without a licence.

title: Arola (microcar)
text: Arola became part of the Aixam group in 1983.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: Knapp, Stout & Co. was a lumber company based in Menomonie, Wisconsin in the 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: The company was established in 1846, when John Holly Knapp and William Wilson purchased half of interest in a lumber mill on the Red Cedar River from David Black; it was originally known as Black & Knapp.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: Later Andrew Tainter acquired a quarter-interest, and the company has become Knapp-Tainter Lumber Company.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: Henry Stout bought a quarter interest in the company in 1853, and its name became Knapp, Stout & Company.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: The company's location allowed it to control the lumber industry in the region, and by 1870 it controlled the logging industry in the Red Cedar River valley.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: In 1878, the company incorporated, and its official name became the Knapp, Stout & Co., Company.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: The company employed over 2,000 workers in the Menomonie area and produced 85 million board feet of lumber on average yearly from 1871 to 1896; its output made it the largest lumber company in the world.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: In the 1880s, the company expanded to sites along the Mississippi River, opening offices in Dubuque, Iowa, Read's Landing, Minnesota, and St. Louis.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: By the 1900s, the company had largely depleted its lumber supply; it closed many of its camps and dissolved early in the 20th century.

title: Knapp, Stout & Co.
text: The company sent out its last shipment of lumber on August 12, 1901.

title: Syncros
text: Syncros is a brand of bicycle components, with an emphasis on off-road bicycle parts.

title: Syncros
text: Founded by Peter Hamilton and Pippin Osborne in 1986 and originally based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Syncros had its heyday in the early 1990s as one of the earliest and most sought-after brands of high end aftermarket off-road bicycle parts.

title: Syncros
text: In the late 1990s, the company had financial difficulties and was sold to the large U.S. based bicycle company GT.

title: Syncros
text: Shortly thereafter, GT itself was purchased by Schwinn, which in turn was purchased by Pacific Bicycle Group, a large Taiwanese conglomerate known mainly for low end, mass market bicycles and parts.

title: Syncros
text: Pacific was quick to try to capitalize on the Syncros brand name, and used the Syncros label on many cheaply produced OEM parts, severely damaging the brand's reputation.

title: Syncros
text: Due to a lapse in trademark registration in the early 2000s, the Syncros brand name was briefly grabbed in the UK by Super Cycles of Nottingham.

title: Syncros
text: However, a settlement was reached between Super Cycles and Pacific, resulting in Pacific regaining control of the brand name.

title: Murco Petroleum
text: Murco Petroleum Ltd is a United Kingdom based oil refining company.

title: Murco Petroleum
text: It was set up by Murphy Oil Corporation in 1960.

title: Murco Petroleum
text: The company owns a forecourt based chain of Costcutter convenience stores.

title: Murco Petroleum
text: In 1981, Murco purchased an 30% stake in Amoco's Milford Haven Refinery, and in 2007, they purchased the remaining 70%.

title: I. G. Baker Company
text: The I. G. Baker Company was a mercantile and grocery company based in Fort Benton, Montana, started by Isaac Gilbert Baker and his brother, George Amos Baker, as I. G. Baker & Brother in 1866.

title: I. G. Baker Company
