text: After the Conrad brothers (Charles E. & Wm. G.) were admitted as partners in 1873, the company name was changed to I. G. Baker & Co., which name was retained after the Conrads purchased George Baker’s interest in 1874.

title: I. G. Baker Company
text: In 1891, the Canadian assets of the company were purchased by its chief rival there, the Hudson's Bay Company.

title: Cliché Skateboards
text: Cliché Skateboards was a skateboard company based in Lyon, France and distributed by the American company Dwindle Distribution.

title: Cliché Skateboards
text: The company was established in 1997 by French professional skateboarder Jeremie Daclin.

title: Cliché Skateboards
text: In 2001, Cliché was purchased by the France-based Salomon Group which in 2005 became a part of Amer Sports.

title: Cliché Skateboards
text: In 2009, US-based Dwindle Distribution purchased the company from the Salomon Group.

title: Cliché Skateboards
text: In November 2016, Dwindle announced that they would be discontinuing the brand.

title: Budd Silverliner
text: The Budd Silverliner a model of Electric Multiple Unit railcar was designed and built by the Budd Company with 59 examples being delivered starting in 1963.

title: Budd Silverliner
text: 55 of the cars were purchased for the Reading and Pennsylvania Railroads with public funds for use in Philadelphia, PA area commuter rail service with the remaining 4 cars being purchased by USDOT for use in high-speed rail experiments in 1965.

title: Budd Silverliner
text: Based on a series of 6 prototype Pioneer III cars built in 1958, the Silverliners represented the first production order of "modern" commuter MU equipment purchased by either railroad and earned their name from their unpainted stainless steel construction which contrasted with the painted carbon steel bodies of the pre-war MU fleets.

title: Budd Silverliner
text: The cars became a fixture of SEPTA Regional Rail service providing the name to their entire series of EMU railcars before finally being retired in 2012 after 49 years in service.

title: Polaris Industries
text: Polaris Industries is an American manufacturer of snowmobiles, ATV, and neighborhood electric vehicles.

title: Polaris Industries
text: Polaris is based in Roseau, Minnesota, USA.

title: Polaris Industries
text: The company also manufactures motorcycles through its Victory Motorcycles subsidiary and through the Indian Motorcycle subsidiary which it purchased in April 2011.

title: Polaris Industries
text: Polaris no longer produces watercraft.

title: Adam (musical)
text: Adam is a musical with a book by June Tansey, lyrics and music by Richard Ahlert, based on the life of the controversial politician Adam Clayton Powell Jr..

title: Adam Clayton Powell (film)
text: Adam Clayton Powell is a 1989 American documentary film directed by Richard Kilberg about the civil rights leader.

title: Adam Clayton Powell (film)
text: It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr.
text: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. (November 29, 1908 – April 4, 1972) was a Baptist pastor and an American politician, who represented Harlem, New York City, in the United States House of Representatives (1945–71).

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr.
text: He was the first person of African-American descent to be elected from New York to Congress.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr.
text: Oscar Stanton De Priest of Illinois was the first black person to be elected to Congress in the 20th century; Powell was the fourth.

title: Adam Clayton Powell IV
text: Adam Clayton Powell IV (born Adam Clayton Powell Diago in 1962) is an American politician from the state of New York.

title: Adam Clayton Powell IV
text: He was a member of the New York State Assembly from 2001 to 2010.

title: Adam Clayton Powell IV
text: From 1992–1997, he served as New York City Council Member representing East Harlem and parts of the Upper West Side and the South Bronx.

title: Adam Clayton Powell IV
text: Beginning in 2001, Powell represented the 68th Assembly District, which includes parts of Harlem and East Harlem.

title: Adam Clayton Powell IV
text: He was defeated by Charles Rangel in the 2010 Democratic Primary for the seat of the 15th Congressional District.

title: Seventh Avenue (Manhattan)
text: Seventh Avenue – known as Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Boulevard north of Central Park – is a thoroughfare on the West Side of the borough of Manhattan in New York City.

title: Seventh Avenue (Manhattan)
text: It is southbound below Central Park and a two-way street north of the park.

title: Mother African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church
text: The Mother African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church, also known as "Mother Zion", located at 140–148 West 137th Street between Adam Clayton Powell Jr.

title: Mother African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church
text: Boulevard and Lenox Avenue in the Harlem neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City, is the oldest African-American church in New York City, and the "mother church" of the African Methodist Episcopal Zion conference.

title: Abyssinian Baptist Church
text: The Abyssinian Baptist Church, located at 132 West 138th Street between Adam Clayton Powell Jr.

title: Abyssinian Baptist Church
text: Boulevard and Lenox Avenue in the Harlem neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City, was built in 1922-23 and was designed by Charles W. Bolton & Son in Gothic Revival and Tudor Revival styles – it has also been described as "Collegiate Gothic".

title: Abyssinian Baptist Church
text: It features stained glass windows and marble furnishings The church is noted for its ministers, including Adam Clayton Powell, Sr. and Adam Clayton Powell, Jr. Over the years, the church has served as a place for African American spirituality, politics and community.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building
text: The Adam Clayton Powell Jr.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building
text: State Office Building, originally the Harlem State Office Building, is a nineteen-story, high-rise office building located at 163 West 125th Street at the corner of Adam Clayton Powell Jr.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building
text: Boulevard in the Harlem neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building
text: It is named after Adam Clayton Powell Jr, the first African-American elected to Congress from New York.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building
text: It was designed by the African-American architecture firm of Ifill Johnson Hanchard in the shape of an African mask in the Brutalist Architecture style.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building
text: It is the tallest building in Harlem, overtaking the nearby Hotel Theresa.

title: The Saimaa Gesture
text: The Saimaa Gesture (Finnish: "Saimaa-ilmiö" ) is a 1981 film by Finnish directors Aki and Mika Kaurismäki.

title: The Saimaa Gesture
text: It is a documentary of three Finnish rock groups aboard the steamboat SS Heinävesi on their tour around Lake Saimaa.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Sr.
text: Adam Clayton Powell (May 5, 1865 – June 12, 1953) was an American pastor who developed the Abyssinian Baptist Church in Harlem, New York as the largest Protestant congregation in the country, with 10,000 members.

title: Adam Clayton Powell Sr.
text: He was a community activist, author, and the father of Congressman Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Born into poverty in southwestern Virginia, Powell worked to put himself through school and Wayland Seminary, where he was ordained in 1892.

title: Just Like Paradise
text: "Just Like Paradise" is a song by American rock singer David Lee Roth.

title: Just Like Paradise
text: Released after he left Van Halen, it was produced by Roth and guitarist Steve Vai.

title: Just Like Paradise
text: The lead single from Roth's second solo album, 1988's "Skyscraper", it reached the top 10 in the United States and Canada.

title: The David Lee Roth Band
text: The David Lee Roth Band was an American rock and roll band, formed in Pasadena, California in 1985 by Van Halen frontman David Lee Roth.

title: The David Lee Roth Band
text: Originally featuring a supergroup line-up of guitarist Steve Vai, bassist Billy Sheehan, and drummer Gregg Bissonette, the band released numerous popular songs and albums from the mid-1980s until the late 1990s.

title: The David Lee Roth Band
text: Other well-known musicians in the David Lee Roth Band have include guitarist Jason Becker, guitarist Steve Hunter, guitarist John 5 (guitarist), bassist Matt Bissonette drummer Ray Luzier, and keyboardist Brett Tuggle.

title: The David Lee Roth Band
text: The band's well-known songs include "Yankee Rose", "Goin' Crazy!"

title: The David Lee Roth Band
text: , "Shy Boy", "Just Like Paradise", "Stand Up", "Damn Good", "A Little Ain't Enough", "She's My Machine", and "Slam Dunk!"

title: Sammy Hagar
text: Samuel Roy Hagar (born October 13, 1947), also known as The Red Rocker, is an American rock vocalist, guitarist, songwriter, musician and entrepreneur.

title: Sammy Hagar
text: Hagar came to prominence in the 1970s with the hard rock band Montrose.

title: Sammy Hagar
text: He afterwards launched a successful solo career, scoring an enduring hit in 1984 with "I Can't Drive 55".

title: Sammy Hagar
text: He enjoyed huge commercial success when he replaced David Lee Roth as the lead singer of Van Halen in 1985, but left the band in 1996.

title: Sammy Hagar
text: He returned to the band for a 2-year reunion from 2003 to 2005.

title: Sammy Hagar
text: On March 12, 2007, Hagar was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame as a member of Van Halen.

title: Sammy Hagar
text: His musical style primarily consists of hard rock and heavy metal.

title: Your Filthy Little Mouth
text: Your Filthy Little Mouth is the fourth full-length studio LP by David Lee Roth, the lead singer of the American rock band Van Halen.

title: Your Filthy Little Mouth
text: Released in 1994 by Warner Brothers-Reprise and produced by Nile Rodgers (producer of albums by David Bowie, Madonna, et cetera), "Your Filthy Little Mouth" explores relatively disparate genres of popular music, but contextualizes them via rock and blues.

title: Your Filthy Little Mouth
text: The album reflects Roth's growing fascinations with literature and philosophy, as well as his experiences living in New York City's Lower East Side during the early 1990s.

title: Your Filthy Little Mouth
text: The album's artwork, based conceptually on tattoo art and graffiti art, is executed by Roth.

title: The Midnighters
text: The Midnighters were an American R&B group from Detroit, Michigan.

title: The Midnighters
text: They were an influential group in the 1950s and early 1960s, with many R&B hit records.

title: The Midnighters
text: They were also notable for launching the career of lead singer Hank Ballard and the worldwide dance craze the Twist.

title: The Midnighters
text: Between 1953 and 1962 the Midnighters had almost two dozen hits on the U.S. Pop & R&B charts.

title: The Midnighters
text: Their big hits included the million-selling Billboard Top 10 pop hits "Finger Popping Time" (for which they received a 1961 Grammy Award nomination), and "Let's Go, Let's Go, Let's Go".

title: The Midnighters
text: The Midnighters also had 13 Top 10 R&B hits, including three that reached number 1.

title: The Midnighters
text: Their Top 10 R&B hits included "Work with Me, Annie", "It's Love Baby (24 Hours a Day)", "Annie Had a Baby", "The Hoochi Coochi Coo", "Teardrops on Your Letter", "Get It", "The Float" and "Nothing but Good".

title: The Midnighters
text: They received the Rhythm and Blues Foundation's prestigious Pioneer Award in 1992 and were inducted into the Vocal Group Hall of Fame in 1999.

title: The Midnighters
text: The group's lead singer, Hank Ballard, was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1990.

title: The Midnighters
text: The Midnighters as a "group" were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame on April 14, 2012.

title: The David Lee Roth Show
text: The David Lee Roth Show is a former short-lived American radio show that aired from January 3 to April 21, 2006, hosted by rock musician David Lee Roth.

title: The David Lee Roth Show
text: It was the replacement of "The Howard Stern Show" following its departure from terrestrial to Sirius Satellite Radio.

title: The David Lee Roth Show
text: It was simulcast on seven stations across the United States owned by CBS Radio, who launched the show as part of its Free FM radio format.

title: The David Lee Roth Show
text: Notably different from Howard Stern's program, or corporate "morning zoo" and "shock jock" formats which dominated morning radio at the time, Roth's show sounded similar to pirate radio, featuring ethnic and non-commercial rock music integrated with personal stories, occasionally uncomfortable debates on intellectual matters, and interviews with people Roth admired, such as guitarist Brian May, baseball player Johnny Damon, and Roth's uncle, Manny Roth.

title: Cia Berg
text: Cia Berg (born 2 December 1963), now known as Cia Soro, is a Swedish television presenter and singer.

title: Cia Berg
text: She was at one time the lead singer of the Swedish rock band Whale, who released the single "Hobo Humpin' Slobo Babe".

title: David Lee Roth
text: David Lee Roth (born October 10, 1954) is an American rock vocalist, musician, songwriter, actor, author, and former radio personality.

title: David Lee Roth
text: In 2007, he was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

title: David Lee Roth discography
text: David Lee Roth is an American rock music singer.

title: David Lee Roth discography
text: His discography consists of six studio albums, one extended play, one compilation album, and twenty singles.

title: David Lee Roth discography
text: Of his eight albums, four have been certified Gold or higher by the Recording Industry Association of America. "

title: David Lee Roth discography
text: Eat 'Em and Smile", "Skyscraper" and "Crazy from the Heat" are certified Platinum, and "A Little Ain't Enough" is certified Gold.

title: David Lee Roth discography
text: As of 2012, all of David Lee Roth's Warner Brothers LPs are due for recertification.

title: Yankee Rose (song)
text: "Yankee Rose" is a hard rock song recorded by David Lee Roth.

title: Yankee Rose (song)
text: It was written by Roth and Steve Vai and was Roth's first single on his 1986 first full-length album "Eat 'Em and Smile".

title: Yankee Rose (song)
text: It was recorded as a tribute to the Statue of Liberty in New York City, as the statue was completing a major renovation for the 100th anniversary of its dedication in 1886.

title: Inyathi High School
text: Inyathi High School (formerly, Inyathi Secondary School and prior to that Inyathi Mission) holds the distinction of being the oldest formal educational institution of any kind in Zimbabwe.

title: Inyathi High School
text: Inyathi High School stands out in the history of Zimbabwe as having been amongst the first places in modern-day Zimbabwe to have seen the dawn of Western Civilization within the region.

title: Inyathi High School
text: It is also the first formal points within Zimbabwe to have guardedly resisted Western incursions into the region by the missionaries.

title: Inyathi High School
text: Finally, it was also the site of mutual co-existence between the Kingdom of King Mzilikazi and the Western Missionaries.

title: Inyathi High School
text: Inyathi High School is a boarding co-educational secondary school in Inyathi, Zimbabwe designed along the lines of the traditional British Boarding Public School System (without the attendant social implications).

title: Inyathi High School
text: Together with sister institutions of Dombodema High School (Mission)in Plumtree and Tennyson Hlabangane High School (formerly known as Hope Fountain Mission) in Hope Fountain, Inyathi High School is privately owned by the United Congregational Church of Southern Africa (UCCSA) which is itself an offshoot of the London Missionary Society (LMS).

title: Presbyterian Boys' Senior High School
text: Presbyterian Boys' Secondary School (or PRESEC) is a secondary school for boys, founded in 1938, under the auspices of the Presbyterian Church of the Gold Coast.

title: Presbyterian Boys' Senior High School
text: The progenitor of the school was the Basel missionary, The Reverend Nicholas Timothy Clerk.

title: Presbyterian Boys' Senior High School
text: The school has ties with its sister school, Aburi Girls' Senior High School.

title: J. Sterling Morton High School East
text: J. Sterling Morton High School East (often called "Morton East") is a public secondary school located in Cicero, Illinois.

title: J. Sterling Morton High School East
text: Morton East is one of three schools in J. Sterling Morton High School District 201.

title: J. Sterling Morton High School East
text: Morton East is a sophomore through senior building, with future students attending the "J. Sterling Morton Freshman Center" for one year.

title: J. Sterling Morton High School East
text: Morton East's sister school, J. Sterling Morton High School West is a four-year secondary school.

title: Reverend Juuso Shikongo Senior Secondary School
text: Reverend Juuso Shikongo Senior Secondary School is a Namibian public school in the Omuntele Constituency in the Oshikoto Region about 60 kilometres southeast of Ondangwa, which was in 2013 inaugurated by then Education Minister Dr David Namwandi.

title: Reverend Juuso Shikongo Senior Secondary School
text: The school is named after the founder of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Namibia 's Omuntele congregation, Reverend Juuso Shikongo, the school started operating from a sister school, Uukule Senior Secondary School situated at Onyaanya Constituency some 30 kilometres away, in 2011 before moving to Omuntele at the beginning of the year 2013.

title: Reverend Juuso Shikongo Senior Secondary School
text: In his official inauguration address, the education minister David Namwandi pointed out that Government has spent N$120 million (Namibian Dollars) on the construction of classrooms, offices and hostels for the school.

title: Legae Academy
text: Legae Academy is an English medium, independent, co-educational, secondary school located in Gaborone, Botswana.

title: Legae Academy
text: The academy is a sister school to Legae English Medium Primary School which was established in 1983.

title: Legae Academy
text: The academy follows the Cambridge International Examinations syllabus, allowing students to sit for the International General Certificate of Secondary Education (IGCSE) after four years of secondary education, and the A-Level examination after a further two years.Legae academy is the best school for Cambridge in not only Botswana but Southern africa itself

title: Winslow Township High School
text: Winslow Township High School (WTHS) is a four-year comprehensive public high school in Winslow Township, in Camden County, New Jersey, United States, that serves students in ninth through twelfth grades as the lone secondary school of the Winslow Township School District.

title: Winslow Township High School
text: Until 2000, the facility that is now Winslow Township High School was part of the Lower Camden County Regional School District and was known as Edgewood Regional High School, which was the sister school of Overbook Regional Senior High School in Pine Hill (now known as Overbrook High School).

title: Ishibu Higher Secondary School
text: Ishibu Higher Secondary School (Nepali: ईसिवू उचच माधयमिक विधालय ) is a community school under government of Nepal located at the point of ishibu vdc ward no.4 in Terathum district of Nepal.

title: Ishibu Higher Secondary School
text: It is established in 1960 A.D in the fundamental of primary school and it has been upgraded adding high school & later in 5–7 years ago it has risen as higher secondary school.Since it is situated on the lap of the Himalayas, it has automatically a panoramic environment of nature where the atmosphere is cool and favorable for students.

title: Ishibu Higher Secondary School
text: In the past time its educating system was in old system where there was everything lack needed for studies and teachers were used to regard as god like and it was quite rigorous management of school therefore, students were forced to study with hard labour memorising by heart.Teaching was lecture based method so that there was rare practical education.

title: Ishibu Higher Secondary School
text: But now education system has also been change along with changes of time.It has a modern fashioned library and it is equipped with sufficient halls for seating of students.

title: Ishibu Higher Secondary School
text: Head of school is thought to be Principal or headmaster and the former principal was Mr.Mahesh Niraula whereas the current Principal is Mr. Ram Prasad Timsina.Since it is a government school it has not any sister school however few name of schools may come with the same name but they are distinguished by location.

title: Guwe Secondary School
text: Guwe Secondary School is located in Zimbabwe.

title: Guwe Secondary School
text: It has a sister school in Carle Place, New York, United States.

title: Singwango Secondary School
text: Singwango Secondary School is located in Filabusi, Matabeleland South Province, Zimbabwe.

title: Singwango Secondary School
text: It had a sister school in Carle Place, New York, United States, although Carle Place High School still donates sports equipment and clothes.

title: Carle Place High School
text: Carle Place Middle/High School is a six-year comprehensive public high school located in the hamlet of Carle Place in Nassau County, New York.

title: List of Commissioners of New South Wales Police
text: The Commissioner of the New South Wales Police Force (Known from 1851 to 1926 as the Inspector-General of the New South Wales Police Force) is the head of New South Wales's Police Force.

title: List of Commissioners of New South Wales Police
text: The post is currently held by Mick Fuller, who replaced Andrew Scipione on 31 March 2017.

title: List of Commissioners of New South Wales Police
text: The rank is usually referred to as the New South Wales Police Commissioner or simply just "Commissioner".

title: List of Commissioners of New South Wales Police
text: The New South Wales Police Force has had 22 Commissioners since 1851.

title: Royal Commission into Drug Trafficking
text: The Royal Commission into Drug Trafficking (1977–1979) or Woodward Royal Commission was a royal commission initiated by the New South Wales Government to investigate drug trafficking in New South Wales, Australia, especially links between the Mafia and New South Wales Police and the disappearance of anti-marijuana campaigner Donald Mackay.

title: New South Wales Police Force
text: The New South Wales Police Force (NSW Police Force; previously the New South Wales Police Service and New South Wales Police) is the primary law enforcement agency of the state of New South Wales, Australia.

title: New South Wales Police Force
text: It is a servant of the Crown, independent of Government, although a minister of the Crown has administration.

title: New South Wales Police Force
text: Divided into seventy six local area commands (LAC), the NSW Police Force consists of more than 500 local police stations and covers an area of 801,600 square kilometres in a state of some seven million people.

title: Kennedy Royal Commission
text: The Royal commission into whether there has been corrupt or criminal conduct by any Western Australian Police Officer, commonly known as the Kennedy Royal Commission, was a Royal Commission established in 2002 by the state government of Western Australia to determine whether any officer of the Western Australia Police had engaged in corrupt or criminal conduct.

title: Kennedy Royal Commission
text: The commission issued an interim report on 20 December 2002 and a final report on 30 January 2004.

title: First 'Ndrangheta war
text: The First 'Ndrangheta war was an internal struggle in the 'Ndrangheta, a Mafia-type criminal organisation in Calabria (southern Italy).

title: First 'Ndrangheta war
text: The conflict raged from 1974-1976, and would result in approximately 233 deaths.

title: First 'Ndrangheta war
text: The war broke the equilibrium in the triumvirate, made up of Antonio Macrì, Domenico Tripodo and Girolamo Piromalli, that had ruled the 'Ndrangheta for 15 years, and facilitated the rise of a new generation 'Ndranghetisti, in particular the De Stefano 'ndrina, who wanted to open the doors of the 'Ndrangheta in new, more lucrative criminal activities (especially drug trafficking).

title: Honoured Society (Australia)
text: The Honoured Society (Italian: "Onorata Società" ) is a Calabrian 'Ndrangheta criminal confederation, started in Melbourne and currently active in all Australia.

title: Honoured Society (Australia)
text: In 1963, it was reportedly involved in the Victoria Market Murders.

title: Honoured Society (Australia)
text: It was led by gangster Frank Benvenuto until his slaying in 2000.

title: Honoured Society (Australia)
text: Tony Romeo, another high-ranking member, was shot in 2002.

title: Royal Commission of Inquiry into Drug Trafficking
text: The Royal Commission of Inquiry into Drug Trafficking (1981–1983), also known as the Stewart Royal Commission, was a Royal Commission set up in 1981 by the Commonwealth, Queensland, New South Wales and Victorian governments to inquire into various drug trafficking and related criminal activities of Terence John Clark and his associates.

title: Royal Commission of Inquiry into Drug Trafficking
text: However, the Commission would spend much of its time examining how criminals were using and abusing the passport system for criminal purposes.

title: Chelmsford Royal Commission
text: The Chelmsford Royal Commission (1988–1990), chaired by Justice John Patrick Slattery, was established by the New South Wales state government, ostensibly to investigate mental health services in The state.

title: Chelmsford Royal Commission
text: It came about only after prominent Sydney radio and television shows pressured the newly elected Health Minister, Peter Collins, to make good his promises for a Royal Commission.

title: Chelmsford Royal Commission
text: Originally, its prime focus was to have been psychosurgery at the NSW Neuropsychiatric Institute.

title: Chelmsford Royal Commission
text: Following media pressure it focused more on the Deep Sleep Therapy of Dr Harry Bailey, the director, from 1963 to 1979, of the state-funded Neuropsychiatric Institute and then the Chelmsford Private Hospital, a private psychiatric institution in Sydney.

title: Robert Trimbole
text: Bruno Robert Trimbole (19 March 1931 – 12 May 1987) was an Australian businessman, drug baron and organised crime boss whose was alleged involvement in drug trafficking in the Griffith, New South Wales area, which according to popular loose fiction series Underbelly: Tale of Two Cities, led to a royal commission, a Coroner's inquest and an international chase by the Australian Government seeking his apprehension after he travelled overseas visiting Europe.

title: Roberto Pannunzi
text: Roberto Pannunzi (born Rome, March 4, 1948), also known as "Bébé" (Baby), is an Italian criminal linked to the 'Ndrangheta, a Mafia-type organisation in Calabria.

title: Roberto Pannunzi
text: He is one of the top cocaine brokers for the Sicilian Mafia and the 'Ndrangheta with the Colombian cocaine cartels.

title: Roberto Pannunzi
text: He has been described as "Europe's most wanted drugs trafficker", and the "biggest cocaine trafficker in the world", the equivalent of Pablo Escobar, the head of the Colombian Medellín Cartel.

title: Roberto Pannunzi
text: According to the United States Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), the drug trafficking activities of Pannunzi have been documented for over 30 years.

title: 46th Operations Group
text: The 46th Operations Group was a component of the United States Air Force 46th Test Wing assigned to Eglin Air Force Base, Florida.

title: 46th Operations Group
text: It was inactivated on 1 October 2012, and its functions consolidated under the 96th Test Wing at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida

title: 46th Test Wing
text: The 46th Test Wing is an inactive wing of the United States Air Force last based at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida.

title: 46th Test Wing
text: The wing's 46th Test Group was a tenant unit at Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico.

title: 46th Test Group
text: The 46th Test Group was a United States Air Force unit active from 1992 to 2012.

title: 46th Test Group
text: It was last active with 46th Test Wing, at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida.

title: 46th Test Group
text: The 46th Test Group was stationed as a tenant unit at Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico, throughout its existence.

title: 46th Test Group
text: It was inactivated on 18 July 2012, being replaced by the 96th Test Group in an administrative reorganization.

title: 486th Flight Test Squadron
text: The 486th Flight Test Squadron is a secretive unit, with a somewhat misleading designation, assigned to Eglin Air Force Base, Florida, and which is associated with United States Department of State Foreign Emergency Support Team activities.

title: 486th Flight Test Squadron
text: The squadron motto is ""Non semper ea sunt quae videntur"" which translates as "Not always what they seem".

title: 486th Flight Test Squadron
text: It was apparently assigned to the 227th Special Operations Flight, later redesignated the 150th Special Operations Squadron, McGuire Air Force Base, New Jersey, but is currently assigned to the 46th Test Wing at Eglin, and operates a pair of Boeing C-32B or Boeing 757-23A aircraft, on stand-by alert for special operations and intelligence missions world-wide.

title: 486th Flight Test Squadron
text: Official documents make it clear that operations fall under the aegis of Air Force Special Operations Command.

title: 586th Flight Test Squadron
text: The 586th Flight Test Squadron (586 FLTS) is part of the 96th Test Wing based at Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico.

title: 337th Flight Test Squadron
text: The 337th Flight Test Squadron (337 FLTS) was most recently part of the 46th Test Wing and based at McClellan Air Force Base, California.

title: 337th Flight Test Squadron
text: It performed depot acceptance testing until being inactivated with the closure of McClellan AFB on 13 July 2001.

title: Holloman High Speed Test Track
text: The Holloman High Speed Test Track (HHSTT) is a United States Department of Defense/Air Force aerospace ground test facility located at Holloman Air Force Base in south-central New Mexico.

title: Holloman High Speed Test Track
text: It is adjacent to the White Sands Missile Range and is operated by the 846th Test Squadron of the 96th Test Group of the 96th Test Wing at Eglin Air Force Base.

title: Holloman High Speed Test Track
text: The Test Track provides its services to a wide variety of American defense and governmental agencies such as the Air Force, Army, Navy, and the Missile Defense Agency, as well as America's allies.

title: McClellan Air Force Base
text: McClellan Air Force Base (1935–2001) is a former United States Air Force base located in the North Highlands area of Sacramento County, 7 mi northeast of Sacramento, California.

title: 417th Flight Test Squadron
text: The 417th Flight Test Squadron is an inactive United States Air Force squadron.

title: 417th Flight Test Squadron
text: It was last assigned to the 412th Operations Group at Edwards Air Force Base, California, where it was inactivated on 14 February 2012.

title: 417th Flight Test Squadron
text: The squadron was first activated in 1989 as the 6517th Test Squadron and conducted flight testing of the McDonnell Douglas C-17 Globemaster III until it was inactivated in 1995 as the 417th Test Squadron.

title: 417th Flight Test Squadron
text: It was reactivated in 2006 and performed ground and flight testing on the Boeing YAL-1A until 2012.

title: 96th Test Wing
text: The 96th Test Wing is a United States Air Force unit assigned to the Air Force Test Center of Air Force Materiel Command at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida.

title: 96th Test Wing
text: The wing was activated at Eglin in 1994 as the 96th Air Base Wing, the headquarters for all support units on Eglin, the largest installation in the Air Force.

title: 96th Test Wing
text: In 2012, it absorbed the mission and resources of the 46th Test Wing and added the mission of testing and evaluating weapons, navigation and guidance systems and command and control systems.

title: Hexatron Engineering
text: Hexatron Engineering Co., Inc. is an American aerospace engineering, aircraft engine and aircraft parts manufacturer based in Salt Lake City, Utah.

title: Hexatron Engineering
text: The company was founded in 1982 by Cy Williams and specializes in the design and manufacture of airline aircraft crew seats and also has an aircraft engine design in production for homebuilt, ultralight aircraft and the American light-sport aircraft categories.

title: History of BMW
text: BMW AG originated with three other manufacturing companies, Rapp Motorenwerke and Bayerische Flugzeugwerke (BFw) in Bavaria, and Fahrzeugfabrik Eisenach in Thuringia.

title: History of BMW
text: The company is now known as BMW or Bayerische Motoren Werke.

title: History of BMW
text: Aircraft engine manufacturer Rapp Motorenwerke became Bayerische Motorenwerke in 1916.

title: History of BMW
text: The engine manufacturer, which built proprietary industrial engines after World War I, was then bought by the owner of BFw who then merged BFw into BMW and moved the engine works onto BFw's premises.

title: History of BMW
text: BFw's motorcycle sideline was improved upon by BMW and became an integral part of their business.

title: Engine Alliance
text: The Engine Alliance (EA) is an American aircraft engine manufacturer based in East Hartford, Connecticut.

title: Engine Alliance
text: The company is a 50/50 joint venture between GE Aviation, a subsidiary of General Electric, and Pratt & Whitney, a subsidiary of United Technologies.

title: Engine Alliance
text: Engine Alliance was established in August 1996 to develop, manufacture, sell, and support a family of modern technology aircraft engines for new high-capacity, long-range aircraft.

title: BMW R32
text: The BMW R32 was the first motorcycle produced by BMW under the BMW name.

title: BMW R32
text: An aircraft engine manufacturer during World War I, BMW was forced to diversify after the Treaty of Versailles banned the German air force and German aircraft manufacture.

title: BMW R32
text: BMW initially turned to industrial engine design and manufacturing.

title: Orenda Iroquois
text: The Orenda PS.13 Iroquois was an advanced turbojet engine designed for military use.

title: Orenda Iroquois
text: It was developed by the Canadian aircraft engine manufacturer Orenda Engines, a part of the Avro Canada group.

title: Orenda Iroquois
text: Intended for the CF-105 Arrow interceptor, development was cancelled, along with the Arrow, in 1959.

title: D-Motor
text: D-Motor is a Belgian aircraft engine manufacturer based in Deerlijk.

title: D-Motor
text: The company specializes in the design and manufacture of aircraft engines for homebuilt and ultralight aircraft.

title: MTU Aero Engines
text: MTU Aero Engines AG is a German aircraft engine manufacturer.

title: MTU Aero Engines
text: MTU develops, manufactures and provides service support for military and civil aircraft engines.

title: MTU Aero Engines
text: MTU Aero Engines was formerly known as MTU München.

title: Pirna 014
text: The Pirna 014 was an axial turbojet designed in East Germany (or the GDR) in the mid- to late 1950s by former Junkers engineers, who were repatriated to East Germany in 1954 after being held in custody in the Soviet Union following World War II.

title: Stratus 2000
text: Stratus 2000, Inc was an American aircraft engine manufacturer based in Camano Island, Washington and later in Corvallis, Oregon.

title: Stratus 2000
text: The company specialized in the design and manufacture of engines based on Subaru automotive engines for homebuilt aircraft.

title: Junkers
text: Junkers Flugzeug- und Motorenwerke AG (JFM, earlier JCO or JKO in World War I), more commonly Junkers, was a major German aircraft and aircraft engine manufacturer.

title: Junkers
text: It produced some of the world's most innovative and best-known airplanes over the course of its fifty-plus year history in Dessau, Germany.

title: Junkers
text: It was founded there in 1895 by Hugo Junkers, initially manufacturing boilers and radiators.

title: Junkers
text: During World War I, and following the war, the company became famous for its pioneering all-metal aircraft.

title: Junkers
text: During World War II the company produced some of the most successful Luftwaffe planes, as well as piston and jet aircraft engines, albeit in the absence of its founder, who had been removed by the Nazis in 1934.

title: Missoula, Montana
text: Missoula is a city in the U.S. state of Montana and is the county seat of Missoula County.

title: Missoula, Montana
text: It is located along the Clark Fork River near its confluences with the Bitterroot and Blackfoot Rivers in western Montana and at the convergence of five mountain ranges, thus is often described as the "hub of five valleys".

title: Missoula, Montana
text: In 2016 , the United States Census Bureau estimated the city's population at 72,364 and the population of the Missoula Metropolitan Area at 116,130.

title: Missoula, Montana
text: In the 1990s, Missoula overtook GreatFalls as Montana’s second‐largest city, behind Billings.

title: Missoula, Montana
text: Missoula is home to the University of Montana, a public research university.

title: Great Falls, Montana
text: Great Falls is a city in and the county seat of Cascade County, Montana, United States.

title: Great Falls, Montana
text: The 2015 census estimate put the population at 59,638.

title: Great Falls, Montana
text: The population was 58,505 at the 2010 census.

title: Great Falls, Montana
text: It is the principal city of the Great Falls, Montana Metropolitan Statistical Area, which encompasses all of Cascade County and has a population of 82,278.

title: Great Falls, Montana
text: Great Falls was the largest city in Montana from 1950 to 1970, when Billings surpassed it.

title: Great Falls, Montana
text: Great Falls remained the second largest city in Montana until 2000, when it was passed by Missoula.

title: Great Falls, Montana
text: Since then Great Falls has been the third largest city in the state.

title: Lynn University
text: Lynn University is an American private university in Boca Raton, Florida.

title: Lynn University
text: It was founded in 1962.

title: Lynn University
text: Its students come from all over the USA and approximately 80 other nations: 24% of students have citizenship in countries outside the United States.

title: Lynn University
text: The university is accredited by the Commission on Colleges of the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools to award associate's, baccalaureate, master's and doctoral degrees.

title: Lynn University
text: It is named for the Lynn family (Christine E. and Eugene M. Lynn).

title: Lynn University
text: It has a total undergraduate enrollment of 2,100, its setting is suburban, and the campus size is 123 acres.

title: Lynn University
text: It utilizes a semester-based academic calendar.

title: Lynn University
text: Lynn University's ranking in the 2015 edition of Best Colleges is National Universities, Tier 2.

title: New Providence High School
text: New Providence High School is a comprehensive public high school in the borough of New Providence, in Union County, New Jersey, United States, operating as the lone secondary school in the New Providence School District, serving students in ninth through twelfth grades. New Providence High School opened on September 8, 1958 with its first graduating class on June 23, 1960.

title: New Providence High School
text: The school has been accredited by the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Secondary Schools since 1965.

title: New Providence High School
text: The school opened on September 8, 1958, and had its first graduating class of seniors in June 1960.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: Montana State University Billings (or MSU Billings) is a state university.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: Its main campus is located on 110 acres in downtown Billings, Montana, United States.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: Formerly Eastern Montana Normal School when it was founded in 1927, it was then renamed in 1949 to Eastern Montana College of Education.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: In 1965, it became a full-fledged four-year college as Eastern Montana College.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: It merged with Montana State University in 1994 under its present name.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: Currently, the university offers associate’s, bachelor's and master's degrees through the University’s five colleges.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: The five colleges of Montana State University Billings are Arts and Sciences, Business, Allied Health professions, Education and City College.

title: Montana State University Billings
text: It has the third largest campus population in the Montana State University System.

title: Media in Missoula, Montana
text: Since its incorporation in 1885, Missoula, Montana has been one of the primary media markets in the state of Montana, beginning with the weekly newspaper the "Missoula and Cedar Creek Pioneer".

title: Media in Missoula, Montana
text: The Missoula single-broadcast over-air television media market has been the largest in Montana (#166 nationally) since 2002.

title: Media in Missoula, Montana
text: Though Billings is the largest city in Montana, Missoula's single-broadcast over-air television media market includes Missoula, Ravalli, Granite, Mineral, Lake, Flathead, and Sanders and serves over 113,000 television homes (2011).

title: Media in Missoula, Montana
text: Missoula is also home to the state's third largest daily newspaper, the "Missoulian", and the state's largest alternative weekly, the "Missoula Independent".

title: Ohio Northern University
text: Ohio Northern University is a private, United Methodist Church-affiliated university located in the United States in Ada, Ohio, founded by Henry Solomon Lehr in 1871.

title: Ohio Northern University
text: ONU is accredited by The Higher Learning Commission and the North Central Association of Colleges and Schools.

title: Ohio Northern University
text: ONU is a sister university with Dankook University, a private university in Seoul, South Korea.

title: Ohio Northern University
text: In 2008, 2009, 2010, and 2013 "U.S. News & World Report" listed Ohio Northern as Regional Universities (Midwest), #2.

title: Cooperating Colleges of Greater Springfield
text: The Cooperating Colleges of Greater Springfield (CCGS) is an association of accredited colleges and universities located in Hampden County in Western Massachusetts, in and around the city of Springfield.

title: Cooperating Colleges of Greater Springfield
text: Formed in 1971, the association provides various benefits to the students enrolled in its member institutions.

title: Cooperating Colleges of Greater Springfield
text: It includes 4-year public and private institutions as well as 2-year community colleges, all of which are non-profit schools accredited by the New England Association of Schools and Colleges.

title: University of Providence
text: The University of Providence (UP) (renamed from University of Great Falls in July 2017), is a private Roman Catholic university located in Great Falls, Montana within the Diocese of Great Falls–Billings.

title: University of Providence
text: The university is accredited by the Northwest Association of Schools and Colleges.

title: University of Providence
text: The University's mission "is to provide students with the opportunity to obtain a liberal education for living and for making a living."

title: Jacksonville University
text: Jacksonville University (JU) is a private university in Jacksonville, Florida, United States.

title: Jacksonville University
text: The school was founded in 1934 as a two-year college and was known as Jacksonville Junior College until September 5, 1956, when it shifted focus to building four-year university degree programs and later graduated its first four-year degree candidates as Jacksonville University in June 1959.

title: Jacksonville University
text: It is a member of the Independent Colleges and Universities of Florida and is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS) and the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB).

title: Jacksonville University
text: JU's student body currently represents more than 40 U.S. states and approximately 45 countries around the world.

title: Jacksonville University
text: As a Division I university, it is home to 19 sports teams, known as the JU Dolphins, as well as intramural sports and clubs.

title: Jacksonville University
text: Among the top majors declared by JU students are aviation management, biology, nursing, business and marine science.

title: Cover version
text: In popular music, a cover version or cover song, or simply cover, is a new performance or recording of a previously recorded, commercially released song by someone other than the original artist or composer.

title: Till Death Unites Us
text: Till Death Unites Us is the fourth full-length studio album by the Finnish melodic death metal band Norther.

title: Till Death Unites Us
text: It was released on 25 January 2006 through Spinefarm Records.

title: Till Death Unites Us
text: The album has no cover song, while most other Norther releases include such a song; this release marks their first studio album to not include a cover song.

title: Till Death Unites Us
text: The song "Scream" was released as a CD single.

title: Livin' in the Sunlight, Lovin' in the Moonlight
text: "Livin' in the Sunlight, Lovin' in the Moonlight" is a popular song that was written by Al Sherman and Al Lewis for the 1930 film, "The Big Pond" starring Maurice Chevalier, who made it famous.

title: Livin' in the Sunlight, Lovin' in the Moonlight
text: On March 22, 1930 Bing Crosby and the Paul Whiteman Orchestra recorded a popular cover of this song as well.

title: Livin' in the Sunlight, Lovin' in the Moonlight
text: This registered in the charts of the day at the No. 16 position.

title: The Chimes (album)
text: The Chimes is the debut and only album by Scottish dance music act The Chimes, released in 1990.

title: The Chimes (album)
text: Featuring singer Pauline Henry on vocals, the album includes their cover of U2's "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For", which reached number 6 in the UK Singles Chart, along with their other Top 40 hit "Heaven", which reached number 24.

title: The Chimes (album)
text: The album was certified silver in the UK, and gold in Australia.

title: The Chimes (Scottish band)
text: The Chimes were a successful dance music trio.

title: The Chimes (Scottish band)
text: Pauline Henry (born in Jamaica) with Mike Peden and James Locke from Edinburgh, in Scotland.

title: The Chimes (Scottish band)
text: They are best known for their hits "Heaven" and a remake of U2's "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For," which became a UK Top Ten hit.

title: Dragostea Din Tei
text: "Dragostea Din Tei" (] , "Love from the lindens", official English title: Words of Love), also informally known as "Ma Ya Hi" and "The Numa Numa Song" (see ), is the most successful single by the Moldovan pop group O-Zone, sung in Romanian.

title: Dragostea Din Tei
text: It shot to the number one spot on the Eurochart Hot 100, where it remained for 12 weeks between June and early September 2004.

title: Dragostea Din Tei
text: It topped the single charts in France, Germany and Austria for over three months, reached three in the United Kingdom and 72 on the US Pop 100.

title: Dragostea Din Tei
text: The song became the fourth-best-selling single of the 21st century in France, with 1,170,000 units sold.

title: Dragostea Din Tei
text: A popular cover of the song was made by Italian-Romanian pop singer Haiducii, which also charted in many countries, especially Italy and Sweden, where it topped the singles charts.

title: Dragostea Din Tei
text: The original song was made notable in the United States by the viral video of Gary Brolsma dancing to the song, calling it "Numa Numa".

title: I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For
text: "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For" is a song by Irish rock band U2.

title: I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For
text: It is the second track from their 1987 album "The Joshua Tree" and was released as the album's second single in May 1987.

title: I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For
text: The song was a hit, becoming the band's second consecutive number-one single on the US "Billboard" Hot 100 while peaking at number six on the UK Singles Chart.

title: Pauline Henry
text: Pauline Henry (born 29 January 1961) is a British Jamaican recording artist.

title: Pauline Henry
text: She was the vocalist in the Scottish band The Chimes, best known for their 1990 cover version of U2's "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For", between 1988 and 1991.

title: Pauline Henry
text: Following her departure from the group, Henry embarked on a solo career, and achieved five UK top 40 singles between 1993 and 1996.

title: Cover Version
text: Cover Version is a compilation album released in 2014 by British musician and record producer Steven Wilson.

title: Cover Version
text: The album compiles the 12 songs originally released as six "2 song" singles.

title: Cover Version
text: Every release was made up of one original song and one cover song that involved new interpretations of other artist's songs in ways much different from their original versions.

title: Cover Version
text: The only exception to this format is in "The Unquiet Grave" which is actually an old English folk song, and not an original song written by Wilson.

title: Love Is (Michi EP)
text: Love Is is the first EP released by British-Japanese musician MiChi, released on 22 December 2010.

title: Love Is (Michi EP)
text: It is her first non-single release since her debut album "Up to You" was released in 2009.

title: Love Is (Michi EP)
text: All four of the songs featured on the EP are used in various commercials and advertisements.

title: Love Is (Michi EP)
text: The title song was sent to Japanese radio stations as the first single on 19 November, with the music video premiering in early December.

title: Love Is (Michi EP)
text: It also contains a cover of The Offspring's "Pretty Fly (For A White Guy)", MiChi's first cover song since 2009's "Kiss Kiss xxx".

title: Love Is (Michi EP)
text: This makes it her seventh cover song, following her cover versions of songs by The Spice Girls, Nirvana, Avril Lavigne, Queen, Des'ree and Fergie.

title: Michael Breed
text: Michael S. Breed (born May 14, 1962, in Greenwich, Connecticut) is a professional golf instructor and television host.

title: Michael Breed
text: In 2003, he was selected as a Top 100 Instructor in America by "Golf Magazine", in 2011, he was voted one of the Top 50 Instructors in America by Golf Digest (now 13th on this list, and #1 in the state of New York.)

title: Michael Breed
text: , in 2012, Breed was chosen as the PGA's National Teacher of the Year.

title: Michael Breed
text: Prior to his time as a television host, Breed was the Head Golf Professional at Sunningdale Country Club for 12 years from 2001–2012, and the Head Golf Professional at Birchwood Country Club, as well as the Assistant Professional at Deepdale Golf Club and Augusta National Golf Club.

title: Michael Breed
text: He has served on different boards for the Metropolitan PGA for over 10 years and has represented the PGA of America at the National Golf Day in Washington D.C. since 2012.

title: Michael Breed
text: He is involved in charities such as The First Tee, Folds of Honor, Hope for the Warriors, Wounded Warriors Foundation and Salute Military Golf Association.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: The towns and cities of the Hudson Valley were created by the U.S. state of New York as municipalities, in order to perform the services of local government.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: In 1683, prior to the creation of modern towns, the Province of New York was divided into twelve counties for administrative purposes by the Colonial Governor of New York.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: In the Hudson Valley, these divisions included Dutchess, Orange, and Ulster counties.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: Dutchess and Orange remained unorganized until 1713, with Dutchess administered from Ulster; Orange would be administered from New York County.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: Future counties would be formed and towns exchanged over time, with Rockland County split from Orange in 1799, at which time the southern towns of Ulster were transferred to Orange as compensation for the loss; and Putnam County from Dutchess in 1812, these county's towns can trace their origins to towns and precincts that were formed in their parent counties.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: Another change that occurred was the transfer of Dutchess County's northern section, the Livingston Manor, to Columbia County.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: Greene County was formed in 1800 by the combination of the southernmost towns of Albany County with the northernmost towns of Ulster.

title: Timeline of town creation in the Hudson Valley
text: The history of the towns of Greene and Columbia counties can be found at the Timeline of town creation in New York's Capital District.

title: Guitars for Wounded Warriors
text: Guitars for Wounded Warriors is the sixth solo studio album by guitarist Brian Tarquin, released in August 2014 by Cleopatra Records.

title: Guitars for Wounded Warriors
text: In 2016, it received a Best Compilation Album nomination by the Independent Music Awards.

title: Guitars for Wounded Warriors
text: All tracks were recorded at Tarquin's Jungle Room Studios in New Paltz (village), New York.

title: Guitars for Wounded Warriors
text: Being moved by the lack of support for returning veterans through his life Tarquin decided to compose a heavy instrumental rock album as a way to show his appreciation to all veterans.

title: Guitars for Wounded Warriors
text: So once again he enlisted top notch players to guest with him on the album, Billy Sheehan on "Black Hawk", Ron "Bumblefoot" Thal and Reb Beach on "Taliban Terror", Steve Morse on "Freedom", Chris Poland on "Charlie Surfs" and "Hunting", Chuck Loeb on "Escape Kabul", Hal Lindes on "Sand & Blood", Gary Hoey on "5 Klicks To Hell" and "Baghdad", Alex De Rosso Dokken on "Broken Arrow", and The Flyin' Ryan Brothers on "Surgical Strike".

title: Guitars for Wounded Warriors
text: The entire album was engineered, produced and composed by Tarquin especially for each one of the guest guitarists.

title: Guitars for Wounded Warriors
text: Partial proceeds are donated to the Fisher House Foundation from sales.

title: Aaron B. Rollins
text: Aaron B. Rollins (1818 - December 4, 1878) was a member of the New York State Assembly for the 9th district of Manhattan from 1851 to 1853.

title: Aaron B. Rollins
text: He was the deputy Sheriff of New York County, New York from 1853 to 1859, and the Coroner of New York County, New York from 1867 to 1870.

title: New Paltz (village), New York
text: New Paltz is a village in Ulster County located in the U.S. state of New York.

title: New Paltz (village), New York
text: It is about 80 mi north of New York City and 70 mi south of Albany.

title: New Paltz (village), New York
text: The population was 6,818 at the 2010 census.

title: Brian Tarquin
text: Brian Tarquin is an American multi-Emmy Award winning guitarist/composer and producer of the "Guitar Masters Series" featuring Jeff Beck, Steve Vai, Jimmy Page, Santana, BB King and Joe Satriani.

title: Brian Tarquin
text: Also known for his work as a smooth jazz artist and a music composer receiving 3 Emmy Awards for "Outstanding Achievement in Music Direction and Composition for a Drama Series" and also received Emmy nominations in 2001, 2002 and 2004.

title: Brian Tarquin
text: Tarquin has sold more than 150,000 albums through his career in the USA.

title: Brian Tarquin
text: He wrote the theme music for MTV's "Road Rules", as well as producing music for many other TV shows such as "", "TMZ on TV", "America's Next Top Model", ABC's "Making The Band", "Extra", "Alias" and the Keanu Reeves film "The Watcher".

title: Brian Tarquin
text: In 2014, Tarquin produced, engineered and composed "Guitars for Wounded Warriors", which showcases Tarquin’s guitar prowess alongside other guitarists such as, Steve Morse, Billy Sheehan, Gary Hoey, Bumblefoot (Guns N' Roses), Reb Beach (Whitesnake), Hal Lindes (Dire Straits), Chris Poland (Megadeth) and Chuck Loeb (Fourplay).

title: Brian Tarquin
text: The album features exclusively released tracks inspired by those military soldiers who fought for our country and released by Cleopatra Records.

title: New York County Courthouse
text: The New York State Supreme Court Building, originally known as the New York County Courthouse, at 60 Centre Street on Foley Square in the Civic Center district of Manhattan, New York City houses the Civil and Appellate Terms of the New York State Supreme Court for the state's First Judicial District, which is coextensive with Manhattan, as well as the offices of the New York County Clerk.

title: New York County District Attorney
text: The New York County District Attorney is the elected district attorney for New York County (Manhattan), New York.

title: New York County District Attorney
text: The office is responsible for the prosecution of violations of New York state laws. (Federal law violations in Manhattan are prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.)

title: New York County District Attorney
text: The current district attorney is Cyrus Vance, Jr.

title: Julius Harburger
text: Julius Harburger (1850 - November 9, 1914) was a New York City politician.

title: Julius Harburger
text: He was elected as the Sheriff of New York County, New York from 1911 to December 31, 1913.

title: Julius Harburger
text: He also served as the Coroner of New York County, New York in 1907 serving as the president of the board of coroners.

title: List of counties in New York
text: There are 62 counties in the state of New York.

title: List of counties in New York
text: The original twelve counties were created immediately after the British takeover of the Dutch colony of New Amsterdam, although two of these counties have since been abolished.

title: List of counties in New York
text: The most recent county formation in New York was in 1914, when Bronx County was created from the portions of New York City that had been annexed from Westchester County in the late 19th century and added to New York County.

title: List of counties in New York
text: New York's counties are named for a variety of Native American words; British provinces, counties, cities, and royalty; early American statesmen and military personnel; and New York State politicians.

title: Loretta Lynn
text: Loretta Lynn (née Webb; born April 14, 1932) is an American country music singer-songwriter with multiple gold albums over a career of almost 60 years.

title: Loretta Lynn
text: She has received numerous awards and other accolades for her groundbreaking role in country music, including awards from both the Country Music Association and Academy of Country Music as a duet partner and an individual artist.

title: Loretta Lynn
text: She is the most awarded female country recording artist and the only female ACM Artist of the Decade (1970s).

title: Tim Malchak
text: Tim Malchak (born June 25, 1957 in Binghamton, New York) is an American country music singer-songwriter.

title: Tim Malchak
text: Malchak partnered with Dwight Rucker in 1982 to form the country music duo Malchak & Rucker.

title: Tim Malchak
text: Together, they became the first black/white duo in country music history with a charting single when "Just Like That" debuted on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart in 1984.

title: Tammy Wynette
text: Tammy Wynette (born Virginia Wynette Pugh; May 5, 1942 – April 6, 1998) was an American country music singer-songwriter and one of country music's best-known artists and biggest-selling female singers.

title: Bobby Lewis (country singer)
text: Bobby Lewis (born May 9, 1942 in Hodgenville, Kentucky) is an American country music singer-songwriter.

title: Bobby Lewis (country singer)
text: Between 1963 and 1985, Lewis released ten albums and charted more than twenty-five songs on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles chart.

title: Bobby Lewis (country singer)
text: His biggest hit, "How Long Has It Been," peaked at Number 6 in 1966.

title: Bobby Lewis (country singer)
text: Lewis released a whopping 26 Country charted singles from 1966 to 1985, with 14 for United Artists, 5 for Ace Of Hearts, two with GRT, 3 for RPA and one each for Capricorn and HME.

title: Bobby Lewis (country singer)
text: Lewis also released a total of 9 albums with United Artists.

title: Three Wooden Crosses
text: "Three Wooden Crosses" the title of a song written by Kim Williams and Doug Johnson, and recorded by American country music singer-songwriter Randy Travis.

title: Three Wooden Crosses
text: It was released in November 2002 from his album, "Rise and Shine".

title: Three Wooden Crosses
text: The song became Travis' 16th Number One single, his first since "Whisper My Name" in 1994.

title: Three Wooden Crosses
text: "Three Wooden Crosses" was named Song of the Year by the Country Music Association in 2003 and won a Dove Award from the Gospel Music Association as Country Song of the Year in 2004.

title: I'm a One-Woman Man
text: "(I'm a) One-Woman Man" is a song co-written by American country music artist Johnny Horton and Tillman Franks.

title: I'm a One-Woman Man
text: It was originally released as a single by Horton in 1956, whose version peaked at number 7 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles chart.

title: I'm a One-Woman Man
text: The song was twice recorded by American country music artist George Jones: first released on the album "The Crown Prince of Country Music" retitled "One Woman Man" in 1960, and later as "I'm a One Woman Man" released in November 1988 as the first single from his album "One Woman Man".

title: I'm a One-Woman Man
text: It peaked at number 5 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles chart in early 1989 and it would be his final Top 10 solo hit.

title: I'm a One-Woman Man
text: His final appearance on the Top-10 country singles chart arrived a year later as part of a duet recording with Randy Travis.

title: I'm a One-Woman Man
text: In spite of the lack of radio hits as the 1990s dawned Jones remained a popular concert draw for the next two decades and continued to release original recordings into the mid 2000s.

title: Please Don't Stop Loving Me
text: "Please Don't Stop Loving Me" is a song written and recorded as a duet by American country music artists Porter Wagoner and Dolly Parton.

title: Please Don't Stop Loving Me
text: It was released in July 1974 as the first single from the album "Porter 'n' Dolly".

title: Please Don't Stop Loving Me
text: "Please Don't Stop Loving Me" was Porter Wagoner and Dolly Parton's sixteenth country hit and their only number one on the country chart as a duet act.

title: Please Don't Stop Loving Me
text: Though Parton and Wagoner had each topped the charts as solo artists, and many of their duet singles had reached the country top-ten, "Please Don't Stop Loving Me" was their only chart-topper as a duet act.

title: Please Don't Stop Loving Me
text: The single stayed at number one for one week and spent a total of ten weeks on the country chart.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: Buddy Brown is a traditional American country music singer-songwriter who was discovered as a YouTube sensation.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: Brown was born on May 12, 1982 to Dan and Cheryl Brown in Madison, Mississippi, a suburb of Jackson.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: When Brown was nine years old, his family decided to relocate to Orlando, Florida for his father’s career.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: In 2005, he graduated from Mississippi State with a degree in Psychology.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: On October 13, 2009, he released a cover of Easton Corbin’s "A Little More Country Than That" that went viral.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: A year later, he opened up for country music legend, John Anderson in Wildwood, FL.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: On July 4, 2012, he released his first album titled Mason Jar.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: His fan base pushed his first full-length CD to No. 34 on the iTunes country chart without a record deal.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: March 11, 2014, he released a self-titled EP, Buddy Brown.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: On October 14, 2014, Buddy released his second EP, Keepin’ It Country.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: This EP reached to No. 12 on the iTunes charts.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: In January 2014, Billboard put Keepin’ It Country on their Heat Seekers Albums list.

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: USA Today published a story on Brown, labeling him as a "YouTube Sensation."

title: Buddy Brown (musician)
text: His single "Takin’ You Huntin’" landed him a spot on the front page and an online feature in the Clarion Ledger.

title: Lane Brody
text: Lane Brody (born September 24, 1955 in Oak Park, Illinois) is an American country music singer-songwriter, active since the early 1980s, best known for her 1984 Billboard-topping country hit "The Yellow Rose" (a duet with country music singer Johnny Lee), and for the Oscar-nominated song "Over You" from the 1983 film "Tender Mercies".

title: Lane Brody
text: She is the first female in country music to have an Oscar-nominated hit from a soundtrack album.

title: Lane Brody
text: Besides "The Yellow Rose", Brody has eleven other chart singles on the Billboard country charts.

title: The Battle (George Jones song)
text: "The Battle" is a song by American country music artist George Jones.

title: The Battle (George Jones song)
text: It was composed by Norro Wilson, George Richey, and Linda Kimball and became the title track of Jones' 1976 LP.

title: The Battle (George Jones song)
text: The song uses war as a metaphor in describing an argument and eventual reconciliation between a couple, with the woman emerging victorious and the narrator exclaiming, "Oh, what a sweet surrender!"

title: The Battle (George Jones song)
text: The song begins with the sound of drums mimicking the start of a battle march.

title: The Battle (George Jones song)
text: Despite Billy Sherrill's ambitious production and Jones' committed vocal performance, the single did not crack the Top 10, stalling at #16 and continued the singer's commercial slide as a solo artist.

title: The Battle (George Jones song)
text: Meanwhile, the single "Golden Ring," a duet with his estranged ex-wife Tammy Wynette, became a #1 hit that same year.

title: James Stuart, 3rd Earl of Moray
text: James Stuart, 3rd Earl of Moray (1581 – 6 August 1638) was the son of James Stewart, 2nd Earl of Moray and Elizabeth Stuart, 2nd Countess of Moray.

title: Charlotte of the Palatinate (1628–1631)
text: Charlotte of the Palatinate ("Princess Palatine Charlotte", 19 December 1628 – 14 January 1631), was the fourth daughter of Frederick V, Elector Palatine (of the House of Wittelsbach), the "Winter King" of Bohemia, by his consort, the English princess Elizabeth Stuart.

title: Charlotte of the Palatinate (1628–1631)
text: Charlotte was born up in the Dutch Republic, where her family had sought refuge after the sequestration of their Electorate during the Thirty Years' War.

title: Charlotte of the Palatinate (1628–1631)
text: Charlotte's brother Charles Louis was, as part of the Peace of Westphalia, restored to the Palatinate.

title: Margaret Howard, Countess of Nottingham
text: Margaret Stuart (or Stewart) (c. 1591 – 4 August 1639), was an English court office holder.

title: Margaret Howard, Countess of Nottingham
text: She served as lady-in-waiting to the queen consort of England, Anne of Denmark.

title: Margaret Howard, Countess of Nottingham
text: She was the daughter of James Stewart, 2nd Earl of Moray, and Elizabeth Stuart, 2nd Countess of Moray.

title: Francis Nethersole
text: Sir Francis Nethersole (1587–1659) was an English diplomat, secretary to the Electress Elizabeth, Member of Parliament for Corfe Castle, Dorset, and a Civil War political pamphleteer.

title: Gustavus Adolphus of the Palatinate
text: Gustavus Adolphus of the Palatinate ("Prince Palatine Gustavus Adolphus", 14 January 1632 – 9 January 1641), was the last son of Frederick V, Elector Palatine (of the House of Wittelsbach), the "Winter King" of Bohemia, by his consort, the English princess Elizabeth Stuart.

title: Gustavus Adolphus of the Palatinate
text: Gustavus was born in the Dutch Republic, where his family had sought refuge after the sequestration of the Electorate during the Thirty Years' War.

title: Gustavus Adolphus of the Palatinate
text: Gustavus's brother Charles Louis was, as part of the Peace of Westphalia, restored to the Palatinate.

title: Elizabeth Stuart, Queen of Bohemia
text: Elizabeth Stuart (19 August 1596 – 13 February 1662) was Electress of the Palatinate and briefly Queen of Bohemia as the wife of Frederick V of the Palatinate.

title: Elizabeth Stuart, Queen of Bohemia
text: Due to her husband’s reign in Bohemia lasting for just one winter, Elizabeth is often referred to as The Winter Queen.

title: The Gates Ajar
text: The Gates Ajar is an 1868 religious novel by Elizabeth Stuart Phelps (later Elizabeth Phelps Ward) that was immensely popular following its publication.

title: The Gates Ajar
text: It was the second best-selling religious novel of the 19th century.

title: The Gates Ajar
text: 80,000 copies were sold in America by 1900; 100,000 were sold in England during the same time period.

title: The Gates Ajar
text: Sequels "Beyond the Gates" (1883) and "The Gates Between" (1887) were also bestsellers, and the three together are referred to as the author's "Spiritualist novels."

title: Elisabeth of the Palatinate
text: Elisabeth of the Palatinate (26 December 1618 – 11 February 1680), also known as Elisabeth of Bohemia, Princess Elisabeth of the Palatinate, or Princess-Abbess of Herford Abbey, was the eldest daughter of Frederick V, Elector Palatine (who was briefly King of Bohemia), and Elizabeth Stuart.

title: Elisabeth of the Palatinate
text: She was born in Heidelberg, Germany, spending the first nine years of her life there.

title: Elisabeth of the Palatinate
text: When she was nine, she went to live in Leyden, with her brother and was raised in a nursery palace to complete her studies.

title: Elisabeth of the Palatinate
text: After finishing her studies, she was deemed ready to live in The Hague with her mother.

title: A Singular Life
text: A Singular Life is a novel published in 1895 by Elizabeth Stuart Phelps Ward.

title: A Singular Life
text: It was first published in serial form in "The Atlantic Monthly" from January through October 1895, and published in novel form in late 1895.

title: A Singular Life
text: It was the fourth highest best-selling book in the United States in 1896.

title: Philip Howard (cardinal)
text: Hon. Philip Howard (21 September 1629 – 17 June 1694) was an English Roman Catholic cardinal.

title: Philip Howard (cardinal)
text: Born the third son of Henry Frederick Howard (afterwards Earl of Arundel and Surrey and head of the House of Norfolk) and his wife, Elizabeth Stuart (daughter of Esme Stuart, the Duke of Lennox), Howard was a member of the premier Catholic family in England.

title: Philip Howard (cardinal)
text: At the age of sixteen he joined the Dominican Order in Cremona, and was ordained in 1652.

title: Philip Howard (cardinal)
text: He founded the priory of Bornem in Flanders, with a college for English youths attached to it, and was himself the first prior and novice master.

title: Philip Howard (cardinal)
text: He also founded at Vilvoorde a convent of nuns of the Second Order of Saint Dominic, now at Carisbrooke on the Isle of Wight.

title: Hacker-Pschorr Brewery
text: Hacker-Pschorr is a brewery in Munich, formed in 1972 out of the merger of two breweries, Hacker and Pschorr.

title: Hacker-Pschorr Brewery
text: Hacker was founded in 1417, 99 years before the enactment of the Reinheitsgebot Purity Law of 1516.

title: Reinheitsgebot
text: The Reinheitsgebot (] , literally "purity order"), sometimes called the "German Beer Purity Law" in English, is the collective name for a series of regulations limiting the ingredients in beer in Germany and the states of the former Holy Roman Empire.

title: Reinheitsgebot
text: The best-known version of the law was adopted in Bavaria in 1516, but similar regulations predate the Bavarian order, and modern regulations also significantly differ from the 1516 Bavarian version.

title: KAGG (law)
text: Gesetz über Kapitalanlagegesellschaften (KAGG) — (German for Investment Company Act) — was a set of German regulations for Mutual Funds that was phased out in 2007 and replaced by the German Investment Modernization Act ("Investement Act").

title: KAGG (law)
text: An objective of the new Investment Act is to promote Germany as an investment fund market, stemming the erstwhile exodus of German-managed funds that became domiciled in other European havens, namely Luxembourg.

title: KAGG (law)
text: BaFin is the regulatory enforcement agency that oversees the German financial industry.

title: Building regulations approval
text: To comply with the Building Act 1984 and the subsequent statutory instruments known as the Building Regulations, Building regulations approval is required to construct certain structures in England and Wales.

title: Building regulations approval
text: Construction projects falling into this category are sometimes referred to as "notifiable", however this is different from the "notification" (which may also be required under the Construction (Design and Management) Regulations 2015, which seeks to monitor health and safety in construction projects.

title: Self-executing order
text: A self-executing order is a type of court order.

title: Self-executing order
text: Court orders are usually made with only immediate effect, and without any future effect.

title: Self-executing order
text: With a self-executing order, an order is made by a court that a party to a legal matter must comply with a request by a future date or be subject to legal sanctions.

title: Self-executing order
text: If the party does not comply with the request, the sanctions will apply with no further court order required.

title: Comply or explain
text: Comply or explain is a regulatory approach used in the United Kingdom, Germany, the Netherlands and other countries in the field of corporate governance and financial supervision.

title: Comply or explain
text: Rather than setting out binding laws, government regulators (in the UK, the Financial Reporting Council, in Germany, under the Aktiengesetz) set out a code, which listed companies may either comply with, or if they do not comply, explain publicly why they do not.

title: Comply or explain
text: The UK Corporate Governance Code, the German Corporate Governance Code (or Deutscher Corporate Governance Kodex) and the Dutch Corporate Governance Code 'Code Tabaksblat' () use this approach in setting minimum standards for companies in their audit committees, remuneration committees and recommendations for how good companies should divide authority on their boards.

title: Mercedes-Benz short bonnet trucks
text: The Mercedes-Benz "Kurzhauber" (short-bonnet) truck is a conventional layout, cab-after-engine truck manufactured from 1959 to 1995.

title: Mercedes-Benz short bonnet trucks
text: In Germany it is most commonly referred to as the "Kurzhauber" (for "short bonnet").

title: Mercedes-Benz short bonnet trucks
text: The engine intruded into the cabin underneath the windshield, all in the name of making a shorter truck to meet the strict period German regulations on overall length.

title: Title 47 CFR Part 15
text: Code of Federal Regulations, Title 47, Part 15 (47 CFR 15) is an oft-quoted part of Federal Communications Commission (FCC) rules and regulations regarding unlicensed transmissions.

title: Title 47 CFR Part 15
text: It is a part of Title 47 of the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR), and regulates everything from spurious emissions to unlicensed low-power broadcasting.

title: Title 47 CFR Part 15
text: Nearly every electronics device sold inside the United States radiates unintentional emissions, and must be reviewed to comply with Part 15 before it can be advertised or sold in the US market.

title: Corporate social responsibility
text: Corporate social responsibility (CSR, also called corporate conscience, corporate citizenship or responsible business) is a form of corporate self-regulation integrated into a business model.

title: Corporate social responsibility
text: CSR policy functions as a self-regulatory mechanism whereby a business monitors and ensures its active compliance with the spirit of the law, ethical standards and national or international norms. With some models, a firm's implementation of CSR goes beyond compliance and statutory requirements, which engages in "actions that appear to further some social good, beyond the interests of the firm and that which is required by law".

title: Corporate social responsibility
text: The binary choice between 'complying' with the law and 'going beyond' the law must be qualified with some nuance.

title: Corporate social responsibility
text: In many areas such as environmental or labor regulations, employers can choose to comply with the law, to go beyond the law, but they can also choose to not comply with the law, such as when they deliberately ignore gender equality or the mandate to hire disabled workers.

title: Corporate social responsibility
text: There must be a recognition that many so-called 'hard' laws are also 'weak' laws, weak in the sense that they are poorly enforced, with no or little control or no or few sanctions in case of non-compliance.

title: Corporate social responsibility
text: 'Weak' law must not be confused with soft law.

title: Corporate social responsibility
