text: The aim is to increase long-term profits and shareholder trust through positive public relations and high ethical standards to reduce business and legal risk by taking responsibility for corporate actions.

title: Corporate social responsibility
text: CSR strategies encourage the company to make a positive impact on the environment and stakeholders including consumers, employees, investors, communities, and others.

title: Greisen–Zatsepin–Kuzmin limit
text: The Greisen–Zatsepin–Kuzmin limit (GZK limit) is a theoretical upper limit on the energy of cosmic rays (high energy charged particles from space) coming from "distant" sources.

title: Greisen–Zatsepin–Kuzmin limit
text: The limit is , or about 8 joules.

title: Greisen–Zatsepin–Kuzmin limit
text: The limit is set by slowing-interactions of cosmic ray protons with the microwave background radiation over long distances (~160 million light-years).

title: Greisen–Zatsepin–Kuzmin limit
text: The limit is at the same order of magnitude as the upper limit for energy at which cosmic rays have experimentally been detected.

title: Greisen–Zatsepin–Kuzmin limit
text: For example, one extreme-energy cosmic ray has been detected which appeared to possess a record (50 joules) of energy (about the same as the kinetic energy of a 60 mph baseball).

title: Australian twenty five-cent coin
text: The twenty five-cent coin of the Australian decimal currency system was issued as a part of a 14 coin collectors set on from the 10 April 2016 to the 23 April 2016.

title: Australian twenty five-cent coin
text: The coins were sold for $3 in conjunction with a local news corp paper.

title: Charles Cardoza Poindexter
text: Charles Cardoza Poindexter (March 10, 1880 – June 3, 1913) was a professor at Fisk University.

title: Charles Cardoza Poindexter
text: Poindexter was also known for being the precursor, but not a Founder, of the oldest intercollegiate fraternity for blacks in America, Alpha Phi Alpha, who later on became a prominent member and influence in Omega Psi Phi, using his earlier experience to develop much of the framework.

title: Charles Cardoza Poindexter
text: He is credited with suggesting the "Phi" in the name Omega Psi Phi, as well as the color "Old Gold".

title: 2016–17 British and Irish Cup
text: The 2016–17 British and Irish Cup was the eighth season of the annual rugby union competition for second tier, semi-professional clubs from Britain and Ireland.

title: 2016–17 British and Irish Cup
text: London Welsh are the defending champions having won the 2015–16 final against Yorkshire Carnegie 10–33 at Headingley Carnegie Stadium, Leeds on 10 April 2016.

title: 2016–17 British and Irish Cup
text: There have been six different winners and six different losing finalists in the seven seasons of its existence.

title: 2016–17 British and Irish Cup
text: The format of the competition is similar to last season with Scottish clubs not competing.

title: 2016–17 British and Irish Cup
text: For the second consecutive season the four Welsh teams are the reserve sides of the teams competing in the Pro12 competition instead of clubs from the Welsh Premier Division.

title: The Ride Tour
text: The Ride Tour is the ongoing second concert tour by English indie rock band Catfish and the Bottlemen, in support of the group's second studio album "The Ride".

title: The Ride Tour
text: The tour was announced in February 2016 and began on 4 April 2016, in Glasgow, United Kingdom at the O2 Academy Glasgow.

title: The Ride Tour
text: The tour is planned to travel across Europe and North America with a total of 50 shows planned so far.

title: The Ride Tour
text: On 22 February 2016, the band announced an April 2016 stint of shows in UK, including Glasgow, Halifax, Southend On Sea, Doncaster, London and Brighton.

title: The Ride Tour
text: The band will also headline several festivals across the UK throughout the summer, including Liverpool's 'Sound City' in May 2016, Bristol's Summer Series in July 2016 and Manchester's Castlebowl in July 2016.

title: The Ride Tour
text: On 14 March 2016 it was announced that the band will play several dates in North America in June 2016.

title: The Ride Tour
text: The band are also scheduled to play several European festivals this year, including Scotland's T in the Park, Spain's Benicàssim festival, Cumbria's Kendal Calling in July 2016, Cornwall's Boardmasters Festival in August 2016 and Germany's Lollapalooza in September 2016.

title: The Ride Tour
text: The band will also support Welsh rock band Stereophonics on their Wrexham, Racecourse Ground stadium gig in July 2016, as part of their Keep the Village Alive tour.

title: 2015–16 A-League
text: The 2015–16 A-League was the 39th season of top-flight soccer in Australia, and the 11th since the establishment of the A-League in 2004.

title: 2015–16 A-League
text: Melbourne Victory were both the defending A-League Premiers and Champions.

title: 2015–16 A-League
text: The regular season schedule was released on 29 June 2015.

title: 2015–16 A-League
text: The season commenced on 8 October 2015 and concluded on 10 April 2016.

title: 2015–16 A-League
text: The finals series commenced on 15 April 2016 and concluded with the 2016 Grand Final, held on 1 May 2016.

title: Howard Marks
text: Dennis Howard Marks (13 August 1945 – 10 April 2016) was a Welsh drug smuggler and author who achieved notoriety as an international cannabis smuggler through high-profile court cases.

title: Howard Marks
text: At his peak he claimed to have been smuggling consignments of the drug as large as 30 tons, and was connected with groups as diverse as the CIA, the IRA, MI6, and the Mafia.

title: Howard Marks
text: He was eventually convicted by the American Drug Enforcement Administration and handed a 25-year sentence to be served at Terre Haute; he was released in April 1995 after serving seven years.

title: Howard Marks
text: Though he had up to 43 different aliases, he became known as "Mr Nice" after he bought a passport from convicted murderer Donald Nice.

title: Howard Marks
text: After his release from prison, he published a best-selling autobiography, "Mr Nice", and campaigned publicly for changes in drugs legislation.

title: Marching On Together
text: "Leeds!

title: Marching On Together
text: Leeds!

title: Marching On Together
text: Leeds!"

title: Marching On Together
text: (commonly known as "Marching On Together") is the name of the anthem of Leeds United A.F.C. Unlike many football songs that are just new words set to existing music, "Leeds!

title: Marching On Together
text: Leeds!

title: Marching On Together
text: Leeds!"

title: Marching On Together
text: is an original composition by Les Reed and Barry Mason.

title: Marching On Together
text: The song first appeared in 1972 as the B-side of the record released by Leeds United to coincide with the team reaching the 1972 FA Cup Final, the A-side being titled "Leeds United".

title: Marching On Together
text: The vocals on the original recording were sung by the then-members of the Leeds United team and their supporters.

title: Marching On Together
text: The record stayed in the UK Singles Chart for almost 3 months, peaking at number 10.

title: Matthew Mason (Welsh cricketer)
text: Matthew Barry Mason (born 24 November 1984 in Swansea) is a Welsh cricketer.

title: Matthew Mason (Welsh cricketer)
text: Although he has made a number of appearances at second XI level for Glamorgan, as of the end of the 2006 season his only senior appearances had been three games in the C&G Trophy for Wales Minor Counties, in which he took a total of four wickets.

title: Here It Comes Again (The Fortunes song)
text: "Here It Comes Again" is a song written by Barry Mason and Les Reed in 1965.

title: Here It Comes Again (The Fortunes song)
text: It was recorded by The Fortunes and released on 10 September 1965.

title: Here It Comes Again (The Fortunes song)
text: It reached number four on the UK Singles Chart and number twenty-seven on the U.S. "Billboard" Hot 100 chart that same year.

title: Don Barry Mason
text: Don 'Barry' Mason (1950–2006) was the founder of the Psychedelic Shamanistic Institute (PSI), a networking organisation that encouraged ethnobotany and scientific research into cannabis and other psychoactive plants while contributing substantially to the public debate about drug policy reform.

title: Don Barry Mason
text: Associates of PSI include: Mathew Atha, Colin Angus, Brian Barritt, Michael Carmichael, Fraser Clark, Paul Devereux, the late John Entwistle, Paul Flynn MP, Ben Ganly, Lee Harris, Mike Jay, Howard Marks, Dr John Marks, Jonathan Ott, Dr Russell Newcombe, Richard Rudgley and Youth.

title: Producers Guild Film Award for Best Male Debut
text: The Producers Guild Film Award for Best Male Debut (previously known as the Apsara Award for Best Male Debut) is given by the producers of the film and television guild as part of its annual award ceremony for Hindi films, to recognise a male actor who has delivered an outstanding performance in his debut film.

title: Producers Guild Film Award for Best Male Debut
text: While the official awards ceremony started in 2004, awards for the best male debut commenced four years later.

title: Sverrir Gudnason
text: Sverrir Gudnason (in Icelandic "Sverrir Páll Guðnason"), born 12 September 1978 in Lund, Sweden, is a Swedish actor of Icelandic origin.

title: Sverrir Gudnason
text: He starred in the 2007 television series How Soon Is Now.

title: Sverrir Gudnason
text: Gudnason was born in Sweden, but brought up in Reykjavík, Iceland.

title: Sverrir Gudnason
text: He moved with his family to Tyresö, Sweden in 1990 when his father found work as a professor at the Royal Institute of Technology.

title: Sverrir Gudnason
text: At the 2009 Shanghai International Film Festival he received the award for best male actor for his role in the Swedish/Danish film "Original".

title: Sverrir Gudnason
text: He has since played the role of Pontus Höijer in the second series of "Wallander" as well as leading roles in productions at both Gothenburg's and Stockholm's city theatres.

title: Indian Telly Award for Best Actor in a Lead Role
text: Indian Telly Award for Best Actor in a Lead Role – Male is an award given by IndianTelevision.com as part of its annual Indian Telly Awards for TV serials, to recognize a male actor who has delivered an outstanding performance in a leading role.

title: Robert Sheehan
text: Robert Michael Sheehan (Irish: "Roibeárd Mícheál Ó Siodhacháin" ; born 7 January 1988) is an Irish actor.

title: Robert Sheehan
text: He is best known for television roles such as Nathan Young in "Misfits" and Darren in "Love/Hate", as well as the 2009 film "Cherrybomb" alongside Rupert Grint.

title: Robert Sheehan
text: He also co-starred in the film "Killing Bono" as Ivan McCormick.

title: Robert Sheehan
text: In late 2011 he starred in John Crowley's production of J. M. Synge's comic play "The Playboy of the Western World" at the Old Vic Theatre in London.

title: The Messenger (2015 horror film)
text: The Messenger is a 2015 British supernatural mystery horror film directed by David Blair, written by Andrew Kirk and starring Robert Sheehan and Lily Cole.

title: Mohammad-Reza Foroutan
text: Mohammad-Reza Foroutan (Persian: محمد رضا فروتن‎ ‎ , born December 28, 1968 in Tehran, Iran) is an Iranian actor.

title: Mohammad-Reza Foroutan
text: He graduated with a master's degree in clinical psychology from Azad University and now is a Ph.D candidate of Health Psychology.

title: Mohammad-Reza Foroutan
text: He has passed some free courses in acting.

title: Mohammad-Reza Foroutan
text: His first film was "Goal".

title: Mohammad-Reza Foroutan
text: After some minor roles his performance in an episode of TV series "The Clue" revealed his capabilities and Masoud Kimiay chose him for the leading role of Mercedes.

title: Mohammad-Reza Foroutan
text: He has been acting as actor for more than two decades and received several awards including best male actor award for acting in Germez 1999 Fajr International Film Festival and best male actor award for acting in Be Ahestegi Fajr International Film Festival 2005.

title: IIFA Award for Star Debut of the Year – Male
text: The IIFA Award for Star Debut of the Year – Male is given by the International Indian Film Academy as part of its annual award ceremony to recognise a male actor who has delivered an outstanding performance in his debut film.

title: IIFA Award for Star Debut of the Year – Male
text: Originally known as the "IIFA Award for Fresh Face of the Year (Male)", it was officially given its new title in 2006.

title: IIFA Award for Star Debut of the Year – Male
text: During its inaugural year in 2001, four separate actors were presented with an award.

title: Filmfare Award for Best Male Debut
text: The Filmfare Award for Best Male Debut is given by Filmfare as part of its annual Filmfare Awards for Hindi films to recognise a performance by a male actor in a debut role.

title: Filmfare Award for Best Male Debut
text: However, in the year 1990, it was a director (Sooraj R. Barjatya) who won the award instead of an actor.

title: ARY Film Award for Best Star Debut Male
text: ARY Film Award for Best Star Debut Male is one of the ARY Film Awards of Merit presented annually by the ARY Digital Network and Entertainment Channel to recognize the male actor who has delivered an outstanding debut performance while working in the film industry.

title: ARY Film Award for Best Star Debut Male
text: Since its inception, however, the award has commonly been referred to as the AFA for Best Star Debut Male.

title: ARY Film Award for Best Star Debut Male
text: While actors are nominated for this award by AFA members who are actors and actresses themselves, winners are selected by the AFA membership as a whole.

title: Kurt Kreuger
text: Kurt Kreuger (July 23, 1916 – July 12, 2006) was a Swiss-reared German actor.

title: Kurt Kreuger
text: Kreuger once was the third most requested male actor at 20th Century Fox.

title: Kurt Kreuger
text: He starred with, among others, Ingrid Bergman and Humphrey Bogart.

title: Parallel key
text: In music, a major scale and a minor scale that have the same tonic are called parallel keys and are said to be in a parallel relationship.

title: Parallel key
text: The parallel minor or tonic minor of a particular major key is the minor key based on the same tonic; similarly the parallel major has the same tonic as the minor key (from the Greek, "para alleilos", "beside each other").

title: Parallel key
text: For example, G major and G minor have different modes but both have the same tonic, G; so we say that G minor is the parallel minor of G major.

title: Parallel key
text: In contrast, a major scale and a minor scale that have the same key signature (and therefore different tonics) are called relative keys.

title: Paloma (cocktail)
text: The paloma (Spanish for "dove") is a tequila-based cocktail.

title: Paloma (cocktail)
text: This drink is most commonly prepared by mixing tequila with a grapefruit-flavored soda such as Fresca, Squirt, or Jarritos and served on the rocks with a lime wedge.

title: Paloma (cocktail)
text: This drink also has the option of adding salt to the rim of the glass.

title: Sazerac Company
text: The Sazerac Company is a large privately held alcoholic beverages company with headquarters in Metairie, Louisiana (in the New Orleans metropolitan area).

title: Sazerac Company
text: Its distilleries include the Barton Brands distillery (in Bardstown, Kentucky), the Buffalo Trace Distillery (in Frankfort, Kentucky), the former Glenmore Distillery (now a bottling plant in Owensboro, Kentucky), and the A. Smith Bowman Distillery (a microdistillery in Fredericksburg, Virginia).

title: Sazerac Company
text: The products of the company and its subsidiaries include various types of whiskey, vodka, gin, tequila, rum, brandy, cognac, cocktails, cordials, liqueurs, "shooters", and wine.

title: Seafood cocktail
text: Seafood cocktails are appetizer dishes including shrimp cocktail, squid cocktail, and mixed seafood cocktails.

title: Seafood cocktail
text: Various preparations use ingredients such as fish and octopus.

title: Seafood cocktail
text: Seafood cocktails often include lime juice, a tomato based sauce and are sometimes served with lemon.

title: Seafood cocktail
text: Seafood cocktails are eaten in the U.S. and Latin America.

title: Salty dog (cocktail)
text: A salty dog is a cocktail of tequila, or gin, and grapefruit juice, served in a highball glass with a salted rim.

title: Salty dog (cocktail)
text: The salt is the only difference between a salty dog and a greyhound.

title: Salty dog (cocktail)
text: Vodka may be used as a substitute for tequila; nevertheless, it is historically a tequila drink.

title: Sweet Melissa
text: A Sweet Melissa is a gin-based cocktail that was named by its creator, Daniel Bouie, after his wife Melissa Chabran Bouie.

title: Sweet Melissa
text: Sweet Melissa is made with gin, tonic water and a splash of Jack Daniel's in a short glass of ice.

title: Sweet Melissa
text: Care must be taken not to add too much whiskey to this gin & tonic beverage.

title: Tequila and tonic
text: Tequila and tonic, also known as TnT or Teqtonic, is a non-standard highball beverage.

title: Tequila and tonic
text: The drink is made with a 2:1 ratio of tonic water to tequila and is served with lemon or lime wedges on ice.

title: Tonic water
text: Tonic water (or Indian tonic water) is a carbonated soft drink in which quinine is dissolved.

title: Tonic water
text: Originally used as a prophylactic against malaria, tonic water usually now has a significantly lower quinine content and is consumed for its distinctive bitter flavour.

title: Tonic water
text: It is often used in mixed drinks, particularly in gin and tonic.

title: Gin and tonic
text: A gin and tonic is a highball cocktail made with gin and tonic water poured over ice.

title: Gin and tonic
text: It is usually garnished with a slice or wedge of lime.

title: Gin and tonic
text: The amount of gin varies according to taste.

title: Gin and tonic
text: Suggested ratios of gin to tonic are between 1:1 and 1:3.

title: Mário-Henrique Leiria
text: Mário-Henrique Leiria (1923–1980) was a Portuguese surrealist poet.

title: Mário-Henrique Leiria
text: Born in Lisbon, he studied at the Escola de Belas Artes.

title: Mário-Henrique Leiria
text: He and his fellow surrealists were involved in an absurdist plot to overthrow the dictatorship of Antonio Salazar.

title: Mário-Henrique Leiria
text: He is best known for his books "Contos do Gin-Tonic" (Gin and Tonic Tales, 1973) and "Novos Contos do Gin" (More Gin Tales, 1974).

title: Mário-Henrique Leiria
text: He died in 1980.

title: Babette Hughes
text: Babette Hughes (1906–1982) was an American playwright of one-act plays and mystery novelist.

title: Babette Hughes
text: She was born in Seattle, Washington and while an English student at the University of Washington she met the American playwright Glenn Hughes who she married in 1924 for around 20 years.

title: Babette Hughes
text: Hughes wrote comedic one-act plays, mysteries, and non-fiction works.

title: Dark Side (R5 song)
text: "Dark Side" is a song by American pop rock band R5.

title: Dark Side (R5 song)
text: It was released on February 1, 2016 as the fifth single from "Sometime Last Night".

title: Dark Side (R5 song)
text: It was written by Ross Lynch, Riker Lynch, Rocky Lynch and Ellington Ratliff, and produced by Rocky and Matt Wallace.

title: Ross Lynch
text: Ross Shor Lynch (born December 29, 1995) is an American singer, songwriter, and actor.

title: Ross Lynch
text: He is one of the founding members of the pop rock band R5.

title: Ross Lynch
text: As an actor, he is known for his debut role as Austin Moon on the Disney Channel original series "Austin & Ally", and for his role as Brady in the "Teen Beach Movie" series.

title: Ross Lynch
text: Lynch is also starring in a new horror/thriller movie called "My Friend Dahmer," where he plays the role of Jeffrey Dahmer in his teenage years.

title: Ross Lynch
text: The movie is set to debut in the fall of 2017.

title: Live in Tokyo (HTP album)
text: Live In Tokyo is a live album by Hughes Turner Project, a collaboration between Glenn Hughes (Deep Purple/ Black Sabbath/ Trapeze) and Joe Lynn Turner (Deep Purple/ Rainbow/ Yngwie Malmsteen); it was released in 2002 on MTM Music and Pony Canyon Records.

title: Glenn Hughes
text: Glenn Hughes (born 21 August 1951) is an English rock bassist and vocalist, best known for playing bass and performing vocals for funk rock pioneers Trapeze, the Mk.

title: Glenn Hughes
text: III and IV line-ups of Deep Purple, as well as briefly fronting Black Sabbath in the mid-1980s.

title: Trapeze (band)
text: Trapeze were an English rock band from Cannock, Staffordshire.

title: Trapeze (band)
text: Formed in 1969, the band originally featured former The Montanas members John Jones (trumpet, vocals) and Terry Rowley (keyboards), and former Finders Keepers members Glenn Hughes (bass, vocals, piano), Mel Galley (guitar, vocals) and Dave Holland (drums).

title: Trapeze (band)
text: Jones and Rowley left the band following the release of their self-titled debut album in 1970, with the lineup of Hughes, Galley and Holland continuing as a trio.

title: Trapeze (band)
text: After the release of "Medusa" later in 1970 and "You Are the Music... We're Just the Band" in 1972, Hughes left Trapeze in 1973 to join Deep Purple.

title: Black Country Communion
text: Black Country Communion is an English-American hard rock band based in Los Angeles, California.

title: Black Country Communion
text: Formed in 2009, the band is a supergroup composed of bassist and vocalist Glenn Hughes, guitarist and vocalist Joe Bonamassa, drummer and backing vocalist Jason Bonham, and keyboardist Derek Sherinian.

title: Black Country Communion
text: Originally formed by Hughes and Bonamassa with the help of producer Kevin Shirley, the group released its self-titled debut album in September 2010.

title: Black Country Communion
text: Second album "Black Country Communion 2" followed in June 2011, which was promoted on a European tour later in the year.

title: Black Country Communion
text: The band released its third album "Afterglow" in October 2012.

title: California Breed
text: California Breed was an English-American hard rock band based in Los Angeles, California.

title: California Breed
text: Formed in 2013, the band was a supergroup composed of bassist and vocalist Glenn Hughes, guitarist Andrew Watt, and drummer Jason Bonham.

title: California Breed
text: Following the breakup of his previous band Black Country Communion, Hughes was introduced to Watt in 2013 and the two quickly formed California Breed, with Black Country Communion drummer Bonham completing the lineup shortly after.

title: California Breed
text: The band recorded its self-titled debut album with producer Dave Cobb in late 2013, which was released through Frontiers Records in May 2014 and reached number 78 on the US "Billboard" 200.

title: List of Trapeze band members
text: Trapeze were an English rock band from Cannock, Staffordshire.

title: List of Trapeze band members
text: Formed in March 1969, the band originally featured former The Montanas members John Jones (vocals, trumpet) and Terry Rowley (keyboards, guitar, flute), as well as former Finders Keepers members Mel Galley (guitar, vocals), Glenn Hughes (bass, piano, vocals) and Dave Holland (drums).

title: List of Trapeze band members
text: After the band released their self-titled debut album in May 1970, Jones and Rowley left to return to The Montanas.

title: List of Trapeze band members
text: Hughes, Galley and Holland released "Medusa" later in the year and "You Are the Music... We're Just the Band" in 1972, before Hughes left to join Deep Purple in June 1973.

title: List of Trapeze band members
text: Prior to his departure, Hughes was due to switch to the role of second guitarist, with Pete MacKie set to take his place on bass; however, this never came to fruition.

title: Different Stages – The Best of Glenn Hughes
text: Different Stages – The Best of Glenn Hughes is a compilation album by former Deep Purple, Black Sabbath and Trapeze vocalist/ bassist Glenn Hughes.

title: Different Stages – The Best of Glenn Hughes
text: The album was released in 2002 on SPV records.

title: Mark Simpson (clarinetist)
text: Mark Simpson (born 26 September 1988) is a British composer and clarinettist from Liverpool, who won the BBC Young Musician of the Year 2006 title on 20 May 2006, playing Nielsen's Clarinet Concerto with the Northern Sinfonia and Yan Pascal Tortelier at The Sage Gateshead.

title: Mark Simpson (clarinetist)
text: In the same year, Simpson was also the winner of the BBC Young Composer of the Year competition, becoming the only person in history to have ever won both competitions.

title: Mark Simpson (clarinetist)
text: He resides in Merseyside and attended King David High School, Liverpool before attending the Royal Northern College of Music junior department where he studied clarinet with Nicholas Cox.

title: Mark Simpson (clarinetist)
text: He was also Principal Clarinet in the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain, playing a Peter Eaton clarinet.

title: Mark Simpson (clarinetist)
text: After a term at the Royal College of Music, Simpson spent the rest of his gap year in Berlin, and attended St. Catherine's College, Oxford University reading for a BA in Music from 2008-2011.

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: Doctor Who: The Music is a 1983 compilation of music from the BBC Radiophonic Workshop featuring incidental music from the popular science-fiction television series "Doctor Who".

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: The album was the first full-length to feature solely music from the programme.

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: The collection was produced by Workshop member and long-time "Doctor Who" sound-effects creator Dick Mills.

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: It featured the original Delia Derbyshire arrangement of Ron Grainer's theme tune and music by Malcolm Clarke from the 1972 serial "The Sea Devils", which was only the second to have an incidental score provided completely by the Radiophonic Workshop.

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: Most of the music included came from serials from the previous three years to demonstrate the recent composers' works.

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: For the album, each serial's incidental music was reassembled into short "suites" and although most of the music had been recorded in mono it was, for this compilation, remixed into stereo with sound effects added on to some tracks.

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: The album was re-released in 1992 by Silva Screen records as "Earthshock - Classic Music From The BBC Radiophonic Workshop Volume 1", with bonus tracks including "The World of Doctor Who", a track recorded by Mills as a B-side to Dudley Simpson's 1973 ""Moonbase 3"" single, which featured a mix of music from the serial "The Mind of Evil" with sound effects from "Planet of the Daleks" before finishing with Simpson's "Master's Theme".

title: Doctor Who: The Music
text: Selections from both this compilation and its follow-up, "Doctor Who - The Music II", were also re-used on the 1994 Silva Screen compilation "The Best Of Doctor Who Volume 1 - The Five Doctors".

title: Alf Clausen
text: Alf Heiberg Clausen (born March 28, 1941) is an American film and television composer.

title: Alf Clausen
text: He is best known for his work scoring many episodes of "The Simpsons", of which he had been the sole composer between 1990 and 2017.

title: Alf Clausen
text: Clausen has scored or orchestrated music for more than 30 films and television shows, including "Moonlighting", "The Naked Gun", "ALF" and "Ferris Bueller's Day Off".

title: Hail to the Hills of Westwood
text: "Hail to the Hills of Westwood" is the school song or alma mater of the University of California, Los Angeles.

title: Hail to the Hills of Westwood
text: It was written by Jeane Emerso, a 1929 graduate of UCLA, and adopted by the school in 1960.

title: Hail to the Hills of Westwood
text: The current arrangement performed by the UCLA Marching Band was written by band member Dwayne S. Milburn for the 1985 football season.

title: Sarp Bridge
text: Sarp Bridge (Norwegian: "Sarpsbrua" or "Sarpebrua" ) is a series of bridges which span across Sarpefossen, a waterfall of the river Glomma in Sarpsborg, Norway.

title: Sarp Bridge
text: In the current arrangement, one bridge carries a pathway, one carries a single track of the Østfold Line and one carries two lanes of National Road 118.

title: Sarp Bridge
text: The road and pathway bridges are about 91 m long, while the railway bridge is 247 m .

title: Celebrity Mastermind
text: Celebrity Mastermind is a celebrity version of "Mastermind", a British television quiz show broadcast by BBC television.

title: Celebrity Mastermind
text: It began in 2002 as a one-off special, expanding to the current arrangement of 10 episodes, broadcast during December and January.

title: Celebrity Mastermind
text: It is hosted by John Humphrys, who also hosts the main show.

title: Donnie Simpson
text: Donnie Simpson (born January 30, 1954) is a longtime American radio DJ as well as a television and movie personality.

title: Donnie Simpson
text: He hosted "The Donnie Simpson Morning Show" on Washington, D.C. radio station WPGC-FM from March 1993 to January 29, 2010.

title: Donnie Simpson
text: Currently, he hosts "The Donnie Simpson Show" on D.C.-based radio station WMMJ-FM (Majic 102.3 FM), which began airing on August 17, 2015.

title: Donnie Simpson
text: Simpson is the first urban-format radio personality to have an annual salary over $1 million without being syndicated.

title: Donnie Simpson
text: In 2003, Simpson, through his agent and longtime friend, George Parker, inked a 6-year, 8-figure deal with WPGC-FM making Simpson the highest paid African-American radio personality ever without syndication.

title: Donnie Simpson
text: He was "Billboard's" "Radio Personality of the Year" and "Program Director of the Year".

title: Donnie Simpson
text: He has also been known by the nicknames, "Love Bug", "The Green-eyed Bandit" and "Dr. Green Eyes" for his luminous, light green eyes.

title: British Royal Train
text: In the United Kingdom, the Royal Train is used to convey senior members of the British Royal Family and associated staff of the Royal Household around the railway network of Great Britain.

title: British Royal Train
text: It is formed from a dedicated set of claret liveried sleeper, dining and lounge carriages.

title: British Royal Train
text: The current stock dates from 1977-1987.

title: British Royal Train
text: They are arranged according to requirements, and stored when not in use.

title: British Royal Train
text: The earliest royal coaches date back to the mid-19th Century in the reign of Queen Victoria; until an upgrade in 1977 there were multiple sets based in different regions, a legacy of the pre-nationalisation era of railways in Britain.

title: British Royal Train
text: Many are now in museums or on heritage railways; the National Railway Museum in York has a royal themed exhibition.

title: British Royal Train
text: Dedicated locomotives have never traditionally been part of the Royal Train, first appearing in special livery only in the 1990s, but also seeing use on other trains since 2003.

title: British Royal Train
text: In the 21st Century, various preserved (and one new build) steam locomotives have also hauled the train on special occasions.

title: British Royal Train
text: Although regularly cited by critics as one of the unnecessary luxuries of the Royal Family, which has led to an increase in the alternate use of normal scheduled services where possible, supporters argue the current arrangement emphasizes utility over luxury, and is still often the most practical and secure mode of travel to fit the required itinerary and avoid disruption to the public.

title: The Simpsons Theme
text: "The Simpsons" Theme", also referred to as "The Simpsons" Main Title Theme" in album releases, is the theme music of the animated television series "The Simpsons".

title: The Simpsons Theme
text: It plays during the opening sequence and was composed by Danny Elfman in 1989, after series creator Matt Groening approached him requesting a retro-style theme.

title: The Simpsons Theme
text: The piece, which took 3 days, 2 hours, 48 minutes, and 19 seconds to create, has been noted by Elfman as the most popular of his career.

title: The Simpsons Theme
text: The theme, as used for the opening sequence, was re-arranged during season 2, and the current arrangement by Alf Clausen was introduced at the beginning of the third season.

title: Las Lomitas Elementary School District
text: The Las Lomitas Elementary School District is a public school district in the San Francisco Bay Area, primarily serving parts of the communities of Menlo Park, Atherton and Ladera, with its headquarters in Menlo Park.

title: Las Lomitas Elementary School District
text: Under the current arrangement, all students in the district attend Las Lomitas Elementary School starting before Kindergarten through 3rd grade, and attend La Entrada Middle School for 4th through 8th grade.

title: Las Lomitas Elementary School District
text: Students from this school district who continue on with public schooling matriculate to the Sequoia Union High School District, most attending Menlo-Atherton High School, though some students opt to attend Woodside High School, which is closer to home for some students.

title: Las Lomitas Elementary School District
text: Several LLESD schools have won the prestigious Blue Ribbon Award.

title: Semmering railway
text: The Semmering railway (German: "Semmeringbahn" ) in Austria, which starts at Gloggnitz and leads over the Semmering to Mürzzuschlag was the first mountain railway in Europe built with a standard gauge track.

title: Semmering railway
text: It is commonly referred to as the world's first true mountain railway, given the very difficult terrain and the considerable altitude difference that was mastered during its construction.

title: Semmering railway
text: It is still fully functional as a part of the Southern Railway which is operated by the Austrian Federal Railways.

title: Most–Moldava railway
text: The Most–Moldava railway is a branch line in Czech Republic, which was originally built and operated by the Prague-Dux Railway.

title: Most–Moldava railway
text: The line, formerly known as the"Teplitz Semmering Railway" ("Teplitzer Semmeringbahn") runs from Most ("Brüx") over the Ore Mountains to Moldava ("Moldau") and used to have a junction with the Nossen-Moldau railway there in Saxony until 1945.

title: Most–Moldava railway
text: In the Czech Republic the line is known today as the "Moldavská horská dráha" ("Moldau Mountain Railway") or "Krušnohorská železnice" ("Ore Mountain Railway").

title: Southern Railway (Austria)
text: The Southern Railway (German: "Südbahn" ) is a railway in Austria that runs from Vienna to Graz and the border with Slovenia at Spielfeld via Semmering and Bruck an der Mur.

title: Southern Railway (Austria)
text: It was originally built by the Austrian Southern Railway company and ran to Ljubljana and Trieste, the main seaport of the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy.

title: Southern Railway (Austria)
text: The twin-track, electrified section that runs through the current territory of Austria is owned and operated by Austrian Federal Railways (ÖBB) and is one of the major lines in the country.

title: Rudyard Lake Steam Railway
text: The Rudyard Lake Steam Railway is a ridable miniature railway and the third railway of any gauge to run along the side of Rudyard Lake in Staffordshire.

title: Rudyard Lake Steam Railway
text: The railway runs for 1+1/2 mi on the track bed of an old standard gauge North Staffordshire Railway line.

title: Rudyard Lake Steam Railway
text: After the NSR line closed down, a small narrow gauge train ran on the site for two years before moving via Suffolk to Trago Mills in Devon.

title: Rudyard Lake Steam Railway
text: The current line started in 1985 and is gauge, and operates to a timetable.

title: Rudyard Lake Steam Railway
text: It was built by Peter Hanton of Congleton working on his own over a period of 10 years.

title: Rudyard Lake Steam Railway
text: He sold the railway to the Rudyard Lake Steam Railway Ltd in October 2000 who have developed it since that date.

title: Carolina and Northwestern Railway
text: The Carolina & Northwestern Railway (Ca&NW) was a railroad that served South Carolina and North Carolina from 1897 until January 1, 1974.

title: Carolina and Northwestern Railway
text: The original line was operated by the Ca&NW as a separate railroad controlled by the Southern Railway until 1974 when the name was changed to the Norfolk Southern Railway.

title: Carolina and Northwestern Railway
text: On June 1, 1982, Southern Railway and Norfolk and Western Railroad merged to form Norfolk Southern Railway.

title: Carolina and Northwestern Railway
text: Choosing to use the name 'Norfolk Southern Railway' for the merger, in 1981, the original Ca&NW line along with original Norfolk Southern Railway was renamed Carolina and Northwestern once again.

title: Carolina and Northwestern Railway
text: In the early 1950s several shortline subsidiaries of the Southern Railway were leased to the Ca&NW for operation, with these lines remaining a part of the Ca&NW into the 1980s.

title: D. William Brosnan
text: D. William Brosnan was a president of Southern Railway in the USA, a railroad that later merged with Norfolk and Western Railroad to form Norfolk Southern Railway.

title: D. William Brosnan
text: Born in 1903 in Albany, Georgia, he was the son of the town's fire chief.

title: D. William Brosnan
text: In 1923, he took a job as an engineer with the Georgia Department of Highways, before taking a job at as an apprentice student engineer for the Southern Railway, three years later, maintaining the right-of-way.

title: D. William Brosnan
text: Between 1931 and 1952, he had several promotions, from apprentice student engineer to junior engineer, to division superintendent, to general manager of the Central Lines of the Southern Railway, to vice president of operations.

title: D. William Brosnan
text: During his time as chief engineer for the Western Lines of the Southern Railway, in 1945 and 1946, he oversaw an increased mechanization of track maintenance and construction on the Southern Railway, and during his time as general manager for the Central Lines, he oversaw the automation of freight car classification in yards and terminals.

title: D. William Brosnan
text: He succeeded Harry A. deButts in 1962.

title: D. William Brosnan
text: In 1964 Brosnan was selected as the first recipient of the Man of the Year award by "Modern Railways" magazine, an award now presented by "Railway Age" magazine as the Railroader of the Year.

title: Hakone Tozan Railway
text: The Hakone Tozan Railway (箱根登山鉄道 , Hakone Tozan Tetsudō ) is a private railway company in Japan, part of the Odakyu Group.

title: Hakone Tozan Railway
text: It is best known for its operation of the Hakone Tozan Line, the first mountain railway in Japan, but like most Japanese railway companies, also operates bus service, namely Hakone Tozan Bus.

title: Hakone Tozan Railway
text: It also operates the connecting Hakone Tozan Cable Car.

title: Green Mountain Cog Railway
text: The Green Mountain Cog Railway was a mountain railway built to carry tourists to the top of Green Mountain (now known as Cadillac Mountain) on Mount Desert Island in Maine.

title: Green Mountain Cog Railway
text: Its track was built to gauge, which is technically a narrow gauge, as it is a ⁄ -inch less than .

title: East Siberian Railway
text: The East Siberian Railway ("Восточно-Сибирская железная дорога" ) is a railway in Russia (a branch of the Russian Railways and a part of the Trans-Siberian Railway), which runs across Irkutsk Oblast, Chita Oblast, Buryatia, and Yakutia.

title: East Siberian Railway
text: The railway administration is located in Irkutsk.

title: East Siberian Railway
text: The East Siberian Railway borders with the Krasnoyarsk Railway (railway station of Yurty), Trans-Baikal Railway (railway station of Petrovsky Zavod), and Baikal Amur Mainline (railway station of Lena-Vostochnaya).

title: East Siberian Railway
text: To the south, the East Siberian Railway runs close to the Russo-Mongolian border (railway station of Naushki).

title: East Siberian Railway
text: As of 2008, the total working length of the East Siberian Railway was 3848.1 km ; number of employees – 46,233 (61,418 in 2005); net weight hauled – 76 million tonnes (75.934 million in 2005); long-distance passenger traffic – 3.6 million people (4.838 million in 2005); suburban traffic – 29 million people (26.225 million in 2005).

title: East Siberian Railway
text: Annual cargo turnover is 278 million tonnes.

title: Reisseck Railway
text: The Reisseck Railway (sometimes Reißeck Railway, German: "Reißeckbahn" ) is a mountain railway, that runs from Carinthia's Möll valley into the Reißeck Group, a small mountain range in southern Austria.

title: Reisseck Railway
text: It comprises the Reisseck Funicular and the Reisseck Mountain Railway (a narrow gauge railway).

title: List of awards and nominations received by Lost
text: Lost is an American drama series that aired on ABC from September 22, 2004 until May 23, 2010.

title: List of awards and nominations received by Lost
text: It has been nominated for a variety of different awards, including 54 Primetime Emmy Awards (eleven wins), 48 Saturn Awards (thirteen wins), 33 Teen Choice Awards, 17 Television Critics Association Awards (four wins), 12 Golden Reel Awards (five wins), eight Satellite Awards (one win), seven Golden Globe Awards (one win), six Producers Guild of America Awards (one win), six Writers Guild of America Awards (one win), five Directors Guild of America Awards, two NAACP Image Awards (one win), two Screen Actors Guild Awards (one win), and one BAFTA Award.

title: List of awards and nominations received by Lost
text: Amongst the wins for the series are a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Drama Series, a Golden Globe Award for Best Television Series – Drama, a Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series, and a Peabody Award.

title: Frances Conroy
text: Frances Hardman Conroy (born November 13, 1953) is an American actress.

title: Frances Conroy
text: She is best known for playing Ruth Fisher on the television series "Six Feet Under".

title: Frances Conroy
text: Her work on the show won her acclaim and several awards, including a Golden Globe and three Screen Actors Guild Awards.

title: Frances Conroy
text: She is also known for playing the older version of the character Moira O'Hara on of the television anthology series "American Horror Story", which garnered Conroy her first Saturn Award for Best Supporting Actress on Television nomination, and as well an Emmy nomination for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Miniseries or a Movie.

title: Frances Conroy
text: Conroy subsequently portrayed The Angel of Death, Myrtle Snow, Gloria Mott, and Mama Polk on four further seasons of the show "", "", "", and "", respectively.

title: Frances Conroy
text: For her performance in "Coven", she was nominated again for a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Miniseries or a Movie.

title: Megan Mullally
text: Megan Mullally (born November 12, 1958) is an American actress and singer.

title: Megan Mullally
text: She is best known for her role as Karen Walker on the NBC sitcom "Will & Grace" (1998–2006, 2017-), for which she received 7 consecutive Primetime Emmy Award nominations for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series, winning twice in 2000 and 2006.

title: Megan Mullally
text: She also received nominations for numerous other accolades for her portrayal, including 7 consecutive Screen Actors Guild Awards nominations for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series, winning 3 times in 2001, 2002, and 2003, as well as receiving 4 Golden Globe Award nominations.

title: Lucy Liu
text: Lucy Alexis Liu (born Lucy Liu; December 2, 1968) is an American actress, voice actress, director, producer, singer and artist.

title: Lucy Liu
text: She became known for playing the role of the vicious and ill-mannered Ling Woo in the television series "Ally McBeal" (1998–2002), for which she was nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series and a Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series.

title: Lucy Liu
text: Liu's film work includes starring as one of the heroines (Alex Munday) in "Charlie's Angels" (2000), portraying O-Ren Ishii in "Kill Bill" (2003), and starring roles in the main casts of "Payback" (as Pearl; 1999), "Chicago" (as Kitty Baxter; 2002), and the animated film series "Kung Fu Panda" (2008–present) portraying the character Master Viper.

title: Geoffrey Rush
text: Geoffrey Roy Rush {'1': ", '2': ", '3': ", '4': "} (born 6 July 1951) is an Australian actor and film producer.

title: Geoffrey Rush
text: Rush is the youngest amongst the few people who have won the "Triple Crown of Acting": the Academy Award, the Primetime Emmy Award, and the Tony Award.

title: Geoffrey Rush
text: He has won one Academy Award for acting (from four nominations), three British Academy Film Awards (from five nominations), two Golden Globe Awards and four Screen Actors Guild Awards. Rush is the founding President of the Australian Academy of Cinema and Television Arts and was named the 2012 Australian of the Year.

title: Geoffrey Rush
text: He is also the first actor to win the Academy Award, BAFTA Award, Critics' Choice Movie Award, Golden Globe Award, and Screen Actors Guild Award for a single performance in film for his performance in "Shine" (1996).

title: Uzo Aduba
text: Uzoamaka Nwanneka "Uzo" Aduba ( ; born February 10, 1981) is an American actress.

title: Uzo Aduba
text: She is known for her role as Suzanne "Crazy Eyes" Warren on the Netflix original series "Orange Is the New Black" (2013–present), for which she won an Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series in 2014, an Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series in 2015, and two Screen Actors Guild Awards for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series in 2014 and 2015.

title: Uzo Aduba
text: She is one of only two actors to win an Emmy Award recognition in both the comedy and drama categories for the same role, the other being Ed Asner for the character Lou Grant.

title: Miranda Hobbes
text: Miranda Hobbes is a fictional character on the American HBO television sitcom "Sex and the City" and its subsequent film spinoffs.

title: Miranda Hobbes
text: She is portrayed by actress Cynthia Nixon.

title: Miranda Hobbes
text: Nixon received an Emmy Award and a Screen Actors Guild Award for her performance.

title: Skyler White
text: Skyler White (née Lambert) is a fictional character in "Breaking Bad", where she is portrayed by Anna Gunn.

title: Skyler White
text: For her portrayal, Gunn won two consecutive Primetime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series in 2013 and 2014.

title: Skyler White
text: She also won the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series in 2014.

title: Crazy Eyes (character)
text: Suzanne "Crazy Eyes" Warren is a fictional character played by Uzo Aduba on the Netflix series "Orange Is the New Black".

title: Crazy Eyes (character)
text: Warren is portrayed as intelligent, but lacking in social skills, and prone to spiral into emotional outbursts when agitated.

title: Crazy Eyes (character)
text: The character is the only role that has received Emmy Award recognition both in the comedy and drama genres from the same show and only the second character to earn Emmy recognition in both genres.

title: Crazy Eyes (character)
text: Aduba won the Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series as well as the Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Guest Performer in a Comedy Series for her season one performance.

title: Crazy Eyes (character)
text: She received the Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series as well as the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series for her season two performance.

title: Crazy Eyes (character)
text: Her season three performance again won Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series.

title: Crazy Eyes (character)
text: She is a recurring character in season one and a regular character beginning with season two.

title: Cynthia Nixon
text: Cynthia Ellen Nixon (born April 9, 1966) is an American actress.

title: Cynthia Nixon
text: She is known for her portrayal of Miranda Hobbes in the HBO series, "Sex and the City" (1998–2004), for which she won the 2004 Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series.

title: Cynthia Nixon
text: She reprised the role in the films "Sex and the City" (2008) and "Sex and the City 2" (2010).

title: Cynthia Nixon
text: Other film credits include "Amadeus" (1984), "The Pelican Brief" (1993), "Little Manhattan" (2005), "5 Flights Up" (2014), "James White" (2015), and playing Emily Dickinson in "A Quiet Passion" (2016).

title: The Green Hornet (2011 film)
text: The Green Hornet is a 2011 American superhero action comedy film based on the character of the same name by George W. Trendle and Fran Striker that had originated in a 1930s radio program and has appeared in movie serials, a television series, comic books, and other media.

title: The Green Hornet (2011 film)
text: Directed by Michel Gondry and written by Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg, the film stars Rogen, Jay Chou, Christoph Waltz, Edward James Olmos, David Harbour, Tom Wilkinson and Cameron Diaz.

title: The Green Hornet (2011 film)
text: The film was released to theaters in North America on January 14, 2011 by Columbia Pictures, in versions including RealD Cinema and IMAX 3D.

title: The Green Hornet (2011 film)
text: The film earned $227.8 million on a $120 million budget.

title: The Green Hornet (2011 film)
text: "The Green Hornet" was released on DVD, Blu-ray, and Blu-ray 3D on May 3, 2011 by Sony Pictures Home Entertainment.

title: Kato (The Green Hornet)
text: Kato (加藤) is a fictional character from "The Green Hornet" series.

title: Kato (The Green Hornet)
text: This character has also appeared with the Green Hornet in film, television, book and comic book versions.

title: Kato (The Green Hornet)
text: Kato was the Hornet's assistant and has been played by a number of actors.

title: Kato (The Green Hornet)
text: On radio, Kato was initially played by Raymond Hayashi, then Roland Parker who had the role for most of the run, and in the later years Mickey Tolan and Paul Carnegie.

title: Kato (The Green Hornet)
text: Keye Luke took the role in the movie serials, and in the television series he was portrayed by Bruce Lee.

title: Kato (The Green Hornet)
text: Jay Chou played Kato in the 2011 Green Hornet film.

title: The Green Hornet (radio series)
text: The Green Hornet is an American radio adventure series that debuted in 1936 and introduced the character of the Green Hornet, a masked vigilante.

title: The Green Hornet (Hong Kong film)
text: The Green Hornet is a 1994 Hong Kong action film directed by Lam Ching Ying and starring Chin Ka-lok.

title: The Green Hornet (Hong Kong film)
text: Based on the American Green Hornet series the film focuses on the character of Kato.

title: Cyndee San Luis
text: Cyndee San Luis is a Filipino American Actress.

title: Cyndee San Luis
text: She plays Paulita Maya in the HBO series "The Newsroom," who appears in the Fourth Episode of the First Season, "I'll Try to Fix You."

title: Cyndee San Luis
text: She was also in BET's "He's Mine Not Yours" as Natalie Su.

title: Cyndee San Luis
text: She has also appeared in Dave Coulier's "Can't Get Arrested" Web Series Episode 2: "Saved by the Bell - Ding!"

title: Cyndee San Luis
text: with Dave Coulier, Dennis Haskins and Kato Kaelin.

title: Cyndee San Luis
text: She has also played double roles as twin sisters (Faye S. and Twin Sister) in the short film, "The Case" (Directed by Timothy Tau).

title: Cyndee San Luis
text: Additionally, she appears as Lenore "Casey" Case, the secretary to Britt Reid/The Green Hornet in the Green Hornet segment of Timothy Tau's bio-pic, "Keye Luke".

title: Bruce Lee
text: Lee Jun-fan (; November 27, 1940 – July 20, 1973), known professionally as Bruce Lee, was a Hong Kong and American actor, film director, martial artist, martial arts instructor, philosopher and founder of the martial art Jeet Kune Do.

title: Bruce Lee
text: Lee was the son of Cantonese opera star Lee Hoi-chuen.

title: Bruce Lee
text: He is widely considered by commentators, critics, media, and other martial artists to be one of the most influential martial artists of all time, and a pop culture icon of the 20th century.

title: Bruce Lee
text: He is often credited with helping to change the way Asians were presented in American films.

title: The Green Hornet Strikes Again!
text: The Green Hornet Strikes Again!

title: The Green Hornet Strikes Again!
text: (1941) is a Universal movie serial based on The Green Hornet radio series by George W. Trendle and Fran Striker.

title: The Green Hornet Strikes Again!
text: It is a sequel to the 1940 serial "The Green Hornet".

title: The Green Hornet Strikes Again!
text: This was Universal's 117th serial (the 49th with sound) of the 137 the studio produced.

title: The Green Hornet Strikes Again!
text: The plot involves racketeering and is unusual for a film serial in having mostly stand alone episodes instead of a continuous story (although this was also the case for the original "Green Hornet" serial).

title: The Green Hornet (2006 film)
text: The Green Hornet (original title is "Le frelon vert") is a 2006 French short-movie, based on The Green Hornet character created by George W. Trendle and Fran Striker.

title: The Green Hornet (TV series)
text: The Green Hornet is a television series on the ABC US television network that aired for the 1966–1967 TV season starring Van Williams as the Green Hornet/Britt Reid and Bruce Lee as Kato.

title: Green Hornet
text: The Green Hornet is a fictional character, a masked crime-fighter, created by George W. Trendle and Fran Striker, with input from radio director James Jewell, in 1936.

title: Green Hornet
text: Since his radio debut in the 1930s, the Green Hornet has appeared in numerous serialized dramas in a wide variety of media.

title: Green Hornet
text: The character appeared in film serials in the 1940s, a television show in the 1960s, multiple comic book series from the 1940s on, and a feature film in January 2011.

title: Green Hornet
text: The franchise is currently owned by Green Hornet, Inc., who license the property across a wide variety of media that includes comics, films, TV shows, radio and books.

title: Green Hornet
text: The comic book rights are currently licensed out to and Dynamite Entertainment.

title: Liverpool F.C. league record by opponent
text: Liverpool Football Club is an English association football club based in Liverpool, Merseyside, which competes in the top tier of English football, for the 2015–16 season.

title: Liverpool F.C. league record by opponent
text: The club was formed in 1892 following a disagreement between the board of Everton and club president John Houlding, who owned the club's ground, Anfield.

title: Liverpool F.C. league record by opponent
text: The dispute over rent resulted in Everton leaving Anfield for Goodison Park, which left Houlding with an empty stadium.

title: Liverpool F.C. league record by opponent
text: Not content for his ground to lay idle, he created his own club: Liverpool.

title: Liverpool F.C. league record by opponent
text: Liverpool joined the Lancashire League on their foundation before the 1892–93 season.

title: Liverpool F.C. league record by opponent
text: They ended their inaugural season as league champions, and were elected to The Football League soon afterwards.

title: Liverpool F.C. league record by opponent
text: The club remained in The Football League until 1992, when its First Division was superseded as English football's top level by the newly formed Premier League.

title: 2009–10 Everton F.C. season
text: The 2009–10 season of Everton F.C. was Everton's 18th season in the Premier League and 56th consecutive season in the top division of English football.

title: 2009–10 Everton F.C. season
text: The club began their preseason friendly schedule on 10 July 2009 and concluded the summer friendlies on 7 August.

title: 2009–10 Everton F.C. season
text: Everton began their Premier League season at home in Goodison Park with a 6–1 defeat by Arsenal, the worst defeat by the North London side since a 7–0 loss in 2005.

title: 2009–10 Everton F.C. season
text: Everton's poor form continued throughout most of the first half of the season; they found themselves in 16th place, only two points clear of the relegation zone, at Christmas, though their league form improved significantly from that time.

title: 2009–10 Everton F.C. season
text: Everton entered the League Cup in the Third Round against Hull City, a match they won, but the club was eliminated in the next round by Tottenham Hotspur.

title: 2009–10 Everton F.C. season
text: They also entered the FA Cup in the Third Round Proper and were eliminated in the Fourth Round by Birmingham City.

title: 1966 FA Charity Shield
text: The 1966 FA Charity Shield was a Merseyside derby between Liverpool and Everton at Goodison Park.

title: 1966 FA Charity Shield
text: Liverpool won the Football League and Everton won the 1966 FA Cup Final to qualify for the charity shield.

title: 1966 FA Charity Shield
text: Before the game, Roger Hunt, Alan Ball and Ray Wilson paraded the World Cup, the FA Cup and the Football League Trophy around Goodison Park.

title: Anfield
text: Anfield is a football stadium in Anfield, Liverpool, England which has a seating capacity of 54,074 making it the sixth largest football stadium in England.

title: Anfield
text: It has been the home of Liverpool F.C. since their formation in 1892.

title: Anfield
text: It was originally the home of Everton F.C. from 1884 to 1891, before they moved to Goodison Park after a dispute with the club president.

title: 1895–96 Everton F.C. season
text: The 1895/96 Football League season was the eighth in Football League history with Everton having been an ever present in the top division.

title: 1895–96 Everton F.C. season
text: The club played thirty-three games in England's two major competitions, winning eighteen, drawing seven and losing eight.

title: 1895–96 Everton F.C. season
text: The club finished the season in third place, six points adrift of Champions Aston Villa, and were defeated in the quarter final of the F A Cup by eventual winners The Wednesday.

title: 1895–96 Everton F.C. season
text: Their Goodison Park home hosted the drawn semi final between Wednesday and Bolton Wanderers.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: The 2010–11 season of Everton F.C. was Everton's 19th season in the Premier League and 57th consecutive season in the top division of English football.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: It was also Everton's 112th season of league football and 114th season in all competitions.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: The club began their pre-season friendly schedule on 10 July 2010 with a 3-match tour of Australia.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: Also, for the first time in club history, Everton played against and defeated their namesake, Chilean club Everton de Viña del Mar, 2–0 in a friendly at Goodison Park.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: The club entered the Football League Cup in the Second Round against Huddersfield Town and were knocked out in the subsequent round in an upset defeat away to Brentford.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: Everton entered the FA Cup in the Third Round Proper and were eliminated in the Fifth Round by Reading.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: The club's Premier League campaign began on 14 August against Blackburn Rovers at Ewood Park and concluded on 22 May against Chelsea at Goodison Park.

title: 2010–11 Everton F.C. season
text: For the first time since 2006–07, Everton did not participate in any European competitions.

title: Goodison Park
text: Goodison Park is a football stadium located in Walton, Liverpool, England.

title: Goodison Park
text: The stadium has been home to Premier League club Everton since its completion in 1892 and is one of the world's oldest purpose-built football grounds.

title: Goodison Park
text: The stadium is built in a residential area served by regular rail and bus services two miles (3 km) from Liverpool city centre.

title: A Head Full of Dreams
text: A Head Full of Dreams is the seventh studio album by the British rock band Coldplay.

title: A Head Full of Dreams
text: It was released on 4 December 2015, by Parlophone in the United Kingdom, and by Atlantic Records in the United States.

title: A Head Full of Dreams
text: Coldplay recorded the album from late 2014 to mid 2015, right after the completion of their previous album "Ghost Stories", with a markedly different style and sound from its predecessors.

title: A Head Full of Dreams
text: For various songs, Coldplay collaborated with Beyoncé, Noel Gallagher, Tove Lo, Khatia Buniatishvili and Merry Clayton.

title: A Head Full of Dreams
text: The album was produced by Rik Simpson and Stargate.

title: A Head Full of Dreams
text: The album also features a sample of President Barack Obama singing "Amazing Grace" at Clementa C. Pinckney's funeral on the song "Kaleidoscope".

title: Estadio Ciudad de La Plata
text: The Estadio Ciudad de La Plata ("City of La Plata Stadium") is a multi-purpose stadium located in the city of La Plata, Argentina.

title: Estadio Ciudad de La Plata
text: It is also known popularly as the Estadio Único and is owned by the Province of Buenos Aires, administered jointly by the provincial government, the Municipality of La Plata, and the football clubs Estudiantes de La Plata and Gimnasia y Esgrima de la Plata.

title: A Head Full of Dreams Tour
text: The A Head Full of Dreams Tour is the seventh concert tour currently being undertaken by British alternative rock band Coldplay, launched in support of their namesake seventh studio album "A Head Full of Dreams".

title: A Head Full of Dreams Tour
text: Marking the band's return to large-scale venues, after the brief and intimate Ghost Stories Tour, the tour will visit stadiums and arenas across five continents.

title: A Head Full of Dreams Tour
text: The A Head Full of Dreams Tour boasts extensive laser light and pyrotechnic visuals similar to the Mylo Xyloto Tour, and also sees a reappearance of the Xylobands as a central part of the show's visual design.

title: A Head Full of Dreams Tour
text: The tour consists of eight legs, with a total of 123 shows across Latin America, where they performed for the first time since the Viva la Vida Tour, Europe, North America, where they embarked on their very first stadium tour of the United States, Oceania, and Asia.

title: A Head Full of Dreams Tour
text: The first show of the tour was held at the Estadio Ciudad de La Plata in La Plata, Argentina, on 31 March 2016 and is set to conclude at the same venue on 15 November 2017.

title: A Head Full of Dreams Tour
text: A live album covering the tour will be released in November 2017.

title: Hymn for the Weekend
text: "Hymn for the Weekend" is a song by British rock band Coldplay with uncredited guest vocals from American singer Beyoncé.

title: Hymn for the Weekend
text: It was released on 25 January 2016 as the second single from their seventh studio album, "A Head Full of Dreams" (2015).

title: Hymn for the Weekend
text: The song was written by the members of Coldplay and produced by Rik Simpson, Tim Bergling, Digital Divide, and Stargate.

title: Wildest Dreams Tour
text: Wildest Dreams Tour is the seventh concert tour by American singer Tina Turner.

title: Wildest Dreams Tour
text: The tour supported her eighth studio album "Wildest Dreams".

title: Wildest Dreams Tour
text: The tour is Turner's biggest outing to date, performing over 250 dates in Europe, North America and Australasia—surpassing her Break Every Rule Tour in 1987.

title: Wildest Dreams Tour
text: Lasting nearly 16 months, the tour is estimated to have grossed over $100 million.

title: Wildest Dreams Tour
text: The tour was sponsored by Hanes, as Turner became the spokesperson for their new hosiery line.

title: Wildest Dreams Tour
text: The tour was financially successful, especially in North America.

title: Wildest Dreams Tour
text: It is estimated that tour grossed over 20 million dollars with an attendance of over 650,000 spectators.

title: Kaleidoscope (EP)
text: Kaleidoscope is the thirteenth EP by British rock band Coldplay, released worldwide on 14 July 2017.

title: Kaleidoscope (EP)
text: It serves as a companion piece to Coldplay's seventh studio album, "A Head Full of Dreams" (2015).

title: Everglow
text: "Everglow" is a song by British rock band Coldplay.

title: Everglow
text: It is the fourth track, promotional single and fifth single proper from their seventh studio album, "A Head Full of Dreams".

title: Everglow
text: The song features uncredited guest vocals by Gwyneth Paltrow, the ex-wife of Chris Martin.

title: Everglow
text: The song was served as a promotional single of the album and released on 26 November 2015.

title: Everglow
text: The track was also premiered during Zane Lowe's Beats 1 radio show.

title: Everglow
text: On 11 November 2016 it was released digitally as the fifth single proper from the album, in a newly-recorded stripped-down version that was inspired by Martin's unrehearsed solo performance of the song at the recent Glastonbury Festival due to a technical mishap.

title: Everglow
text: The version ended with a sample of Muhammad Ali's 1977 speech in Newcastle upon Tyne.

title: Maiden England World Tour
text: The Maiden England World Tour was a concert tour by Iron Maiden, which began on 21 June 2012 in Charlotte, North Carolina and ended on 5 July 2014 with a performance at the Sonisphere Festival at Knebworth, UK.

title: Maiden England World Tour
text: The tour's setlist was largely based on the original 1989 concert video of the same name, shot during the Seventh Tour of a Seventh Tour in 1988, which was re-released in 2013.

title: Maiden England World Tour
text: Because of this, the tour's setlist consisted almost entirely of the band's 1980s material, with a particular focus on their 1988 album, "Seventh Son of a Seventh Son".

title: Maiden England World Tour
text: The stage show was also based on the original tour and featured numerous pyrotechnic effects in addition to multiple appearances by the band's mascot, Eddie.

title: Maiden England World Tour
text: Following 2005's Eddie Rips Up the World Tour and 2008–2009's Somewhere Back in Time World Tour, this was the group's third and final tour inspired by a particular period of their history.

title: In Your Wildest Dreams (song)
text: "In Your Wildest Dreams" is a duet released by Tina Turner and Barry White in 1996, from Turner's album "Wildest Dreams".

title: In Your Wildest Dreams (song)
text: The single's largest success was in Austria where it peaked at #2.

title: In Your Wildest Dreams (song)
text: The original European album version featured spoken vocals by actor Antonio Banderas, while for the single version and U.S. edition of the "Wildest Dreams" album, Turner re-recorded the track with White.

title: In Your Wildest Dreams (song)
text: "In Your Wildest Dreams", released in December 1996, was the seventh and final single release from the album and was issued in a wide range of formats and versions; the promo 12" singles featured remixes by, among others, Deep Dish and Pink Noise.

title: In Your Wildest Dreams (song)
text: Certain European CD singles also included two live recordings from the "Wildest Dreams Tour", "Missing You" and "GoldenEye".

title: Seventh Tour of a Seventh Tour
text: Seventh Tour of a Seventh Tour was a world tour conducted by British heavy metal band Iron Maiden in 1988, in support of their seventh studio album, "Seventh Son of a Seventh Son".

title: Seventh Tour of a Seventh Tour
text: It was their last tour to feature guitarist Adrian Smith until he rejoined the band in 1999 and their first to include Michael Kenney (bassist Steve Harris' technician) on keyboards.

title: Beowulf (2007 film)
text: Beowulf is a 2007 British-American 3D motion capture epic fantasy film directed by Robert Zemeckis and written by Neil Gaiman and Roger Avary, based on the Old English epic poem of the same name.

title: Beowulf (2007 film)
text: The film was created through a motion capture process similar to the technique Zemeckis used in "The Polar Express".

title: Beowulf (2007 film)
text: The cast includes Ray Winstone, Anthony Hopkins, Robin Wright Penn, Brendan Gleeson, John Malkovich, Crispin Glover, Alison Lohman, and Angelina Jolie.

title: Beowulf (2007 film)
text: It was released in the United Kingdom and United States on November 16, 2007, by Paramount Pictures and Warner Bros.

title: Beowulf (2007 film)
text: Pictures, and was available to view in IMAX 3D, RealD, Dolby 3D and standard 2D format.

title: Beowulf (2007 film)
text: The film received positive reviews from critics and it earned $196.4 million on a $150 million budget.

title: Dreams on Spec
text: Dreams on Spec is a 2007 American documentary film that profiles the struggles and triumphs of emerging Hollywood screenwriters.

title: Dreams on Spec
text: It was written and directed by Daniel J. Snyder, who learned first-hand about the screenwriter's travails in the late 1980s when he was a teenager working alongside aspiring writer/directors Quentin Tarantino and Roger Avary in the famed Video Archives video store in Manhattan Beach, California.

title: Braddon Mendelson
text: Braddon Mendelson is a producer, director and writer who was named as a defendant in the Rosa Parks v. LaFace Records lawsuit, but was subsequently dismissed from the case by the presiding judge.

title: Braddon Mendelson
text: As a music video producer, Mendelson worked with some of the top R&B and Rap artists of the late 1990s, including Xzibit, Outkast, Bizzy Bone, Mo Thugs and Ice Cube.

title: Braddon Mendelson
text: In 1997 he produced the feature film "Boogie Boy".

title: Braddon Mendelson
text: The film was directed by Craig Hamann and Executive Produced by Academy Award winner Roger Avary, who were both collaborators on Quentin Tarantino's first film "My Best Friend's Birthday."

title: Raymond Dokpesi
text: Raymond Anthony Aleogho Dokpesi is a Nigerian media businessman born in 1951 in Ibadan, Nigeria.

title: Raymond Dokpesi
text: His parents are from Agenebode, Edo state in a family including six sisters siblings.

title: Raymond Dokpesi
text: He entered the Nigerian mass media industry with his company DAAR Communications and set-up the Nigerian TV network Africa Independent Television (AIT) He was the organising committee chairman of the People's Democratic Party national conference in 2015.

title: Roger Avary
text: Roger Avary (born August 23, 1965) is a Canadian film and television producer, screenwriter and director in the American mass media industry.

title: Roger Avary
text: He worked on "Reservoir Dogs" and "Pulp Fiction", for which he and Quentin Tarantino were awarded the Oscar for Best Original Screenplay at the 67th Academy Awards.

title: Roger Avary
text: He wrote the screenplays for "Silent Hill" and "Beowulf".

title: Roger Avary
text: He also directed "Killing Zoe" and "The Rules of Attraction".

title: Sri Lanka Media Training Institute
text: The Sri Lanka Media Training Institute (SLMTI) is an autonomous establishment under the Ministry of Mass Media and Information.

title: Sri Lanka Media Training Institute
text: It was founded in 1984; as the Sri Lankan Television Training Institute to train professionals in the field of television.

title: Sri Lanka Media Training Institute
text: The institute was run in collaboration with Friedrich Ebert Stiftung (FES) of Bonn, Federal Republic of Germany, Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation (SLRC), and Sri Lanka Foundation Institute (SLFI).

title: Sri Lanka Media Training Institute
text: At present as the SLMTI the institute has widened its mandate to offers certificates, Diplomas and higher Diplomas in all disciplines related to Mass Media.

title: Sri Lanka Media Training Institute
text: The Chairman of SLMTI is Dr. Dharmasena Pathiraja who is a Sri Lankan film director, screenwriter and an academic.

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: Latinos Beyond Reel is a documentary which was released on February 23, 2013.

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: Latinos Beyond Reel taps into the harsh reality of Latino representation in the media industry.

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: Latinos Beyond Reel was directed by Miguel Picker and Chyng-Feng Sun.

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: "Latinos Beyond Reel" is under The Media Education Foundation (MEF).

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: The Media Education Foundation (MEF) produced and distributed the film.

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: The film talks about the underrepresentation and marginalization of Latinos in the U.S media.

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: The film also talks about the effects the false representation of Latinos in the media industry has on youth.

title: Latinos Beyond Reel
text: Latinos Beyond Reel captures the most unfortunate portrayal of Latinos in the media ranging from off-screen roles to animated characters in film and television.

title: Beowulf: Return to the Shieldlands
text: Beowulf is a British epic fantasy drama television series from ITV, consisting of 12 episodes and created by James Dormer, Tim Haines, and Katie Newman.

title: Beowulf: Return to the Shieldlands
text: Dormer wrote the series based on the poem "Beowulf" and executive produced along with Haines and Newman, while Stephen Smallwood produced the series.

title: Beowulf: Return to the Shieldlands
text: The series began airing in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2016 and in the United States from 23 January 2016.

title: Beowulf: Return to the Shieldlands
text: Shortly into the series, ITV announced that the series would not be picked up for another season, and the show finished with its original 12 episodes.

title: Christopher Panzner
text: Christopher Panzner (born 1959) is an American artist/writer/producer living and working in France.

title: Christopher Panzner
text: He has worked for a number of pioneers in the television and film industry, notably as Technical Director for the inventor of interactive television shopping, the Home Shopping Network and as Operations Director, France, for the inventor of the colorization process for black-and-white films, Color Systems Technology.

title: Christopher Panzner
text: He has developed animation software (Pixibox), designed theme channels (Canal +) and was Managing Director of the Luxembourg-based studio, Luxanima, which shared an International Emmy in 1994 for French CGI series Insektors.

title: Christopher Panzner
text: He went on to set up an animation/FX studio (motion capture/motion control), Image Effects, where he supervised the creation of 2D animated series "The Tidings" for Entertainment Rights before creating his own studio in the east of France the following year, Talkie Walkie, specializing in pre-production (design, storyboard and layout) and computer production (ink-and-paint/compositing) and whose clients included a Who’s Who of international television animation producers such as SIP, RTV Family Entertainment, Alphanim and Cinar (now called Cookie Jar.)

title: Christopher Panzner
text: He joined Paris-based production company TEVA in 2001 and was instrumental in the financing and/or the making of five animated features there in 2002–2004: double-Oscar nominated The Triplets of Belleville, Venice Film Festival selection "The Dog, the General and the Birds", "Jester Till", "Blackmor’s Treasure" (Associate Producer) and "Charlie and Mimmo" (Co-Producer).

title: Christopher Panzner
text: In 2002, TEVA and Mistral Films won the grand prize at IMAGINA for an experimental short film, "The Tale of the Floating World" directed by Alain Escalle, beating such prestigious competition as "Shrek", "Amélie" and "The Lord of the Rings", and was entirely responsible for the fabrication of Storimages’ Pulcinella-winning and International Emmy-nominated special, "Harold Peeble", based on the book by famous French illustrator Sempé.

title: Christopher Panzner
text: In 2006, "The Triplets of Belleville", "The Dog, the General and the Pigeons" and "Blackmor’s Treasure" were part of an eight-film retrospective of contemporary French animation at the Museum of Modern Art in New York called "Grand Illusions: The Best of Recent French Animation."

title: The Polar Express (film)
text: The Polar Express is a 2004 American 3D computer-animated Christmas musical fantasy film based on the 1985 children's book of the same name by Chris Van Allsburg, who served as one of the executive producers on the film.

title: The Polar Express (film)
text: Written, produced, and directed by Robert Zemeckis, the film features human characters animated using live action motion capture animation.

title: The Polar Express (film)
text: The film stars Daryl Sabara, Nona Gaye, Jimmy Bennett, and Eddie Deezen, with Tom Hanks in six distinct roles.

title: The Polar Express (film)
text: The film also included a performance by Tinashe at age 9, who later gained exposure as a pop singer in 2010, as the CGI-model for the female protagonist.

title: International House (1933 film)
text: International House is a 1933 American pre-Code comedy film starring Peggy Hopkins Joyce and W. C. Fields, directed by A. Edward Sutherland and released by Paramount Pictures.

title: International House (1933 film)
text: The tagline of the film was "The Grand Hotel of comedy".

title: International House (1933 film)
text: It is a mixture of comedy and musical acts tied together by a slim plot line, in the style of the Big Broadcast pictures that were also released by Paramount during the 1930s.

title: International House (1933 film)
text: In addition to some typical comedic lunacy from W. C. Fields and Burns and Allen, it provides a snapshot of some popular stage and radio acts of the era.

title: International House (1933 film)
text: The film includes some risqué pre-Code humor.

title: Ginger Rogers
text: Ginger Rogers (born Virginia Katherine McMath; July 16, 1911 – April 25, 1995) was an American actress, dancer, and singer, widely known for performing in films and RKO's musical films, partnered with Fred Astaire.
