text: It is the band's last album recorded with all four original members, as bassist Mike Starr was terminated from the band in January 1993.

title: Uncle Charlie
text: Uncle Charlie is the fourth studio album by Charlie Wilson and was released on February 17, 2009.

title: Uncle Charlie
text: It features production from Gregg Pagani, The Underdogs, Bigg D, T-Pain and L.O.S. da Maestro.

title: Uncle Charlie
text: It features guest appearances from Snoop Dogg, Jamie Foxx and T-Pain.

title: Uncle Charlie
text: The first two singles from the album are "Supa Sexxy" and "There Goes My Baby", the latter receiving major airplay on the Urban and Adult R&B radio stations as well being named Billboard Magazine's number one Urban Adult Song for 2009.

title: Uncle Charlie
text: It debuted and peaked at number two on the Billboard 200 with sales of 58,000 copies in its first week.

title: Uncle Charlie
text: This was his highest peak on the Billboard 200 to date and so far has sold 362,355 copies.

title: Hate to Feel
text: "Hate to Feel" is the tenth track on Alice in Chains' album "Dirt" (1992).

title: Hate to Feel
text: The song was included on the compilation albums "Music Bank" (1999) and "The Essential Alice in Chains".

title: Hate to Feel
text: It has also been the ninth track on later prints of the album and eleventh on others.

title: Hate to Feel
text: Some editions of "Dirt" may merge this song with the then-unlisted 43-second track "Iron Gland".

title: Mocean 8
text: Mocean 8 is a Boston, Massachusetts, United States based acoustic rock band consisting of Dan McQueen (guitarist/singer), Jim Corcoran (percussion), Mike Hartman (Bass), and Justin Corcoran (drums/guitar).

title: Mocean 8
text: Since 2002 Mocean 8 has been working together to form a groove rock band that is as close as family (which they are).

title: Mocean 8
text: The two drummers are cousins, the percussionist's sister is the lead singer's fiancé, and the bassist is the lead guitarist's uncle.

title: In the Mountain in the Cloud
text: The Man's major-label debut.

title: Modest Mouse
text: Modest Mouse is an American rock band formed in 1992 in Issaquah, Washington (a suburb of Seattle), and currently based in Portland, Oregon.

title: Modest Mouse
text: The founding members are lead singer/guitarist Isaac Brock, drummer Jeremiah Green, and bassist Eric Judy.

title: Modest Mouse
text: Strongly influenced by groups Pavement, the Pixies, XTC, and Talking Heads, the band rehearsed, rearranged, and recorded demos for almost two years before finally signing with small-town indie label, K Records, and releasing numerous singles.

title: Modest Mouse
text: Since the band's 1996 debut album, "This Is a Long Drive for Someone with Nothing to Think About", the group's lineup has centered on Brock and Green.

title: Modest Mouse
text: Judy performed on every Modest Mouse album until his departure in 2012.

title: Modest Mouse
text: Guitarist Johnny Marr (formerly of the Smiths) joined the band in 2006, shortly following percussionist Joe Plummer (formerly of the Black Heart Procession) and multi-instrumentalist Tom Peloso, to work on the album "We Were Dead Before the Ship Even Sank".

title: Modest Mouse
text: Guitarist Jim Fairchild joined the band in 2009.

title: Modest Mouse
text: The band's sixth album, "Strangers to Ourselves", was released on March 17, 2015.

title: The Studdogs
text: The Studdogs was a rock band from Orlando, Florida.

title: The Studdogs
text: The band's music contains elements of punk, blues rock, garage rock, and noise rock.

title: The Studdogs
text: The band was formed in 2000 and stayed active until 2005.

title: The Studdogs
text: They released a lot of material, particularly the full-length album, "The Gospel According to the Studdogs" and the 7" vinyl 3-song EP, and gained local and national notoriety.

title: The Studdogs
text: They were featured in several national music magazines, including Magnet and Amplifier.

title: The Studdogs
text: Comparisons were made to the Stooges, Dead Boys, and it was said they sounded "like absolute victory by way of slurring, Rolling Stones-y garage rock from nowhere in particular."

title: The Studdogs
text: Their drunken, abrasive live shows often ended with someone bleeding or being thrown out of the venue.

title: The Studdogs
text: Their live shows were said to be "what Howling Wolf would sound like through a wall of noise and distortion."

title: The Studdogs
text: The band was signed by Orange Recordings in Los Angeles and toured all over the country, sharing bills with the Demolition Doll Rods, Bob Log III, The Fleshtones, and Immortal Lee County Killers and a one-time show with the Suicide Girls Burlesque Tour in Orlando.

title: The Studdogs
text: While in the Studdogs, Rich Evans began promoting concerts under the tag "Mutiny Productions".

title: The Studdogs
text: He now heads the independent "Florida's Dying" label, promoting and releasing material from the Florida-underground music scene.

title: The Studdogs
text: Kyle Justin joined the band on drums in early 2002 to replace Jason, who was moving to Texas.

title: The Studdogs
text: Kyle vacated his position as drummer in 2003 to pursue a music career in Los Angeles.

title: The Studdogs
text: Eric Gebhardt left the band in 2005 to pursue a solo career under the alias Red Mouth.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: The Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year award is presented annually by the National Football League (NFL) honoring a player's volunteer and charity work, as well as his excellence on the field.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: Prior to 1999, it was called simply the NFL Man of the Year Award.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: Shortly after Chicago Bears running back Walter Payton died (having been the 1977 recipient himself), the award was renamed to honor his legacy as a humanitarian.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: Each year, a winner is selected from 32 nominees from the 32 different teams.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: A panel of judges, which includes the Commissioner of the NFL, Connie Payton (widow of Walter Payton), the previous year's winner, and a number of former players select the winner of the award.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: The Man of the Year winner receives a $50,000 donation in his name to a charity of his choice.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: The other 31 finalists also receive donations in their name of $5,000 each to charities of their choice.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: The Chicago Bears and Kansas City Chiefs have had more winners of the award than any other team, with 5 winners each.

title: Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award
text: The winners for the 2016 award are New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning and Arizona Cardinals wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald.

title: Carole Dieschbourg
text: Carole Dieschbourg (born 1977) is a Luxembourg politician and writer.

title: Carole Dieschbourg
text: Since December 2013, she has been Minister for the Environment representing the Green in the government coalition consisting of the Democratic Party, the Luxembourg Socialist Workers' Party and the Green Party.

title: Carole Dieschbourg
text: She represented Luxembourg at the COP22 Climate Change Conference in Marrakesh, November 2016.

title: Jérôme d'Ambrosio
text: Jérôme d'Ambrosio (born 27 December 1985) is a Belgian professional racing driver.

title: Jérôme d'Ambrosio
text: He drove for Marussia Virgin Racing during the 2011 Formula One World Championship.

title: Jérôme d'Ambrosio
text: As a result of the one-race ban given to Romain Grosjean for actions at the start of the 2012 Belgian Grand Prix, d'Ambrosio replaced the Frenchman for the 2012 Italian Grand Prix.

title: Jérôme d'Ambrosio
text: In 2016, he is competing in Formula E driving for Dragon Racing.

title: Jérôme d'Ambrosio
text: D'Ambrosio achieved his first Formula E victory in 2015 at the 2015 Berlin ePrix, and a second at the 2016 Mexican ePrix, both as a result of Lucas di Grassi's disqualification.

title: 2016 Marrakesh ePrix
text: The 2016 Marrakesh ePrix (formally the 2016 FIA Formula E Marrakesh ePrix) was a Formula E motor race held on 12 November 2016 at the Circuit Moulay El Hassan in Marrakesh, Morocco in front of a crowd of 7,000 people.

title: 2016 Marrakesh ePrix
text: It was the second round of the 2016–17 Formula E season and the first time the series had visited the African continent.

title: 2016 Marrakesh ePrix
text: The 33-lap race was won by e.Dams-Renault driver Sébastien Buemi, who started from the seventh position.

title: 2016 Marrakesh ePrix
text: Sam Bird finished second for the Virgin team and Mahindra driver Felix Rosenqvist came in third.

title: 2016 BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: The 2016 BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award took place on 18 December 2016 at the Genting Arena in Birmingham.

title: 2016 BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: It was the 63rd presentation of the BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award.

title: 2016 BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: Awarded annually by the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), the main award honours an individual's British sporting achievement over the past year, with the winner selected by public vote from a sixteen-person shortlist; the winner was Tennis player Andy Murray, who became the first person to win the award three times.

title: Sébastien Buemi
text: Sébastien Olivier Buemi (born 31 October 1988) is a Swiss professional racing driver, who formerly competed for Scuderia Toro Rosso in Formula One.

title: Sébastien Buemi
text: Buemi is currently a reserve driver for Scuderia Toro Rosso's sister team, Red Bull Racing, as well as being a member of Toyota's FIA World Endurance Championship squad and e.dams Renault in the FIA Formula E Championship.

title: Sébastien Buemi
text: Along with teammate Anthony Davidson, Buemi became World Champion in the LMP1 class of the FIA World Endurance Championship, in 2014.

title: Sébastien Buemi
text: He won the second ever Formula E championship, the season held across 2015–2016, by two points for setting the fastest lap time in the final race despite not finishing the event.

title: Lucas di Grassi
text: Lucas Tucci di Grassi (born 11 August 1984) is a Brazilian professional racing driver who currently competes for Audi Sport ABT in Formula E and is the 2016-17 World Champion.

title: Lucas di Grassi
text: In 2014, di Grassi became the first driver in motorsport history to win a motor race in an all-electric single-seater racing car at the 2014 Beijing ePrix.

title: Lucas di Grassi
text: He was also runner-up in the 2007 GP2 Series, 2015-16 FIA Formula E and 2016 FIA World Endurance Championship, and drove for Virgin Racing in the 2010 Formula One season.

title: BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: The BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award is the main award of the BBC Sports Personality of the Year ceremony, which takes place each December.

title: BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: The winner is the sportsperson, judged by a public vote, to have achieved the most that year.

title: BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: The recipient must either be British or reside and play a significant amount of their sport in the United Kingdom.

title: BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: The winner is selected by a public-vote from a pre-determined shortlist.

title: BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award
text: The most recent award winner is tennis player Andy Murray, who won in 2016.

title: FPAI Indian Player of the Year
text: The FPAI Indian Player of the Year is an annual award given to an Indian player who is adjudged to have been the best of the year in Indian football.

title: FPAI Indian Player of the Year
text: The award has been presented since the 2009–10 season and the winner is chosen by a vote amongst the members of the players' trade union, the Football Players' Association of India.

title: FPAI Indian Player of the Year
text: The first winner of the award was Dempo striker Sunil Chhetri.

title: FPAI Indian Player of the Year
text: Anas Edathodika, the Defender of Mohun Bagan and Indian national team has been the recent winner, for 2016–17.

title: Seoul Station (film)
text: Seoul Station (Korean: 서울역 ) is a South Korean animated zombie drama film written and directed by Yeon Sang-ho.

title: Seoul Station (film)
text: Released on August 18, 2016, the film stars Ryu Seung-ryong, Shim Eun-kyung and Lee Joon in the lead roles.

title: Seoul Station (film)
text: The film was shown at the 2016 Edinburgh International Film Festival.

title: Cafe Noir
text: Cafe Noir () is a 2009 South Korean romance melodrama film starring Shin Ha-kyun, Moon Jeong-hee, Kim Hye-na and Jung Yu-mi.

title: Cafe Noir
text: Written and directed by first-time director Jung Sung-il, a well regarded film critic-turned-director, it is a contemplation on love and heartbreak largely based on two works of literature - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe's "The Sorrows of Young Werther" and Fyodor Dostoyevsky's White Nights.

title: Cafe Noir
text: The critically acclaimed work debuted at the 66th Venice Film Festival in 2009, and Jung was nominated for New Talent Grand Pix at the 2010 Copenhagen International Film Festival.

title: Psychokinesis (film)
text: Psychokinesis is an upcoming South Korean black comedy film directed by Yeon Sang-ho.

title: Psychokinesis (film)
text: The film stars Ryu Seung-ryong, Shim Eun-kyung, Park Jung-min, Kim Min-jae and Jung Yu-mi.

title: Train to Busan
text: Train to Busan () is a 2016 South Korean zombie apocalypse action thriller film directed by Yeon Sang-ho and starring Gong Yoo, Jung Yu-mi, and Ma Dong-seok.

title: Train to Busan
text: The film takes place on a train to Busan, as a zombie apocalypse suddenly breaks in the country and compromises the safety of the passengers.

title: The Fake (2013 film)
text: The Fake () is a 2013 South Korean animated film written and directed by Yeon Sang-ho.

title: Yeon Sang-ho
text: Yeon Sang-ho (born 1978) is a South Korean film director and screenwriter.

title: Yeon Sang-ho
text: He wrote and directed the animated films "The King of Pigs" (2011) and "The Fake" (2013), and the live-action film "Train to Busan" (2016).

title: Kim Yool-ho
text: Kim Yool-ho (; born February 21, 1985) is a South Korean actor and model, He is best known for his role in "The Map Against the World", in which he played Prince Geumwi, and the 2016 zombie thriller apocalypse film "Train to Busan" as "man in suit 2", who helps Yong-suk (played by Kim Eui-sung).

title: The Crucible (2011 film)
text: The Crucible (; also known as Silenced) is a 2011 South Korean drama film based on the novel of the same name by Gong Ji-young, starring Gong Yoo and Jung Yu-mi.

title: The Crucible (2011 film)
text: It is based on actual events that took place at Gwangju Inhwa School for the hearing-impaired, where young deaf students were the victims of repeated sexual assaults by faculty members over a period of five years in the early 2000s.

title: The King of Pigs
text: The King of Pigs () is a 2011 South Korean animated drama film based on a true story, directed by Yeon Sang-ho.

title: The King of Pigs
text: It won three awards at the 2011 Busan International Film Festival.

title: The King of Pigs
text: The film was selected to be screened in the Directors' Fortnight section at the 2012 Cannes Film Festival.

title: The King of Pigs
text: One primary trait of the film is that its events are based on actual accounts, accurately depicted down to every last detail.

title: Top Gear Korea
text: Top Gear Korea () is the South Korean adaptation of BBC's popular "Top Gear" show.

title: Top Gear Korea
text: Officially announced on 21 June 2011, the show follows a similar format with the British version and season 1 included 3 presenters: singer and professional driver Kim Jin-pyo (김진표), actor Yeon Jung-hoon (연정훈), and actor Kim Kap-soo (김갑수).

title: Top Gear Korea
text: It premiered on cable channel XTM on 20 August 2011.

title: Tabas-e Masina
text: Tabas-e Masina (Persian: طبس مسينا‎ ‎ , also Romanized as Ţabas-e Masīnā and Ţabas Masīnā; also known as Ţabas and Masīnā) is a city in Gazik District, Darmian County, in South Khorasan Province, Iran.

title: Tabas-e Masina
text: At the 2006 census, where it had village status, its population was 3,776, in 779 families.

title: Tabas-e Masina
text: It was promoted to city status following the 2006 census.

title: Aghajari
text: Aghajari (Persian: آغاجاری‎ ‎ , also Romanized as Āghājārī and Āghā Jārī; also known as Aghajari-e Zeydūn and Āqā Jarī) is a city in and the capital of Central District, in Aghajari County, Khuzestan Province, Iran.

title: Aghajari
text: At the 2006 census, its population was 13,152, in 2,943 families.

title: Aghajari
text: Because of the Iran-Iraq War the city's population dropped from 64,102 in 1986 to around 16,337 in the 1991 census and its population continued to drop long after the 1991 census (held 3 years after the end of the Iran-Iraq War), but according to World Gazetteer the population has slowly grown to 15,153 in 2012, meaning the city's population is extremely far from reaching or getting close to its 1986 population.

title: Sareyn County
text: Sareyn County (Persian: شهرستان سرعین‎ ‎ ) is a county in Ardabil Province in Iran.

title: Sareyn County
text: The capital of the county is Sareyn.

title: Sareyn County
text: The county was split off from Ardabil County after the 2006 census.

title: Sareyn County
text: At the 2006 census, the county's population was 17,197, in 3,937 families.

title: Sareyn County
text: The county consists of two districts: the Central District and Sabalan District.

title: Sareyn County
text: The county has one city: Sareyn.

title: Ningi, Nigeria
text: Ningi is a town, a local government area, and an emirate in Bauchi State, Nigeria.

title: Ningi, Nigeria
text: The Ningi emirate comprises two local government areas, Ningi and Warji, with a combined area of 5,250 km and a population of 501,912 according to the 2006 Census.

title: Ningi, Nigeria
text: The Ningi local government area covers an area of 4,625 km with a population of 387,192 at the 2006 Census.

title: Ningi, Nigeria
text: The area is inhabited mostly by Fa,awa, Warjawa, Duwa, Ningawa and Fulani people.

title: Ningi, Nigeria
text: Yunusa Mohammadu Danyaya is the current Emir of Ningi.

title: Uche James-Iroha
text: James Iroha Uchechukwu is a Nigerian photographer.

title: Uche James-Iroha
text: He was born in 1972 in Enugu.

title: Uche James-Iroha
text: For of his photographic approach, his support to young photographers and the passing of his knowledge, he is regarded at the beginning of the 21st century as someone that has broadened the horizon of Nigerian photography.

title: Noorat
text: Noorat is a small township in southwestern Victoria, Australia.

title: Noorat
text: Noorat is located approximately 218 km west of Melbourne.

title: Noorat
text: The township is located at the base of Mount Noorat, a dormant volcano, which is considered to have Australia's largest dry crater.

title: Noorat
text: At the 2006 census, Noorat had a population of 252.

title: Noorat
text: By 2011, according to the census, the population had dropped to 167, although this drop in numbers is a bit deceptive as the town boundary was changed in between the 2006 and 2011 census.

title: Hinduism in Australia
text: Hinduism is a major religion in Australia consisting of more than 440,300 followers, making up 1.9% of the population as of the 2016 census, up from 275,000 individuals representing 1.3% of the total Australian population according to the 2011 census (up from 148,119 in the 2006 census).

title: Enugu
text: Enugu ( ; Igbo: Énugwú ) is the capital of Enugu State in Nigeria.

title: Enugu
text: It is located in southeastern Nigeria.

title: Enugu
text: The city had a population of 722,664 according to the 2006 Nigerian census.

title: Enugu
text: The name "Enugu" is derived from the two Igbo words "Énú Ụ́gwụ́" meaning "hill top" denoting the city's hilly geography.

title: Enugu
text: The city was named after Enugwu Ngwo, under which coal was found.

title: Terang
text: Terang is a town in the Western District of Victoria, Australia.

title: Terang
text: The town is in the Shire of Corangamite and on the Princes Highway 212 km south west of the state's capital, Melbourne.

title: Terang
text: At the 2006 census , Terang had a population of 1,824.

title: Terang
text: At the 2001 census, Terang had a population of 1,859.

title: Terang
text: The population of Terang has since risen according to the 2011 Census; the population is now 2,348, of which 1,155 are male and 1,193 are female, with the median age being 44.

title: Shiqi Subdistrict
text: Shiqi Subdistrict or Shiqiqu Subdistrict is located in the center of Zhongshan city and covering an area of 49.72 square kilometers.

title: Shiqi Subdistrict
text: Kei River is the mother river of Shekki district.

title: Shiqi Subdistrict
text: The district administers 19 neighborhood committees, and is considered the city's center for commerce and culture.

title: Shiqi Subdistrict
text: According to a 2006 census, the district had a permanent population of 169,400 and migrant population of 40,900.

title: Shiqi Subdistrict
text: Shekki District has a national-level private enterprise industrial park—Guangdong Zhongshan Industrial Park.

title: Shiqi Subdistrict
text: Furthermore, the district has currently 20 commercial networks, such as major marketplaces, logistic centers, and shopping malls.

title: Shiqi Subdistrict
text: One study in 2006 finds credits the district with 11767 business enterprises.

title: Barbara Avedon
text: Barbara Avedon (June 14, 1925 – August 31, 1994) was a television writer, political activist, and feminist.

title: Barbara Avedon
text: She was one of the writers for the television series "Bewitched", and helped a group of Jefferson High School students write the episode "Sisters at Heart".

title: Barbara Avedon
text: She also wrote for "Executive Suite" and "Fish", a 1977-78 spin-off from "Barney Miller".

title: Barbara Avedon
text: With Barbara Corday, Avedon created "Cagney & Lacey", the world's first dramatic television series to place women in both of its starring roles.

title: Barbara Avedon
text: They came up with the idea for this television series after having read Molly Haskell's book "From Reverence to Rape" which stated that there had never been a female buddy film.

title: Barbara Avedon
text: Avedon and Corday initially intended "Cagney & Lacey" to be a film.

title: Barbara Avedon
text: While they were writing the series together, Avedon was more experienced and proficient in screenwriting than Corday, and Avedon mentored Corday in this area throughout the series.

title: Barbara Avedon
text: They were best friends for nearly a decade.

title: D.C. Cab
text: D.C. Cab (also known as Street Fight) is a 1983 American comedy film, starring Max Gail, Adam Baldwin, Mr. T, Charlie Barnett, Gary Busey, Marsha Warfield, and Whitman Mayo.

title: D.C. Cab
text: The film was written and directed by Joel Schumacher with the story by Topper Carew & Schumacher.

title: Phil Fish (character)
text: Detective Phil Fish is a fictional NYPD detective in the TV series "Barney Miller" and later in the spin off series "Fish".

title: Phil Fish (character)
text: He was played by Abe Vigoda.

title: Jim Moody (actor)
text: Jim Moody (born September 25, 1949 in Portsmouth, Virginia) is a television and film character actor.

title: Jim Moody (actor)
text: He played the tough-talking counselor/teacher Gene Daniels in "Bad Boys".

title: Jim Moody (actor)
text: His first feature film role was in the 1980 hit film "Fame", in which he played Mr. Farrell, a drama teacher.

title: Jim Moody (actor)
text: Jim starred in the 1983 comedy film "D.C. Cab" as Arnie, a member of the rival cab company, Emerald Cab.

title: Jim Moody (actor)
text: He also appeared in the 1999 drama "The Best Man" and as Leroy Greene, Sr. (the father) in "The Last Dragon".

title: Jack Soo
text: Jack Soo (October 28, 1917 – January 11, 1979) was a Japanese American actor.

title: Jack Soo
text: He is best known for his role as Detective Nick Yemana on the television sitcom "Barney Miller".

title: Nellie Bellflower
text: Nellie Bellflower (born May 1, 1946 in Phoenix, Arizona) is an American actress and voice artist who provided the voice of Princess Ariel in the Ruby-Spears animated television series "Thundarr the Barbarian".

title: Nellie Bellflower
text: She has also been in "The Last Unicorn" (voice), Rankin/Bass "The Return of the King", "Americathon", the miniseries "East of Eden", and guest roles on various TV shows such as "Barnaby Jones", "Barney Miller", "Starsky and Hutch", and "Happy Days" as Fonzie's ex-fiancée Maureen Johnson, a.k.a. "The Lone Stripper", in the Season 2 episode of the series titled "Fonzie's Getting Married" (episode #13).

title: Nellie Bellflower
text: Nellie has been involved in movie production with three projects: "The Girl in Melanie Klein" (2008), "Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day" (2008) and "Finding Neverland" (2004), for which she was nominated for an Academy Award as Producer for Best Picture.

title: Nellie Bellflower
text: She is married to Michael Mislove.

title: Max Gail
text: Maxwell Trowbridge "Max" Gail Jr. (born April 5, 1943) is an American actor who has starred in stage, television, and film roles.

title: Max Gail
text: He most notably portrayed the role of Detective Stan "Wojo" Wojciehowicz on the television sitcom "Barney Miller".

title: Ron Carey (actor)
text: Ronald Joseph Cicenia (December 11, 1935 – January 16, 2007), known as Ron Carey, was an American film and television actor.

title: Ron Carey (actor)
text: The 5 ft actor was best known for playing ambitious NYPD Police Officer Carl Levitt on TV's "Barney Miller", in which he was almost always surrounded by male actors (and sometimes female guest stars) who stood at least 4 in taller.

title: Ron Carey (actor)
text: The series' stars (Hal Linden, Max Gail, Abe Vigoda, Ron Glass, Steve Landesberg) all stood 6 ft or more.

title: Ron Carey (actor)
text: Carey appeared in the recurring role for the last six of the eight seasons of "Barney Miller"' s run.

title: Ron Carey (actor)
text: He first appeared on the show as a criminal, Angelo Molinari (aka The Mole), in Season 2, Episode 22.

title: Steve Landesberg
text: Steve Landesberg (November 23, 1936December 20, 2010) was an American actor, comedian, and voice actor known for his role as the erudite, unflappable police detective Arthur P. Dietrich on the ABC sitcom "Barney Miller", for which he was nominated for three Emmy Awards.

title: Joe Bash
text: Joe Bash is an American comedy-drama television series that aired on ABC from March 28 to May 10, 1986.

title: Joe Bash
text: Starring Peter Boyle as a weary and embittered New York City Police Department beat cop, it was created by veteran TV producer Danny Arnold following his successful New York City police detective sitcom "Barney Miller".

title: Joe Bash
text: The production company was Tetagram Ltd., with Arnold and Chris Hayward serving as the show's executive producers. All six episodes were written by the team of Arnold, Hayward and Philip Jayson Lasker, with Arnold directing all but the fifth episode, which was directed by John Florea.

title: Late Night Final
text: Late Night Final is the second studio album (and first full-length album after the mini-album "Richard Hawley" released six months earlier) from musician Richard Hawley, released in the UK in October 2001 by Setanta Records.

title: Late Night Final
text: Named after the cry of vendors selling the "Sheffield Star" evening newspaper on the streets of his home city, it was released to positive reviews.

title: Late Night Final
text: A single, "Baby, You're My Light" was released from the album in February 2002, reaching #81 in the UK singles chart.

title: Lady's Bridge (album)
text: Lady's Bridge is the fifth studio album from musician Richard Hawley, released on 20 August 2007 in the UK and on 9 October 2007 in the US.

title: Lady's Bridge (album)
text: The album follows his 2005 Mercury Music Prize-nominated album "Coles Corner".

title: Lady's Bridge (album)
text: It is named after the landmark location of Lady's Bridge in Hawley's hometown of Sheffield, an old bridge over the River Don that historically connected the rich and poor parts of the town.

title: Lady's Bridge (album)
text: Hawley told "Uncut" magazine that "the title is a metaphor too; it's about leaving the past behind".

title: Lady's Bridge (album)
text: The cover features a photograph, taken by Martin Parr, of Hawley and his guitar at the Club 60 music venue in Sheffield as a tribute to his father Dave who had died of lung cancer earlier that year: Dave Hawley had been a blues guitarist at the club in his youth, playing alongside Muddy Waters and John Lee Hooker.

title: Standing at the Sky's Edge
text: Standing at the Sky's Edge is the seventh studio album from English musician Richard Hawley, released in the UK on 7 May 2012 and in the US on 28 August 2012.

title: Standing at the Sky's Edge
text: The album is markedly different from Hawley's previous efforts, often relinquishing softer instrumentation in favour of squalling guitars.

title: Standing at the Sky's Edge
text: As with all of Hawley's previous albums, the title obliquely refers to a location in his native city of Sheffield, in this case Skye Edge, a hillside area with views over the city centre and formerly known for its crime-ridden estates but largely redeveloped in the mid-2000s.

title: Richard Hawley
text: Richard Willis Hawley (born 17 January 1967) is an English guitarist, singer-songwriter and producer.

title: Richard Hawley
text: After his first band Treebound Story (formed while he was still at school) broke up, Hawley found success as a member of Britpop band Longpigs in the 1990s.

title: Richard Hawley
text: After that group broke up in 2000, he later joined the band Pulp, led by his friend Jarvis Cocker, for a short time.

title: Richard Hawley
text: As a solo musician, Hawley has released seven studio albums.

title: Richard Hawley
text: He has been nominated for a Mercury prize twice and once for a Brit Award.

title: Richard Hawley
text: He has collaborated with Lisa Marie Presley, Arctic Monkeys, Manic Street Preachers and Paul Weller.

title: Catherine (alternative rock band)
text: Catherine was an alternative rock band from Chicago, Illinois that was active from 1985 to 1998.

title: Catherine (alternative rock band)
text: They were signed to TVT Records.

title: Truelove's Gutter
text: Truelove's Gutter is the sixth studio album from musician Richard Hawley, released on 21 September 2009 in the UK and on 22 September 2009 in the US.

title: Truelove's Gutter
text: The album title refers to an ancient street in Hawley's native Sheffield, now thought to be the location of present-day Castle Street, which was allegedly named after 18th-century innkeeper Thomas Truelove, who used charge local people to dump their rubbish in the gutter in the street that then flowed down to the River Don.

title: Truelove's Gutter
text: Thematically, "Truelove's Gutter" is Richard's darkest album to date.

title: Truelove's Gutter
text: Richard told the BBC that the album was inspired by particularly dark periods in his life and those of others.

title: Truelove's Gutter
text: The album features some uncommon instrumentation, such as the waterphone, megabass, and cristal baschet.

title: Lowedges
text: Lowedges is the third studio album from musician Richard Hawley.

title: Lowedges
text: It was released in the UK in February 2003 by Setanta Records.

title: Lowedges
text: It is named after a district in Hawley's home city of Sheffield.

title: A Heavy Nite With...
text: A Heavy Nite With... is the debut album by British band Relaxed Muscle fronted by Pulp's Jarvis Cocker, using the pseudonym Darren Spooner.

title: A Heavy Nite With...
text: The other member is Jason Buckle.

title: A Heavy Nite With...
text: It has been alleged that Jason Buckle is a pseudonym for Pulp guitarist Richard Hawley, but this is not the case - Hawley does contribute guitar to the album, however, under the pseudonym Wayne Marsden.

title: Broken (Soulsavers album)
text: Broken is the third full-length studio album from electronica production duo Soulsavers, released by V2 Records in the UK on 17 August 2009, and released by Columbia Records in the US in September as a digital download.

title: Broken (Soulsavers album)
text: As with their 2007 album "It's Not How Far You Fall, It's the Way You Land", a collaboration with Mark Lanegan and a host of guest vocalists, "Broken" once again features Lanegan as the primary vocalist, as well as contributions from Bonnie "Prince" Billy (Will Oldham), Jason Pierce (of Spiritualized and Spacemen 3), Mike Patton (of Faith No More), Richard Hawley, and Gibby Haynes (of Butthole Surfers).

title: Broken (Soulsavers album)
text: The non-album single "Sunrise", a song written by Lanegan and sung by Will Oldham, preceded the album release on 3 August 2009.

title: Broken (Soulsavers album)
text: The AA-side is a cover of Palace Brothers' "You Will Miss Me When I Burn", written by Oldham and sung by Lanegan, that also features on the album.

title: Longpigs
text: Longpigs were a British alternative rock band who rose to fame on the fringe of Britpop in the 1990s, comprising Crispin Hunt (vocals), Richard Hawley (guitar), Simon Stafford (bass guitar) and former Cabaret Voltaire member Dee Boyle (drums) who was replaced by Andy Cook for their second album.

title: Longpigs
text: Hailing from Sheffield, the group had success with singles such as "She Said", "On and On", and their well-received debut album "The Sun Is Often Out" (1996).

title: Pam Veasey
text: Pamela Renea Veasey (born May 25, 1962) is an American television writer, producer and director.

title: All the Vermeers in New York
text: All the Vermeers in New York is a 1990 American film written, directed and produced by Jon Jost.

title: Marc Veasey
text: Marc Allison Veasey (born January 3, 1971) is an American politician from Fort Worth, Texas.

title: Marc Veasey
text: Veasey is currently the United States Representative for Texas's 33rd congressional district, winning the office in November 2012.

title: Marc Veasey
text: Previously he was a member of the Texas House of Representatives from 2005 to 2013, where he served as Chair Pro Tempore of the House Democratic Caucus.

title: Marc Veasey
text: He is a member of the Democratic Party.

title: Black Merda
text: Black Merda ( ) is an American rock band from Detroit, active from the mid-1960s to the early 1970s and reuniting in 2005.

title: Black Merda
text: The core band members are guitarist/vocalist Anthony Hawkins, bassist/guitarist/vocalist VC L. Veasey, and guitarist/vocalist Charles Hawkins, plus original drummer/vocalist Tyrone Hite.

title: Black Merda
text: Hite was a native of Detroit; the Hawkins brothers and Veasey were all born in Mississippi and came of age in Detroit.

title: Dale Veasey
text: Todd Dale Veasey (born May 20, 1960) is a retired American professional wrestler, better known by his ringnames Dale Veasey and Lt. James Earl Wright, who competed in North American regional promotions including the Mid-South region and the National Wrestling Alliance, particularly the Georgia and Florida territories, as well as brief stints in the World Wrestling Federation and World Championship Wrestling, most notably as one half of the tag team State Patrol with Buddy Lee Parker during the 1990s.

title: Over Here (film)
text: Over Here is a 2007 drama film directed by Jon Jost and starring Ryan Harper Gray.

title: Last Chants for a Slow Dance
text: Last Chants for a Slow Dance is a 1977 American drama film directed by Jon Jost and starring Tom Blair.

title: Emmanuelle Chaulet
text: Emmanuelle Chaulet is a French actress.

title: Emmanuelle Chaulet
text: She starred in Eric Rohmer's 1987 comedy "Boyfriends and Girlfriends" and Jon Jost's 1990 film "All the Vermeers in New York".

title: List of CSI: Cyber episodes
text: "", a CBS crime drama starring Patricia Arquette and Ted Danson, was originally introduced during a 2014 episode of "".

title: List of CSI: Cyber episodes
text: The series premiered on March 4, 2015.

title: List of CSI: Cyber episodes
text: Created by Carol Mendelsohn, Ann Donahue and Anthony E. Zuiker, and executive produced by Mendelsohn, Donahue, Zuiker, Jerry Bruckheimer, and Pam Veasey, "Cyber" follows the work of Mary Aiken inspired Avery Ryan, Ph.D. (Arquette), the Deputy Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and a former psychologist tasked with working on the dark web.

title: List of CSI: Cyber episodes
text: She works alongside D.B. Russell (Danson), a "" ex-pat, the civilian Director of Next-Gen Forensics, and a seasoned investigator.

title: List of CSI: Cyber episodes
text: James Van Der Beek, Peter MacNicol, Shad Moss, Charley Koontz, and Hayley Kiyoko also star.

title: Jon Jost
text: Jon Jost (born 16 May 1943 in Chicago) is an American independent filmmaker.

title: Maurice Spata
text: Muriki or Maurice Spata (, ; ) was the ruler of Arta from late 1399/early 1400 until his death in 1414 or 1415.

title: Maurice Spata
text: Maurice's reign was dominated by his wars with Carlo I Tocco.

title: Maurice Spata
text: Maurice was able to defend his capital of Arta, but despite some victories failed to prevent the fall of Ioannina to Tocco.

title: Maurice Spata
text: As a result, his brother Yaqub Spata who succeeded him was defeated in October 1416, ending the Despotate of Arta.

title: Hot Feet
text: Hot Feet is a jukebox musical featuring the music of Earth, Wind & Fire, a book by Heru Ptah and was conceived, directed, and choreographed by Maurice Hines.

title: Hot Feet
text: The musical opened on Broadway at the Foxwoods Theatre (then the Hilton Theatre) on April 30, 2006 and closed on July 23, 2006.

title: Thomas Berkeley, 5th Baron Berkeley
text: He was born to Sir Maurice Berkeley, "de jure" 3rd Baron Berkeley, and Isabel Meade, in England.

title: Thomas Berkeley, 5th Baron Berkeley
text: He was the younger brother to Maurice Berkeley, "de jure" 4th Baron Berkeley, and had a younger brother, James, and younger sister, Anne.

title: Thomas Berkeley, 5th Baron Berkeley
text: On 9 September 1513 he fought in the Battle of Flodden and was knighted by the Earl of Surrey, Thomas Howard.

title: Thomas Berkeley, 5th Baron Berkeley
text: He later became Constable of Berkeley Castle on 15 May 1514, and Sheriff of Gloucestershire, November 1522 - November 1523.

title: Thomas Berkeley, 5th Baron Berkeley
text: By writ, he was succeeded to the title of "de jure" 5th Baron Berkeley on 12 September 1523 after his brother Maurice's death, and his eldest son Thomas followed as the "de jure" 6th Baron Berkeley, again by writ.

title: John Hines (Australian soldier)
text: John "Barney" Hines (1873–1958) was a British-born Australian soldier of World War I, known for his prowess at collecting "souvenirs" from German soldiers.

title: John Hines (Australian soldier)
text: Hines was the subject of a famous photo taken by Frank Hurley that depicted him surrounded by German military equipment and money he had looted during the Battle of Polygon Wood in September 1917.

title: John Hines (Australian soldier)
text: This image is among the best-known Australian photographs of the war.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: Baron Berkeley of Stratton, in the County of Cornwall, was a title in the Peerage of England.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: It was created in 1658 for John Berkeley, 1st Baron Berkeley of Stratton, a Royalist supporter during the English Civil War, of the Bruton branch of the Berkeley family.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was a descendant of Sir Maurice de Berkeley (14th century), younger son of Maurice de Berkeley, 2nd Baron Berkeley (see Baron Berkeley).

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: Charles Berkeley, 2nd Viscount Fitzhardinge, was his brother and Charles Berkeley, 1st Earl of Falmouth, his nephew.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: Lord Berkeley of Stratton's second son, the third Baron (who succeeded his elder brother), was an Admiral in the Royal Navy.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He died without surviving children and was succeeded by his younger brother, the fourth Baron.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was a politician and served as First Lord of Trade between 1714 and 1715.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: On his death the title passed to his eldest son, the fifth Baron.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was also a politician and held office as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard and Captain of the Honourable Corps of Gentlemen-Pensioners.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was childless and the title became extinct on his death in 1775.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: The title Baron Berkeley originated as a feudal title and was subsequently created twice in the Peerage of England by writ.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: It was first granted by writ to Thomas II de Berkeley, 1st Baron Berkeley (1245–1321), 6th feudal Baron Berkeley, in 1295, but the title of that creation became extinct at the death of his great-great-grandson, the fifth Baron by writ, when no male heirs to the barony by writ remained, although the feudal barony continued.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: The next creation by writ was in 1421, for the last baron's nephew and heir James Berkeley.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: His son and successor William was created Viscount Berkeley in 1481, Earl of Nottingham in 1483, and Marquess of Berkeley in 1488.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: He had no surviving male issue, so the Marquesate and his other non-inherited titles became extinct on his death in 1491, whilst the barony passed "de jure" to his younger brother Maurice.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: However William had disinherited Maurice because he considered him to have brought shame on the noble House of Berkeley by marrying beneath his status to Isabel, daughter of Philip Mead of Wraxhall, an Alderman and Mayor of Bristol.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: Instead he bequeathed the castle, lands and lordships comprising the Barony of Berkeley to King Henry VII and his heirs male, failing which to descend to William's own rightful heirs.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: Thus on the death of King Edward VI in 1553, Henry VII's unmarried grandson, the Berkeley inheritance returned to the family.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: Therefore, Maurice and his descendants from 1492 to 1553 were "de jure" barons only, until the return of the title to the senior heir Henry (and indirectly to his mother Anne), becoming "de facto" 7th Baron in 1553.

title: Baron Berkeley
text: Upon his death he was succeeded by his relative George Harding.

title: Andrew Hines
text: Andrew Hines (born May 25, 1983 in Villa Park, California) is a five-time National Hot Rod Association Pro Stock Motorcycle champion.

title: Andrew Hines
text: He rides the flagship Screamin' Eagle/Vance & Hines Harley-Davidson V-rod.

title: Andrew Hines
text: Andrew follows in the footsteps of his brother and crew chief, Matt Hines (NHRA Champion 1996, 97, 98).

title: Andrew Hines
text: The team is headed by the legendary duo of Terry Vance and Byron Hines.

title: Cactus Club
text: The Cactus Club was a nightclub in the South of First Area (SoFA) of Downtown San Jose, California.

title: Cactus Club
text: It was one of the first clubs to replace some of the 'red light' businesses on South First Street (across the street was the Pussycat Theater which later became F/X).

title: Cactus Club
text: The Cactus Club took over The Bachelor Club and went on to become a legendary live music venue in San Jose for close to 15 years.

title: Cactus Club
text: The concept of The Cactus Club was created by Sean Galvin and Mike Trippett.

title: Cactus Club
text: It was Producer/Promoter Ric Hines who made the opening of the Cactus Club possible with his business experience and professional network.

title: Cactus Club
text: Hines recruited a local lawyer as a partner, Bob Cullen, whose nickname "Cactus Bob" was used to name the club.

title: Cactus Club
text: Mike's brother Calvin Trippett was brought in later as the booking agent for the club.

title: Cactus Club
text: The Cactus Club opened in 1988 and remained open until 2002.

title: Uptown... It's Hot!
text: Uptown... It's Hot!

title: Uptown... It's Hot!
text: was a 1986 Broadway play created, directed, choreographed by and starring Maurice Hines.

title: Uptown... It's Hot!
text: Performed at the Lunt-Fontanne Theatre, the play was a musical anthology chronicling the history of African-American music in the United States.

title: Maurice Hines
text: Maurice Hines (born December 13, 1943) is an American actor, director, singer, and choreographer.

title: Maurice Hines
text: He is the brother of dancer Gregory Hines.

title: Augusta Canal
text: The Augusta Canal is a historic canal located in Augusta, Georgia, United States.

title: Augusta Canal
text: The canal is fed by the Savannah River and passes through three levels (approximately 13 miles total) in suburban and urban Augusta before the water returns to the river at various locations.

title: Augusta Canal
text: It was devised to harness the water power at the fall line of the Savannah River to drive mills, to provide transportation of goods, and to provide a municipal water supply.

title: Augusta Canal
text: It is the only canal in the US in continuous use for its original purposes of providing power, transport and municipal water.

title: 17th Street Canal
text: The 17th Street Canal is the largest and most important drainage canal in the city of New Orleans.

title: 17th Street Canal
text: Operating with Pump Station 6, It moves water into Lake Pontchartrain.

title: 17th Street Canal
text: The canal, along with the Orleans Canal and the London Avenue Canal, form the New Orleans Outfall Canals.

title: 17th Street Canal
text: The 17th Street Canal forms a significant portion of the boundary between the city of New Orleans and Metairie, Louisiana.

title: 17th Street Canal
text: The canal has also been known as the Metairie Outlet Canal and the Upperline Canal.

title: Almonaster Road
text: Almonaster Avenue is a four-lane divided road in New Orleans, Louisiana, United States, named after 18th-century Spanish philanthropist Don Andres Almonaster y Rojas.

title: Almonaster Road
text: It forms in the residential neighborhoods of the Upper Ninth Ward by branching off at a Y-type intersection with Franklin Avenue.

title: Almonaster Road
text: Shortly afterwards, the road elevates on an overpass to cross the Norfolk Southern Railway and returns to ground level as it crosses the Industrial Canal on the Almonaster Avenue Bridge, a bascule bridge that it shares with CSX Transportation, proceeding into New Orleans East.

title: Almonaster Road
text: The traffic lanes straddle the railroad bridge on either side; this is the only location where Almonaster becomes a two-lane road, albeit divided.

title: Almonaster Road
text: It is also the last of the combination railroad/automobile movable bridges.

title: Almonaster Road
text: It winds through the New Orleans Business and Industrial District (NO BID) parallel with the Mississippi River Gulf Outlet and Gulf Intracoastal Waterway.

title: Almonaster Road
text: It intersects with Interstate 510 before finally ending at the junction with U.S. Highway 90.

title: Almonaster Road
text: It is also known for New Orleans street racing.

title: Karakum Canal
text: The Karakum Canal (Qaraqum Canal, Kara Kum Canal, Garagum Canal; Russian: Каракумский канал , "Karakumsky Kanal", Turkmen: Garagum kanaly , گَرَگوُم كَنَلیٛ, "Гарагум каналы") in Turkmenistan is one of the largest irrigation and water supply canals in the world.

title: Karakum Canal
text: Started in 1954, and completed in 1988, it is navigable over much of its 1375 km length, and carries 13 km3 of water annually from the Amu-Darya River across the Karakum Desert in Turkmenistan.

title: Karakum Canal
text: The canal opened up huge new tracts of land to agriculture, especially to cotton monoculture heavily promoted by the Soviet Union, and supplying Ashgabat with a major source of water.

title: Karakum Canal
text: Unfortunately, the primitive construction of the canal allows almost 50 percent of the water to escape en route, creating lakes and ponds along the canal, and a rise in groundwater leading to widespread soil salinization problems.

title: Karakum Canal
text: The canal is also a major factor leading to the Aral Sea environmental disaster.

title: New Orleans Outfall Canals
text: There are three outfall canals in New Orleans, Louisiana – the 17th Street, Orleans Avenue and London Avenue canals.

title: New Orleans Outfall Canals
text: These canals are a critical element of New Orleans’ flood control system, serving as drainage conduits for much of the city.

title: New Orleans Outfall Canals
text: There are 13 mi of levees and floodwalls that line the sides of the canals.

title: New Orleans Outfall Canals
text: The 17th Street Canal is the largest and most important drainage canal and is capable of conveying more water than the Orleans Avenue and London Avenue Canals combined.

title: London Avenue Canal
text: The London Avenue Canal is a drainage canal in New Orleans, Louisiana, used for pumping rain water into Lake Pontchartrain.

title: London Avenue Canal
text: The Canal runs through the 7th Ward of New Orleans from the Gentilly area to the Lakefront.

title: London Avenue Canal
text: It is one of the three main drainage canals responsible for draining rainwater from the main basin of the city of New Orleans.

title: London Avenue Canal
text: The London Avenue Canal's flood walls built atop earthen levees breached on both sides during Hurricane Katrina in 2005.

title: Orleans Canal
text: The Orleans Canal is a drainage canal in New Orleans, Louisiana.

title: Orleans Canal
text: The canal, along with the 17th Street Canal and the London Avenue Canal, form the New Orleans Outfall Canals.

title: Orleans Canal
text: The current version of the canal is about 2 km long, running along the up-river side of City Park, through the Lakeview and Lakeshore neighborhood, and into Lake Pontchartrain.

title: Orleans Canal
text: It is part of the system used to pump rain water out of the streets of the city into the Lake.

title: Orleans Canal
text: The Canal has also been known as the Orleans Avenue Canal, the Orleans Outfall Canal, the Orleans Tail Race, and early on, the Girod Canal,

title: Southern Railway Terminal (New Orleans)
text: The Southern Railway Terminal, originally officially "New Orleans Terminal", in New Orleans was constructed by the Southern Railway in 1908 on the neutral ground of Basin Street at the intersection of Canal Street.

title: Southern Railway Terminal (New Orleans)
text: The building was designed by Daniel Burnham, who was also the architect for the Union Station in Washington D.C.

title: Southern Railway Terminal (New Orleans)
text: The station also served the New Orleans and Northeastern Railroad and the New Orleans Terminal Company.

title: 16th Ward of New Orleans
text: The 16th Ward or Sixteenth Ward is a division of the city of New Orleans, Louisiana, one of the 17 Wards of New Orleans.

title: 16th Ward of New Orleans
text: New Orleans Districts and Wards.

title: 16th Ward of New Orleans
text: It is an Uptown ward, along with the adjacent 17th Ward formerly part of the city of Carrollton, Louisiana, annexed by New Orleans in the 1870s.

title: 16th Ward of New Orleans
text: The Ward stretches inland from the Mississippi River, with the upper boundary being Carrollton Avenue, across which is the 17th Ward, and the lower being Lowerline Street, across which is the 14th Ward.

title: 16th Ward of New Orleans
text: The back boundary was the New Basin Canal, now part of the route of I-10.

title: Canal Streetcar Line
text: The Canal Streetcar line is a historic streetcar line in New Orleans, Louisiana.

title: Canal Streetcar Line
text: It is operated by the New Orleans Regional Transit Authority (RTA).

title: Canal Streetcar Line
text: It originally operated from 1861 to 1964.

title: Canal Streetcar Line
text: It was redesigned and rebuilt between 2000 and 2004, and operation was reinstated in 2004 after a 40-year hiatus.

title: Canal Streetcar Line
text: Primarily running along its namesake street, Canal Street, it consists of two branches named for their outer terminals, totaling about 5+1/2 mi in length: "Canal - Cemeteries" (officially designated as Route 47) and "Canal - City Park/Museum" (officially designated as Route 48).

title: Canal Streetcar Line
text: Each branch is denoted with the red and light green colors respectively on most RTA publications.

title: Pokémon universe
text: The Pokémon universe is a fictional continuity construct that exists in stories and works of fiction by video game company Game Freak.

title: Pokémon universe
text: The concept of the "Pokémon" universe, in both the video games and the general nonfictional world of "Pokémon", stems from the hobby of insect collecting, a popular pastime which "Pokémon" executive director Satoshi Tajiri-Oniwa enjoyed as a child.

title: Pokémon universe
text: Players of the games are designated as Pokémon Trainers, and the two general goals (in most Pokémon games) for such Trainers are: to complete the Pokédex by collecting all of the available Pokémon species found in the fictional region where that game takes place; and to train a team of powerful Pokémon from those they have caught to compete against teams owned by other Trainers, and eventually become the strongest Trainer: the Pokémon Master.

title: Pokémon universe
text: These themes of collecting, training, and battling are present in almost every version of the Pokémon franchise, including the video games, the anime and manga series, and the Pokémon Trading Card Game.

title: Pete Hill
text: John Preston "Pete" Hill (October 12, 1882 – December 19, 1951) was an American outfielder and manager in baseball's Negro leagues from 1899 to 1925.

title: Pete Hill
text: He played for the Philadelphia Giants, Leland Giants, Chicago American Giants, Detroit Stars, Milwaukee Bears, and Baltimore Black Sox.

title: Pete Hill
text: Hill starred for teams owned by Negro league executive Rube Foster for much of his playing career.

title: RSPORTS
text: RSPORTS was an auto racing team that competed in the Champ Car World Series.

title: RSPORTS
text: It was founded officially in 2007 as a technological partnership, but started out originally as two different teams owned by former race car drivers Carl Russo, who owned RuSPORT, and Paul Gentilozzi who founded Rocketsports.

title: Robert Kraft
text: Robert Kenneth Kraft (born June 5, 1941) is an American businessman.

title: Robert Kraft
text: He is the chairman and chief executive officer of the Kraft Group, a diversified holding company with assets in paper and packaging, sports and entertainment, real estate development and a private equity portfolio.

title: Robert Kraft
text: His sports holdings include: the National Football League's New England Patriots, Major League Soccer's New England Revolution and the stadium in which both teams play, Gillette Stadium.

title: Mane 'n Tail Lady Stallions (2015)
text: The Mane 'n Tail Lady Stallions were a professional volleyball team in the Philippine Super Liga (PSL).

title: Mane 'n Tail Lady Stallions (2015)
text: It was one of two teams owned by Federated Distributors, Inc. and was the second team to play under the name "Mane 'n Tail Lady Stallions".

title: Mane 'n Tail Lady Stallions (2015)
text: The original Mane 'n Tail Lady Stallions was renamed Philips Gold Lady Slammers in 2015.

title: 1926 American Football League season
text: The 1926 American Football League season is the only season of the existence of the first American Football League.

title: 1926 American Football League season
text: It started with nine teams, with the initial game of the season being played in front of 22,000 fans in Cleveland, Ohio, but by the end of the season (December 14, 1926), only four teams were still in existence: three teams owned or subsidized by league founder C. C. Pyle and star Red Grange (New York Yankees, Los Angeles Wildcats, and Chicago Bulls) and league champion Philadelphia Quakers.

title: 1926 American Football League season
text: The initial lineup of teams included the traveling Wildcats and a charter member of the National Football League, the Rock Island Independents, which became a second traveling team after having poor attendance in its first three games.

title: Crispa 400
text: Crispa 400 was the name of two amateur basketball teams owned by P. Floro and Sons, Inc. that played in the Manila Industrial and Commercial Athletic Association (MICAA) from 1977 to 1981 and the Philippine Basketball League (PBL) from 1989 to 1992, respectively.

title: Canadian Premier League
text: The Canadian Premier League is a proposed fully professional, FIFA-sanctioned soccer league expected to begin play as early as 2018.

title: Canadian Premier League
text: Six to eight teams owned and operated, at least in part, by a mix of NHL and CFL ownership groups are expected to initially compete in the league.

title: Canadian Premier League
text: The league's focus will be to fully "Canadianize" itself to improve talent and the sport in Canada.

title: Canadian Premier League
text: It was officially sanctioned by the Canadian Soccer Association on May 6, 2017, with a launch date of 2018.

title: Canadian Premier League
text: It is expected to be headquartered in Hamilton, Ontario.

title: PLDT Volleyball Club
text: The PLDT Home TVolution Power Attackers (women's) and the PLDT Home Telpad-Air Force Turbo Boosters (men's) were professional volleyball teams owned by PLDT that played in the Philippine Super Liga (PSL) from 2013 to 2014.

title: PLDT Volleyball Club
text: The club was first known as PLDT myDSL Speed Boosters.

title: Myra Kraft
text: Myra Hiatt Kraft ("née" Myra Nathalie Hiatt; December 27, 1942 – July 20, 2011) was an American philanthropist and the wife of New England Patriots and New England Revolution owner Robert Kraft.

title: David Lucas (composer)
text: David Lucas (born David Helfman April 21, 1937) is an American rock and roll composer, singer, and music producer.

title: David Lucas (composer)
text: He has written a number of commercial jingles, such as AT&T's "Reach Out and Touch Someone."

title: David Lucas (composer)
text: In 1981, he received a Clio Award for composing the music to Pepsi's "Catch That Pepsi Spirit."

title: David Lucas (composer)
text: As a record producer, he worked with many new artists such as Blue Öyster Cult.

title: David Lucas (composer)
text: On the 1976 Blue Öyster Cult song "Don't Fear the Reaper" which he co-produced, Lucas sang backup vocals and came up with the idea for using a cowbell, parodied by Christopher Walken in the "More cowbell" skit on "Saturday Night Live".

title: David Lucas (composer)
text: In June 2011, Lucas was inducted into Buffalo's Music Hall of Fame.

title: Blue Öyster Cult
text: Blue Öyster Cult (often abbreviated BÖC) is an American hard rock band formed on Long Island, New York, in 1967, whose most successful work includes the hard rock and heavy metal songs "(Don't Fear) The Reaper", "Godzilla" and "Burnin' for You".

title: Blue Öyster Cult
text: Blue Öyster Cult has sold over 24 million records worldwide, including 7 million records in the United States alone.

title: Blue Öyster Cult
text: The band's music videos, especially "Burnin' for You", received heavy rotation on MTV when the music television network premiered in 1981, cementing the band's contribution to the development and success of the music video in modern popular culture.

title: Godzilla (song)
text: "Godzilla" is a song by Blue Öyster Cult from their fifth album, "Spectres".

title: Godzilla (song)
text: The lyrics are a tongue-in-cheek tribute to the popular movie monster of the same name.

title: Godzilla (song)
text: The song is, along with "(Don't Fear) The Reaper" and "Burnin' for You", one of Blue Öyster Cult's best known songs and has become a staple of their live performances.

title: Godzilla (song)
text: It has been covered by bands such as Racer X, Fu Manchu, The Smashing Pumpkins, Sebastian Bach and Fighting Gravity.

title: Imaginos
text: Imaginos is the eleventh studio album by the American hard rock band Blue Öyster Cult (commonly shortened as BÖC).

title: Imaginos
text: It was released in 1988, and was their last recording with their original record label, CBS/Columbia Records.

title: Imaginos
text: The album took nearly eight years to complete and was originally intended to be the first in a trilogy of solo albums by Blue Öyster Cult drummer and songwriter Albert Bouchard.

title: Imaginos
text: Bouchard was fired in August 1981, and CBS rejected the album in 1984, but a re-worked version was eventually published as a product of the band.

title: Imaginos
text: Many musicians contributed to the project over this eight-year span, including Joe Satriani and Doors guitarist Robby Krieger, but some band members were barely involved in the recording process.

title: Imaginos
text: Thus, "Imaginos" is often considered more as a project of producer and lyricist Sandy Pearlman than as a true album of the band.

title: Fu Manchu (band)
text: Fu Manchu is an American, Southern California-based stoner rock band that formed in 1985.

title: Some Enchanted Evening (Blue Öyster Cult album)
text: Some Enchanted Evening is the second live album by the American hard rock band Blue Öyster Cult, released in September 1978 (see 1978 in music).

title: Some Enchanted Evening (Blue Öyster Cult album)
text: It is Blue Öyster Cult's best selling album, having sold two million copies, including over a million in the United States.

title: Some Enchanted Evening (Blue Öyster Cult album)
text: The album's seven original tracks were recorded at various locations in the United States and England.

title: Blue Öyster Cult (album)
text: Blue Öyster Cult is the eponymous debut studio album by the American hard rock band Blue Öyster Cult, released on January 16, 1972 by Columbia Records.

title: Blue Öyster Cult (album)
text: The album featured songs such as "Cities on Flame with Rock and Roll", "Stairway to the Stars", and "Then Came the Last Days of May", all of which the band still plays regularly during its concerts.

title: Blue Öyster Cult (album)
text: Despite positive reviews, the album failed to chart for some time before finally cracking the "Billboard" 200 chart on May 20, 1972, peaking at No. 172.

title: Blue Öyster Cult (album)
text: Blue Öyster Cult toured with artists such as The Byrds, Alice Cooper and the Mahavishnu Orchestra to support the album.

title: Mirrors (Blue Öyster Cult album)
text: Mirrors is the sixth studio album by Blue Öyster Cult, released in 1979.

title: Mirrors (Blue Öyster Cult album)
text: "Mirrors" is the first Blue Öyster Cult album not produced by long-time producer and manager Sandy Pearlman.

title: Mirrors (Blue Öyster Cult album)
text: The album is notable for a collaboration with British fantasy/science-fiction author Michael Moorcock, who co-wrote a song based on his novel "The Fireclown".

title: Mirrors (Blue Öyster Cult album)
text: "The Great Sun Jester" is the first of several Moorcock co-writing credits with the band.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: "Black Blade" is a song by American rock band Blue Öyster Cult.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: The lyrics were written by Eric Bloom and British science fiction writer Michael Moorcock from the viewpoint of Elric, Moorcock's most famous character.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: Elric wields a sentient, soul-sucking sword named Stormbringer.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: Aside from a set of cryptic, blood-red runes on the blade, the sword is black, hence the name "Black Blade".

title: Black Blade (song)
text: The music was jointly composed by Eric Bloom, lead singer of Blue Öyster Cult, and bass-player John Trivers.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: The song was featured in the Blue Öyster Cult album "Cultösaurus Erectus."

title: Black Blade (song)
text: When Bloom was asked how he got in touch with Moorcock for the song he claims, "I went out of my way to send him a Fan Boy letter.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: He was living in England, and he came over to America, to meet with his publisher.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: He said, “Let's get together.”

title: Black Blade (song)
text: We got together, and bonded, and he started sending me lyrics.

title: Black Blade (song)
text: That is how "Black Blade," "Veteran of Psychic Wars" and "Great Sun Jester" happened.

title: The Essential Blue Öyster Cult
text: The Essential Blue Öyster Cult is a compilation album by the hard rock band Blue Öyster Cult, released in 2003 as part of Sony BMG's "Essential" series.

title: The Essential Blue Öyster Cult
text: An expanded edition of the album, with different cover, was released in 2012, based from 1995 compilation "Workshop of the Telescopes".

title: Joe Wizan
text: Joe Wizan (January 7, 1935 – March 21, 2011) was an American film producer and studio executive.

title: Joe Wizan
text: He was head of 20th Century Fox's motion picture division from 1983 to 1984.

title: Joe Wizan
text: His credits as a producer or executive producer include "Jeremiah Johnson", "Junior Bonner", "The Last American Hero", "Audrey Rose" , " And Justice for All", Along Came a Spider and Dark Night of the Scarecrow".

title: Joe Wizan
text: Wizan died on March 21, 2011 at an assisted-living facility in Westlake Village, California.

title: Joe Wizan
text: He was 76.

title: Connie Tavel
text: Connie Tavel is an American television and film executive producer and talent manager.

title: Connie Tavel
text: She is partners with Helen Hunt in Hunt/Tavel Productions, and with Tim Johnson in Tavel/Johnson Television.

title: Connie Tavel
text: She has served as executive producer on films such as "Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey", "Fever", and "The Wishing Tree", as well as television movies such as "Ride with the Wind" and "Summer's End".

title: Connie Tavel
text: She also produced an episode of the television series "Judging Amy", which she is credited as a co-creator.

title: Proud Mary (film)
text: Proud Mary is an upcoming American action-thriller directed by Babak Najafi, from a screenplay written by John S. Newman and Christian Swegal.

title: Proud Mary (film)
text: The film will star Taraji P. Henson, Billy Brown, Danny Glover, Neal McDonough, Xander Berkeley, and Margaret Avery.

title: Proud Mary (film)
text: The film will be released on January 12, 2018 by Screen Gems.

title: Toby Emmerich
text: Toby Emmerich (born February 8, 1963) is an American producer, film executive, and screenwriter.

title: Toby Emmerich
text: He was born in New York City, the son of Constance (née Marantz), a concert pianist, and André Emmerich (1924–2007), a Frankfurt-born gallery owner and art dealer.

title: Toby Emmerich
text: He has been producer or executive producer of over 50 films, and he also wrote the screenplays to the films "Frequency" and "The Last Mimzy", among other screenplays.

title: Toby Emmerich
text: After serving as president of production at New Line Cinema, Emmerich became president and chief operating officer of New Line on March 18, 2008, then in 2017, he became President and Chief Content Officer of the Warner Bros.

title: Toby Emmerich
text: Pictures Group.

title: Toby Emmerich
text: He was also the executive music producer of the films "Menace II Society" and "Above The Rim".

title: Dete Meserve
text: Dete Meserve is an award-winning and bestselling author as well as film and television executive and a principal of Wind Dancer Films.

title: Dete Meserve
text: Wind Dancer Films is best known as the creators and producers of Home Improvement starring Tim Allen, What Women Want starring Helen Hunt and Mel Gibson, Where The Heart Is starring Natalie Portman.

title: Dete Meserve
text: Meserve's credits include producing Bernie starring Jack Black, Shirley MacLaine and Matthew McConaughey, executive producer of Walker Payne starring Sam Shepard and Jason Patric, executive producer of the TV series Wildest Africa for Discovery International, executive producer of As Cool As I Am, starring Claire Danes and James Marsden.

title: Dete Meserve
text: In 2014, she was an executive producer of the George Lopez sitcom, "Saint George," and producer of the thriller, The Keeping Room starring Sam Worthington, Hailee Steinfeld and Brit Marling.

title: Dete Meserve
text: She is currently an Executive Producer of the hit kids television series Ready Jet Go on PBSKids.

title: Easy Money II: Hard to Kill
text: Easy Money II: Hard to Kill (Swedish: "Snabba Cash II" ) is a Swedish thriller film directed by Babak Najafi that was released on 17 August 2012.

title: Easy Money II: Hard to Kill
text: The film is a sequel to the 2010 film "Easy Money", and is based on Jens Lapidus' books "Easy Money" and "Aldrig fucka upp".

title: Easy Money II: Hard to Kill
text: It's the second part in a trilogy, and is followed by "" (2013).

title: Easy Money II: Hard to Kill
text: The screenplay is written by Peter Birro and Maria Karlsson.

title: Zygi Kamasa
text: Zygi Kamasa (born 12 November 1969) is a Swedish-British entertainment studio executive and film executive producer.

title: Zygi Kamasa
text: He currently serves as CEO of Lionsgate UK & Europe and was the Executive Producer for Brooklyn, Eddie the Eagle, Salmon Fishing in the Yemen, The Railway Man and London Has Fallen.

title: No Code of Conduct
text: No Code of Conduct is a 1998 action crime thriller film directed by Bret Michaels.

title: No Code of Conduct
text: The film stars Charlie Sheen, and Martin Sheen as father-and-son vice unit detectives, along with Mark Dacascos who portrays Charlie Sheen's partner.

title: No Code of Conduct
text: The film was released as a direct-to-video feature in some countries, including: Australia, Sweden, Japan, the Czech Republic, Argentina, Brazil, Azerbaijan, Russia and Turkey.

title: No Code of Conduct
text: Bret Michaels is credited as Director, Screenwriter, Composer (Music Score), Actor and Executive Producer.

title: No Code of Conduct
text: Charlie Sheen's credits in this release include Actor, Screenwriter and Executive Producer.

title: Scott Rosenbaum
text: Scott Rosenbaum is a film and television screenwriter, producer, and showrunner.

title: Scott Rosenbaum
text: Scott recently served as the Executive Producer and Showrunner of ABC’s science fiction drama "V" and Fox’s crime drama "Gang Related".

title: Scott Rosenbaum
text: Previously, he was an Executive Producer on NBC's "Chuck" and an Executive Producer on FX’s award-winning drama "The Shield".

title: Scott Rosenbaum
text: As an original member of the show's writing staff, Rosenbaum has won numerous awards for his achievements on "The Shield" including a Golden Globe for Best Drama, an American Film Institute Award for Best Television Drama as well as the prestigious George Foster Peabody Award.

title: Scott Rosenbaum
text: He is currently the executive producer and showrunner of "Queen of the South" for USA Network.

title: London Has Fallen
text: London Has Fallen is a 2016 American action thriller film directed by Babak Najafi and written by Creighton Rothenberger, Katrin Benedikt, Chad St. John and Christian Gudegast.

title: London Has Fallen
text: It is a sequel to Antoine Fuqua's 2013 film "Olympus Has Fallen" and stars Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart and Morgan Freeman, with Alon Moni Aboutboul, Angela Bassett, Robert Forster, Jackie Earle Haley, Melissa Leo, Radha Mitchell, Sean O'Bryan, Waleed Zuaiter and Charlotte Riley in supporting roles.

title: London Has Fallen
text: It is the second installment in the "Has Fallen" film series.

title: Jane Alexander
text: Jane Alexander (born October 28, 1939) is an American author, actress and former director of the National Endowment for the Arts.

title: Jane Alexander
text: She is a Tony Award winner and two-time Emmy Award winner.

title: Rafael Bello
text: Rafael Emilio Bello Castro, known professionally as Rafael Bello (pronounced Rafael "BE-YO"), is a Dominican television and radio personality based in New York City.

title: Rafael Bello
text: Bello, a two-time Emmy award winner, currently serves as the Weather and Entertainment Anchor in "Al Despertar", WXTV WXTV-DT Univision 41 Nueva York' early morning newscast.

title: Rafael Bello
text: Bello formerly served as the Traffic and Entertainment Anchor on WNJU Telemundo 47 in "Noticiero 47 Primera Edicion" and also hosted feature and entertainment segments including his Emmy Award winner for best entertainment segment under the name "Pa la Calle con Rafa".

title: Chuck Versus the Role Models
text: "Chuck Versus the Role Models" is episode 15 of the third season of "Chuck".

title: Chuck Versus the Role Models
text: Chuck and Sarah are assigned to train under Craig and Laura Turner (Fred Willard and Swoosie Kurtz), a married CIA team who, despite their impeccable record, hate one another.

title: Chuck Versus the Role Models
text: The Turners' stormy relationship forces Chuck and Sarah to wonder if they're doomed with the same fate.

title: Chuck Versus the Role Models
text: Meanwhile, Casey must train the newest member of the team - Morgan.

title: Patti LuPone
text: Patti Ann LuPone (born April 21, 1949) is an American actress and singer, best known for her work in stage musicals.

title: Patti LuPone
text: She is a two-time Grammy Award winner and a two-time Tony Award winner.

title: Patti LuPone
text: She is also a 2006 American Theater Hall of Fame inductee.

title: John Carrafa
text: John Carrafa is an American theater and film director/choreographer best known as the two-time Tony Award nominated choreographer of the Broadway musicals "Urinetown" and "Into The Woods" and the Media Choreography Honors Award winner for the Robert Zemeckis film "The Polar Express".

title: Serializer
text: serializer.net was an online artist collective that was active from 2002 to 2012.

title: Serializer
text: Serializer included many well-known award-winning alternative artists like Tom Hart (Xeric Award winner), Eric Millikin (Pulitzer Prize winner), Shaenon K. Garrity (Lulu Award winner), James Kochalka (Eisner Award winner), Dean Haspiel (Emmy Award winner), Howard Cruse (Prix de la critique winner), Chris Onstad (Ignatz Award winner), Nick Bertozzi (Harvey Award winner), and Jen Sorenson (Herblock Prize winner).

title: Serializer
text: Each artist created, and sometimes collaborated on, serialized webcomics.

title: Rich Moore
text: Rich Moore (born May 10, 1963) is an American film and television animation director, screenwriter, voice actor, and a creative partner at both Rough Draft Studios and Walt Disney Animation Studios.

title: Rich Moore
text: He is best known for his work on the animated television shows "The Simpsons", "The Critic," and "Futurama", and for directing the Disney animated film "Wreck-It Ralph" (2012) and co-directing "Zootopia" (2016).

title: Rich Moore
text: He is a two-time Emmy Award winner, a three-time Annie Award winner, and an Academy Award winner.

title: Swoosie Kurtz
text: Swoosie Kurtz ( , ; born September 6, 1944) is an American actress.

title: Swoosie Kurtz
text: She is an Emmy Award winner and two-time Tony Award winner.

title: Paul Haggis
text: Paul Edward Haggis (born March 10, 1953) is a Canadian screenwriter, producer, and director of film and television.

title: Paul Haggis
text: He is best known as screenwriter and producer for consecutive Best Picture Oscar winners: "Million Dollar Baby" (2004) and "Crash" (2005), the latter of which he also directed.

title: Paul Haggis
text: He is the creator of the television series "Due South" and the co-creator of "Walker, Texas Ranger".

title: Paul Haggis
text: He is a two-time Academy Award winner, two-time Emmy Award winner, and seven-time Gemini Award winner.

title: Christian Borle
text: Christian Dominique Borle (born October 1, 1973) is an American actor in theatre, television, and film.

title: Christian Borle
text: He is a two-time Tony Award winner for his roles as Black Stache in "Peter and the Starcatcher" and as William Shakespeare in "Something Rotten!

title: Christian Borle
text: Borle originated the role of Emmett in "Legally Blonde" on Broadway , as Tom Levitt on the NBC musical-drama television series "Smash" and as Marvin in the 2016 Broadway revival of "Falsettos".

title: Rainbow Terrace
text: Rainbow Terrace, now known as Lullwater Estate, is the Mediterranean-style Atlanta mansion built for Lucy Beall Candler Owens Heinz (1882–1962), daughter of Coca-Cola co-founder Asa Griggs Candler.

title: Rainbow Terrace
text: The architect was G. Lloyd Preacher, the architect of Atlanta City Hall.

title: Rainbow Terrace
text: It is located at what is now 1610 Ponce de Leon Avenue in the Druid Hills Historic District.

title: Antonio Villaraigosa
text: Antonio Ramón Villaraigosa ( ; born Antonio Ramón Villar Jr.; January 23, 1953) is an American politician who was the 41st Mayor of Los Angeles, California, from 2005 to 2013.

title: Antonio Villaraigosa
text: Before becoming mayor, he was a member of the California State Assembly (1994–2000), where he served as the Democratic leader of the Assembly (1996–98), and the Speaker of the California State Assembly (1998–2000).

title: William B. Hartsfield
text: William Berry Hartsfield, Sr. (March 1, 1890 – February 22, 1971), was an American politician who served as the 49th and 51st Mayor of Atlanta, Georgia.

title: William B. Hartsfield
text: His tenure extended from 1937 to 1941 and again from 1942 to 1962, making him the longest-serving mayor of his native Atlanta, Georgia.

title: Glen Murray (politician)
text: Glen R. Murray (born October 26, 1957) is a Canadian politician and urban issues advocate.

title: Glen Murray (politician)
text: He served as the 41st Mayor of Winnipeg, Manitoba from 1998 to 2004, and was the first openly gay mayor of a large North American city.

title: Glen Murray (politician)
text: He subsequently moved to Toronto, Ontario, and was elected to the Legislative Assembly of Ontario as a Liberal Member of Provincial Parliament (MPP) for Toronto Centre in 2010, serving until 2017.

title: Robert Maddox
text: Robert Foster Maddox (April 4, 1870 – 1965) was the 41st Mayor of Atlanta, Georgia.

title: Albert Hofstede
text: Albert "Al" J. Hofstede (September 25, 1940 – September 3, 2016) was an American politician who served two non-consecutive terms as mayor of Minneapolis, Minnesota, both times representing the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party.

title: Albert Hofstede
