text: The team earned an invitation to the 1981 National Invitation Tournament.

title: 1980–81 Michigan Wolverines men's basketball team
text: Although the team was ranked in the Associated Press Top Twenty Poll for eleven of the sixteen weeks reaching a peak at number nine, it began and finished the season unranked and it also ended the season unranked in the final UPI Coaches' Poll.

title: 1980–81 Michigan Wolverines men's basketball team
text: The team was led by All-American Mike McGee.

title: 1980–81 Michigan Wolverines men's basketball team
text: The team set the current Big Ten conference record by playing in six overtime games.

title: 1980–81 Michigan Wolverines men's basketball team
text: That season McGee also set the current conference record for career field goals attempted (2077).

title: 1980–81 Michigan Wolverines men's basketball team
text: McGee set several other records, which have since been broken: career points (2439, broken in 1989 by Glen Rice), career points (conference games only) (1503, broken in 1995), single-season field goals made (309, broken in 1986) and career field goals made (1010, broken in 1993).

title: 1980–81 Michigan Wolverines men's basketball team
text: Mark Bodnar became the first Michigan Wolverines player on record to total 13 assists in a game on December 13, 1980, against the Dayton Flyers

title: John Beilein
text: John Patrick Beilein (pronounced "bee-line"; born February 5, 1953) is an American college basketball coach and current men's basketball head coach at the University of Michigan.

title: John Beilein
text: He is the 16th head coach of the Michigan Wolverines.

title: John Beilein
text: The 2016–17 season is his tenth at Michigan.

title: John Beilein
text: Beilein has won 691 career games at four-year universities and 766 games altogether, including those at the junior college level.

title: John Beilein
text: He has previously coached the West Virginia Mountaineers (2002–2007), Richmond Spiders (1997–2002), Canisius Golden Griffins (1992–1997) in NCAA Division I as well as Le Moyne College (1983–1992), Nazareth College (1982–1983) and Erie Community College (1978–1982).

title: New Orleans Film Society
text: The New Orleans Film Society (NOFS) is a nonprofit arts organization located in New Orleans, Louisiana.

title: New Orleans Film Society
text: The organization presents and exhibits year-round film programming and events in addition to the annual New Orleans Film Festival.

title: Newswomen's Club of New York
text: The Newswomen's Club of New York is a nonprofit organization that focuses on women working in the media in the New York City metropolitan area.

title: Newswomen's Club of New York
text: It was founded in 1922 as the New York Newspaper Woman’s Club and included such well-known individuals as Eleanor Roosevelt, Helen Rogers Reid and Anne O'Hare McCormick among its membership; it changed its name in 1971 to include members working in magazines and broadcast media.

title: Newswomen's Club of New York
text: The organization presents its Front Page Award annually to honor the most prominent achievements by women in journalism.

title: Chris Noonan
text: Chris Noonan (born 14 November 1952) is a Sydney-based Australian filmmaker and actor best known for the family film "Babe" (1995), for which he was nominated for both the Academy Award for Best Director and Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay.

title: Alabama Broadcasters Association
text: The Alabama Broadcasters Association (ABA) represents radio and television broadcasters across the U.S. state of Alabama.

title: Alabama Broadcasters Association
text: It is affiliated with the National Association of Broadcasters.

title: Alabama Broadcasters Association
text: Every year the organization presents the ABBY (Alabama's Best in Broadcasting Yearly) Awards.

title: Alabama Broadcasters Association
text: The organization also has a Hall of Fame .

title: Public Art Fund
text: Public Art Fund is an independent, non-profit arts organization founded in 1977 by Doris C. Freedman.

title: Public Art Fund
text: The organization presents contemporary art in New York City's public spaces through a series of highly visible artists' projects, new commissions, installations, and exhibitions that are emblematic of the organization's mission and innovative history.

title: Public Art Fund
text: Nicholas Baume joined PAF as Director & Chief Curator in 2009, and Susan K. Freedman has served as the President since 1986.

title: Academy Award for Best Director
text: The Academy Award for Best Director (officially known as the Academy Award for Best Directing) is an award presented annually by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS).

title: Academy Award for Best Director
text: It is given in honor of a film director who has exhibited outstanding directing while working in the film industry.

title: Babe (film)
text: Babe is a 1995 Australian-American comedy-drama film directed by Chris Noonan, produced by George Miller, and written by both.

title: Babe (film)
text: It is an adaptation of Dick King-Smith's 1983 novel "The Sheep-Pig", also known as "Babe: The Gallant Pig" in the US, which tells the story of a pig who wants to be a sheepdog.

title: Babe (film)
text: The main animal characters are played by a combination of real and animatronic pigs and Border Collies.

title: The Center for Arts in Natick
text: The Center for Arts in Natick, also known as TCAN (pronounced tee-can) in Natick, Massachusetts, is a regional community arts organization serving the cities and towns of MetroWest Boston.

title: The Center for Arts in Natick
text: It has been in existence in various locations since 1997.

title: The Center for Arts in Natick
text: The organization presents more than 300 events, classes and performances each year attended by over 24,000 patrons annually.

title: The Center for Arts in Natick
text: TCAN was established as a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization in 1997.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: The Office of the Chief Trade Adviser (OCTA) is an independent trade advisory body of the Forum Island Countries.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: OCTA provides policy advice and capacity building support to the Forum Island Countries, particularly in the Pacific Agreement on Closer Economic Relations (PACER) Plus trade negotiations with Australia and New Zealand.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: OCTA was established on 29 March 2010 and is based in Port Vila, Vanuatu.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: The first to be appointed to the Chief Trade Adviser position was Chris Noonan, an academic from New Zealand.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: Noonan resigned in September 2011.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: The OCTA Governing Board then appointed Julia Tijaja, the Trade Policy Adviser, as Caretaker Chief Trade Adviser in the interim until the new Chief Trade Adviser came on board.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: In February 2012, Edwini Kessie, an international trade law expert, was appointed the new Chief Trade Adviser.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: Kessie took up his post in June 2012.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: Thirteen Forum Island Countries are currently members of the OCTA; Cook Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Kiribati, Nauru, Niue, Palau, Papua New Guinea, Marshal Islands, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Tonga, Tuvalu and Vanuatu.

title: Office of the Chief Trade Adviser
text: OCTA is fully owned and is under the exclusive control of its members.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: The League of American Orchestras, formerly the American Symphony Orchestra League, is a North American Musical Organization consisting of a network of approximately 800 orchestras.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: “Dedicated to helping orchestras meet the challenges of the twenty-first century,” the League consists of leading symphony and philharmonic orchestras, collegiate orchestras, community ensembles, and youth and student ensembles.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: The only national organization devoted and focused on elevating the orchestra industry, the League was founded in 1942 and later chartered by Congress in 1962.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: The League creates a network of all facets of the industry, including administrators, managers, board members, business partners, volunteers, and musicians.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: Each year this organization presents two awards: the Gold Baton Award and the Helen M. Thompson Award.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: The League affects the orchestral world through several outreach experiences, dedicated advocacy to music education and especially orchestral education, and maintaining and communicating a breadth of information and pertinent topics in publications.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: It has also developed detailed antitrust policy and guidelines in order to comply with the landscape of the industry.

title: League of American Orchestras
text: The League is a leading force in work on legislation regarding orchestras and support for the arts.

title: Defence Strategic Policy and Intelligence Group
text: The Defence Strategic Policy and Intelligence Group (SP&I) of the Australian Government Department of Defence is responsible for defence diplomacy, strategic policy, international security, and military intelligence coordination and advice to the Prime Minister of Australia, Minister for Defence, Secretary of the Department of Defence, and Chief of the Defence Force.

title: Defence Strategic Policy and Intelligence Group
text: The Defence Strategic Policy and Intelligence Group is led by the Deputy Secretary for Strategic Policy and Intelligence and comprises four policy divisions and three intelligence agencies, which are the Australian Defence Organisation members of the Australian Intelligence Community.

title: British intelligence agencies
text: The Government of the United Kingdom maintains intelligence agencies within several different government departments.

title: British intelligence agencies
text: The agencies are responsible for collecting and producing foreign and domestic intelligence, providing military intelligence, performing espionage and counter-espionage.

title: British intelligence agencies
text: Their intelligence assessments contribute to the conduct of the foreign relations of the United Kingdom, maintaining the national security of the United Kingdom, military planning and law enforcement in the United Kingdom.

title: British intelligence agencies
text: The three main agencies are the Secret Intelligence Service (MI6), the Security Service (MI5), and the Government Communications Headquarters (GCHQ).

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Gustav Laabs (born 20 December 1902-died 12 March 1980) was a German SS commander during the Nazi era.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: During the Second World War, he worked as a gas van operator at the Chełmno extermination camp in Wartheland.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: As an operator of a gas van, Laabs was directly involved in and responsible for the genocidal extermination of over 100,000 men, women and children, most of whom were killed on account of being Jewish.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: After the war, he was tried and convicted for his crimes against humanity.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Despite being convicted, Laabs was given the lenient sentence of 15 years (subsequently reduced to 13 years) by a regional court in Landgericht Bonn, Germany.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Far from being outliers, such instances of leniency, extended to perpetrators of genocide and crimes against humanity during trials in post-Nazi Germany, constituted the norm, as evidenced by the fact that most of the perpetrators of Nazi war crimes and the Final Solution were not brought to justice.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Many former SS officers and Nazis, who were directly responsible for perpetrating genocide and murdering countless innocent people, were contracted to work for US and British intelligence agencies as part of the war against the USSR and Communism (also see Operation Paperclip for more on post-WWII Allied collaboration with Nazis).

title: Alliance Base
text: Alliance Base was the cover name for a secret Western Counterterrorist Intelligence Center (CTIC) that existed between 2002 and 2009 in Paris.

title: Alliance Base
text: The existence of CTICs were first revealed by Dana Priest in a November 17, 2005 "Washington Post" article, while she referred to the Alliance Base in a July 2, 2005, article.

title: Alliance Base
text: The name was chosen in reference of Al Qaeda, which means "The Base" in Arabic.

title: Alliance Base
text: It was headed by a French General assigned to the Directorate-General for External Security (DGSE), and largely funded by the CIA's Counterterrorist Center.

title: Alliance Base
text: It hosted officers from Great Britain, France, Germany, Canada, Australia and the United States and was used for intelligence exchange and operational planning.

title: Alliance Base
text: Its existence was confirmed on 8 September 2006 by Christophe Chaboud, chief of the UCLAT (""Unité de Coordination de la Lutte contre le Terrorisme"", "Fight against Terrorism Coordination Unit"), in an interview to RFI.

title: Alliance Base
text: Although intelligence exchange between intelligence agencies has become more and more widespread in the last decade, in particular following the September 11, 2001 attacks, this organisation also engaged in operations.

title: Yulin Naval Base
text: Yulin Naval Base () is a naval base for nuclear submarines along the southern coast of Hainan Island, People's Republic of China.

title: Yulin Naval Base
text: This underground base has been reported by several intelligence agencies, especially Indian agencies.

title: Yulin Naval Base
text: The images collected by the Federation of American Scientists (FAS) in February 2008 shows that China constructed a large scale underground base for its naval forces.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: Sir Ardeshir Reporter was born in a Zoroastrian Parsee family in Bombay on August 22, 1865.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: He was a secret British Intelligence agent in Iran for many years.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: In fact, he lived and worked in Iran as a secret British Intelligence agent since 1893.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: He came to Iran under the cover of Times' reporter.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: It was he who introduced General Ironside to Reza Khan, and it was Ironside who encouraged Reza Khan to seize power.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: According to his own will, he was the one, who discovered Reza Khan and guided him in the coup on February 22, 1921.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: Therefore he was instrumental in Reza Khan’s 1921 military coup and the consequent establishment of the Pahlavi dynasty and enthronement of Reza Shah in Iran in 1925.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: Ardeshir Reporter died in Tehran in 1933.

title: Ardeshir Reporter
text: His son, Shapoor Reporter, was also a secret agent of the British Intelligence Service in Iran who served the Pahlavi family after Reza Shah's death.

title: Australian Secret Intelligence Service
text: The Australian Secret Intelligence Service (ASIS; ) is Australia's foreign intelligence agency.

title: Australian Secret Intelligence Service
text: ASIS was formed in 1952, but its existence remained secret even within the Government until 1972.

title: Australian Secret Intelligence Service
text: ASIS is part of the Australian Intelligence Community responsible for the collection of foreign intelligence, including both counter-intelligence and liaising with the intelligence agencies of other countries.

title: Australian Secret Intelligence Service
text: In these roles, ASIS is comparable to the British Secret Intelligence Service (MI6) and the American Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).

title: Defense Intelligence Agency in popular culture
text: The Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) is a military espionage organization of the United States and one of the country's national-level intelligence agencies under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD).

title: Defense Intelligence Agency in popular culture
text: Less known than its non-DoD equivalent or its cryptologic counterpart, the DIA and its personnel have at times been portrayed in works of American popular culture.

title: Defense Intelligence Agency in popular culture
text: As with other U.S. foreign intelligence organizations, the agency's role has occasionally been confused with those of law enforcement agencies.

title: Government Communications Headquarters
text: The Government Communications Headquarters (GCHQ) is an intelligence and security organisation responsible for providing signals intelligence (SIGINT) and information assurance to the government and armed forces of the United Kingdom.

title: Government Communications Headquarters
text: Based in "The Doughnut" in the suburbs of Cheltenham, GCHQ is the responsibility of the country's Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs, but it is not a part of the Foreign Office and its director ranks as a Permanent Secretary.

title: Israel's Secret Wars
text: It explores the role of secret intelligence and covert activities in the Zionist movement before independence and explore the operational and political histories all three major Israeli intelligence agencies Aman (military intelligence), Mossad (foreign intelligence and covert operations) and Shin Bet (internal security).

title: When a Man Falls in Love
text: When a Man Falls in Love () is a 2013 South Korean television series, starring Song Seung-heon, Shin Se-kyung, Chae Jung-an, and Yeon Woo-jin.

title: When a Man Falls in Love
text: The story revolves around a world-weary gangster as his love life intertwines with three others, and how the course of their lives changes entirely based on one moment of fevered passion.

title: When a Man Falls in Love
text: It aired on MBC from April 3 to June 6, 2013 on Wednesdays and Thursdays at 21:55 for 20 episodes.

title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince
text: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (; also known as Coffee Prince) is a 2007 South Korean television drama, starring Yoon Eun-hye, Gong Yoo, Lee Sun-kyun, and Chae Jung-an.

title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince
text: Based on the novel of the same name written by Lee Sun-mi, the hit series aired on MBC from July 2 to August 28, 2007 on Mondays and Tuesdays at 21:55 for 17 episodes.

title: A New Leaf (TV series)
text: A New Leaf () is a 2014 South Korean television series starring Kim Myung-min, Park Min-young, Kim Sang-joong and Chae Jung-an.

title: A New Leaf (TV series)
text: It aired on MBC from April 30 to June 26, 2014 on Wednesdays and Thursdays at 21:55 for 16 episodes.

title: Man to Man (TV series)
text: Man to Man () is a 2017 South Korean television series starring Park Hae-jin, Park Sung-woong, Kim Min-jung, Chae Jung-an and Yeon Jung-hoon.

title: Man to Man (TV series)
text: The show airs on JTBC every Friday and Saturday at 11:00pm KST.

title: Chae Jung-an
text: Chae Jung-An (born Jang Jung-An on September 9, 1977) is a South Korean actress and singer.

title: Cain and Abel (TV series)
text: Cain and Abel () is a 2009 South Korean television series starring So Ji-sub, Shin Hyun-joon, Han Ji-min, and Chae Jung-an.

title: Cain and Abel (TV series)
text: It aired on SBS from February 18 to April 23, 2009 on Wednesdays and Thursdays at 21:55 for 20 episodes.

title: Emperor of the Sea
text: Emperor of the Sea (; literally "Sea God") is a South Korean television drama series starring Choi Soo-jong, Chae Shi-ra, Song Il-gook، Soo Ae and Chae Jung-an It aired on KBS2 from November 24, 2004 to May 25, 2005 on Wednesdays and Thursdays at 21:55 for 51 episodes.

title: Emperor of the Sea
text: The period drama is based on Choi In-ho's 2003 novel "Hae-sin", which depicts the life of Jang Bogo, who rises from a lowly slave to a powerful maritime figure who dominated the East Asia seas and international trade during the Unified Silla Dynasty.

title: Prime Minister and I
text: Prime Minister and I () is a 2013 South Korean television drama starring Im Yoon-ah, Lee Beom-soo, Yoon Shi-yoon, Chae Jung-an and Ryu Jin.

title: Prime Minister and I
text: It aired on KBS2 from December 9, 2013 to February 4, 2014 on Mondays and Tuesdays at 22:00 for 17 episodes.

title: Queen of Reversals
text: Queen of Reversals () is a 2010 South Korean romantic comedy television series, starring Kim Nam-joo, Jung Joon-ho, Park Si-hoo and Chae Jung-an.

title: Queen of Reversals
text: It is about a career woman who experiences the many ups, downs, and reversals of work, family, and romance as she falls in and out of love and marriage.

title: Queen of Reversals
text: It aired on MBC from October 18, 2010 to February 1, 2011 on Mondays and Tuesdays at 21:55 for 31 episodes.

title: Yeon Woo-jin
text: Yeon Woo-jin (born Kim Bong-hoe on July 5, 1984) is a South Korean actor.

title: Yeon Woo-jin
text: He started in the entertainment industry as a model and gained recognition with his leading roles in "Marriage, Not Dating" (2014), "Divorce Lawyer in Love" (2015), "Introverted Boss" (2017) and "Queen for Seven Days" (2017).

title: Jean Carper
text: Jean Carper (born January 3, 1932) is a New York Times best-selling author, an American medical journalist, contributing editor to USA Weekend Magazine, and author of 24 books including 100 Simple Things You Can Do to Prevent Alzheimer's, Your Miracle Brain, Miracle Cures, the award-winning Stop Aging Now!

title: Jean Carper
text: , and The Food Pharmacy.

title: Amell Santana
text: Amell Santa de Jesus (born July 30, 1987, in Sabana de la Mar) is a Dominican beauty pageant contestant.

title: Amell Santana
text: She competed in Miss Dominican Republic Universe 2005, representing the province of Hato Mayor, and ended as 1st runner-up.

title: Amell Santana
text: Santana then competed in Miss Dominican Republic 2005 and also placed as 1st runner-up.

title: Amell Santana
text: Receiving most of the judge votes, she was crowned as Miss Tierra República Dominicana 2005.

title: Amell Santana
text: A few months later, she represented the Dominican Republic in the 2005 Miss Earth pageant, placing as 1st runner-up.

title: Deanna Loveland
text: Deanna Marie Loveland (born April 5, 1989) is an American recording artist, harpist, pianist and fashion designer.

title: Deanna Loveland
text: She began her career performing the harp at private functions, weddings and celebrity events for Jerry Bruckheimer and his wife, Linda.

title: Deanna Loveland
text: Consequently, she began songwriting and in 2005 her original song, "Shine" was 1st Runner-Up out of 12,000 entries in USA Weekend Magazine's national songwriting competition judged by Simon Cowell and Fantasia Barrino.

title: Deanna Loveland
text: In March 2007 Loveland released her solo harp album, "Moments".

title: Deanna Loveland
text: A month later she signed with a talent agency, appearing in music videos and commercials for companies including Toyota and Target and films including "A Pure Country Gift II" and "Country Strong".

title: Gloria Almonte
text: Almonte won the Miss New York Teen USA 2001 title in late 2000, after placing 2nd Runner-Up in the same competition the year prior.

title: Gloria Almonte
text: She represented New York at the Miss Teen USA 2001 pageant held in South Padre Island, Texas on August 22, 2001 where placed 1st Runner-Up to Marissa Whitley of Missouri.

title: Gloria Almonte
text: This was New York's first placement since 1996 and their highest since 1988, when Jessica Collins also placed 1st Runner-Up.

title: Miss New York USA
text: The Miss New York USA competition is the pageant that selects the representative for the state of New York in the Miss USA pageant.

title: Miss New York USA
text: New York is one of the most successful states at Miss USA, and is ranked third in terms of number and value of placement across all years of competition .

title: Miss New York USA
text: New York's strongest run was an unbroken string of placements from 1957 to 1966.

title: Miss New York USA
text: New York also had a streak of 3 consecutive 1st runner-up placements from 1972 to 1974.

title: Miss New York USA
text: In 1954, Karin Huitman was 2nd runner-up.

title: Miss New York USA
text: She later moved up to be 1st runner-up, as the original 1st runner-up, Miss Virginia USA was dethroned due to underage (she was 16).

title: Miss New York USA
text: As there was no rule in 1954 that if Miss USA won Miss Universe, first runner-up became Miss USA, Karin was only 1st runner-up.

title: Miss New York USA
text: Huitman went on to become Miss World USA 1954 and 1st runner-up at Miss World 1954.

title: Target Corporation
text: Target Corporation is the second-largest discount store retailer in the United States, behind Walmart, and a component of the S&P 500 Index.

title: Target Corporation
text: Founded by George Dayton and headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the company was originally named Goodfellow Dry Goods in June 1902 before being renamed the Dayton's Dry Goods Company in 1903 and later the Dayton Company in 1910.

title: Target Corporation
text: The first Target store opened in Roseville, Minnesota in 1962 while the parent company was renamed the Dayton Corporation in 1967.

title: Target Corporation
text: It became the Dayton-Hudson Corporation after merging with the J.L. Hudson Company in 1969 and held ownership of several department store chains including Dayton's, Hudson's, Marshall Field's, and Mervyn's.

title: Miss North Dakota Teen USA
text: Compared to the sister Miss North Dakota USA pageant, North Dakota Teen USAs have been quite successful at Miss Teen USA, and are ranked fifteenth in terms of number and value of placements .

title: Miss North Dakota Teen USA
text: North Dakota is one of only ten states to have had nine or more semifinalist (or better) placings at Miss Teen USA .

title: Miss North Dakota Teen USA
text: Despite this, no Miss North Dakota Teen USA has won the Miss Teen USA crown, and in fact the highest placement ever reached by a North Dakota teen is 2nd runner-up, which was awarded to Katie Cooper 2006.

title: Miss North Dakota Teen USA
text: The new record was made until Audra Mari placed 1st runner-up in 2011.

title: Mary Murphy (news personality)
text: Mary Murphy is an American television personality, print journalist and author.

title: Mary Murphy (news personality)
text: She is an on-air correspondent for "The Insider" and a news producer at "Entertainment Tonight".

title: Mary Murphy (news personality)
text: Murphy is also a Senior Lecturer at USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism.

title: Mary Murphy (news personality)
text: She is a contributor to the "Los Angeles Times Magazine", "USA Weekend Magazine", the "New York Post" and "The Hollywood Reporter".

title: Mary Murphy (news personality)
text: Murphy has been on the staff of the "Los Angeles Times" and New York, "Esquire", and "TV Guide" Magazines.

title: Carole Gist
text: Carole Anne-Marie Gist (born May 8, 1969) is an American TV host, model and first African American woman to win the Miss USA title.

title: Carole Gist
text: Gist first won the title of Miss Michigan USA and went on to win the Miss USA crown on March 2, 1990 in Wichita, Kansas.

title: Carole Gist
text: The 1990 pageant had representatives from Georgia (Brenda Leithleiter), Alaska (Karin Elizabeth Meyer), Kentucky (Tiffany Tenfelde), South Carolina (Gina Tolleson, who as 1st runner-up then went on to represent the country at the Miss World pageant, winning the title) and Karin Hartz of New Jersey making up with Gist the Top 6 finalists.

title: Carole Gist
text: Gist, a 5 ft Detroit native, 20 years old at the time, eventually became first runner-up to Mona Grudt of Norway in the Miss Universe pageant of that same year.

title: Carole Gist
text: She was also the first contestant from Michigan to win Miss USA, and broke the five-year streak of winners from Texas.

title: Anne Marie Braafheid
text: Anne Marie Braafheid became the first black woman to attain the position of 1st runner-up in the Miss Universe contest.

title: Anne Marie Braafheid
text: She was the second black woman to reach the top 15 finalists position, after Evelyn Miot of Haiti in 1962.

title: Anne Marie Braafheid
text: She represented Curaçao in the 1968 pageant, and was featured in Ebony Magazine after achieving 1st runner-up status

title: Follow the Yellow Brick Road
text: Follow the Yellow Brick Road is a television play by Dennis Potter, first broadcast in 1972 as part of BBC Two's "The Sextet" series of eight plays featuring the same six actors.

title: Follow the Yellow Brick Road
text: The play's central theme is of popular culture becoming the inheritor of religious scripture, which anticipated Potter's later serial "Pennies from Heaven" (1978).

title: Follow the Yellow Brick Road
text: The play's title is taken from the song used in "The Wizard of Oz", another version of which features in the incidental music.

title: List of Life on Mars (UK TV series) episodes
text: "Life on Mars" is a British television drama series, produced by Kudos Film & Television for the BBC in 2006 and 2007.

title: List of Life on Mars (UK TV series) episodes
text: The transmission dates given below refer to the original UK showings on the BBC — for the first series in 2006 all episodes premiered on BBC One, but for the second series in 2007 two of the episodes had their first showing on the digital television channel BBC Four.

title: List of Life on Mars (UK TV series) episodes
text: For these episodes, both the BBC Four and BBC One premiere dates are given.

title: Round the Horne
text: Round the Horne is a BBC Radio comedy programme that was transmitted in four series of weekly episodes from 1965 until 1968.

title: Round the Horne
text: The series was created by Barry Took and Marty Feldman, with others contributing to later series after Feldman returned to performing, and starred Kenneth Horne, with Kenneth Williams, Hugh Paddick, Betty Marsden and Bill Pertwee.

title: Round the Horne
text: The show's announcer was Douglas Smith and from time to time he took part in the sketches.

title: Round the Horne
text: It had musical interludes by close harmony singing group the Fraser Hayes Four, and accompaniment by the big band of Edwin Braden ("the great, 'airy fool" according to Kenneth Williams), known as Edwin Braden and the Hornblowers.

title: Round the Horne
text: The band was actually the BBC Radio Orchestra but was never billed as such.

title: Round the Horne
text: In the fourth series, all the musical duties were performed by the smaller Max Harris Group.

title: Round the Horne
text: Took and the cast had worked on the predecessor series "Beyond Our Ken".

title: Round the Horne
text: The name is a pun on the nautical phrase for sailing around Cape Horn.

title: Pennies from Heaven (TV series)
text: Pennies From Heaven is a 1978 BBC musical drama serial written by Dennis Potter.

title: Pennies from Heaven (TV series)
text: The title is taken from the song "Pennies from Heaven" written by Johnny Burke and Arthur Johnston.

title: Pennies from Heaven (TV series)
text: It was one of several Potter serials (another being "The Singing Detective") to mix the reality of the drama with a dark fantasy content, and the earliest of his works where the characters burst into extended performances of popular songs.

title: ShakespeaRe-Told
text: ShakespeaRe-Told is the umbrella title for a series of four television adaptations of William Shakespeare's plays broadcast on BBC One during November 2005.

title: ShakespeaRe-Told
text: In a similar manner to the 2003 production of "The Canterbury Tales", each play is adapted by a different writer, and relocated to the present day.

title: ShakespeaRe-Told
text: The plays were produced in collaboration by BBC Northern Ireland and the central BBC drama department.

title: ShakespeaRe-Told
text: In August 2006 the four films aired on BBC America.

title: Harry Lloyd
text: Harry Charles Salusbury Lloyd (born 17 November 1983) is an English actor.

title: Harry Lloyd
text: He is known for his roles as Will Scarlet in the 2006 BBC drama "Robin Hood", Jeremy Baines in the 2007 "Doctor Who" episodes "Human Nature" and "The Family of Blood", and Viserys Targaryen in the HBO series "Game of Thrones".

title: Harry Lloyd
text: He has also appeared on stage, and in films including "The Theory of Everything" and "Anthropoid".

title: Dawn French's Girls Who Do Comedy
text: Dawn French's Girls Who Do Comedy is an interview series shown on BBC Four.

title: Dawn French's Girls Who Do Comedy
text: In the series, Dawn French interviewed some of the most prolific comedians of the century from Phyllis Diller to Catherine Tate and asked about life, love, family and comedy.

title: Dawn French's Girls Who Do Comedy
text: The series was shown as three episodes featuring clips from French's various interviews with different comedians, however, from 25 to 30 December 2006 BBC Four showed six full interviews of 20–30 minutes.

title: Dawn French's Girls Who Do Comedy
text: They are (in order of re-broadcast on BBC Four) Whoopi Goldberg, Catherine Tate, Kathy Burke, Julie Walters, Victoria Wood and Joan Rivers.

title: Dawn French's Girls Who Do Comedy
text: This is one of the last interviews done with the late comedian Linda Smith.

title: Dawn French's Girls Who Do Comedy
text: Each episode ends with a tribute to Linda Smith.

title: Cheryl Campbell
text: Cheryl Campbell (born 22 May 1949) is an English actor of stage, film and television.

title: Cheryl Campbell
text: She starred opposite Bob Hoskins in the 1978 BBC drama "Pennies From Heaven", before going on to win the 1980 BAFTA TV Award for Best Actress for "Testament of Youth" and "Malice Aforethought", and the 1982 Olivier Award for Best Actress in a Revival for "A Doll's House".

title: Cheryl Campbell
text: Her film appearances include "Chariots of Fire" (1981), "" (1984) and "The Shooting Party" (1985).

title: Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa!
text: Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa!

title: Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa!
text: is a 2006 BBC Four television play starring Michael Sheen as the English comic actor Kenneth Williams, based on Williams' own diaries.

title: Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa!
text: Cheryl Campbell plays Williams's beloved mother, Lou.

title: Pennies from Heaven (1981 film)
text: Pennies from Heaven is a 1981 American musical romantic drama film adapted from a 1978 BBC television drama.

title: Pennies from Heaven (1981 film)
text: Dennis Potter adapted his own screenplay from the BBC series for American audiences, changing its setting from London and the Forest of Dean to Depression-era Chicago and rural Illinois.

title: Miss USA 1973
text: Miss USA 1973, the 22nd Miss USA pageant, was televised live by CBS from Broadway Theatre, New York City, New York on May 19, 1973, Hosted by Bob Barker who 8 months earlier began hosting The Price Is Right on CBS.

title: Shawnae Jebbia
text: Jebbia won the Miss Massachusetts USA title in 1997, in her first attempt at a pageant title.

title: Shawnae Jebbia
text: She went on to represent Massachusetts in the Miss USA 1998 pageant, becoming that state's first Miss USA winner.

title: Shawnae Jebbia
text: Whilst Jebbia had little prior experience, her first runner-up Shauna Gambill had previously held the Miss Teen USA 1994 title.

title: Shawnae Jebbia
text: Jebbia's "sister" titleholder, Miss Massachusetts Teen USA 1998 Susie Castillo, went on to hold the Miss Massachusetts USA title and became Massachusetts' second Miss USA titleholder in 2003.

title: Miss New York USA
text: The Miss New York USA competition is the pageant that selects the representative for the state of New York in the Miss USA pageant.

title: Miss New York USA
text: New York is one of the most successful states at Miss USA, and is ranked third in terms of number and value of placement across all years of competition .

title: Miss New York USA
text: New York's strongest run was an unbroken string of placements from 1957 to 1966.

title: Miss New York USA
text: New York also had a streak of 3 consecutive 1st runner-up placements from 1972 to 1974.

title: Miss New York USA
text: In 1954, Karin Huitman was 2nd runner-up.

title: Miss New York USA
text: She later moved up to be 1st runner-up, as the original 1st runner-up, Miss Virginia USA was dethroned due to underage (she was 16).

title: Miss New York USA
text: As there was no rule in 1954 that if Miss USA won Miss Universe, first runner-up became Miss USA, Karin was only 1st runner-up.

title: Miss New York USA
text: Huitman went on to become Miss World USA 1954 and 1st runner-up at Miss World 1954.

title: Miss USA 1956
text: Miss USA 1956, the fifth edition of Miss USA was held on 18 July 1956, at Long Beach Municipal Auditorium, Long Beach, California.

title: Miss USA 1956
text: They had 43 young ladies in the competition.

title: Miss USA 1956
text: Miss Iowa USA, Carol Morris, won the competition and later became Miss Universe.

title: Miss USA 1956
text: She became the first contestant from Iowa to win the Miss USA competition.

title: Miss USA 1956
text: She was crowned by Miss USA 1955, Carlene King Johnson of Vermont.

title: Miss USA 1968
text: Miss USA 1968, the 17th Miss USA pageant, was televised live by CBS from Miami Beach, Florida on May 18, 1968 hosted by Bob Barker.

title: Bob Barker
text: Robert William Barker (born December 12, 1923) is an American former television game show host.

title: Bob Barker
text: He is known for hosting CBS's "The Price Is Right" from 1972 to 2007, making it the longest-running daytime game show in North American television history, and for hosting "Truth or Consequences" from 1956 to 1974.

title: Dorothy Anstett
text: Anstett competed in the Miss Washington pageant in July 1967 and placed first runner-up.

title: Dorothy Anstett
text: In April of the following year she won the Miss Washington USA 1968 crown title.

title: Dorothy Anstett
text: She won the Miss USA 1968 title on May 19, 1968 and represented the United States at Miss Universe 1968 in July, where she placed fourth runner-up.

title: Miss USA 1967
text: Miss USA 1967, the 16th Miss USA pageant, was won by Sylvia Hitchcock of Alabama.

title: Miss USA 1967
text: She was crowned by Miss USA 1966, Maria Remenyi of California.

title: Miss USA 1967
text: It took place on the Miami Beach Auditorium in Miami Beach, Florida.

title: Miss USA 1967
text: Hitchcock won Miss Universe later and her 2nd runner-up Cheryl Patton later becames Miss USA because the 1st runner-up refused the title.

title: Tanya Wilson
text: Wilson placed second runner-up in the Miss Nevada pageant in 1969 and also competed in 1970.

title: Tanya Wilson
text: After moving to Honolulu with her mother, Wilson won the Miss Hawaii USA title in early May 1972.

title: Tanya Wilson
text: Two weeks later she represented her state in the Miss USA 1972 pageant, held in Dorado, Puerto Rico and won the Miss USA title.

title: Tanya Wilson
text: She was crowned by Michele McDonald of Pennsylvania, Miss USA 1971.

title: Tanya Wilson
text: Wilson was the second of four women from Hawaii to win the Miss USA title.

title: Miss Montana USA
text: The Miss Montana USA competition is the pageant that selects the representative for the state of Montana in the Miss USA pageant.

title: Miss Montana USA
text: Montana is one of the least successful states in Miss USA history, but there has been success in other pageants.

title: Miss Montana USA
text: Miss Montana USA 2005 Amanda Kimmel was chosen to represent the United States in the 2005 Miss Earth pageant.

title: Miss Montana USA
text: Although she failed to place at Miss USA, Kimmel finished in the top 8 at Miss Earth.

title: Miss Montana USA
text: The current titleholder is Dani Walker of Billings.

title: List of Crash Bandicoot video games
text: "Crash Bandicoot" is a video game series created by Andy Gavin and Jason Rubin.

title: List of Crash Bandicoot video games
text: It is published by Activision, Sierra Entertainment, Vivendi Universal Games, Konami, Universal Interactive Studios, and Sony Computer Entertainment, with entries developed by Polarbit, Radical Entertainment, Vicarious Visions, Traveller's Tales, Eurocom, and Naughty Dog.

title: List of Crash Bandicoot video games
text: The series debuted in 1996 with the Sony PlayStation video game "Crash Bandicoot", premiered in North America on September 9, 1996.

title: List of Crash Bandicoot video games
text: Most "Crash Bandicoot" games have either been platform games or released for Sony consoles and handhelds.

title: Hoyle Puzzle Games 2005
text: Hoyle Puzzle Games 2005 is a 2005 puzzle video game published by Sierra Entertainment.

title: Hoyle Puzzle Games 2005
text: "Hoyle Puzzle Games 2005" was released in US on January 1, 2005.

title: World in Conflict
text: World in Conflict is a 2007 real-time strategy (RTS) video game developed by the Swedish video game company Massive Entertainment and published by Sierra Entertainment for Microsoft Windows.

title: World in Conflict
text: The game was released in September 2007, receiving generally favorable reviews and several awards.

title: World in Conflict
text: The game is considered by some to be the spiritual successor of "Ground Control", another game by Massive Entertainment, and is generally conceived by its designers to be a real-time tactical game, despite being marketed as a RTS game.

title: F.E.A.R.
text: F.E.A.R. First Encounter Assault Recon is a survival horror first-person shooter video game developed by Monolith Productions and published by Sierra Entertainment.

title: F.E.A.R.
text: It was released on October 17, 2005, for Microsoft Windows, and ported by Day 1 Studios to the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3.

title: F.E.A.R.
text: TimeGate Studios has released two expansion packs, "F.E.A.R. Extraction Point" in October 2006, and "F.E.A.R. Perseus Mandate" in November 2007.

title: F.E.A.R.
text: A direct sequel titled "", was released in February 2009, and a second sequel, "F.3.

title: F.E.A.R.
text: A.R.", was released in June 2011, though it was developed by Day 1 Studios (now known as Wargaming Chicago-Baltimore), not by Monolith Productions.

title: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions
text: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions is a 2014 multidirectional shooter video game developed by Lucid Games and published by Activision under the Sierra Entertainment brand name.

title: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions
text: The game was released on November 25, 2014 for Microsoft Windows, OS X, GNU/Linux, PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4, on November 26, 2014 for Xbox 360 and Xbox One and in the middle of 2015 for iOS and Android.

title: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions
text: "Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions" is the first Sierra video game not to be owned by their former owner Vivendi.

title: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions
text: It is the sixth installment in the "Geometry Wars" series, and the first one developed after the creator of the series Bizarre Creations was shut down by Activision.

title: Roberta Williams
text: Roberta Williams (born February 16, 1953) is an American video game designer, writer, and a co-founder of Sierra On-Line (later known as Sierra Entertainment), who developed her first game while living in Simi Valley, California.

title: Roberta Williams
text: She is most famous for her pioneering work in the field of graphic adventure games with titles such as "Mystery House", the "King's Quest" series, and "Phantasmagoria".

title: Roberta Williams
text: She is married to Ken Williams and retired from her career in 1999.

title: Roberta Williams
text: Roberta Williams is one of the most influential PC game designers of the 1980s and 1990s, and has been credited with creating the graphic adventure genre.

title: Crash: Mind over Mutant
text: Crash: Mind over Mutant is a platform video game published by Activision in North America and by Sierra Entertainment internationally and developed by Vancouver-based Radical Entertainment for the PlayStation 2, PlayStation Portable (ported by Virtuos), Wii and Xbox 360.

title: Crash: Mind over Mutant
text: The Nintendo DS version of the game was developed by TOSE.

title: Crash: Mind over Mutant
text: It was released in North America on October 7, 2008 and was later released in Europe and Australia on October 31.

title: Crash: Mind over Mutant
text: It is the second game in the series not to have a Japanese release, after "Crash of the Titans".

title: Crash of the Titans
text: Crash of the Titans is a platform game published by Sierra Entertainment and developed by Vancouver-based Radical Entertainment for the PlayStation 2, PlayStation Portable (ported by SuperVillain Studios), Wii and Xbox 360.

title: Crash of the Titans
text: The Game Boy Advance and Nintendo DS versions of the game were developed by Amaze Entertainment.

title: Crash of the Titans
text: The game was first released in North America on October 3, 2007, in Europe on October 12, 2007 and in Australia on October 25, 2007.

title: Crash of the Titans
text: It is the first game in the "Crash Bandicoot" series not to have a Japanese release.

title: Alma Wade
text: Alma Wade is a major antagonist and key figure in the "F.E.A.R." series of first-person shooter horror video games by Monolith Productions, introduced in "F.E.A.R." in 2005.

title: Alma Wade
text: The mystery of Alma is the very core of the series.

title: Hoyle Casino
text: Hoyle Casino is a virtual casino video game published by Encore, Inc. It was previously published by Sierra Entertainment for a variety of different platforms, including Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X, Sega Dreamcast, and Game Boy Color.

title: Tom Hollander
text: Thomas Anthony Hollander (born 25 August 1967) is an English actor.

title: Tom Hollander
text: He began his career in theatre, winning the Ian Charleson Award in 1992 for his performance as Witwoud in "The Way of the World" at the Lyric Hammersmith Theatre.

title: Tom Hollander
text: He is known for his roles in comedic films such as "Pirates of the Caribbean" and "In the Loop" and drama films such as "Enigma", "Pride & Prejudice", "Gosford Park", and "Hanna".

title: Tom Hollander
text: He played the lead role in the sitcom "Rev.", which won the British Academy Television Award for best sitcom in 2011.

title: Tom Hollander
text: He also played the lead in the ITV's "Doctor Thorne" and won the BAFTA Television Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role as Major Lance "Corky" Corkoran in the BBC series "The Night Manager".

title: Robert Glenister
text: Robert Lewis Glenister (born 11th March 1960) is an English actor known for his roles as con man Ash "Three Socks" Morgan in the BBC television series "Hustle" and Nicholas Blake in the BBC spy drama "Spooks".

title: Tom Burke (actor)
text: Tom Liam Benedict Burke (born 30 June 1981) is an English actor.

title: Tom Burke (actor)
text: He is best known for his role as Athos in the BBC series "The Musketeers" (2014–2016), as Dolokhov in the BBC literary-adaptation miniseries "War & Peace" and most recently for his role as the titular character Cormoran Strike in the BBC series "Strike" (2017).

title: Steven Hartley
text: Steven Hartley (born 12 August 1960, in Shipley) is an English actor known internationally for his television, film and theatre roles.

title: Steven Hartley
text: He has appeared in over 40 principle and leading roles on television and film since 1985, including "EastEnders", "The Bill", "The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles", "Rumble", "Strictly Confidential", "Badboys", "Trial & Retribution", "Sharman", "Holby City", "Casualty", "Doctors", "Pie in the Sky", "The Cut", "Agatha Christie's Marple", "Merlin", "Married... with Children", "The Borgias", "Vera" alongside Brenda Blethyn, "Ripper Street", and the acclaimed BBC series "Happy Valley" and "Silent Witness" in 2015.

title: Close to the Enemy
text: Close to the Enemy is a British period drama miniseries set in the late 1940s in London.

title: Close to the Enemy
text: It is written and directed by Stephen Poliakoff, starring Jim Sturgess, Freddie Highmore, Charlotte Riley, Phoebe Fox, Alfred Molina, Lindsay Duncan, August Diehl, Alfie Allen, Angela Bassett, Antje Traue, Lily G and Robert Glenister.

title: Close to the Enemy
text: It premiered in the United Kingdom on BBC Two on 10 November 2016.

title: Mark Williams (actor)
text: Mark Williams (born 22 August 1959) is an English actor, screenwriter and presenter.

title: Mark Williams (actor)
text: He is best known as Arthur Weasley in the "Harry Potter" films, and as one of the stars of the popular BBC sketch show "The Fast Show".

title: Mark Williams (actor)
text: He also played Brian Williams (father of Rory Williams) in the BBC series "Doctor Who", and Olaf Petersen in "Red Dwarf".

title: Mark Williams (actor)
text: More recently he has appeared as the title character in the BBC series "Father Brown".

title: Caroline Hayes
text: Caroline Hayes is an English actress currently working and living in London.

title: Caroline Hayes
text: She has appeared on stage and television in the UK and Canada, most notably in the BBC series "The Sins", alongside Pete Postlethwaite and Geraldine James, and Servants, another BBC series featuring Joe Absolom.

title: Caroline Hayes
text: She also starred in the highly acclaimed Donmar Warehouse production of "The Real Thing" by Tom Stoppard alongside Steven Dillane and Jennifer Ehle.

title: Caroline Hayes
text: In the North American market, she had a supporting role in two episodes of the Canadian science fiction TV series "Starhunter".

title: Peter Barkworth
text: Peter Wynn Barkworth (14 January 1929 – 21 October 2006) was an English actor.

title: Peter Barkworth
text: He twice won the BAFTA TV Award for Best Actor; for "Crown Matrimonial" in 1975 and for "Professional Foul" and "The Country Party" in 1978.

title: Peter Barkworth
text: He also starred in the ITV series "Manhunt" (1970) and the BBC series "Telford's Change" (1979).

title: Peter Barkworth
text: His film appearances included "Where Eagles Dare" (1968), "Patton" (1970), "International Velvet" (1978) and "Champions" (1984).

title: Andrew Burt
text: Andrew Burt (born 23 May 1945 in Wakefield, England) is a retired English actor, who has appeared in many British TV drama series from the 1970s to the present day.

title: Andrew Burt
text: He is perhaps best known as the original Jack Sugden in "Emmerdale Farm", a role he played from 1972 to 1974 (with a brief return in 1976), before handing over the character to another actor, Clive Hornby.

title: Andrew Burt
text: He played the brother of Lesley Whittle in the 1977 film "The Black Panther", and had the eponymous starring role in the BBC series "The Legend of King Arthur" (1979).

title: Tony Booth (actor)
text: Anthony George Booth (9 October 1931 – 25 September 2017, later known as Tony and Antony) was an English actor, best known for his role as Mike Rawlins in the BBC series "Till Death Us Do Part", and as the father-in-law of the former Prime Minister, Tony Blair.

title: Split Rock Lighthouse State Park
text: Split Rock Lighthouse State Park is a state park of Minnesota on the North Shore of Lake Superior.

title: Split Rock Lighthouse State Park
text: It is best known for the picturesque Split Rock Lighthouse, one of the most photographed lighthouses in the United States.

title: Split Rock Lighthouse State Park
text: Built by the United States Lighthouse Service in 1910, the lighthouse and some adjacent buildings have been restored and the Minnesota Historical Society operates them as a museum.

title: Split Rock Lighthouse State Park
text: The 2200 acre state park offers a unique cart-in campground and scenic trails for hiking, cross-country skiing, and bicycling.

title: Baldred Rock
text: Baldred Rock ( ) is a rock in Fitchie Bay at Laurie Island in the South Orkney Islands.

title: Baldred Rock
text: It lies close off the south side of Ferrier Peninsula, 0.75 nmi east-southeast of Graptolite Island.

title: Baldred Rock
text: This rock was mapped by the Scottish National Antarctic Expedition under William Speirs Bruce, 1902–04, and was later named "Bass Rock" owing to its likeness to the Bass Rock in Scotland.

title: Baldred Rock
text: The name Bass Rock has also appeared on charts as an alternative name for an island in the Joinville Island group.

title: Baldred Rock
text: To avoid confusion of these names, in 1954 the UK Antarctic Place-Names Committee recommended an entirely new name for the rock at Fitchie Bay.

title: Baldred Rock
text: Baldred Rock is named after Saint Baldred, the first hermit known to have lived on the Scottish Bass Rock.

title: Black Rock Harbor Light
text: Black Rock Harbor Light, also known as Fayerweather Island Light, is a lighthouse in Bridgeport, Connecticut, United States which stands on the south end of Fayerweather Island and marks the entrance to Black Rock Harbor.

title: Black Rock Harbor Light
text: The first lighthouse at the site, built by Abisha Woodward under contract with the United States government, was a wooden tower that was lit and made operational by 1808.

title: Black Rock Harbor Light
text: A storm destroyed the tower in 1821 and the current, stone lighthouse was erected in its place in 1823.

title: Black Rock Harbor Light
text: The Black Rock Harbor Light was an active navigational aid until 1933 when it was replaced by two automatic lights offshore.

title: Black Rock Harbor Light
text: The beacon was subsequently given to the City of Bridgeport in 1934.

title: Black Rock Harbor Light
text: Two significant efforts during the 1980s and 1990s served to restore the aging tower and the light was relit as a non-navigational aid in 2000.

title: Black Rock Harbor Light
text: Black Rock Lighthouse is listed as a contributing property for Bridgeport's Seaside Park historic district.

title: Bass Rock Lighthouse
text: The Bass Rock Lighthouse on Bass Rock is a 20 m lighthouse, built in 1902 by David Stevenson, who demolished the 13th-century keep, or governor's house, and some other buildings within the castle for the stone.

title: Bass Rock Lighthouse
text: The commissioners of the Northern Lighthouse Board decided that a lighthouse should be erected on the Bass Rock in July 1897 along with another light at Barns Ness near Dunbar.

title: Bass Rock Lighthouse
text: The cost of constructing the Bass Rock light was £8,087, a light first being shone from the rock on the evening of 1 November 1902.

title: Bass Rock Lighthouse
text: It has been unmanned since 1988 and is remotely monitored from the board’s headquarters in Edinburgh.

title: Bass Rock Lighthouse
text: Until the automation the lighthouse was lit by incandescent gas obtained from vaporised paraffin oil converted into a bunsen gas for heating a mantle.

title: Bass Rock Lighthouse
text: Since that time a new biform ML300 synchronised bifilament 20-watt electric lamp has been used.

title: Split Rock Lighthouse
text: Split Rock Lighthouse is a lighthouse located southwest of Silver Bay, Minnesota, USA on the North Shore of Lake Superior.

title: Split Rock Lighthouse
text: The structure was designed by lighthouse engineer Ralph Russell Tinkham and was completed in 1910 by the United States Lighthouse Service at a cost of $75,000, including the buildings and the land.

title: Split Rock Lighthouse
text: It is considered one of the most picturesque lighthouses in the United States.

title: New Brighton Lighthouse
text: New Brighton Lighthouse or Perch Rock Lighthouse, is a decommissioned lighthouse situated at the confluence of the River Mersey and Liverpool Bay on an outcrop off New Brighton known locally as Perch Rock.

title: New Brighton Lighthouse
text: Together with its neighbour, the Napoleonic era Fort Perch Rock, it is one of the Wirral's best known landmarks.

title: Bass Rock
text: The Bass Rock, or simply the Bass ( ), is an island in the outer part of the Firth of Forth in the east of Scotland.

title: Bass Rock
text: Approximately 2 km offshore, and 5 km north-east of North Berwick, it is a steep-sided volcanic rock, 107 m at its highest point, and is home to a large colony of gannets.

title: Bass Rock
text: The rock is uninhabited, but historically has been settled by an early Christian hermit, and later was the site of an important castle, which after the Commonwealth period was used as a prison.

title: Bass Rock
text: The island belongs to Sir Hew Hamilton-Dalrymple, whose family acquired it in 1706, and before to the Lauder family for almost six centuries.

title: Bass Rock
text: The Bass Rock Lighthouse was constructed on the rock in 1902, and the remains of an ancient chapel survive.

title: Halfway Rock Light
text: Halfway Rock Lighthouse is a lighthouse located on a barren ledge in Casco Bay, Maine.

title: Halfway Rock Light
text: The lighthouse tower, which has a height of 76 ft , and the attached ex-boathouse are all that remain, as the other buildings have been taken away in storms.

title: Halfway Rock Light
text: The name "Halfway Rock" comes from the position of the rock which is halfway between Cape Elizabeth and Cape Small, the southwest and northeast extremities of Casco Bay, which are about 18 nmi apart.

title: Ida Lewis Rock Light
text: Ida Lewis Lighthouse, which was formerly the Lime Rock Lighthouse, is in the Newport harbor in Rhode Island.

title: Ida Lewis Rock Light
text: It is named after Ida Lewis, who lived and worked at the lighthouse from 1857 and was the official lighthouse keeper from 1879 until her death in 1911.

title: Ida Lewis Rock Light
text: She was celebrated for many acts of bravery in saving lives.

title: Canty Bay
text: Canty Bay is a coastal hamlet off the A198, in East Lothian, Scotland, situated opposite the Bass Rock and Tantallon Castle.

title: Canty Bay
text: Settlements nearby include Auldhame, Scoughall, Seacliff, and the Peffer Sands.

title: Column of the Goths
text: The Column of the Goths (Turkish: "Gotlar Sütunu" ) is Roman victory column dating to the third or fourth century A.D.

title: Column of the Goths
text: It stands in what is now Gülhane Park, Istanbul, Turkey.

title: Lyceum Theatre (Park Avenue South)
text: The Lyceum Theatre was a theatre in New York City located on Fourth Avenue, now Park Avenue South, between 23rd and 24th Streets in Manhattan.

title: Lyceum Theatre (Park Avenue South)
text: It was built in 1885 and operated until 1902, when it was torn down to make way for the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company Tower.

title: Lyceum Theatre (Park Avenue South)
text: It was replaced by a new Lyceum Theatre on 45th Street.

title: Lyceum Theatre (Park Avenue South)
text: For most of its existence, the theatre was home to Daniel Frohman’s Lyceum Theatre Stock Company, which presented many important plays and actors of the day.

title: Procession Kiosk
text: The Procession Kiosk (Turkish: "Alay Köşkü" ) is a 16th-century historical building on the outer walls of the Gülhane Park next to Topkapı Palace in Istanbul, Turkey.

title: Procession Kiosk
text: It was used by the Ottoman sultans to receive the salute of processing janissary as well as a pleasure local.

title: Procession Kiosk
text: The building is situated across the Sublime Porte.

title: Soğukçeşme Sokağı
text: Soğukçeşme Sokağı (literally: Street of the Cold Fountain) is a small street with historic houses in the Sultanahmet neighborhood of Istanbul, Turkey, sandwiched in-between the Hagia Sophia and Topkapı Palace.

title: Soğukçeşme Sokağı
text: The car-free zone street is named after the fountain situated at its end towards Gülhane Park.

title: İstanbul Archaeology Museums
text: The Istanbul Archaeology Museums (Turkish: "" ) is a group of three archeological museums located in the Eminönü district of Istanbul, Turkey, near Gülhane Park and Topkapı Palace.

title: Gülhane Park
text: Gülhane Park (Turkish: "Gülhane Parkı" , "Rosehouse Park"; from Persian: "Gulkhāna", "house of flowers") is a historical urban park in the Eminönü district of Istanbul, Turkey; it is located adjacent to and on the grounds of the Topkapı Palace.

title: Gülhane Park
text: The south entrance of the park sports one of the larger gates of the palace.

title: Gülhane Park
text: It is the oldest and one of the most expansive public parks in Istanbul.

title: Sarayburnu
text: Sarayburnu (Turkish: "Sarayburnu" , meaning "Cape Palace"; known in English as the Seraglio Point) is a promontory quarter separating the Golden Horn and the Sea of Marmara in Istanbul, Turkey.

title: Sarayburnu
text: The area is where the renowned Topkapı Palace and Gülhane Park stand.

title: Sarayburnu
text: Sarayburnu is included in the historic areas of Istanbul, added to the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1985.

title: Zografeion Lyceum
text: Zografeion Lyceum (Turkish: "Özel Zoğrafyon Rum Lisesi" , Greek: Ζωγράφειον Λύκειον ) is one of the remaining open Greek schools in Istanbul.

title: Zografeion Lyceum
text: The school is in the Istanbul city centre in the Beyoğlu district and very close to the Taksim Square, which is considered the heart of the city.

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: Istanbul Sirkeci Terminal, also known as Istanbul Terminal (Turkish: "Sirkeci Garı" ), is a railway terminal in Istanbul.

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: The terminal is located on the tip of Istanbul's historic peninsula right next to the Golden Horn and just northwest of Gülhane Park and the famous Topkapı Palace.

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: Sirkeci Terminal, along with Haydarpaşa Terminal on the other side of the Bosphorus, are Istanbul's two intercity and commuter railway terminals.

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: Built in 1890 by the Oriental Railway as the eastern terminus of the world-famous Orient Express, Sirkeci Terminal has become a symbol of the city.

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: As of 19 March 2013 service to the station had been indefinitely suspended due to the rehabilitation of the existing line between Kazlıçeşme and Halkalı for the new Marmaray commuter rail line.

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: On 29 October 2013, a new underground station opened to the public and is currently serviced by Marmaray trains travelling across the Bosphorus.

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: Sirkeci Terminal has a total of 4 platforms (3 above, 1 underground) with 7 tracks (5 above, 2 underground).

title: İstanbul Sirkeci Terminal
text: Formerly, commuter trains to Halkalı would depart from tracks 2, 3 and 4 while regional trains to Kapıkule, Edirne and Uzunköprü along with international trains to Bucharest, Sofia and Belgrade would depart from tracks 1 and 5.

title: Tiled Kiosk
text: The Tiled Kiosk (Turkish: "Çinili Köşk" ) is a pavilion set within the outer walls of Topkapı Palace and dates from 1472 as shown on the tile inscript above the main entrance.

title: Tiled Kiosk
text: It was built by the Ottoman sultan Mehmed II as a pleasure palace or kiosk.

title: Tiled Kiosk
text: It is located in the most outer parts of the palace, next to Gülhane Park.

title: Tiled Kiosk
text: It was also called " Glazed Kiosk" ("Sırça Köşk").

title: Albert Pierrepoint
text: Albert Pierrepoint ( ; 30 March 1905 – 10 July 1992) was a long-serving hangman in England.

title: Albert Pierrepoint
text: He executed at least 400 people, including William Joyce ("Lord Haw-Haw") and John Amery.

title: Albert Pierrepoint
text: In Germany and Austria, after the Second World War, he executed some 200 people who had been convicted of war crimes.

title: Albert Pierrepoint
text: In England, Pierrepoint hanged Timothy Evans for a crime committed by his neighbour John Christie, who was also hanged by Pierrepoint.

title: Ban Khor Sign Language
text: Ban Khor Sign Language (BKSL) is a village sign language used by at least 400 people of a rice-farming community in the village of Ban Khor in a remote area of Isan (northeastern Thailand).

title: Ban Khor Sign Language
text: Known locally as "pasa kidd" ('language of the mute'), it developed in the 1930s due to a high number of deaf people.

title: Ban Khor Sign Language
text: Estimated number of users in 2009 was 16 deaf and approximately 400 hearing out of 2741 villagers.

title: Ban Khor Sign Language
text: It is a language isolate, independent of the other sign languages of Thailand such as Old Bangkok Sign Language and the national Thai Sign Language.

title: Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1597
text: The Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1597 was a series of nationwide witch trials that took place in the whole of Scotland from March to October 1597.

title: Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1597
text: At least 400 people were put on trial for witchcraft and various forms of diabolism during the witch hunt.

title: Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1597
text: The exact number of those executed is unknown, but is believed to be about 200.

title: Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1597
text: The Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1597 was the second of five nationwide witch hunts in Scottish history, the others being The Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1590–91, The Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1628–1631, The Great Scottish witch hunt of 1649–50 and The Great Scottish Witch Hunt of 1661–62.

title: Hurricane Hazel
text: Hurricane Hazel was the deadliest and costliest hurricane of the 1954 Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Hurricane Hazel
text: The storm killed at least 400 people in Haiti before striking the United States near the border between North and South Carolina, as a Category 4 hurricane.

title: Hurricane Hazel
text: After causing 95 fatalities in the US, Hazel struck Canada as an extratropical storm, raising the death toll by 81 people, mostly in Toronto.

title: Hurricane Hazel
text: As a result of the high death toll and the damage caused by Hazel, its name was retired from use for North Atlantic hurricanes.

title: John Amery
text: John Amery (14 March 1912 – 19 December 1945) was a British fascist who proposed to the Wehrmacht the formation of a British volunteer force (that subsequently became the British Free Corps) and made recruitment efforts and propaganda broadcasts for Nazi Germany.

title: John Amery
text: Because of such activities he was executed for treason after the war.

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: The 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak, also known as the 1984 Ivanovo tornado outbreak, was one of only three disastrous tornado outbreaks in modern Russian history (one of the others being the 1904 Moscow tornado) and the third-deadliest tornado outbreak in European history.

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: Occurring on June 9, 1984, the outbreak struck the Ivanovo and Yaroslavl regions north of Moscow, an area over 400,000 km.

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: At least two of the eleven known tornadoes were violent events, equal to F4 or F5 in intensity on the Fujita scale, based upon observed damages.

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: The deadliest single tornado was posthumously rated at F5 intensity and killed at least 92 people along its long path near Ivanovo and other towns.

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: The tornado, up to 800 m wide, caused extreme damage, reportedly annihilating steel-reinforced concrete structures and throwing heavy objects of 320000 kg for distances up to 200 m .

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: Another tornado, assessed to have been at least F4 and possibly F5 in intensity, occurred at Kostroma.

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: Severe thunderstorms also produced hail up to 1 kg in weight, among the heaviest hailstones confirmed worldwide.

title: 1984 Soviet Union tornado outbreak
text: In all, the entire tornado outbreak killed at least 400 people and injured 213.

title: Eddy Brown
text: Edwin Brown (28 February 1926 – 12 July 2012) was an English footballer who played as a centre forward.

title: Eddy Brown
text: He played professionally for a number of clubs, but the peak of his career was spent with Birmingham City during their most successful period in the 1950s.

title: Eddy Brown
text: Over a professional career of nearly 400 appearances in the Football League, he scored at a rate of very nearly one goal every two games.

title: Eddy Brown
text: He was a pioneer of the goal celebration.

title: Edwin Brown (actor)
text: He had a lengthy career in television, often playing policemen or similar roles.

title: Edwin Brown (actor)
text: His film roles included a prison warder in the comedy "Two-Way Stretch" (1960), and Albert Pierrepoint, the hangman, in "10 Rillington Place" (1971).

title: Mitch Brown (rugby league)
text: Mitchell Ronald Edwin Brown (born 7 November 1987 in Sutherland, New South Wales) is an Australian professional footballer who currently plays for the Leigh Centurions in the Super League.

title: Mitch Brown (rugby league)
text: He previously played for the Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs, Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks and Wests Tigers.

title: Handicraft Guild Building
text: The Handicraft Guild Building is located at 89 10th Street South, Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States.

title: Handicraft Guild Building
text: It was designed in 1907 by architect William Channing Whitney in the Georgian Revival/Arts & Crafts style to house The Handicraft Guild.

title: Handicraft Guild Building
text: An addition to the Handicraft Guild was designed in 1914 by architects Edwin Hawley Hewitt and Edwin Brown at 1000-1006 Marquette Avenue South Minneapolis, Minnesota.

title: EICAR test file
text: The EICAR Anti-Virus Test File or EICAR test file is a computer file that was developed by the European Institute for Computer Antivirus Research (EICAR) and Computer Antivirus Research Organization (CARO), to test the response of computer antivirus (AV) programs.

title: EICAR test file
text: Instead of using real malware, which could cause real damage, this test file allows people to test anti-virus software without having to use a real computer virus.

title: Imposs
text: Stanley Rimsky Salgado known by his stage name Imposs is a Canadian rapper of Haitian origin based in Quebec.

title: Imposs
text: Before becoming a solo artist, he was part of Muzion, one of the well-known hip hop bands of Quebec.

title: Imposs
text: He has collaborated on many occasions with Wyclef Jean during Muzion days and as a solo artist.

title: Imposs
text: He is also well known for dubbing the phrase "Real City" for Montreal.

title: Imposs
text: He is signed to the K.Pone.Inc music label.

title: Real Damage
text: Real Damage is a Split EP of American indie rock band Gossip and Electropop solo artist Tracy + the Plastics, it was released on January 25, 2005.

title: Luba (singer)
text: Luba (born Lubomyra Kowalchyk (Ukrainian: Любомира Ковальчук ), April 24, 1958, Montreal, Quebec, Canada) is a Canadian musician, singer, songwriter and recording artist of Ukrainian descent.

title: Luba (singer)
text: She was commercially active from 1980 to 1990, 2000 to 2001 and is active again from 2007 to present.

title: Luba (singer)
text: She was initially the vocalist for a band named "Luba" before signing as a solo artist under that name.

title: Luba (singer)
text: She has released five full-length albums and two EPs as a solo artist.

title: Luba (singer)
text: (Two albums were released as a member of a band – 1973's Zorya, (Via Zorya) and 1980's "Chain Reaction" – with a band named "Luba".)

title: Luba (singer)
text: Two of her albums are certified platinum by the Canadian music industry (sales in excess of 100,000 units).

title: Luba (singer)
text: She has nine top-40 hits on the Canadian pop charts.

title: Luba (singer)
text: Her signature song is "Everytime I See Your Picture" (1983).

title: Luba (singer)
text: Her most successful song is a cover of Percy Sledge's "When a Man Loves a Woman" which reached No. 6 on the Canadian pop chart and No. 3 on the Canadian adult contemporary chart (1987).

title: Luba (singer)
text: She is a three-time winner of the Canadian music industry Juno Award for Female Vocalist of the Year (1985–1987).

title: Luba (singer)
text: Her success is limited to her native Canada as she has never charted in the US or elsewhere.

title: Luba (singer)
text: In addition to her Juno Awards, Luba has also received CASBY and Félix Awards, and a Black Music Association Award for "Female Entertainer of the Year".

title: Luba (singer)
text: Most recently, her music has been featured on "Canadian Idol".

title: Luba (singer)
text: She continues to record music under her own independent label.

title: Bill LaBounty
text: Bill LaBounty is an American musician.

title: Bill LaBounty
text: He was initially a singer-songwriter in the soft rock genre, first as a member of the band Fat Chance, and later as a solo artist.

title: Bill LaBounty
text: As a solo artist, LaBounty recorded six studio albums, including four on Curb Records/Warner Bros.

title: Bill LaBounty
text: Records.

title: Bill LaBounty
text: His first chart single, "This Night Won't Last Forever", was covered in 1979 by Michael Johnson, whose rendition was a Top 20 pop hit that year.

title: Hum Award for Best Solo Artist
text: The Hum Award for Best Solo Artist is one of the Hum Awards presented annually by the Hum Television Network and Entertainment Channel (HTNEC) to best Music Artist who has delivered an outstanding performance while working within the Music industry.

title: Hum Award for Best Solo Artist
text: Since its inception, however, the award has commonly been referred to as the hum for Best Solo Artist.

title: Hum Award for Best Solo Artist
text: Nominations are made by Hum members who are artists and composers, and the winners are chosen by the Hum membership as a whole.

title: Hum Award for Best Solo Artist
Electropop
text: Electropop is a variant of synth-pop that places more emphasis on a harder, electronic sound.

title: Electropop
text: The genre has seen a revival of popularity and influence since the 2000s.

title: San Miguel (volcano)
text: San Miguel (also known as Volcán Chaparrastique) is a stratovolcano in central-eastern El Salvador, approximately 15 km southwest of the city of San Miguel.

title: San Miguel (volcano)
text: On January 16, 2002, a minor eruption of steam, gas, and ash occurred from the summit crater, lasting 3 hours but causing no real damage to life or property.

title: San Miguel (volcano)
text: Carbon dioxide emissions had been monitored since November 2001, and their steady increase continued to build up until the eruption.

title: The Real Damage
text: The Real Damage is the second EP by UK singer-songwriter Frank Turner.

title: The Real Damage
text: It was released via Xtra Mile Recordings on 7 May 2007 and features all newly recorded songs with exception of the title track.

title: List of Kelly Rowland live performances
text: American recording artist Kelly Rowland has embarked on eight concert tours during her career, six of which as a solo artist, including three of her own, two as a collaborative act and one as an opening act.

title: List of Kelly Rowland live performances
text: In her six solo live tours and notable events dates, she has performed as a solo singer in over 119 shows in six continents through twenty-one countries: in Asia (China, Japan, Philippines, Vietnam, Malaysia, Singapore), in Africa (Nigeria), in Europe (Germany, United Kingdom, France, Italy, Netherlands, Belgium, Switzerland, Denmark, Monaco), in North America (United States, Canada and The Bahamas), in South America (Brazil) and in Oceania (Australia, and the US State of Hawaii).

title: List of Kelly Rowland live performances
text: Throughout a career spanning 18 years, Rowland has sold over 40 million records as a solo artist with four studio albums, two compilation albums, one box set, two extended plays and forty-three singles, including nineteen as a featured artist and five promotional singles, and a further 60 million records with Destiny's Child.

title: List of Kelly Rowland live performances
text: Her work has earned her several awards and nominations, including four Grammy Awards, a Billboard Music Award and a Soul Train Music Award.

title: List of Kelly Rowland live performances
text: Rowland has also received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame with Destiny's Child, and as a solo artist she has been honored by the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers and "Essence" for her contributions to music.

title: List of Kelly Rowland live performances
text: In 2014, Fuse ranked Rowland in their "100 Most Award-Winning Artists" list at number 20.

title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (film)
text: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels is a 1988 American comedy film directed by Frank Oz and starring Steve Martin, Michael Caine and Glenne Headly.

title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (film)
text: The screenplay was written by Dale Launer, Stanley Shapiro, and Paul Henning.

title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (film)
text: It is a remake of the Shapiro and Henning script for the 1964 Marlon Brando/David Niven film "Bedtime Story".

title: Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
text: Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen is a 2004 American teen musical comedy film directed by Sara Sugarman and produced by Robert Shapiro and Matthew Hart for Walt Disney Pictures.

title: Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
text: It stars Lindsay Lohan as an aspiring teenaged actress whose family moves from New York City to New Jersey, Adam Garcia as her favorite rock musician, Glenne Headly as her mother, and Alison Pill as her best friend.

title: Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
text: The screenplay was written by Gail Parent and is based on the novel of the same name by Dyan Sheldon.

title: De Palma (film)
text: De Palma is a 2015 American documentary film directed by Noah Baumbach and Jake Paltrow about the director and screenwriter Brian De Palma.

title: De Palma (film)
text: It world premiered, out of competition, at the 72nd edition of the Venice Film Festival.

title: We Married Margo
text: We Married Margo is a 2000 American independent comedy film directed by J. David Shapiro and co-written by Shapiro and William Dozier.

title: We Married Margo
text: The film tells a story of two friends who were married to the same woman and is loosely based on real events in that Shapiro and Dozier actually met after dating the same woman named Margaux.

title: We Married Margo
text: The film was awarded the "Audience Award for Comedy Film of the Year" at the 2000 The Comedy Festival (formerly known as the "US Comedy Arts Festival") and was nominated for the "Grand Jury Prize" at the Slamdance Film Festival the same year.

title: Battlefield Earth (film)
text: Battlefield Earth (also referred to as Battlefield Earth: A Saga of the Year 3000) is a 2000 American science fiction action film based upon the first half of L. Ron Hubbard's 1982 novel of the same name.

title: Battlefield Earth (film)
