text: The supporting cast features Graham Greene, James Coburn, Alfred Molina and a large number of cameo appearances by Western film actors, country music stars and other actors.

title: Tequila Sunrise (film)

title: Tequila Sunrise (film)
text: It stars Mel Gibson, Michelle Pfeiffer and Kurt Russell, with Raúl Juliá, J. T. Walsh, Arliss Howard and Gabriel Damon in supporting roles.

text: Dragged Across Concrete is an upcoming American action thriller film written and directed by S. Craig Zahler.

title: Dragged Across Concrete
text: The film stars Mel Gibson, Vince Vaughn and Laurie Holden.

title: The Beaver (film)
text: This is Gibson and Foster's first film together since 1994's "Maverick" and Summit Entertainment's only film to have Entertainment One not distribute it within the UK.

title: Ted Sutton

title: Ted Sutton
text: He is best known for playing Sergeant Cunningham in M. Night Shyamalan's 2002 film "Signs".

title: We Were Soldiers

title: Randy Rainbow
text: Randy Stewart Rainbow (born July 6, 1981) is a comedian, YouTube actor, singer and writer based in New York, NY, United States.

title: Randy Rainbow
text: Rainbow—his real name—is most notable for writing, editing, and starring in a series of humorous YouTube viral videos.

title: Randy Rainbow
text: In his earlier work, he stages fake phone conversations with famous people by editing real audio clips of those celebrities.

title: Randy Rainbow
text: He posted his breakout video, "Randy Rainbow is Dating Mel Gibson", on July 18, 2010.

title: Signs (film)

title: Signs (film)
text: Its story focuses on a former Episcopal priest named Graham Hess, played by Mel Gibson, who discovers a series of crop circles in his cornfield.

title: Signs (film)
text: Hess slowly discovers that the phenomena are a result of extraterrestrial life.

title: Signs (film)
text: It also stars Joaquin Phoenix, Rory Culkin, and Abigail Breslin.

title: Signs (film)
text: "Signs" explores faith, kinship, and extraterrestrials.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Pam Teeguarden (born April 17, 1951) is a former American professional tennis player in the 1970s and 1980s, ranked in the top 20 from 1970–1975, according to "John Dolan's Women's Tennis Ultimate Guide", prior to computer rankings.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: She won two Grand Slam Doubles Titles and was a quarter finalist in singles at the U.S. Open and The French Open.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Her father Jerry, a well known coach, helped Margaret Court win the coveted Grand Slam (all four Grand Slam titles in one year) in 1970 and Virginia Wade to her 1977 Wimbledon triumph.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Teeguarden was voted the "Most Watchable Player" based on play and appearance by a group of Madison Avenue advertising executives or "Mad Men" while playing at the US Open.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Teeguarden played in 19 consecutive US Opens, holding the record until Chris Evert played in 20.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: She wore the first all black outfit in the history of tennis in 1975 at The Bridgestone Doubles Championships in Tokyo, starting a trend that is still popular today.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: Teeguarden was the first woman tennis player signed by Nike.

title: Pam Teeguarden
text: She played on the victorious Los Angeles Strings Team Tennis team in 1981 and won the Team Tennis Mixed Doubles Division with Tom Gullikson in 1977; they were also runners-up in the league that year.

title: Lindsay Davenport
text: Lindsay Ann Davenport Leach (born June 8, 1976) is an American former professional tennis player.

text: She was ranked World No. 1 on eight different occasions, for a total of 98 weeks.

title: Lindsay Davenport
text: Davenport is one of five women who have been the year-end World No. 1 at least four times (1998, 2001, 2004, and 2005) since 1975; the others are Chris Evert, Steffi Graf, Martina Navratilova and Serena Williams.

title: Lindsay Davenport
text: She has achieved the No. 1 ranking in doubles as well.

title: Mara Santangelo
text: Mara Santangelo (born 28 June 1981) is a former professional tennis player from Italy.

title: Mara Santangelo
text: She retired from the sport on 28 January 2011.

title: 2009 Internationaux de Strasbourg – Doubles
text: In the doubles event at the 2009 Internationaux de Strasbourg women's tennis tournament played in Strasbourg, France, the winning pair was Nathalie Dechy of France and Mara Santangelo of Italy.

title: Chris Evert
text: Christine Marie Evert (born December 21, 1954), known as Chris Evert Lloyd from 1979 to 1987, is a former World No. 1 professional tennis player from the United States.

title: Chris Evert
text: She won 18 Grand Slam singles championships and three doubles titles.

title: Chris Evert
text: She was the year-ending World No. 1 singles player in 1974, 1975, 1976, 1977, 1978, 1980, and 1981.

title: Chris Evert
text: Overall Evert won 157 singles championships and 32 doubles titles.

title: Jimmy Evert
text: James Evert (July 31, 1924 – August 21, 2015) was an American tennis coach and player.

title: Jimmy Evert
text: He was the father of Chris Evert, who was one of the world's top women tennis players in the 1970s and 1980s.

title: Jeanne Evert
text: Jeanne Evert Dubin (born October 5, 1957) is an American former professional tennis player and the younger sister of Chris Evert.

title: Jeanne Evert
text: She was ranked as high as 42nd by the WTA in 1975 and ninth within the United States alone in 1974.

title: Jeanne Evert
text: She reached the third round of the U.S. Open in 1973 and 1978.

title: Jeanne Evert
text: She won all 4 of her Fed Cup matches for the U.S. in 1974.

title: JoAnne Russell
text: JoAnne Russell (born October 30, 1954) is an American former professional tennis player.

title: JoAnne Russell
text: With playing partner Helen Gourlay Cawley, she won the Wimbledon Ladies' Doubles title in 1977.

title: JoAnne Russell
text: They beat the team of Chris Evert and Rosie Casals in the first round and the top-ranked team of Martina Navratilova and Betty Stöve in the final (6–3, 6–3).

title: JoAnne Russell
text: Russell reached a career-high singles ranking of No. 22.

title: Alicia Molik
text: Alicia Molik (born 27 January 1981) is an Australian former professional tennis player.

title: Alicia Molik
text: She reached a career-high singles ranking of world No. 8 and won a bronze medal for Australia at the 2004 Athens Olympics by upsetting then world No. 3 and reigning French Open champion Anastasia Myskina.

title: Alicia Molik
text: Molik peaked in the doubles rankings at No. 6 and won two Grand Slam women's doubles titles, the 2005 Australian Open and the 2007 French Open, alongside Svetlana Kuznetsova and Mara Santangelo, respectively.

title: Alicia Molik
text: In addition, she won the 2004 Zurich Open, defeating Maria Sharapova in the final, and reached the finals of the 2004 Wimbledon, 2004 US Open, and 2007 Wimbledon mixed doubles events, as well as the quarterfinals of the 2005 Australian Open singles tournament.

title: Annie Gariepy
text: Annie Gariepy (born May 12, 1975 in Bromont, Québec) is a female member of the Canadian cycling team and has cycled for the American team auto trader.

title: Annie Gariepy
text: Gariepy was the only Canadian on the team with her team mates included Sarah Ulmer, Susie Pryde, Kim Smith and WFP Shuster.

title: Annie Gariepy
text: she left Team Autotrader at the beginning of 2002 when she passed over to team trek more.

title: The Prince and Me
text: The Prince and Me is a 2004 romantic comedy film directed by Martha Coolidge, and starring Julia Stiles, Luke Mably, and Ben Miller, with Miranda Richardson, James Fox, and Alberta Watson.

title: The Prince and Me
text: The film focuses on Paige Morgan, a pre-med college student in Wisconsin, who is pursued by a prince posing as a normal college student.

title: Marc Quinn
text: Marc Quinn (born 8 January 1964) is a British contemporary visual artist whose work includes sculpture, installation and painting.

title: Marc Quinn
text: Quinn explores 'what it is to be human in the world today' through subjects including the body, genetics, identity, environment and the media.

title: Marc Quinn
text: His work has used materials that vary widely, from blood, bread and flowers, to marble and stainless steel.

title: Marc Quinn
text: Quinn has been the subject of solo exhibitions at Sir John Soane's Museum, Tate, National Portrait Gallery, Fondation Beyeler, Fondazione Prada and South London Gallery.

title: Marc Quinn
text: The artist was a notable member of the Young British Artists movement, which included Sarah Lucas and Damien Hirst.

title: Sarah... Ang Munting Prinsesa
text: Sarah... Ang Munting Prinsesa (Filipino: "Sarah... The Little Princess") is a 1995 Filipino family-drama film adapted from the 1985 Nippon Animation anime, "Princess Sarah", which in turn was based on the children's novel "A Little Princess" by British playwright and author Frances Hodgson Burnett.

title: Sarah... Ang Munting Prinsesa
text: The film was directed by Romy Suzara and starred Camille Prats as Sara Crewe, Angelica Panganiban as Becky and Jean Garcia as Ms. Minchin.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: The Women's Printing Society was a British publishing house founded in either 1874 or 1876 by Emma Paterson and Emily Faithfull with the company being officially incorporated as a cooperative in 1878.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: The company played an important role in British Suffragette movement, both through its publication of feminist tracts and in providing employment opportunities for women in a field that had previously been restricted to men.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: The house was set up to allow women to learn the trade of printing, and provided an apprenticeship program.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: Women worked as compositors, and as of 1904, it was one of the few houses where they also did the imposing: ordering the galley proofs so that when folded, the front and back pages aligned properly.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: As of 1899, the company employed 22 women as compositors.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: The manager, proof-reader and bookkeeper were also women.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: Men held the tasks of "pressmen and feeders".

title: Women's Printing Society
text: The women apprentices earned a wage "considering the hours (9 to 6.30), etc., this is better pay than even highly-educated women can sometimes secure."

title: Women's Printing Society
text: Some of the initial employees came from Faithful's Victoria Press.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: The Board of Directors included Sarah Prideaux, Mabel Winkworth and Stewart Duckworth Headlam.

title: Women's Printing Society
text: Elizabeth Yeats studied for a brief time at the Women's Printing Society, before returning to Ireland and starting the Dun Emer Press.

title: The Initiation of Sarah (2006 film)
text: The Initiation of Sarah is a 2006 made for TV movie that was directed by Stuart Gillard for ABC Family.

title: The Initiation of Sarah (2006 film)
text: It first aired as part of ABC Family's "13 Nights of Halloween" on October 22, 2006 and is a loose remake of the 1978 film of the same name.

title: The Initiation of Sarah (2006 film)
text: The two films differ in several ways.

title: The Initiation of Sarah (2006 film)
text: The personalities of Sarah and Patty (who was renamed Lindsay) were switched, the two are now biological sisters instead of adopted siblings, and the movie features magic as a predominant element to the plot, whereas in the original the focus is more heavily on Sarah having telekinesis.

title: The Initiation of Sarah (2006 film)
text: The character of Mrs. Hunter was re-written to be younger and possess a PhD, and is seen as a more positive figure in the movie as opposed to the character portrayed by Shelley Winters.

title: The Initiation of Sarah (2006 film)
text: The film's ending is also changed, as Sarah ends up with her love interest and does not die at the film's completion.

title: Willy the Sparrow
text: Willy the Sparrow (Hungarian: "Vili, a veréb" ) is a 1989 Hungarian animated film directed by József Gémes.

title: Willy the Sparrow
text: It was released in Hungary to critical acclaim and it won the Prize of the Audience at the 3rd Kecskemét Animation Film Festival.

title: Willy the Sparrow
text: The English adaptation was directed by Scott Murphy.

title: Willy the Sparrow
text: Voice actors included Sarah Schaub, Barta Heiner, Rick Macy and Aaron Bybee.

title: Willy the Sparrow
text: The film was released on DVD in 2004.

title: Sarah Manninen
text: Sarah Manninen (born November 6, 1976 in Waterloo, Ontario) is a Canadian film, television and stage actress, better known for her appearances on film "The Prince and Me" and series "The Line".

title: Separation (2013 film)
text: Separation is a 2013 Canadian thriller film directed by Greg White and his feature film directorial debut.

title: Separation (2013 film)
text: The film was released on video on demand on April 15, 2013 and stars Sarah Manninen and Peter Stebbings as a married couple struggling to save their lives as well as their marriage.

title: The Killing Field
text: The Killing Field is an Australian mystery-drama-thriller television film on the Seven Network.

title: The Killing Field
text: It was created by Sarah Smith and Michaeley O'Brien and directed by Samantha Lang, from a screenplay by Sarah Smith and Michaeley O'Brien.

title: The Killing Field
text: It was produced by Bill Hughes and Sarah Smith with Rebecca Gibney co-producing and Julie McGauran executive producing.

title: The Killing Field
text: A spin-off series "Winter" screened from February 2015.

title: Stegotetrabelodon
text: Stegotetrabelodon is an extinct genus of primitive elephant with gomphothere-like anatomical features from the Late Miocene to Early Pliocene of Africa and Eurasia.

title: Stegotetrabelodon
text: The type species is "S. syrticus" of late Miocene Africa, which reached roughly 4 m (13.1 ft) in shoulder height.

title: Stegotetrabelodon
text: The other unequivocally recognized species is "S. orbus", also of late Miocene Africa.

title: Stegotetrabelodon
text: Other species outside of Africa are questionably placed in this genus, including teeth from Late Miocene Hungary and Iran originally described as being of the "Mastodon" subgenus "Bunolophodon", Chinese specimens originally described as being also of "Mastodon", as well as of "Tetralophodon" and "Stegodon", and a species from the late Miocene-aged Dokh Pathan Formation in Pakistan, "S. maluvalensis".

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: Volvopluteus michiganensis is a species of mushroom in the family Pluteaceae.

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: It was originally described under the name "Pluteus michiganensis" but molecular studies have placed it in the "Volvopluteus", a genus described in 2011.

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: The cap of this mushroom is about 7 – in diameter, gray, and has a cracked margin that is sticky when fresh.

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: The gills start out as white but they soon turn pink.

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: The stipe is white and has a volva at the base.

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: Microscopical features and DNA sequence data are of great importance for separating this taxon from related species.

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: "V. michiganensis" is a saprotrophic fungus that was originally described as growing on sawdust.

title: Volvopluteus michiganensis
text: It has only been reported from Michigan (USA) and the Dominican Republic.

title: Jurodidae
text: The beetle family Jurodidae was originally described from fossils, but in 1996, a single species from the Russian Far East, described as Sikhotealinia zhiltzovae, was found and later was recognized to be a living representative of this otherwise extinct family (a "living fossil").

title: Jurodidae
text: Since then, this beetle, known from only a single specimen, has been the source of contention, as it is reported to possess three ocelli on its forehead, a condition otherwise unknown in the entire order Coleoptera, whether extinct or living - though it is common in other orders, and generally considered a groundplan character for neopteran insects.

title: Jurodidae
text: If true, this species may represent the most archaic of all living beetles.

title: Jurodidae
text: However, other authorities have challenged this interpretation, and have further suggested that this beetle does not even belong to the Archostemata.

title: Jurodidae
text: This may not be possible to resolve until additional specimens are collected, allowing for genetic analysis.

title: Agonum fuliginosum
text: Agonum fuliginosum is a species of ground beetle in the Platyninae family.

title: Agonum fuliginosum
text: It was described by Panzer in 1809 and can be found everywhere in Europe except for Albania, Andorra, Monaco, Portugal, San Marino, Vatican City and various European islands.

title: Selatosomus aeneus
text: Selatosomus aeneus is a species of click beetle found in Europe.

title: Selatosomus aeneus
text: It was originally described as "Corymbites aeneus" by Carl Linnaeus.

title: Protostropharia alcis
text: Protostropharia alcis is a species of coprophilous agaric fungus in the family Strophariaceae.

title: Protostropharia alcis
text: It was originally described by Finnish mycologist Ilkka Kytövuori in 1999, as one of six species in the ""Stropharia semiglobata"" group in northwestern Europe.

title: Protostropharia alcis
text: The fungus produces fruit bodies on moose  dung.

title: Protostropharia alcis
text: In 2013, the fungus named after "Alces alces" was transferred by Redhead et al. to "Protostropharia", a genus circumscribed to contain "Stropharia" species characterized by the formation of astrocystidia rather than acanthocytes on their mycelium.

title: Protostropharia alcis
text: In addition to Europe, the species has also been recorded in Brazil.

title: Protostropharia alcis
text: The variety "austrobrasiliensis" was described from Rio Grande do Sul in 2008, where it grows on cow dung, or dung-enriched soil.

title: Cicindela albissima
text: Cicindela albissima, commonly called the Coral Pink Sand Dunes tiger beetle is a species of tiger beetle endemic to Coral Pink Sand Dunes State Park in southern Utah, United States.

title: Cicindela albissima
text: It was originally described by Rumpp in 1962 as the subspecies "Cicindela limbata albissima", but mitochondrial DNA, along with the species' morphological and geographical distinctiveness, have shown that it is a separate species.

title: Cicindela albissima
text: "C. albissima" can be distinguished from other "Cicindela" species by its restricted range and lack of pigmentation on its elytra.

title: Bark beetle
text: A bark beetle is one of about 220 genera with 6,000 species of beetles in the subfamily Scolytinae.

title: Bark beetle
text: Traditionally, this was considered a distinct family Scolytidae, but is now understood to be very specialized members of the "true weevil" family (Curculionidae).

title: Bark beetle
text: Well-known species are members of the type genus "Scolytus", namely the European elm bark beetle "S. multistriatus" and the large elm bark beetle "S. scolytus", which like the American elm bark beetle "Hylurgopinus rufipes", transmit Dutch elm disease fungi ("Ophiostoma").

title: Bark beetle
text: The mountain pine beetle "Dendroctonus ponderosae", southern pine beetle "Dendroctonus frontalis", and their near relatives are major pests of conifer forests in North America.

title: Bark beetle
text: A similarly aggressive species in Europe is the spruce ips "Ips typographus".

title: Bark beetle
text: A tiny bark beetle, the coffee berry borer, "Hypothenemus hampei" is a major pest on coffee plantations around the world.

title: Scydosella
text: Scydosella is a genus of beetles that consists of only one species Scydosella musawasensis.

title: Scydosella
text: The species is regarded as the smallest free-living insect, as well as the smallest beetle.

title: Scydosella
text: They are among featherwing beetle, named because of their feather-like spiny wings.

title: Scydosella
text: It was first discovered in Nicaragua, and described in 1999 by Wesley Eugene Hall of the University of Nebraska State Museum.

title: Scydosella
text: The initial discovery consisted of very few specimens, and exact measurements were not conclusive.

title: Scydosella
text: Because of their tiny size, they were difficult to observe under microscope after preservation.

title: Scydosella
text: The generally accepted size was 0.300 mm in length.

title: Scydosella
text: On 8 February 2015, Alexey Polilov of the Lomonosov Moscow State University collected 85 specimens in Chicaque National Park, Colombia.

title: Scydosella
text: They were discovered on a layer of fungus on which they feed.

title: Scydosella
text: From these specimens exact measurements could be made, and was found that the smallest individual is only 0.325 mm long.

title: Scydosella
text: The largest individual is 0.352 mm long, and the average length of all the specimens is 0.338 mm.

title: Scydosella
text: The body is elongated and oval in shape, yellowish-brown in colour, and its antennae are split into 10 segments.

title: San Marino
text: San Marino ( ; ] ), officially the Republic of San Marino (Italian: "Repubblica di San Marino" ), also known as the Most Serene Republic of San Marino (Italian: "Serenissima Repubblica di San Marino" ), is an enclaved microstate surrounded by Italy, situated on the Italian Peninsula on the northeastern side of the Apennine Mountains.

title: San Marino
text: Its size is just over 61 sqkm , with a population of 33,562.

title: San Marino
text: Its capital is the City of San Marino and its largest city is Serravalle.

title: San Marino
text: San Marino has the smallest population of all the members of the Council of Europe.

title: Demography of the United Kingdom
text: According to the 2011 census, the total population of the United Kingdom was around 63,182,000.

title: Demography of the United Kingdom
text: <ref name="2http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/dcp171778_292378.pdf |title=2011 Census: Population Estimates for the United Kingdom |publisher=Office for National Statistics |date=27 March 2011 |accessdate=18 December 2012 }}</ref> It is the 22nd-largest in the world.

title: Demography of the United Kingdom
text: Its overall population density is 259 people per square kilometre (671 people per sq mi), with England having a significantly higher population density than Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

title: Demography of the United Kingdom
text: Almost one-third of the population lives in England's southeast, which is predominantly urban and suburban, with about 8 million in the capital city of London, the population density of which is just over 5,200 per square kilometre (13,468 per sq mi).

title: Orleans, Ontario
text: Orléans ( ; French: ] ) (officially Orléans), is a suburb of Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

title: Orleans, Ontario
text: It is located in the eastern part of the city along the Ottawa River, about 16 km from downtown Ottawa.

title: Orleans, Ontario
text: The Canada 2011 Census determined that Orléans' population was 107,823.

title: Orleans, Ontario
text: Prior to being amalgamated into Ottawa in 2001, the community of Orléans was spread over two municipal jurisdictions, the eastern portion being in the pre-amalgamation City of Cumberland, the western portion in the City of Gloucester.

title: Orleans, Ontario
text: According to the 2011 census, 62,888 people lived in the Cumberland portion of Orléans, while 44,935 people lived in the Gloucester portion.

title: Orleans, Ontario
text: Today, Orléans spans the municipal wards of Orléans, Innes and Cumberland.

title: Orleans, Ontario
text: Orléans is one of 3 areas of the post-amalgamated City of Ottawa to contain a significant francophone population, hence the community's name.

title: Kerry Saxby-Junna
text: Kerry-Anne Saxby-Junna, born Kerry Saxby AM (born 2 June 1961) is a retired Australian race walker.

title: Kerry Saxby-Junna
text: She was born in Young, New South Wales and grew up in Ballina, New South Wales.

title: Blennerville
text: Blennerville (Irish: "Cathair Uí Mhóráin" , meaning "the seat/home of the Morans") is a small village and now a suburb of Tralee, County Kerry, Ireland.

title: Blennerville
text: It is approximately 1 mi west of the town centre on the N86 road to Dingle, where the River Lee enters Tralee Bay.

title: Blennerville
text: The village was formerly Tralee's port, and is connected to the town centre by the Tralee Ship Canal.

title: Blennerville
text: Part of Blennerville electoral division falls within the area of Tralee Town Council, and at the 2011 census had a population of 141.

title: Blennerville
text: The remaining portion, outside the urban boundaries, had a 2011 population of 556.

title: Islam in West Bengal
text: Since the partition of India in 1947, the majority of the Bengali Muslims have lived in Bangladesh.

title: Islam in West Bengal
text: Islam is the minority religion in West Bengal as of 2011.

title: Islam in West Bengal
text: However, Islam is also the second largest and the fastest growing religion in the Indian state of West Bengal.

title: Islam in West Bengal
text: According to 2011 Census of India, West Bengal has over 24.6 million Bengali Muslims, who form 27% of the state's population.

title: Islam in West Bengal
text: In West Bengal capital Kolkata Muslim's Population is 926,414 making up 20.6% of the city population as of 2011 census.

title: Islam in West Bengal
text: Bengali Muslims are minority in all districts of Bengal except Uttar Dinajpur (49.92%), Maldah (51.27%) and Murshidabad (66.28%) .

title: Islam in West Bengal
text: It is also said that this rise is due to proximity to Muslim-dominated districts of neighboring state of Bihar and illegal migration from Bangladesh cause demography change in the state.

title: Korçë
text: Korçë (] ; (definite Albanian form: "Korça" ), other names see below) is a city and municipality in southeastern Albania, and the seat of Korçë County.

title: Korçë
text: It was formed at the 2015 local government reform by the merger of the former municipalities Drenovë, Korçë, Lekas, Mollaj, Qendër Bulgarec, Vithkuq, Voskop and Voskopojë, that became municipal units.

title: Korçë
text: The seat of the municipality is the city Korçë.

title: Korçë
text: The total population is 75,994 (2011 census), in a total area of 805.99 km2 .

title: Korçë
text: The population of the former municipality at the 2011 census was 51,152.

title: Korçë
text: It is the sixth largest city in Albania.

title: Korçë
text: It stands on a plateau some 850 m above sea level, surrounded by the Morava Mountains.

title: Young, New South Wales
text: Young is a town in the South West Slopes region of New South Wales, Australia and the largest town in Hilltops Council.

title: Young, New South Wales
text: At the 2011 census , Young had a population of 6,960.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: The Northern Region is a region in the Canadian province of Manitoba.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: It is situated on the Canadian Shield and includes Manitoba's Hudson Bay coastline.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: The major economic activities are mining and tourism.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: The region is composed of four census divisions: 19 and 21–23 .

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: The land area of the region is 438,491.51 km2 (169,302.52 mi2), which encompasses 67% of Manitoba's total land area.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: The vast majority of the region is undeveloped wilderness.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: Its total population at the 2011 census was 88,146, which was only 7.3% of Manitoba's total population in the 2011 census.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: The largest municipality is the city of Thompson.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: Other major population centers include the city of Flin Flon and the town of The Pas.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: Indian reserves comprise more than 49% of the region's population.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: There are 54 reserves with a total population of 40,572.

title: Northern Region, Manitoba
text: The largest of these are Norway House 17 and Peguis 1B.

title: Warton, Lancaster
text: Warton is a village, civil parish and electoral ward in the City of Lancaster in north Lancashire in the north-west of England, close to the boundary with Cumbria, with a population of around 2,000, measured at the 2011 Census to be 2,360.

title: Warton, Lancaster
text: It is a village steeped in history; its earliest recording as a settlement is made in Domesday Book written in 1086.

title: Warton, Lancaster
text: The nearest town to Warton is Carnforth, which was originally part of Warton parish.

title: Warton, Lancaster
text: It has connections to the first President of the United States, George Washington: Washington's ancestor of seven generations, Lawrence Washington, is rumoured to have helped build the village church of St Oswald.

title: Warton, Lancaster
text: The parish covers an area in excess of 11000 acre and is predominantly rural.

title: Warton, Lancaster
text: The parish of Warton had a population of 2315 recorded in the 2001 census, and 2,360 in the 2011 census.

title: Ackworth, West Yorkshire
text: Ackworth is a village and civil parish in the metropolitan borough of Wakefield, West Yorkshire, England, situated between Pontefract, Barnsley and Doncaster on the small River Went.

title: Ackworth, West Yorkshire
text: The village consists of four parts, High Ackworth, Low Ackworth, Ackworth Moor Top, and Brackenhill.

title: Ackworth, West Yorkshire
text: According to the 2001 census it had a population of 6,493, increasing to 7,049 at the 2011 Census.

title: Ackworth, West Yorkshire
text: There is also a City of Wakefield Ward called Ackworth, North Elmsall and Upton.

title: Ackworth, West Yorkshire
text: At the 2011 Census this ward had a population of 16,099.

title: Kerbal Space Program
text: Kerbal Space Program (KSP) is a space flight simulation video game developed and published by Squad for Microsoft Windows, OS X, Linux, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, with a Wii U version that was supposed to be released at a later date.

title: Kerbal Space Program
text: The developers have stated that the gaming landscape has changed since that announcement and more details will be released soon.

title: Kerbal Space Program
text: In the game, players direct a nascent space program, staffed and crewed by humanoid aliens known as "Kerbals".

title: Kerbal Space Program
text: The game features a realistic orbital physics engine, allowing for various real-life orbital maneuvers such as Hohmann transfer orbits and bi-elliptic transfer orbits.

title: Ernst Grube
text: Ernst Grube (born on 13 December 1932) is a German teacher and important witness of the Holocaust.

title: Ernst Grube
text: He survived his detention at Theresienstadt concentration camp and has spoken out on several issues of Post-Nazi Germany.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Gustav Laabs (born 20 December 1902-died 12 March 1980) was a German SS commander during the Nazi era.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: During the Second World War, he worked as a gas van operator at the Chełmno extermination camp in Wartheland.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: As an operator of a gas van, Laabs was directly involved in and responsible for the genocidal extermination of over 100,000 men, women and children, most of whom were killed on account of being Jewish.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: After the war, he was tried and convicted for his crimes against humanity.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Despite being convicted, Laabs was given the lenient sentence of 15 years (subsequently reduced to 13 years) by a regional court in Landgericht Bonn, Germany.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Far from being outliers, such instances of leniency, extended to perpetrators of genocide and crimes against humanity during trials in post-Nazi Germany, constituted the norm, as evidenced by the fact that most of the perpetrators of Nazi war crimes and the Final Solution were not brought to justice.

title: Gustav Laabs
text: Many former SS officers and Nazis, who were directly responsible for perpetrating genocide and murdering countless innocent people, were contracted to work for US and British intelligence agencies as part of the war against the USSR and Communism (also see Operation Paperclip for more on post-WWII Allied collaboration with Nazis).

title: Operation Epsilon
text: Operation Epsilon was the codename of a program in which Allied forces near the end of World War II detained ten German scientists who were thought to have worked on Nazi Germany's nuclear program.

title: Operation Epsilon
text: The scientists were captured between May 1 and June 30, 1945, as part of the Allied Alsos Mission, mainly as part of its Operation Big sweep through southwestern Germany.

title: Arthur Rudolph
text: Arthur Louis Hugo Rudolph (November 9, 1906 – January 1, 1996) was a German Nazi rocket engineer who was a leader of the effort to develop the V-2 rocket for Nazi Germany.

title: Arthur Rudolph
text: After the war, the United States Government's Office of Strategic Services (OSS) brought him to the U.S. as part of the clandestine Operation Paperclip, where he became one of the main developers of the U.S. space program.

title: Arthur Rudolph
text: He worked within the U.S. Army and NASA, where he managed the development of several systems, including the Pershing missile and the Saturn V Moon rocket.

title: Arthur Rudolph
text: In 1984, the U.S. Government investigated him for war crimes, and he agreed to renounce his United States citizenship and leave the U.S. in return for not being prosecuted.

title: Operation Damocles
text: Operation Damocles was a covert campaign of the Israeli Mossad in August 1962 targeting German scientists and technicians, formerly employed in Nazi Germany's rocket program, who were developing rockets for Egypt at a military site known as Factory 333.

title: Operation Damocles
text: According to Otto Joklik, an Austrian scientist involved with the project, the rockets being developed were programmed to use a radioactive waste.

title: Operation Paperclip
text: Operation Paperclip was a secret program of the Joint Intelligence Objectives Agency (JIOA) in which more than 1,600 German scientists, engineers, and technicians, such as Wernher von Braun and his V-2 rocket team, were recruited in post-Nazi Germany and taken to the U.S. for government employment, at the end of World War II; many were members and some were leaders of the Nazi Party.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: Jewish settlers founded the Ashkenazi Jewish community in the Early (5th to 10th centuries CE) and High Middle Ages ("circa" 1000–1299 CE).

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: The community survived under Charlemagne, but suffered during the Crusades.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: Accusations of well poisoning during the Black Death (1346–53) led to mass slaughter of German Jews, and they fled in large numbers to Poland.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: The Jewish communities of the cities of Mainz, Speyer, and Worms became the center of Jewish life during Medieval times.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: "This was a golden age as area bishops protected the Jews resulting in increased trade and prosperity."

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: The First Crusade began an era of persecution of Jews in Germany.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: Entire communities, like those of Trier, Worms, Mainz, and Cologne, were murdered.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: The war upon the Hussite heretics became the signal for renewed persecution of Jews.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: The end of the 15th century was a period of religious hatred that ascribed to Jews all possible evils.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: The atrocities during the Khmelnytsky Uprising committed by Khmelnytskyi's Cossacks (1648, in the Ukrainian part of southeastern Poland) drove the Polish Jews back into western Germany.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: With Napoleon's fall in 1815, growing nationalism resulted in increasing repression.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: From August to October 1819, pogroms that came to be known as the Hep-Hep riots took place throughout Germany.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: During this time, many German states stripped Jews of their civil rights.

title: History of the Jews in Germany
text: As a result, many German Jews began to emigrate.

title: Adolf Bernhard Meyer
text: Adolf Bernhard Meyer (11 October 1840, Hamburg – 22 August 1911, Dresden) was a German anthropologist, ornithologist, entomologist, and herpetologist.

title: Adolf Bernhard Meyer
text: He served for nearly thirty years as director of the Königlich Zoologisches und Anthropologisch-Ethnographisches Museum (now the natural history museum or Museum für Tierkunde Dresden) in Dresden.

title: Adolf Bernhard Meyer
text: He worked on comparative anatomy and appreciated ideas from evolution, and influenced many German scientists by translating the works of Darwin and Wallace into German in 1858.

title: Adolf Bernhard Meyer
text: Influenced by the writings of Wallace with whom he interacted, he travelled to Southeast Asia, and collected specimens and recorded his observations from the region.

title: Read into
text: The process of being read into a compartmented program generally entails being approved for access to particularly sensitive and restricted information about a classified program, receiving a briefing about the program, and formally acknowledging the briefing, usually by signing a non-disclosure agreement describing restrictions on the handling and use of information concerning the program.

title: Read into
text: Officials with the required security clearance and a need to know may be read into a covert operation or clandestine operation they will be working on.

title: Read into
text: For codeword–classified programs, an official would not be aware a program existed with that codeword until being read in, because the codewords themselves are classified.

title: Knox County, Tennessee
text: Knox County is a county in the U.S. state of Tennessee.

title: Knox County, Tennessee
text: As of the 2010 census, the population was 432,226, making it the third-most populous county in Tennessee.

title: Knox County, Tennessee
text: Its county seat is Knoxville, the third-most populous city in Tennessee.

title: Blue Flint Ethanol
text: Blue Flint Ethanol is an bioethanol producing company and a production plant with a same name, located in Underwood, North Dakota approximately 50 mi north of Bismarck.

title: Blue Flint Ethanol
text: The plant is unique in the fact that rather than burning fuels, such as coal or natural gas to drive the production process, waste heat from electrical generation at the Coal Creek Station is used.

title: Blue Flint Ethanol
text: The US$100 million plant is capable of processing 18 million bushels (460,000 metric tons) of corn to produce 50 million gallons (190 million liters) of ethanol each year, and is estimated to have a net annual economic impact of $160 million on the North Dakota economy, as well as the creation of approximately 40 new jobs to run the plant.

title: Blue Flint Ethanol
text: In addition to producing ethanol the plant will also produce dry distillers grains, a byproduct of the distillation process which is used as animal feed.

title: Blue Flint Ethanol
text: Of the 18 million bushels of corn used each year for feedstock, the majority will be grown in southeast North Dakota and brought in via rail, with the remaining one third being produced locally.

title: Blue Flint Ethanol
text: In 2006 the Blue Flint Ethanol project was awarded the Project of the Year Award by Governor John Hoeven.

title: Demographics of Mexico
text: With a population of over 123 million in 2017, Mexico ranks as the 10th most populated country in the world.

title: Demographics of Mexico
text: It is the most populous Spanish-speaking country and the third-most populous in the Americas after United States and Brazil.

title: Demographics of Mexico
text: Throughout most of the twentieth century Mexico's population was characterized by rapid growth.

title: Demographics of Mexico
text: Although this tendency has been reversed and average annual population growth over the last five years was less than 1%, the demographic transition is still in progress, and Mexico still has a large cohort of youths.

title: Demographics of Mexico
text: The most populous city in the country is the capital, Mexico City, with a population of 8.9 million (2016), and its metropolitan area is also the most populated with 20.1 million (2010).

title: Demographics of Mexico
text: Approximately 50% of the population lives in one of the 55 large metropolitan areas in the country.

title: Demographics of Mexico
text: In total, about 78.84% of the population of the country lives in urban areas, meaning that only 21.16% live in rural areas.

title: Marion, Ohio
text: Marion is a city in and the county seat of Marion County, Ohio, United States.

title: Marion, Ohio
text: The municipality is located in north-central Ohio, approximately 50 mi north of Columbus.

title: Santa Fe de Antioquia
text: Santa Fe de Antioquia is a municipality in the Antioquia Department, Colombia.

title: Santa Fe de Antioquia
text: The city is located approximately 50 mi north of Medellín, the department capital.

title: Santa Fe de Antioquia
text: It has a population of approximately 23,000 inhabitants.

title: Cambridge
text: Cambridge ( ) is a university city and the county town of Cambridgeshire, England, on the River Cam approximately 50 mi north of London.

title: Cambridge
text: At the United Kingdom Census 2011, its population was 123,867, including 24,488 students.

title: Albany, New York
text: Albany ( ) is the capital of the U.S. state of New York and the seat of Albany County.

title: Albany, New York
text: Roughly 150 mi north of New York City, Albany developed on the west bank of the Hudson River, about 10 mi south of its confluence with the Mohawk River.

title: Albany, New York
text: The population of the City of Albany was 97,856 according to the 2010 census.

title: Albany, New York
text: Albany constitutes the economic and cultural core of the Capital District of New York State, which comprises the Albany-Schenectady-Troy, NY Metropolitan Statistical Area, including the nearby cities and suburbs of Troy, Schenectady, and Saratoga Springs.

title: Albany, New York
text: With a 2013 Census-estimated population of 1.1 million the Capital District is the third-most populous metropolitan region in the state and 38th in the United States.

title: Atlee, Virginia
text: Atlee or Atlee Station is an unincorporated community in northerneastern Hanover County in the Mid-Atlantic state of Virginia, United States.

title: Atlee, Virginia
text: Atlee is located 11 mi north of Richmond on Route 637 approximately .6 mi north-northwest of the intersection of Route 637 and Virginia State Route 2.

title: Atlee, Virginia
text: and approximately 50 mi south of Fredericksburg, Virginia

title: Columbus, Ohio
text: Columbus ( ) is the capital and largest city of the U.S. state of Ohio.

title: Columbus, Ohio
text: It is the 14th-largest city in the United States, with a population of 860,090 as of 2016 estimates.

title: Columbus, Ohio
text: This makes Columbus the third-most populous state capital in the United States, and the second-largest city in the Midwestern United States, after Chicago.

title: Columbus, Ohio
text: It is the core city of the Columbus, Ohio, Metropolitan Statistical Area, which encompasses ten counties.

title: Columbus, Ohio
text: With a population of 2,021,632, it is Ohio's third-largest metropolitan area.

title: Rohnert Park, California
text: Rohnert Park is a city in Sonoma County, California, United States, located approximately 50 mi north of San Francisco.

title: Rohnert Park, California
text: The population at the 2010 United States Census was 40,971.

title: Rohnert Park, California
text: It is an early planned city and is the sister city of Hashimoto in Japan.

title: Rohnert Park, California
text: Sonoma State University, part of the California State University system, is located nearby.

title: Kavin Dave
text: Kavin Dave (born 12 November 1984) is an Indian film and television actor.

title: Kavin Dave
text: Dave made his big screen debut in the movie "Mumbai Meri Jaan" in 2008.

title: Kavin Dave
text: This was followed by further successful films including "My Name Is Khan", "I Hate Luv Storys", "Crook", "Shirin Farhad Ki Toh Nikal Padi" and "Kick".

title: Kavin Dave
text: Dave recently played the lead role in the film "Bumboo".

title: Kavin Dave
text: After featuring in several television commercials for popular brands including Sprite, Vodafone, Dish TV, Fortune oil, Sil jam and Center shock, he landed the lead role in the television sitcom "Rishta.com".

title: Kavin Dave
text: Dave made his Tollywood debut with the Telugu film "Money Money, More Money".

title: Melody Parra
text: Melody Marie Tavitian-Parra is an American actress and model.

title: Melody Parra
text: Born and raised in Los Angeles, California, Parra demonstrated a talent for acting early on.

title: Melody Parra
text: She began acting in school plays at the age of 6 and continued throughout high school where she won the school's Best Actress Gold Medal, the Musical Theatre Director's Dream Actress Award, and the Best Film Actress Tommy at John Marshall High in Los Feliz.

title: Melody Parra
text: She made her professional stage debut during her senior year in "What's Shakein?"

title: Melody Parra
text: (2009) at the Greek Theatre in the play's lead role.

title: Melody Parra
text: In 2009, Parra was admitted to UCLA with a full merit scholarship.

title: Melody Parra
text: While pursuing a dual BA, Parra joined the university's prestigious ACT III Theatre Ensemble where she played lead and large supporting roles in classics such as "Othello", "Oedipus Rex", "Macbeth", and "The Fall".

title: Melody Parra
text: In 2012 she graduated UCLA at the age of 20, receiving her BA in English Literature and Spanish.

title: Melody Parra
text: She made her feature film debut the following year cast in the lead role of Stella in the indie film drama "City of Quartz" (2013).

title: Melody Parra
text: The film premiered at the BLOW-UP Arthouse International Film Festival.

title: Melody Parra
text: That same year she was cast in the comedy "With this Ring" (2013) where she played a supporting role in both the play and its on-screen adaptation.

title: Melody Parra
text: Parra's other films include the crime drama "Here in the East" (2014), "Fronteras" (2015), "Ouroboros" (2015), and "Edge" (2015).

title: Melody Parra
text: Both "Here in the East" and "Edge" won Best Film in the 2015 Hollywood Reel Independent Film Festival and the 2015 San Diego Film Festival, respectively.

title: Takkay Ki Ayegi Baraat
text: Takkay ki Ayegi Baraat is a Pakistani comedy-drama that aired on Geo TV from June 2011 to October 2011.

title: Takkay Ki Ayegi Baraat
text: The third instalment of its kind, it is a continuation of the hit "Dolly ki Ayegi Baraat" in the Evernew's popular storyline of Kis Ki Ayegi Baraat.

title: Takkay Ki Ayegi Baraat
text: The show includes most of the characters from "Dolly ki Ayegi Baraat", and focuses on the story of Mustaq (or "Takkay") and Sila's friend Sukena.

title: Takkay Ki Ayegi Baraat
text: "Takkay ki Ayegi Baraat" is written by Vasay Chaudry who had co written the previous serial as well.

title: Takkay Ki Ayegi Baraat
text: The character of Sila, previously played by Sarwat Gilani and Ayesha Omar in the first and second serials respectively, is played by Alishba Yousuf.

title: Takkay Ki Ayegi Baraat
text: This is the third time the character of Sila has been played by a different actress.

title: Takkay Ki Ayegi Baraat
text: And the character of Azar (played by Hassan Niazi in the previous two serials) is now played by Ahsan Khan.

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein is a 1977 Bollywood film directed by Meraj.

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: The film stars Rajesh Khanna and Hema Malini.

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: It received 4 of 5 stars from critics in Bollywood Guide Collections.

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: Rajesh Khanna plays the lead role of a village postman.

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: The film was critically acclaimed and became an unexpected flop at the box office.

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: However over the years, the film has been appreciated by the audiences in its screening in television and has gained cult following over the years. "

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: Welcome to Sajjanpur", a film inspired by "Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein", became a hit at the box office in 2008.

title: Palkon Ki Chhaon Mein
text: Tamil film "Iyarkai" is inspired by this film's story in a naval background.

title: My Dear Desperado
text: My Dear Desperado (; lit.

title: My Dear Desperado
text: My Gangster Lover) is a 2010 South Korean romantic comedy film written and directed by Kim Kwang-sik, and starring Park Joong-hoon and Jung Yu-mi as two people who become semi-basement one-room neighbors: brave yet jobless Se-jin and Dong-chul, the neighborhood gangster who always gets beaten up.

title: My Dear Desperado
text: The film received 688,832 admissions nationwide.

title: My Dear Desperado
text: This film was remade in Hindi titled "Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story" in 2013 starring Vivek Oberoi opposite Neha Sharma in lead roles.

title: My Dear Desperado
text: The movie was officially remade in Tamil by Nalan Kumarasamy titled "Kadhalum Kadandhu Pogum" for which () or ₩71,587,640.57 was paid as copyrights.

title: Helly Luv
text: Helan Abdulla (born November 16, 1988), better known by her stage name Helly Luv, is a Kurdish singer, dancer, choreographer, actress and model who was born in Urmia, Iran.

title: Helly Luv
text: Her career began by uploading cover videos on social media websites like Myspace and YouTube.

title: Helly Luv
text: Helly Luv has since starred in movies, music videos and has released her own material.

title: Helly Luv
text: Gaining popularity from her 2013 single "Risk It All", Helly Luv has recently signed to G2 Music Group.

title: Helly Luv
text: In 2014, she appeared in her first theatrical feature film, "Mardan".

title: Stinkfoot, a Comic Opera
text: Stinkfoot, a Comic Opera is an English musical with book, music, and lyrics by Vivian Stanshall and Ki Longfellow-Stanshall written for the Crackpot Theatre Company aboard the Old Profanity Showboat in Bristol, England.

title: Stinkfoot, a Comic Opera
text: The show is based on a series of tales written by Longfellow about Stinkfoot, a New York City alley cat, a bit of a rogue and more than a bit of a rake.

title: Stinkfoot, a Comic Opera
text: It had been intended for children, but when told by a New York City literary agent that “No mother in America would want her child identifying with Stinkfoot the alley cat, never mind its name,” the story went into a drawer for many years.

title: Stinkfoot, a Comic Opera
text: It came out with the meeting in 1977 of Vivian and Ki, at which point the story became bedtime reading for Vivian's son Rupert Stanshall (born 1968), and later for his daughter with Ki, Silky Longfellow-Stanshall (born 1979).

title: Stinkfoot, a Comic Opera
text: In 1985 it “grew up” when Vivian and Ki decided to base a musical on its lead character, Stinkfoot.

title: Stinkfoot, a Comic Opera
text: At that point, it became a melding of two very different visions and two very different musical traditions: Vivian’s days as frontman for the Bonzo Dog Band and his childhood in Leigh-on-Sea with Ki’s love of America’s Broadway.

title: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo
text: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo (Bengali: কি করে তোকে বলবো ; English: How do I tell you ) is a Bengali language romantic drama film directed by Rabi Kinnagi.

title: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo
text: The family entertainer is a love story with a twist.

title: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo
text: The title of the movie name is inspired from Rangbaaz movie's song Ki Kore Toke Bolbo sung by Arijit Singh.

title: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo
text: The soundtracks of the film has been composed by Jeet Gannguli and Dev Sen (1 song).

title: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo
text: The film stars Ankush Hazra, Mimi Chakraborty in lead role.

title: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo
text: The film is a remake of the 2007 Kannada film "Milana".

title: Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story
text: Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story is a Bollywood crime romantic comedy film directed by Vinnil Markan, and produced by Kumar Taurani under Tips Music Films.

title: Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story
text: The film stars Vivek Oberoi opposite Neha Sharma in lead roles.

title: Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story
text: The theatrical trailer unveiled on 11 January 2013, whilst the film released on 14 February 2013.

title: Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story
text: English subtitles for this film were done by Shivkumar Parthasarathy.

title: Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story
text: The film is a remake of 2010 South Korean film "My Gangster Lover" which was later remade in Tamil in 2016 as "Kadhalum Kadandhu Pogum".

title: Neha Sharma
text: Neha Sharma (] ; born 21 November 1987) is an Indian film actress and model.

title: Neha Sharma
text: A native of Bihar, Sharma attended the Mount Carmel School in Bhagalpur and pursued a course in fashion design from the National Institute of Fashion Technology (NIFT) in New Delhi.

title: Mining in Mongolia
text: Mining is important to the national economy of Mongolia.

title: Mining in Mongolia
text: Coal, copper, and gold are the principal reserves mined in Mongolia.

title: Mining in Mongolia
text: Several gold mines are located about 110 km north of Ulaanbaatar, such as Boroo Gold Mine and Gatsuurt Gold Mine.

title: Mining in Mongolia
text: Khotgor Coal Mine is an open-pit coal mining site about 120 km west of Ulaangom.

title: Mining in Mongolia
text: Ömnögovi Province in the south of Mongolia is home to large scale mining projects such as the Tavan Tolgoi coal mine and the Oyu Tolgoi copper mine.

title: Mining in Mongolia
text: Oyu Tolgoi mine is reported to have the potential to boost the national economy by a third but is subject to dispute over how the profits should be shared.

title: Mining in Mongolia
text: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has estimated that 71 percent of the income from the mine would go to Mongolia.

title: Temagami-Lorrain Mine
text: Temagami-Lorrain Mine is an abandoned surface and underground mine in Northeastern Ontario, Canada.

title: Temagami-Lorrain Mine
text: It is located about 10 km northeast of the town of Temagami near Sauvé Lake in central Cassels Township.

title: Temagami-Lorrain Mine
text: It is named after the Temagami-Lorrain Mining Company, which carried out work on the property in the early 1900s.

title: Meadowbank Aerodrome
text: Meadowbank Aerodrome (TC LID: CMB2) is an aerodrome located 1 NM northeast of Meadowbank Gold Mine, Nunavut, Canada.

title: Crisson Mine
text: Crisson Mine was a gold mine in Lumpkin County, Georgia, USA, located just east of Dahlonega.

title: Crisson Mine
text: Like many mines in the area, the property probably started as a placer mine during the Georgia Gold Rush.

title: Crisson Mine
text: Once the placer deposits had been exhausted, an open pit gold mine was established in 1847 and commercial operations continued until the early 1980s.

title: Crisson Mine
text: A small stamp mill was also established here.

title: Crisson Mine
text: Much of the gold used for the gold leaf dome of the Georgia State Capitol was mined at this mine, which was among the most productive mine in the Georgia Gold Belt.

title: Crisson Mine
text: The mine is located just north of the site of the Consolidated Mine, which is itself north of and the Calhoun Mine.

title: Samira Hill Gold Mine
text: The Samira Hill Gold Mine (fr.

title: Samira Hill Gold Mine
text: "Mine d'Or du Mont Samira") is a Gold mine in Téra Department of the Tillabéri Region in Niger.

title: Samira Hill Gold Mine
text: Opened in late 2004, it is the first industrial scale gold mine in the nation, and while operated by a Canadian/Moroccan consortia, the government of Niger owns both a 20% stake in its operation, and functions under government concession.

title: Samira Hill Gold Mine
text: The mine, and the possibility that other gold concessions will follow, is projected to be an important component of future export revenue for the West African state.

title: Hill 50 Gold Mine
text: The Hill 50 Gold Mine is a gold mine located 4 km north-west of Mount Magnet, Western Australia.

title: Hill 50 Gold Mine
text: The mine was, until July 2010, owned by Harmony Gold and had been placed in care and maintenance since 2007.

title: Hill 50 Gold Mine
text: In July 2010, Harmony sold the mine to Ramelius Resources, owner of the Wattle Dam Gold Mine, for A$40 million.

title: Dvoinoye Gold Mine
text: The Dvoinoye Gold Mine is an underground gold mine in the Bilibinsky District of the Chukotka Autonomous Okrug of Russia.

title: Dvoinoye Gold Mine
text: The mine is owned by Canadian mining company Kinross Gold and is approximately 100 km from their Kupol Gold Mine.

title: Dvoinoye Gold Mine
text: Originally the site of a surface mine, Kinross acquired the property in 2010, and built the underground mine at a cost of US$360-million.

title: Dvoinoye Gold Mine
text: The mine began production in 2013.

title: Sukari mine
text: The Sukari mine or Alsukari mine (Arabic: السكري "Al-Sukkari", Egyptian pronunciation: "El-Sokkari") is a Gold Mine located in the Nubian Desert/Eastern Desert near the Red Sea in Egypt in the south-east of the country in the Red Sea Governorate, 30 km south of Marsa Alam.

title: Sukari mine
text: It is exploited jointly by the Egyptian Ministry of Mineral Resources and Centamin.

title: Sukari mine
text: It is Egypt's first modern gold mine, an industry considered to have scope for expansion in the country.

title: Sukari mine
text: Egypt was known in the ancient world as being a source of gold, and one of the earliest available maps shows a gold mine at this location.

title: Meadowbank Gold Mine
text: The Meadowbank Gold Mine is an open pit gold mine operated by Agnico-Eagle Mines in the Kivalliq district of Nunavut, Canada.

title: South Kalgoorlie Gold Mine
text: The South Kalgoorlie Gold Mine is a gold mine located south-west of Kalgoorlie, Western Australia.

title: South Kalgoorlie Gold Mine
text: The mine is sometimes also referred to as "South Kal Mines - New Celebration", being a merger of the former "New Celebration Gold Mine" and the "Jubilee Gold Mine", which were combined in 2002.

title: 33 Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: 33 Whitecross Street is a grade II listed building in Monmouth, Monmouthshire, Wales.

title: 33 Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: It is in the historic St James Square neighbourhood.

title: 33 Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: The property was the site of archaeological excavation in 2009, which demonstrated evidence of Neolithic (prehistoric), Roman, and Medieval activity.

title: 33 Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: The following year, archaeological excavation in the square discovered the first evidence of Mesolithic human settlement in Monmouth.

title: Monk Street, Monmouth
text: Monk Street is an historic street in the town of Monmouth, Monmouthshire, Wales.

title: Monk Street, Monmouth
text: A portion of it was in existence by the 14th century, and appears on the 1610 map of the town by cartographer John Speed.

title: Monk Street, Monmouth
text: It runs in a north-south direction, extending northward from its intersection with Whitecross Street.

title: Monk Street, Monmouth
text: The name of the street relates to the nearby Priory, as well as the gate which was originally on this road and provided part of the town's defences, Monk's Gate.

title: Monk Street, Monmouth
text: Monk Street is lined with numerous listed buildings.

title: John Speed
text: John Speed (1551 or 1552 – 28 July 1629) was an English cartographer and historian.

title: John Speed
text: He is the best known English mapmaker of the Stuart period.

title: St Mary's Priory Church, Monmouth
text: St Mary's Priory Church, in Whitecross Street, Monmouth, Monmouthshire, Wales, is an Anglican church founded as a Benedictine priory in 1075.

title: St Mary's Priory Church, Monmouth
text: The current church dates mostly from the 18th and 19th centuries.

title: St Mary's Priory Church, Monmouth
text: It was designated a Grade II* listed building in 1952.

title: St Mary's Priory Church, Monmouth
text: It is one of 24 buildings on the Monmouth Heritage Trail.

title: Judges' Lodgings, Monmouth
text: The Judges' Lodgings, located in Whitecross Street, Monmouth, south east Wales, is an eighteenth-century building, with earlier origins, on the edge of St James' Square.

title: Judges' Lodgings, Monmouth
text: It has its origins as an early 16th-century town house, becoming the 'Labour in Vain' inn around 1756.

title: Judges' Lodgings, Monmouth
text: It was in use as the Judges' Lodgings for the Monmouth Assizes before 1835, and as the Militia Officers' Mess in the 1870s.

title: Judges' Lodgings, Monmouth
text: Today it is a private house, with modern mews cottages built into the rear.

title: Judges' Lodgings, Monmouth
text: It is a Grade II listed building and is one of 24 blue plaque buildings on the Monmouth Heritage Trail.

title: St James Street, Monmouth
text: St James Street is a historic street in the town centre of Monmouth, Monmouthshire, Wales.

title: St James Street, Monmouth
text: It appears as a segment of Whitecross Street on the 1610 map of the town by cartographer John Speed and is within the medieval town walls.

title: St James Street, Monmouth
text: On more recent maps, it extends from St James Square southwest to Almshouse Street.

title: St James Street, Monmouth
text: In 2010, the street was the site of discovery of Mesolithic era artefacts.

title: St James Street, Monmouth
text: St James Street is lined with numerous listed buildings.

title: Wye Bridge Ward, Monmouth
text: Wye Bridge Ward was one of four wards in the town of Monmouth, Monmouthshire, Wales.

title: Wye Bridge Ward, Monmouth
text: Streets in the ward included St Mary's Street, Almshouse Street, St James Street, St James Square, Whitecross Street and Monk Street.

title: Wye Bridge Ward, Monmouth
text: The ward existed as a division of the town by the early seventeenth century, and continued into the twentieth century.

title: Monmouth Methodist Church
text: Monmouth Methodist Church is located in Monmouth, south east Wales.

title: Monmouth Methodist Church
text: It is set well back from St James Street between buildings.

title: Monmouth Methodist Church
text: Designed by George Vaughan Maddox and built in 1837, it retains its original galleries, organ loft and sophisticated pulpit.

title: St James Square, Monmouth
text: St James Square is a historic square in the town centre of Monmouth, Monmouthshire, Wales.

title: St James Square, Monmouth
text: It is located at the eastern end of Whitecross Street, within the medieval town walls.

title: St James Square, Monmouth
text: The area features the Monmouth War Memorial and the controversial, historic Indian Bean Tree.

title: St James Square, Monmouth
text: In addition, in 2010, the square was the site of discovery of the first Mesolithic artefacts in Monmouth.

title: St James Square, Monmouth
text: St James Square is lined with numerous listed buildings.

title: Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: Whitecross Street is a historic street in the town centre of Monmouth, Monmouthshire, Wales.

title: Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: It was in existence by the 15th century, and appears as "Whit crose" on the 1610 map of the town by cartographer John Speed.

title: Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: It runs in an east-west direction, between Church Street and St James Square.

title: Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: It has been suggested that the street takes its name from a plague cross.

title: Whitecross Street, Monmouth
text: Whitecross Street is lined with numerous listed buildings.

title: Chichester, New Hampshire
text: Chichester is a town in Merrimack County, New Hampshire, United States.

title: Chichester, New Hampshire
text: The population was 2,523 at the 2010 census.

title: Creamery Covered Bridge
text: The Creamery Covered Bridge is a historic covered bridge in West Brattleboro, Vermont.

title: Creamery Covered Bridge
text: Now closed to traffic, the Town lattice truss bridge formerly carried Guilford Road across Whetstone Brook, just south of Vermont Route 9.

title: Creamery Covered Bridge
text: Built in 1879, it is Brattleboro's last surviving 19th-century covered bridge.

title: Capon Lake Whipple Truss Bridge
text: The Capon Lake Whipple Truss Bridge ( ), formerly known as South Branch Bridge or Romney Bridge, is a historic Whipple truss bridge in Capon Lake, West Virginia.

title: Capon Lake Whipple Truss Bridge
text: It is located off Carpers Pike (West Virginia Route 259) and crosses the Cacapon River.

title: Capon Lake Whipple Truss Bridge
text: The bridge formerly carried Capon Springs Road (West Virginia Secondary Route 16) over the river, connecting Capon Springs and Capon Lake.

title: Pleasant Lake (Deerfield, New Hampshire)
text: Pleasant Lake is a 479 acre lake located in Rockingham County in central New Hampshire, United States, in the town of Deerfield.

title: Pleasant Lake (Deerfield, New Hampshire)
text: The eastern shore of the lake forms the boundary between Deerfield and the town of Northwood.

title: Pleasant Lake (Deerfield, New Hampshire)
text: Water from Pleasant Lake flows north to Northwood Lake, then west via the Little Suncook River to the Suncook River, a tributary of the Merrimack River.

title: Cameron Suspension Bridge
text: The Cameron Suspension Bridge crosses the Little Colorado River at Cameron, Arizona, USA.

title: Cameron Suspension Bridge
text: The bridge formerly carried U.S. Route 89, but was replaced by a newer deck truss bridge in 1959.

title: Cameron Suspension Bridge
text: Built in 1911, it has an overall length of 680 ft and a main span of 660 ft .

title: Cameron Suspension Bridge
text: The bridge was built by the Midland Bridge Company of Kansas City for the Office of Indian Affairs and the Indian Irrigation Service.

title: Cameron Suspension Bridge
text: W. H. Code of the Midland Bridge Company was the designer.

title: Cameron Suspension Bridge
text: The suspension design was chosen to address the steep-walled canyon at the crossing, which required a single span with no temporary falsework.

title: Cameron Suspension Bridge
text: When built, the Cameron bridge was the longest suspension span west of the Mississippi River.

title: Pineground Bridge
text: The Pineground Bridge, also known as the Depot Road Bridge or the Thunder Bridge, is a through-type lenticular truss bridge that formerly carried Depot Road over the Suncook River in Chichester, New Hampshire.

title: Pineground Bridge
text: The bridge was built in 1887 by the Berlin Iron Bridge Co., and is the only one of its type (and only one of for lenticular truss bridges of any type, as of 2004) in the state.

title: Pineground Bridge
text: It is 96 ft long and 16 ft wide, and rises 15 ft above the river.

title: Pineground Bridge
text: It is mounted on abutments made of unmortarted ashlar granite.

title: Pineground Bridge
text: The decking and rails are made of wood.

title: Pineground Bridge
text: The bridge has not undergone major alterations since its construction.

title: Pineground Bridge
text: Some of its stringers were replaced during the 1981-2 restoration, wooden parts were also replaced, and a number of decorative parts have been lost over the years.

title: Sunday River Bridge
text: The Sunday River Bridge, also known locally as the Artists Bridge, is a historic covered bridge in Newry, Maine.

title: Sunday River Bridge
text: It is located northeast of the Sunday River Ski Resort, adjacent to the crossing of the Sunday River by Sunday River Road, which the bridge formerly carried.

title: Sunday River Bridge
text: Built in 1872, it is one of Maine's few surviving 19th-century covered bridges.

title: Sunday River Bridge
text: It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1970.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Crystal Lake is a 455 acre water body located in Belknap County in the Lakes Region of central New Hampshire, United States, in the town of Gilmanton.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Crystal Lake is at the head of the Suncook River watershed.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Water flows into Crystal Lake from the Belknap Range through Manning and Sunset lakes to the north.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Water from Manning Lake enters Crystal Lake via Nelson Brook.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Other waterways flowing into Crystal Lake include Wasson Brook and Mill Brook.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Water flows out of a dam from the southern end of Crystal Lake via the Suncook Lakes and Suncook River to the Merrimack River.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Shoreline development along Crystal Lake consists primarily of summer cottages, with a few year-round residents.

title: Crystal Lake (Gilmanton, New Hampshire)
text: Belknap Mountain and Mount Major can be seen from the shoreline.

title: Culham Bridge
text: Culham Bridge is a mediaeval bridge crossing a present backwater of the River Thames in England at Culham, Oxfordshire, near the town of Abingdon.

title: Culham Bridge
text: The bridge crosses Swift Ditch which was at one time the main navigation channel of the River Thames until Abingdon Lock was built in 1790.

title: Culham Bridge
text: The bridge formerly carried the A415 road from Abingdon to Dorchester, Oxfordshire, but was superseded in 1928 by a modern road bridge.

title: Suncook Lakes
text: The Suncook Lakes are a pair of lakes located in Belknap County in central New Hampshire, United States, in the town of Barnstead.

title: Suncook Lakes
text: Upper Suncook Lake encompasses 402 acre , while Lower Suncook Lake covers 295 acre .

title: Suncook Lakes
text: The lakes are connected by a 1000 ft channel, spanned by a road bridge.

title: Suncook Lakes
text: A dam at the outlet of Lower Suncook Lake controls the water level of both lakes.

title: Suncook Lakes
text: The lakes are located along the Suncook River, a tributary of the Merrimack River.

title: Suncook Lakes
text: There are three islands on Lower Lake.

title: The Future of the Gravity Boy
text: The Future of the Gravity Boy is the third album by London-based rock band Infadels.

title: The Future of the Gravity Boy
text: It was released digitally on March 19, 2012, and physically on June 9, 2012.

title: The Future of the Gravity Boy
text: The album is produced by DJ and electro artist Alex Metric and Matt Gooderson.

title: Temple of the Dog (album)
text: Temple of the Dog is the only studio album by the American rock band Temple of the Dog, released on April 16, 1991, through A&M Records.

title: Temple of the Dog (album)
text: The album is a tribute to Andrew Wood, the former lead singer of Malfunkshun and Mother Love Bone, who died on March 19, 1990, of a heroin overdose.

title: Temple of the Dog (album)
text: The album has been certified platinum by the RIAA in the United States.

title: Port of Morrow (album)
text: Port of Morrow is the fourth studio album by American rock band The Shins.

title: Port of Morrow (album)
text: The album was released March 19, 2012, on Aural Apothecary and Columbia Records and was co-produced by Greg Kurstin and frontman James Mercer.

title: Port of Morrow (album)
text: The Shins' first studio album in five years, following the release of 2007's "Wincing the Night Away", followed major lineup changes in the group: founding members Dave Hernandez (bass, guitar), Marty Crandall (keyboards) and Jesse Sandoval (drums) departed in 2009.

title: Port of Morrow (album)
text: Mercer deemed it an "aesthetic decision" to part ways with his bandmates, and in the interim, founded side project Broken Bells with Danger Mouse.

title: High Road (album)
text: High Road is an album by Canadian folk rock band The Grapes of Wrath, released March 19, 2013 on Aporia Records.

title: High Road (album)
text: It is the band's first album of new material since "Field Trip" in 2000, and the first to feature all three of the band's original members since 1991's "These Days".

title: High Road (album)
text: The tracks "Good To See You" and "Take On The Day" had previously appeared on the band's compilation album "Singles", released in 2012.

title: Punky Brüster – Cooked on Phonics
text: Punky Brüster – Cooked on Phonics is the debut studio album by Canadian musician Devin Townsend, originally released as Cooked on Phonics under the fictional band name Punky Brüster.

title: Punky Brüster – Cooked on Phonics
text: It was released on Townsend's label, HevyDevy Records, on March 19, 1996.

title: Punky Brüster – Cooked on Phonics
text: It is a metal/punk rock parody concept album written by Townsend.

title: Punky Brüster – Cooked on Phonics
text: "Cooked on Phonics" tells the story of a fictitious death metal band "from South Central Poland" called Cryptic Coroner that sells out their metal look and sound to become a commercial punk rock band called Punky Brüster (the band's name is a pun on the 80's U.S. television series "Punky Brewster").

title: Specter at the Feast
text: Specter at the Feast is the seventh studio album by American rock band Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, released on March 18, 2013 in Europe and March 19, 2013 in the US.

title: Specter at the Feast
text: It was released under the band's own record label, Abstract Dragon, through Vagrant Records.

title: Specter at the Feast
text: Unlike "Beat The Devil's Tattoo", the album wasn't produced by Michael Been, who died after he suffered a heart attack mid-tour in 2010 while the band was playing at Pukkelpop.

title: Specter at the Feast
text: As a result, "Specter at the Feast" was a way for the band to mourn their loss and rid the pain, as he was the father of bassist Robert Levon Been, but also their live sound technician and a mentor to all the members.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: Weathermaker Music is the record label owned by the American rock band Clutch and their manager Jack Flanagan.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: Weathermaker Music LLC was formed in June 2008.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: Weathermaker Music was mostly known to work with Clutch and their side project, the psychedelic jazz-rock alter ego The Bakerton Group.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: In 2012 Weathermaker signed and released product by The Company Band, and The Mob.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: Both groups include Weathermaker Music principal owners.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: On March 19th, 2013 Weathermaker Music released the Clutch record ” Earth Rocker” on CD and vinyl.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: At the end of 2013 Weathermaker Music released “Earth Rocker Live” which is a double 12 inch vinyl picture disc version of the “Earth Rocker” studio release on one LP, and the same track listing recorded live from various cities on their 2013 USA tour on the second LP.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: In 2013 Weathermaker Music signed Deep Swell, featuring Clutch member Tim Sult on guitar.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: Their record, “Lore of the Angler” was released October 15th, 2013.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: Weathermaker Music signed the Maryland-based group Lionize in 2013 as well.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: Entitled “Jetpack Soundtrack”, this Lionize record was released on February 18th, 2014 in North America, April 11th, 2014 in Europe, and February 14th, 2014 in the UK.

title: Weathermaker Music
text: The Lionize signing marks the label’s first signing of an independent artist to Weathermaker Music.

title: The Shins
text: The Shins are an American indie rock band from Albuquerque, New Mexico, formed in 1996.

title: The Shins
text: The band's current lineup consists of James Mercer (vocals, guitar, songwriter), Jon Sortland (drums), Mark Watrous (guitar), Casey Foubert (guitar), Yuuki Matthews (bass), and Patti King (keyboards).

title: The Shins
text: The band is based in Portland, Oregon.

title: H. (song)
text: "H." is a song by the American rock band Tool.

title: H. (song)
text: The song was released as the second single from their third album, "Ænima" on March 19, 1997.

title: H. (song)
text: "H." reached number 23 on the U.S. Mainstream Rock Tracks chart.

title: Tremonti (band)
text: Tremonti is an American heavy metal band founded and fronted by lead vocalist and guitarist Mark Tremonti, best known as the guitarist of the American rock band Creed, and the lead guitarist of American rock band Alter Bridge.

title: Tremonti (band)
text: The band also consists of rhythm guitarist Eric Friedman and drummer Garrett Whitlock.

title: Tremonti (band)
text: Bassist Wolfgang Van Halen was in the band between 2012 to 2017.

title: Tremonti (band)
text: What originally started as a Mark Tremonti solo project evolved into a fully fledged band after the release of the group's first album, "All I Was", in July 2012.

title: Tremonti (band)
text: That album featured Tremonti himself playing guitar in addition to lead vocals, and the band was joined by Tremonti's Creed and Alter Bridge bandmate Brian Marshall playing bass on tour until his departure later that year.

title: Tremonti (band)
text: He was replaced by Van Halen bassist Wolfgang Van Halen, who contributed to the band's second album, "Cauterize", which was released on June 9, 2015.

title: Tremonti (band)
text: The band also has another album, entitled "Dust", in April 2016, serving as a continuation to "Cauterize".

title: Rossendale Free Press
text: The Rossendale Free Press is a weekly newspaper published in Rossendale, Lancashire, England and distributed in Rossendale's four main towns of Rawtenstall, Bacup, Haslingden, and Ramsbottom.

title: Rossendale Free Press
text: It is owned by Manchester Evening News Media, which publishes 19 other newspapers, and its current circulation is 14,369.

title: Philadelphia Free Press
text: Philadelphia Free Press was a 1960s era underground newspaper published biweekly in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania from 1968 to 1972.

title: Philadelphia Free Press
